text: Kulea kwa Pamoja

SourceText: Breathe
text: Vuta pumzi

SourceText: Breathing activities help relax both your mind and body.
text: Shughuli za kupumua zinasaidia kupumzisha vyote akili yako na mwili.

SourceText: Reflect
text: Tafakari

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect and focus your thoughts on what really matters to you.
text: Pata muda kutafakari na zingatia mawazo yako juu ya kile ambacho ni muhimu kabisa kwako.

SourceText: Notice
text: Kutambua

SourceText: Notice and connect with what happens around you and inside you.
text: Fanya utambuzi na unganisha na kile kinachotokea karibu yako na ndani yako.

SourceText: Move
text: Sogeza

SourceText: Move your body to relieve some stress.
text: Chezesha mwili wako ili kuondoa msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText: Great! So good to hear you are in a positive space.
text: Hongera! ni vizuri sana kusikia uko katika nafasi nzuri

SourceText: Things are not always easy. But that is how we can grow and learn every day!
text: Mambo si rahisi kila wakati. Lakini hivyo ndivyo tunavyoweza kukua na kujifunza kila siku!

SourceText: Life can be hard. Whatever you are feeling, you can be proud of yourself for being here!
text: Maisha yanaweza kuwa magumu. Vyovyote unavyohisi, unaweza kujivunia kuwa hapa!

SourceText: You matter! Take a moment to check in with yourself.
text: Wewe ni wa muhimu! Chukua muda kujiangalia wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!
text: Inafurahisha sana kusikia kuwa unaendelea vizuri. Wewe ni mzazi mzuri sana!

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers but you really do your best!
text: Pole kwa sababu leo siyo siku nzuri sana kwako. Hongera kwa kujaribu kuelewa kila kitu. Hakuna ajuaye kila kitu, lakini kwa kweli unajitahidi kwa kadri uwezavyo!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kwamba leo siyo siku nzuri kwako. Hongera kwa kuamka kila asubuhi na kujaribu tena, hata unapokuwa umechoka. Huo ni ujasiri wa kweli na kujitoa kwa dhati!

SourceText: Recognising how you feel helps you care for yourself well. You deserve it.
text: Kutambua jinsi unavyohisi husaidia kujijali vizuri. Unastahili.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy! Keep up the good work.
text: Vizuri, nimefurahi sana! Endeleza kazi hiyo nzuri.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult. All families struggle. @global.app_name is here to help!
text: Pole kwa mambo kuwa magumu. Familia zote zinapambana. @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia!
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Whatever went ‘wrong’ today, let it go and try again tomorrow. It is okay!
text: Jambo lolote lililoenda 'vibaya' leo, hebu lisahau na ujaribu tena kesho. Itakuwa sawa!

SourceText: Caring for yourself is so essential. When you know how you feel, you can see what you need.
text: Kujijali ni muhimu sana. Unapojua jinsi unavyohisi, unaweza kuona kile unachohitaji.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well. Keep up the good work.
text: Ni jambo la kuvutia sana, ninafurahi sana mambo kuona yanaenda vizuri. Endeleza kazi hii nzuri.

SourceText: We all have better and worse days. The fact that you are here shows courage and commitment!
text: Sisi sote tuna siku nzuri na mbaya zaidi. Ukweli ni kwamba uko hapa unaonyesha ujasiri na kujitolea!

SourceText: Remember that YOU matter! Let’s check in with our emotions first.
text: Kumbuka kwamba wewe ni muhimu! Hebu tuangalie hisia zetu kwanza.

SourceText: Well done for recognising a positive feeling. I am happy to hear you are feeling well today!
text: Hongera kwa kutambua hisia chanya. Nimefurahi kusikia kwamba unajisikia vizuri leo!

SourceText: Well done for recognising that you are not feeling great. Be kind to yourself, you deserve it.
text: Umefanya vizuri kwa kutambua kuwa hujisikii vizuri. Unastahili kuwa mwema kwako mwenyewe.

SourceText: Well done for recognising a difficult feeling. It is okay not to be okay sometimes. Remember @global.app_name is here to support you.
text: Umefanya vizuri kutambua hisia ngumu. Ni sawa kutokuwa sawa wakati mwingine. Kumbuka Programu ya wazazi ya malezi ya watoto iko hapa kukusaidia.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Recognising how you feel is key to handling life well. Be real and kind to yourself.
text: Kutambua jinsi unavyohisi ni muhimu ili kushughulikia maisha vizuri. Kuwa halisi na mkarimu kwako mwenyewe.

SourceText: You are a star. And you are making a real difference. You can be proud of yourself.
text: Wewe ni shujaa. Na unaleta mabadiliko ya kweli. Unaweza kujivunia mwenyewe.

SourceText: Everyone has good and bad days. Well done for using this app. It shows you are a committed parent. Remember to praise yourself for it!
text: Kila mtu ana siku nzuri na mbaya. Umefanya vizuri kutumia programu hii. Inaonyesha wewe ni mzazi unayejituma. Kumbuka kujipongeza kwa hilo!

SourceText: Sorry that things are not easy today. All parents have these days. You are trying and moving forward!
text: Pole kama mambo si rahisi leo. Wazazi wote wana siku kama hizi. Unajaribu na kusonga mbele!

SourceText: Take a moment to notice how you are doing.
text: Chukua muda kuona jinsi unavyojisikia.

SourceText: There is no right or wrong way to feel. However you are feeling, it is okay.
text: Hakuna njia sahihi au mbaya ya kuhisi. Kwa namna yeyote unayojisikia, ni sawa.

SourceText: Well done for recognising how you feel. Good to hear that you are feeling well today!
text: Hongera kwa kutambua unavyojisikia. Nimefurahi kusikia kwamba unajisikia vizuri leo!

SourceText: We all have good and hard days. Remember, you are the best parent for your teen and you deserve praise!
text: Sisi sote tuna siku nzuri na siku ngumu. Kumbuka, wewe ni mzazi bora kwa kijana wako na unastahili pongezi!

SourceText: It can be hard to cope with everything happening in our lives. Remember, you are stronger than you may think!
text: Inaweza kuwa vigumu kukabiliana na kila kitu kinachotokea katika maisha yetu. Kumbuka, una nguvu kuliko unavyoweza kufikiria!

SourceText: Let’s take a moment for YOU. Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.
text: Hebu tuchukue muda kwa ajili YAKO. Kujitunza vizuri huanza na kugundua jinsi unavyohisi.

SourceText: Amazing, life is the best when you're feeling good.
text: Ni vyema, maisha ni bora wakati unajisikia vizuri.

SourceText: Everyone has times when they are not feeling good. This is completely normal. Hopefully you feel better soon.
text: Kila mtu ana wakati ambapo hajisikii vizuri. Hii ni kawaida kabisa. Natumaini kwamba utajisikia vizuri punde.

SourceText: It is part of life to have bad days. Always remember, tough times never last and tomorrow is another day!
text: Ni sehemu ya maisha kuwa na siku mbaya. Kumbuka kila wakati, nyakati ngumu kamwe hazidumu na kesho ni siku nyingine!

SourceText: Read
text: Soma

SourceText: Play
text: Cheza

SourceText: Quick Pause
text: Pumziko la haraka

SourceText:
Sit down, close your eyes and listen to your breath as it goes in and out. 

Notice how you feel. 

When you are ready, open your eyes again.

Try this whenever you are feeling stressed and you need a break to reconnect.
text:
Kaa chini, fumba macho yako na sikiliza pumzi yako inapoingia na kutoka,

Chunguza jinsi unavyohisi.

Unapokuwa tayari, fungua macho yako tena.

Jaribu hili wakati wowote unapohisi mfadhaiko na unahitaji mapumziko ili kuwa sawa tena.

SourceText: One Thing Today
text: Jambo moja leo

SourceText:
Close your eyes and think about the day. 

Name one thing that you are grateful for. 
Name one thing that you did well. 
Name one thing that you love. 

Well done on taking time to take care of yourself.
text:
Funga macho yako na ufikirie kuhusu siku.

Taja jambo moja unaloshukuru.
Taja jambo moja ulilofanya vizuri
Taja kitu kimoja unachokipenda

Umefanya vizuri kuchukua muda wa kujijali.

SourceText: In and Out
text: Ndani na nje

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Listen to your breath as it goes in and out five times.

Notice how you feel.

When you are ready, open your eyes again. You are in control!
text:
Funga macho yako.

Sikiliza pumzi yako inapoingia na kutoka mara tano.

Angalia jinsi unavyohisi.

Unapokuwa tayari, fungua macho yako tena. Unautulivu!

SourceText: Think About Today
text: Fikiria kuhusu leo

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Take a minute to think about the day.

Think about one positive or fun thing you did.
Praise yourself for one thing you did well today. 
Think of one thing you can do differently tomorrow.  
Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text:
Fumba macho yako. 

Tumia dakika moja kufikiria siku ya leo.

Fikiria jambo moja chanya au la kufurahisha ulilolifanya.
Jisifie kwa jambo moja ulilolifanya vizuri leo. 
Fikiria jambo moja unaloweza kulifanya tofauti kesho.  

Fikiria jambo moja unalolishukuru.

SourceText: Small Things
text: Vitu Vidogo

SourceText:
Close your eyes.  

Take a moment to stop what you are doing and connect with your breath.   

What is one thing you can be grateful for right now?  
What is one thing that brings you happiness?  
What is one thing that you love?  

They do not have to be big. Sometimes the small things in life count the most!
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Acha kwa muda kile unachokifanya ili uhusiane na pumzi yako.

Je, ni jambo gani moja unalolishukuru sasa hivi?
Je, ni jambo gani moja linalokuletea furaha?
Je, ni jambo gani moja unalolipenda?

Si lazima yawe makubwa. Wakati mwingine mambo madogo maishani ndiyo muhimu zaidi!

SourceText: Feel your Feelings
text: Sikia hisia zako

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Do you ever feel something so strongly that you want to run away from it?

Instead of moving away from the feeling, let’s move towards it for a moment.
It is ok. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath.

Become curious. Where are you feeling it in your body? Is it hot or cold? Hard or soft? Tight or loose?
Ask yourself some questions. What is it telling me? What does it need? How can I be kind to myself right now?
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Je, huwa unahisi kitu kwa nguvu sana kiasi kwamba huwa unataka kukikimbia?

Badala ya kuikimbia hisia hiyo, hebu tuikimbilie kwa muda.
Si vibaya. Fumba macho yako kama unajisikia vizuri. Vuta pumzi ndefu.

Kuwa mdadisi. Je, unaisikia wapi kwenye mwili wako? Je, ni ya moto au baridi? Je, ni ngumu au laini? Je, imekakamaa au imelegea?
Jiulize maswali kadhaa. Je, inaniambia nini? Je, inahitaji nini? Je, ninawezaje kujitendea wema sasa hivi?

SourceText: Your Song
text: Wimbo wako

SourceText:
Here is something fun to help you let go of stress:   

Choose a song that reflects what you need in this moment. Do you need a gentle song to soothe your tired soul or an upbeat song to help you shake some stress out?   

Make a space and move your body to the music. Remember to breathe while you move. Let your breath and the movement go together. 

Even a few minutes of movement can be enough to release stress and lift your mood!
text:
Hapa kuna kitu cha kufurahisha cha kukusaidia kuondokana na msongo wa mawazo:

Chagua wimbo unaoendana na kile unachohitaji kwa sasa. Je, unahitaji wimbo wa taratibu ili kuibembeleza nafsi yako iliyochoka au unahitaji wimbo wa kuchangamsha ili kukusaidia kuondoa msongo wa mawazo kwa kiasi fulani?

Weka nafasi na uchezeshe mwili wako kulingana na muziki. Kumbuka kuvuta pumzi unapocheza. Fanya pumzi yako iendane na miondoko yako.

Hata dakika chache za kucheza  zinaweza kutosha kuondoa msongo wa mawazo na kuinua hali yako!

SourceText: Ground & Gratitude
text: Ardhi na Shukrani

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Take a moment to feel the ground under your feet.
Think of something you feel grateful for.
Focus on your breath.
Breathe in and out.

In and out.
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Tumia muda kuhisi ardhi iliyopo chini ya miguu yako.
Fikiria kuhusu jambo unalolishukuru.
Fuatilia upumuaji wako.
Vuta pumzi na kuzishusha.

Vuta na kushusha pumzi.

SourceText: Notice How You Feel
text: Tambua unavyojisikia

SourceText:
Hello! How are you feeling right now? Happy, sad, angry, excited, worried?

Notice where you feel it in your body. Notice what thoughts are connected to that feeling. Take a deep breath.

Thank yourself for taking the time to check in with your feelings and thoughts!
text:
Habari! Unajisikiaje sasa hivi? Furaha, huzuni, hasira, taharuki, wasiwasi?

Chunguza mahali unapohisi hali hiyo kwenye mwili wako. Chunguza ni mawazo yapi yanayohusiana na hisia hiyo. Vuta pumzi ndefu.

Jishukuru kwa kuchukua muda wa kuangalia hisia na mawazo yako!

SourceText: Pause Power
text: Nguvu ya kupumzika

SourceText:
Let’s practice a calming trick that we call ‘Pause Power’.

Plant your feet on the ground and breathe in and out three times as slowly as you can. Imagine you are smelling a flower or blowing out a candle.

How do you feel now?

This is a great trick to use when you are feeling frustrated because it will help to calm you down.
text:
Na tufanye mazoezi ya mbinu ya kujituliza tunayoiita 'Nguvu ya kupumzika'.

Weka miguu yako chini kwenye ardhi na uvute pumzi ndani na uitoe nje mara tatu polepole kadili unavyoweza. Pata picha unaskia harufu ya ua au unazima mshumaa.

Unajiskiaje sasa?

Hii ni mbinu nzuri ya kutumia pale unapojiskia kuchanganyikiwa kwasababu itakusaidia kukutuliza.

SourceText: Take a Pause
text: Pumzika

SourceText:
Step 1. Close your eyes and take a deep breath. 

Step 2. Ask yourself, "What am I thinking?" Notice if your thoughts are positive or negative.
Notice how you are feeling emotionally. Notice if your emotions are pleasant or unpleasant. Remind yourself that whatever you feel, it is okay.
Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.

Step 3. Focus on your breath. Feel your breath as it goes in and out. You can put a hand on your stomach and feel it rise and fall with each breath. Do this for about 10 breaths.

Step 4. Expand your awareness to your whole body. Listen to the sounds in the room. 

Step 5. Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different. When you are ready, open your eyes.

Well done for taking a pause. You can do this anytime you are feeling stressed. It gives you a chance to be calmer. Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also take a pause with your children!
text:
Hatua ya Kwanza. Fumba macho yako halafu uvute pumzi ndefu.

Hatua ya Pili. Jiulize, "Je, ninafikiria nini?" Chunguza kama mawazo yako ni chanya au hasi.
Angalia jinsi unavyojihisi. Chunguza kama mihemuko yako ni ya kufurahisha au kutofurahisha. Jikumbushe kwamba chochote unachohisi, si kibaya.
Chunguza jinsi mwili wako unavyohisi. Chunguza kitu chochote kinachoumiza au kinacholeta wasiwasi.

Hatua ya Tatu. Makinikia upumuaji wako. Hisi pumzi yako inapoingia na kutoka. Unaweza kuweka mkono kwenye tumbo lako na kuhisi linavyopanda na kushuka kwa kila pumzi. Fanya hivyo kwa mipumuo kama 10.

Hatua ya Nne. Panua ufahamu wako kuhusu mwili wako wote. Sikiliza sauti zilizomo chumbani.

Hatua ya Tano. Tumia muda kutafakari iwapo unahisi mabadiliko au la. Ukimaliza, fumbua macho yako.

Umefanya vizuri kwa kupumzika. Unaweza kufanya hivyo wakati wowote unapohisi msongo wa mawazo. Inakupa nafasi ya kuwa mtulivu. Hata pumzi chache za kina au kuunganishwa na ardhi chini yako kunaweza kuleta mabadiliko. Unaweza pia kuchukua pumziko na watoto wako!

SourceText: Physical Activity
text: Shughuli ya viungo

SourceText:
Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.

Let your hands hang by your side. Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you relax your body.

Relax your arms and let them swing sideways while you turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.

Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from your ankles – remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.

Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!

Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.

Take a moment to reflect on your experience.

Well done! You can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text:
Simama na unyooshe mikono yako juu angani. Sukuma mawingu yote na uache jua likuangazie. Jinyooshe kwenda kulia na kushoto. Jinyooshe kwenda mbele na nyuma.

Acha mikono yako ining'inie ubavuni mwako. Kaza mabega yako na kuyapandisha hadi kwenye masikio yako huku ukipumua, bana macho yako, na ushikilie pumzi yako. Legeza mabega yako wakati unapolegeza mwili wako.

Legeza mikono yako na uibembeze ubavuni, wakati unabinua upande wa juu wa kiwiliwili chako. Mikono yako inapaswa kupiga polepole mgongo wako unapojigeuza kutoka upande mmoja hadi mwingine.

Weka mguu mmoja mbele ya mwingine na fanya miduara midogo kwa kutumia vifundo vya miguu - kumbuka kugeukia pande zote mbili. Kila mguu ufanye miduara minne kwa kila upande.

Sasa tikisa mwili wako wote haraka kadri uwezavyo. Tikisa upande wa juu kabisa! Tikisa upande wa chini kabisa! Tikisa mwili wote!

Fumba macho yako na uinue mikono yako polepole kuzidi kichwa chako huku ukivuta pumzi. Teremsha mikono yako polepole kuelekea ubavuni mwako huku ukishusha pumzi.

Tumia muda kutafakari hali uliyoipitia.

Umefanya vizuri! Unaweza kufanya shughuli hii wakati wowote unapohisi kama unahitaji kutoa msongo wa mawazo na kutia nguvu akili na mwili wako.

SourceText: Connect
text: Unganisha

SourceText: When you take care of yourself, you take care of your children. We all need to connect. Try to talk to friends, family, and other support networks every day. If it has been a while since you reached out to someone, do it now!
text: Unapojitunza wewe mwenyewe, unawatunza watoto wako. Sisi sote tunahitaji kuhusiana. Kila siku, jaribu kuzungumza na marafiki, familia, na mitandao mingine inayosaidia. Kama umepita muda tangu ulipowasiliana na mtu fulani, fanya hivyo sasa!

SourceText: Prevent Anger
text: Zuia Hasira

SourceText:
Think about what makes you angry. When does it happen? How do you normally react?

Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
text:
Jambo linalokukasirisha. Je, linatokea wakati gani? Je, kwa kawaida, mwitikio wako huwa ni upi?

Zuia hasira kabla hata haijapanda. Unapokuwa umechoka, lala usingizi au pumzika. Unapokuwa na njaa, jaribu kula kitu. Unapokuwa mpweke, omba msaada kwa mtu.

SourceText: Angry? Take a Break
text: Je una hasira? Pumzika

SourceText:
Managing anger can be really difficult. Take a break when you feel you are getting angry at your children or someone else.

Go somewhere else for 5 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have a safe outdoor space, go outside. You can get through this!
text:
Kudhibiti hasira kunaweza kuwa kugumu. Pumzika unapohisi unawakasirikia watoto wako au mtu mwingine.

Nenda mahali pengine kwa dakika 5 ili uweze kudhibiti tena hisia zako. Kama una mahali salama nje, nenda nje. Una uwezo wa kulimaliza jambo hili!

SourceText: What’s in Your Cup?
text: Nini kipo kwenye kikombe chako?

SourceText:
Close your eyes. Imagine you are holding a cup, filled with tea. Then someone walks by and bumps into you, making you spill your tea everywhere. 
Why did you spill the tea? Because someone bumped into you? Not exactly. 
 You spilled tea, because there was tea in your cup. Had there been coffee in the cup, you would have spilled coffee. 
 What does this mean?
It means that: Whatever is inside your cup, is what will spill out.
In the same way, when life comes along and shakes you, whatever is inside you, is what will spill out. Life provides the cup, you choose what to fill it with.
So take a moment to think about what you want to fill your cup with. 
Let’s work towards filling our cups with gratitude, forgiveness, joy, strength, and kindness.
text:
Fumba macho yako. Fikiria umeshika kikombe, kilichojaa chai. Halafu mtu anatembea na kukugonga, na kukufanya umwage chai yako kila mahali. Kwanini umemwaga chai? Kwasababu kuna mtu amekugonga. Si hivyo, umemwaga chai kwasababu kulikuwa na chai kwenye kikombe chako. Kulikuwa na kahawa kwenye kikombe, ungemwaga kahawa.
Ina maana kwamba: Chochote kilicho ndani ya kikombe chako ndicho kitakachomwagika nje.
Kwa jinsi hiyo, pale maisha yanapokutingisha, chochote kilicho ndani yako, ndicho kitakachomwagika nje. Maisha yanakupa kikombe, unachagua nini cha kujaza ndani yake. Hivyo pata muda kidogo kufikiri kuhusu unataka kikombe chako kukijaza nini.
Hebu tufanye kazi ya kujaza vikombe vyetu kwa shukrani, furaha, nguvu, na wema.

SourceText: Power of Three
text: Nguvu ya tatu

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Let's use the magic power of three to stay present and relax.

Name three sounds you can hear right now.
Name three smells you can smell right now.
Name your three favourite foods.

What are three things you can be grateful for right now? They do not have to be big.

At the end of a tough day, thinking of three things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Hebu tutumie maajabu ya namba tatu ili tuendelee kuwepo na kupumzika.

Taja sauti tatu unazoweza kuzisikia sasa hivi.
Taja harufu tatu unazoweza kuzinusa sasa hivi.
Taja vyakula vitatu unavyovipenda.

Je, ni mambo gani matatu unayoshukuru kuwa yapo sasa hivi? Si lazima yawe makubwa.

Mwishoni mwa siku ngumu, kufikiria mambo matatu ya kushukuru kunaweza kutusaidia kupata ujasiri wa kujaribu tena kesho.

SourceText:
Children learn a lot from what we say, and how we say it. 

This week, we will look at the power of our words, and how we **TALK** to our children.
text:
Watoto hujifunza mengi kutokana na yale tunayosema na jinsi tunavyoyasema.

Wiki hii, tutaangalia kuhusu nguvu ya maneno na jinsi **TUNAVYOZUNGUMZA**  na watoto wetu.

SourceText:
Imagine someone tells you to go outside your house and walk to the end of your street. But they don’t tell you why, or what might happen when you get there.  
How does that make you feel? Confused? Scared? Hesitant?
Talking to your child about what is happening or why they should be doing something helps them to feel safe and to follow instructions.
text:
Fikiria  mtu anakwambia uende nje ya nyumba yako utembee mpaka mwisho wa mtaa wako. Lakini hakwambii kwanini, au nini kinaweza kutokea ukifika  huko.
Hilo linakufanya ujiskieje? kuchanganyikiwa? kuogopa? Kusita?
Kuzungumza na mtoto wako kuhusu kile kinachotokea au kwanini  anapaswa kufanya jambo fulani humsaidia yeye kujiskia salama na kufuata maelekezo.

SourceText: Let’s see how **talking with your child** forms part of the garden image.
text: Hebu tuone ambavyo **mazungumzo na mtoto wako** yanavyofanya sehemu ya taswira ya bustani.

SourceText:
The amount of water that plants receive determines how they grow. 
In the same way - how much you talk to your child and what you say to them is important for their development.
text:
Kiasi cha maji ambacho mmea hupokea kinapelekea namna mmea unavyokuwa.

Vivyo hivyo - kwa kiasi gani unazungumza na mtoto wako na nini unawaambia ni muhimu kwa maendeleo yao.

SourceText:
Plants that don’t get enough water won’t grow. In the same way, children struggle when they don’t get enough information from their caregivers.
Just as harsh streams of water can damage small plants, a parent’s harsh words can interfere with a child’s growth. 
That is why your words and how you use them play a powerful role in shaping your child.
text:
Mimea ambayo haipati maji ya kutosha haitakuwa.Vivyo hivyo, watoto wanapata shida pale ambapo hawapati taarifa za kutosha  kutoka kwa walezi wao.
Kama vile vijito vya maji vikali vinavyoharibu mimea midogo. Maneno makali ya mzazi yanaweza kuharibu ukuaji wa mtoto.
Ndio maana maneno yako na jinsi unavyoyatumia yana jukumu kubwa la kumjenga mtoto.

SourceText: Here’s how to talk to your child:
text: Hapa ni jinsi unavyoweza kuzungumza na mtoto wako::

SourceText:
**Name and describe things to your child**

This helps your child understand what is happening.
text:
**Taja na elezea vitu kwa mtoto wako**

Hii humsaidia mtoto wako kuelewa nini kinachotokea.

SourceText:
Young children are still learning about the world and how it works. You can use every-day events and activities to talk to your child about different people, places, events and experiences. 
Let’s use this picture as an example. You could point to the taxis and say: “Look, the taxis wait here to pick people up. They wait next to the marketplace because people might need a lift home after they have done their shopping.”
Or you could point to the market stands and say: “The market stands have umbrellas to keep the food out of the sun. This helps to keep the food cool and fresh.”
Or you could point to the woman and child and say: “They are looking out for cars before they cross the road.”
text:
Vijana wadogo bado wanaendelea kujifunza kuhusu ulimwengu na jinsi unavyofanya kazi. Unaweza kutumia matukio na shughuli za kila siku, kuzungumza na mtoto wako kuhusu watu tofauti, mahali, matukio na uzoefu.
Hembu tuitumie picha hii kama mfano. Unaweza kuelekeza kwenye taksi na kusema: “Tazama, taksi inasubiri hapa kuwachukua watu. Wanasubiri karibu na soko kwasababu watu wanaweza kuhitaji lifti ya kwenda nyumbani baada ya kumaliza kufanya manunuzi yao.”
Au unaweza kuwaonyesha kuelekea kwenye stendi ya soko na kusema:” Kituo cha soko kina miamvuli, kufanya chakula kisipigwe na jua. Hii inasaidia kukifanya chakula kipoe na kuwa vizuri.
Au unaweza kuonyesha kuelekea kwa mwanamke na mtoto na kusema: ”wanaangalia magari kabla hawajavuka barabara.”.

SourceText:
**Explain WHY** 

This helps your child understand cause and effect. It also helps them to follow instructions.
text:
**Elezea KWANINI**

Hii husaidia mtoto wako kuelewa sababisho na athari. Pia huwasaidia kufuata maelekezo.

SourceText:
Explaining “why” helps your child to see the bigger picture, and to understand the benefits of what they need to do.
Instead of saying: “Go brush your teeth now!”, you could say: “It’s time to brush your teeth. We brush our teeth because this keeps our teeth strong and healthy. We need strong and healthy teeth to eat and enjoy our food.”
By explaining to your child why they should brush their teeth, you help them to do what is expected of them.
text:
Kuelezea “kwa nini” humsaidia mtoto wako kuona picha kubwa zaidi, na kuelewa manufaa ya kile anachohitaji kufanya.
Badala ya kusema: “Nenda kapige meno yako mswaki sasa!”, unaweza kusema: “Ni wakati wa kupiga mswaki. Tunapiga mswaki meno yetu kwa sababu hii hutunza uimara na afya ya meno yetu. Tunahitaji meno imara na yenye afya kula chakula chetu na kukifurahia".
Kwa kumwelezea mtoto wako kwa nini wanapaswa kupiga mswaki, unawasaidia kufanya kile wanachotarajiwa.

SourceText:
**TALK with kindness** 

Use your words to build your child up, not to break them down.
text:
**ZUNGUMZA kwa ukarimu**

Tumia maneno yako kumjenga mtoto wako, sio kuwakatisha tamaa.

SourceText:
When something upsetting happens, use kind words to help your child learn.
If your child fell over, instead of saying “Look what happened! You hurt your knee because you were being careless and did not look where you were going!” 
You could say in a kind voice: “Oh no – you fell down and hurt your knee – that must have given you a fright. It’s okay – we all fall down or get hurt sometimes. Next time, let’s try to be a bit more careful when we run outside.”
text:
Pale jambo fulani la kukasirisha linapotokea, tumia maneno ya ukarimu ili kumsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza. 
Ikiwa mtoto wako ameanguka, badala ya kusema "Angalia nini kimetokea! Umeumia goti kwa sababu ulikuwa mzembe na hukuangalia ulipokuwa unaenda!”
Unaweza kusema kwa sauti ya huruma: "Loo hapana - ulianguka na kuumia goti lako - hiyo lazima iwe imekupa hofu. Ni sawa - sisi sote huwa tunaanguka chini au kuumia wakati mwingine. Wakati mwingine tujaribu kuwa waangalifu zaidi tunapokimbilia nje.”.

SourceText: Here’s an example of how to use words in a positive and helpful way:
text: Hapa ni mfano wa jinsi ya kutumia maneno kwa njia nzuri na yenye kusaidia:

SourceText: I am going to put @data.characters.f1_baby_boy.name down for his nap. @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name, please can you keep the house quiet so that @data.characters.f1_baby_boy.name can fall asleep.
text: Naenda kumlaza @data.characters.f1_baby_boy.name. @data.characters.f1_mother.name na @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name tafadhali naomba mkae kimya ili @data.characters.f1_baby_boy.name alale usingizi.

SourceText: (@data.characters.f1_child_boy.name plays with instrument and makes loud noises)
text: (@data.characters.f1_child_boy.name anachezea vifaa na kutoa sauti kubwa)
note: The string (@data.characters.f1_child_boy.name should not be translated.

SourceText: @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name, remember that your father is putting down @data.characters.f1_baby_boy.name for his nap. If we make loud noises, your brother won’t fall asleep. So please play a quiet game.”
text: @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name kumbuka kwamba baba yako anamlaza @data.characters.f1_baby_boy.name. Kama tukitoa sauti kubwa, kaka yako hatapata usingizi. Hivyo tafadhali cheza mchezo wa kimyakimya"

SourceText: “If you play a quiet game now, your brother will fall asleep easier. Once he is asleep, @data.characters.f1_father.name and I can play a game with you.”
text: "Kama ukicheza mcezo wa kimyakimya, kaka yako atalala usingizi kirahisi. Mara atakapolala @data.characters.f1_father.name na mimi tunaweza kucheza mchezo na wewe.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_father.name should not be translated.

SourceText: What a good idea to play with the blocks instead, @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name. Well done for playing quietly so that your brother can fall asleep!
text: Mama: Ni wazo zuri sana kuchezea matofali @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name. Umefanya vizuri kucheza kimya kimya ili mdogo wako aweze kulala!
note: The string @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: “Thank you for being so quiet! Now we can play something fun together. What would you like to build?”
text: "Asante kwa ukimya! Sasa tunaweza kucheza mchezo wa kufurahisha pamoja. Ungependa kujenga nini?"

SourceText: Let’s reflect on what happened:
text: Hembu tutafakari kilichotokea:

SourceText: How did @data.characters.f1_mother.name help her son to follow the instructions?
text: Ni kwa namna gani  @data.characters.f1_mother.name alimsaidia mtoto wake wa kiume kufuata maelekezo?
note: The string @data.characters.f1_mother.name should not be translated.

SourceText: She explained to him about what was happening
text: Alimwelezea kuhusu kile kilichotokea

SourceText: That’s right. She explained to @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name what his father was doing, and what the plan was – to put the baby to sleep and then play a game together.
text: Hiyo ni sahihi. Alimuelezea @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name nini baba yake alikuwa anafanya, na mpango uliokuwepo - kumlaza mtoto na halafu kucheza mchezo pamoja.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name should not be translated.

SourceText: She explained why they were asking him to be quiet
text: Alielezea kwanini walimuomba anyamaze

SourceText: Yes. She helped @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name to understand why it would help if he was quiet – that his brother would struggle to fall asleep if there were loud noises.
text: Ndio. Alimsaidia @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name kuelewa kwanini ingesaidia kama angekuwa kimya - kwamba kaka yake angehangaika kupata usingizi kama kungekuwa na sauti kubwa.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name should not be translated.

SourceText: She said he would get punished if he was loud
text: Alisema angeadhibiwa ikiwa angeongea kwa sauti kubwa.

SourceText: Not really. She did not say he would get punished. Instead, she explained why she wanted him to play a quieter game.
text: Sio hivyo. Hakusema angeadhibiwa. Badala yake, alielezea kwanini alitaka acheze mchezo kwa utulivu.

SourceText: She used praise
text: Alimsifia

SourceText: Yes! Once @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name was playing quietly, she used praise to encourage him to continue.
text: Ndio! Mara @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name alipocheza kimyakimya alimsifia kumtia moyo aendelee kufanya hivyo.
note: The string @data.characters.f1_child_boy.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Book activities offer many opportunities for you and your child to talk and interact.
text: Shughuli za vitabu zinatoa fursa nyingi kwako na mtoto wako kuzungumza na kuchangamana.

SourceText: Here are some ideas for how you can use books to talk and interact:
text: Haya ni baadhi ya mawazo ya jinsi unavyoweza kuzungumza na kuchangamana:

SourceText:
**Name and describe what you see in the pictures**
This helps your child learn new words and understand what is happening in the story.
text:
**Taja na elezea unachokiona katika picha**
Hii humsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza maneno mapya na kufahamu kinachotokea katika hadithi.

SourceText:
Looking at this page, here are some ideas for what you can name and describe for your child:
Look, there is a bird sitting on that flower. The bird has a sharp beak and a long tail. I can see two other birds flying in the sky, can you see them? What do they look like? What else can we see that’s flying?”
“What animal can you see sitting on the rock? And what animal can you see sitting on the grass?"
“Look, they are walking up the mountain. What does he have in his hand? The mountain is steep, so the stick helps him to keep his balance. What is he carrying on his back? What do you think is inside?”
text:
Ukiangalia ukurasa huu, hapa kuna baadhi ya mawazo ya nini unaweza kutaja na kumuelezea mtoto wako:
 Tazama, kuna ndege amekaa kwenye lile ua.Ndege ana mdogo mkali ,na mkia mrefu. Naweza kuona ndege wengine wawili wanapaa angani, unaweza kuwaona? Wanafanana na nini? Tunaweza kuona nini kingine kinachopaa?”
Unaweza kuona mnyama gani amekaa kwenye mwamba? Na ni mnyama gani unaweza kumuona amekaa kwenye nyasi?”
“Tazama, wanatembea kwenda mlimani. Ana nini mkononi mwake? Mlima huo una mwinuko, hivyo fimbo humsaidia yeye kupata nguvu anapotembea. Amebeba nini mgongoni kwake? 
Unafikiri ndani kuna nini?

SourceText:
**Ask questions**
 
This helps your child to talk about the pictures, and think about what is happening.
text:
**Uliza maswali**

Hii humsaidia mtoto wako kuzungumza kuhusu picha, na kufikiri kuhusu kile kinachotokea.

SourceText:
Asking your child questions will help them talk about what they see in the pictures, and think about what is happening.
Using Who/What/Where/Why/How questions are great ways to encourage your child to answer using words other than “yes” and “no. 
Questions like: 
“Where is rabbit standing?
What are they eating? 
Why are they lying down?”
Help your child understand events by asking them what is happening and why it is happening.
Help them understand the characters in the story better, by asking them why they think the character is doing that, or what the character might be thinking or feeling.
text:
Kumuuliza mtoto wako maswali itamsaidia kuzungumza kuhusu nini anaona kwenye picha, na kufikiri kuhusu nini kinatokea.
Kutumia maswali ya Nani/Nini/Wapi/Kwanini/Namna gani ni njia nzuri ya kumtia moyo mtoto wako kujibu kwa kutumia maneno zaidi kuliko ‘ndio” na “hapana”
Maswali kama:
“Sungura amesimama wapi?
Wanakula nini?
Kwanini wamelala chini?
Saidia mtoto wako kufahamu matukio kwa kumuuliza nini kinatokea na kwanini inatokea.
Msaidie kufahamu vizuri wahusika wa kwenye hadithi, kwa kumuuliza kwanini anafikiri mhusika anafanya vile, au mhusika anaweza kuwa anafikiria nini au anajiskiaje.

SourceText:
**Show your child you are listening.**
This will encourage your child to talk more.
text:
**Muonyeshe mtoto wako unamsikiliza**
Hii itamtia moyo mtoto wako kuzungumza zaidi.

SourceText: How can I show my child that I am listening?
text: Nitawezaje kumuonyesha mtoto wangu kwamba ninamsikiliza?

SourceText: See examples:
text: Angalia Mifano:

SourceText:
* Look at your child / make eye contact
* Nod your head
* Make encouraging sounds 
* Respond to what they say
text:
* Mtazame mtoto wako/ fanya mawasiliano kwa macho 
* Tikisa kichwa chako
* Tumia sauti za kutia moyo
* Itikia wanachosema

SourceText:
Three easy ways to use book activities to talk:
1. Name and describe what you see in the pictures.
2. Ask questions about the story.
3. Show your child you are listening.
text:
Njia tatu rahisi za kutumia shughuli za kitabu kuzungumza:
1. Taja na elezea unachokiona katika picha.
2. Muulize mtoto wako maswali kuhusu hadithi.
3. Muonyeshe mtoto wako kuwa unamsikiliza.

SourceText: Remember to talk with kindness. Avoid being critical or negative.
text: Kumbuka kuzungumza kwa upole. epuka kuwa mkosoaji au kuwa kinyume naye.

SourceText:
Small actions, big results! Parents who practice at home get better results.

For your home practice:
🤝 Remember the power of your words. Talk with kindness.
📖 Use book activities to talk, ask questions and interact with your child.
😌 Talking about what causes us stress can be helpful. Reach out to someone you trust if you are feeling stressed.
text:
Matendo madogo, matokeo makubwa! Wazazi wanaofanya kwa vitendo nyumbani hupata matokeo makubwa. 

Kwa ajili ya kufanya kwa vitendo nyumbani
🤝Kumbuka nguvu ya maneno yako. Zungumza kwa upole.
📖 Tumia shughuli za kitabu kuzungumza, uliza maswali na changamana na mtoto wako
😌 Kuzungumza kuhusu nini kinachotusababishia msongo inaweza kusaidia. Muone yeyote unayemuamini kama unajiskia kuwa na msongo.

SourceText: Who Took My Shoe?
text: Nani kachukua kiatu changu?

SourceText: Jabulani has lost his school shoe. He can’t find it anywhere. Where can it be?
text: Jabulani amepoteza kiatu chake cha shule. Hawezi kukipata sehemu yoyote.Je kinaweza kuwa wapi?

SourceText: "Come, Jabulani," Ma says."Why aren’t you ready? You’ll be late for school." "I can’t find my shoe," says Jabulani.
text: ''Njoo, Jabulani,'' Mama anasema.''Kwanini hauko tayari? utachelewa shule.'" Sioni viatu vyangu," anasemaJabulani.

SourceText: "Did you look under your bed?" says Ma. "It’s not under my bed," Jabulani says.
text: "Ulliangalia chini ya kitanda chako"? anasema Mama. "Hakipo chini ya kitanda changu," anasema Jabulani.

SourceText: "Did you look in the wardrobe?" Ma asks. "Yes, it’s not in the wardrobe."
text: "Uliangalia ndani ya kabati?" aliuliza Mama."Ndio, hakipo ndani ya kabati"

SourceText: "I know where your shoe is," giggles Jabulani’s sister Lungi. "Where?" Jabulani asks. "I’m not telling you!" says Lungi
text: "Ninajua kiatu chako kilipo", huku akicheka Lungi dada yake Jabulani.''Wapi'' Jabulani anauliza ''Sikwambii!''anasema Lungi

SourceText: "Somebody’s taken it," Jabulani says.
text: ''Kuna mtu amekichukua'', Jabulani anasema.

SourceText: "Why would someone take one shoe when they’ve got two feet?" says Lungi.
text: ''Kwanini achukue kiatu kimoja wakati watu huwa wana miguu miwili?''anasema Lungi.

SourceText: "I don’t know. Maybe they’ve hidden it to make me cross."
text: "Sijui. Labda wameificha ili kunifanya nihangaike"

SourceText: "Did you take my shoe?" he asks Lungi.
text: " Ulichukua kiatu changu?" alimuuliza Lungi.

SourceText: "No," says Lungi, "your shoes are too big for me."
text: "Hapana", alisema Lungi, "Viatu vyako ni vikubwa sana kwangu"

SourceText: "Did you take my shoe?" Jabulani asks Fruit Juice the Dog.
text: "Ulichukua kiatu changu?"Jabulani alimuuliza Mbwa wake anayeitwa Sharubati.

SourceText: She smiles her big dog smile at him and wags her tail.
text: Anatabasamu kwa Mbwa wake mkubwa ametabasamu na akatingisha mkia wake.

SourceText: "Maybe a bird picked it up and flew away with your shoe," laughs Lungi.
text: ''Labda ndege alichukua na kuruka na kiatu chako'', anacheka Lungi.

SourceText: "Maybe a monkey took it and left it up in a tree, " says Jabulani.
text: ''Labda tumbili alikichukua na akakiacha juu ya mti,''anasema Jabulani.

SourceText: "Don’t worry, we’ll find your shoe," says Ma. "Everyone look for Jabulani’s shoe." But the shoe is nowhere to be found.
text: ''Usijali, tutapata kiatu chako'', anasema Mama.''Kila mtu atafute kiatu cha Jabulani.''lakini kiatu hakipatikani popote.

SourceText: "It’s all right," says Ma. "You can wear your takkies to school today."
text: ''Ni sawa'', anasema Mama. unaweza kuvaa raba zako za michezo shuleni leo.''

SourceText: Lungi comes rushing into the kitchen with a big smile on her face. "I know where your shoe is," she shouts. "Come and see."
text: Lungi anakuja akikimbia jikoni akiwa na tabasamu kubwa usoni kwake. ''Najua kiatu chako kilipo,''anapiga kelele,''Njoo uone

SourceText: A Very Important Tree
text: Mti wa muhimu sana

SourceText: Busi loves the big, beautiful tree outside her house. But her brother wants to cut it down. How will she stop him?
text: Busi anapenda mti mkubwa mzuri ulioko nnje ya nyumba yake. Lakini kaka yake anataka kuukata. Atafanyaje kumzuia?

SourceText: An unexpected adventure
text: Tukio lisilotarajiwa

SourceText: A boring afternoon turns into an exciting adventure when a little boy opens a book.
text: Alasiri yaj kuchosha imegeuka kuwa tukio la kufurahisha pale mtoto mdogo wa kiume anapofungua kitabu.

SourceText: I don't want to go to sleep
text: Sitaki kwenda kulala

SourceText: Nandi doesn’t want to go to sleep. No way! She wants to go on an adventure. Join Nandi as she lets her imagination run wild and free.
text: Nandi hataki kwenda kulala. Hakuna jinsi, anataka kuendelea na tukio. Ungana na Nandi kama anavyopata picha kuwa anakimbia porini na kwa uhuru.

SourceText: "That’s enough now. Goodnight, Nandi."
text: "Imetosha sasa. Usiku mwema Nandi"

SourceText: "I ... don’t ... want ... to ... go ... to ... sleep."
text: "Sitaki kwenda kulala"

SourceText: "I want more supper. Another book! Just one more song?" "Goodnight, Nandi."
text: "Nataka chakula zaidi cha usiku. Kitabu kingine! Wimbo mmoja tu zaidi?' "Usiku mwema, Nandi."

SourceText: "I don’t want to go to sleep!"
text: "Sitaki kwenda kulala"

SourceText: "MAMA! ...I need a glass of water. Please? Please." "It’s time to go to sleep now. Goodnight, Nandi."
text: "Mama!... Tafadhali nahitaji bilauri ya maji? Tafadhali. " Ni muda wa kwenda kulala sasa. Usiku mwemza, Nandi"

SourceText: "I DON’T WANT TO GO TO SLEEP!"
text: "SITAKI KWENDA KULALA"

SourceText: Mama sighs: "What about an adventure? Do you want an adventure?"
text: Mama anapumua;'''Vipi kuhusu utambuzi mpya? Unataka utambuzi mpya?''

SourceText: "Do you want to creep through the jungle on the trail of the fearsome hippocrocoturtleduck?"
text: ''Unataka kutambaa msituni kwenye njia za kutisha za nyangumi kiboko na bata?"

SourceText: "Yes! Yes! Yes!"
text: ''Ndio!' 'Ndio! Ndio!''

SourceText: "I want to fly across the sky! Leap from star to star! Fill my pockets with stardust!"
text: ''Nataka kupaa kuzunguka anga! Kuruka kutoka nyota hadi nyota! Kujaza mifuko yangu na vumbi la nyota!''

SourceText: "I want a Nandi-sized glass submarine to see the creatures at the bottom of the ocean! And a pet giant squid to do water ballet there with me!"
text: "Nataka miwani kubwa kama ya Nandi ya kutumia kwenye manowari kutazama viumbe chini ya bahari na pweza mzuri na mkubwa wacheze na mimi kwenye maji!"

SourceText: "I want to build myself a pair of butterfly wings and zoom to the roof of the sky where I’ll see all the world and everything in it!"
text: ''Nataka kujitengenezea mabawa ya kipepeo na kuvuta hadi mawinguni ambapo nitauona ulimwengu wote na kila kitu ndani yake!''

SourceText: "Look here, Nandi. Here is your very own adventure boat. It’s waiting to take you wherever you want to go. See, put your head here...that’s right...and I’ll just tuck you in...there we go...now, off you go! Adventure awaits ..."
text: "Tazama hapa Nandi. Hii ni boti yako kabisa ya kujivinjari. Inakusubiri ikupeleke popote unapotaka.Ona, weka kichwa chako hapa..., hiyo ni sawa... na nitakuvutia ndani... sasa tunaenda... ondoa boti! kujivinjari kunatusubiri"...

SourceText: "Goodnight, Nandi."
text: ''Usiku mwema Nandi'',

SourceText: Draw your dreams here.
text: Chora ndoto zako hapa.

SourceText: Scared Tumi
text: Tumi anaogopa

SourceText: "What if there’s a monster under my bed?" Tumi is scared. Mama tries to show him that everything is okay.
text: ''Je ikiwa kuna Zimwi chini ya kitanda changu?''Tumi anaogopa. Mama anajaribu kumuonyesha kwamba kila kitu kiko sawa.

SourceText: My name is Tumi and I am scared.
text: Jina langu ni Tumi na ninaogopa.

SourceText: Say, “Mmh, the boy looks scared. I wonder what could have happened?
text: Sema, “Mmh, kijana anaonekana kuwa na hofu, nashangaa nini kimetokea?

SourceText: Mama says it’s okay to be scared. "Everybody gets scared."
text: Mama anasema ni sawa kuogopa.''Kilamtu huwa anaogopa

SourceText: Say, “Sometimes I feel scared” Ask, “Have you ever felt scared? what do you think made you feel that way?”
text: Sema, "Wakati mwingine ninaogopa" Uliza, "Je, umewahi kuogopa? unafikiri ni nini kilikufanya uhisi hivyo?"

SourceText: What if there is a monster under my bed?
text: Je ni vipi ikiwa kuna Zimwi chini ya kitanda changu?

SourceText:
Say, “Oh no, is that a monster under the bed? What is the boy going to do?”

Ask, “show me what you do when you feel scared?”
text:
Sema, "La, hapana, je, huyo ni jini chini ya kitanda? Mvulana atafanya nini?"

Muombe, "nionyeshe unachofanya unapohisi hofu?"

SourceText: "Then I will tell it to go away and NEVER come back."
text: ''''Kisha nitakiambia kiondoke na KAMWE kisirudi tena'',

SourceText: Ask, “who do you go to when you feel scared? How do you feel when you are with them?”
text: Muulize."Huwa unakwenda kwa nani unapojiskia kuogopa?Huwa unajiskiaje ukiwa nao?"

SourceText: What if there are eyes in the bath tub drain?
text: Je ikiwa kuna macho kwenye bomba la kuoga?

SourceText:
Say, "Oh no! Not another monster in the bathtub!”
Then point to each item and say, "This is a bathtub (wait for the child to repeat). This is a tap (wait for the child to repeat). These are tiles (wait for the child to repeat). These are monster eyes! (wait for the child to repeat).”
text:
Sema, "La! hapana! Hakuna jini lingine kwenye beseni la kuogea!"

Kisha onyesha kila kitu na useme, "Hii ni beseni la kuogea (ngoja mtoto arudie). Hili ni bomba (subiri mtoto arudie). Hivi ni vigae (subiri mtoto arudie). Haya ni macho ya mnyama! (ngoja mtoto arudie)"

SourceText: "Then your big sister, Kamo, will pull you out of the bath."
text: ''Basi dada yako Kamo atakutoa nje ya bafu'',

SourceText:
Ask, “Can you tell me what a bathtub is used for?” If the child does not know then help them by saying, “a bathtub is used to bath.”

Say, “now tell me, do you enjoy bathing? Why or why not?”
text:
Muulize,"Je unaweza kuniambia beseni linatumika kwa matumizi gani?, "Ikiwa mtoto hajui basi msaidie kusema beseni hutumika kwa ajili ya kuogea".

Sema," sasa niambie ,unafurahia kuoga?kwanini unafurahia na kwanini hufurahii?',

SourceText: What if a whale swallows me at the beach?
text: Je itakuwaje ikiwa nyangumi ananimeza mimi nikiwa ufukweni?

SourceText:
Say, “Oh no, is that a whale at the beach? 

Ask, “how would you react if you saw a whale? why?
text:
Sema, Oh hapana, huyo ni nyangumi ufukweni?

Muulize, Ungefanyaje kama ungemuona nyangumi? kwanini?

SourceText: "Then Kamo and I will swim into the whale’s mouth to rescue you."
text: ''Kisha Kamo na mimi tutaogelea kwenye mdomo wa Nyangumi ili tukuokoe''

SourceText:
Point at the picture of the boy in a whale and say, “oh no, the whale swallowed a boy. What are we going to do? 

Again say, “look, i think they are going to rescue the boy.”

Ask, “how do you think the boy feels seeing them? Why?
text:
Onyesha kwa kuelekezea kwenye picha ya kijana kwenye myangumi na useme, la, hapana, Nyangumi alimmeza mvulana. Tutafanyaje?

Alafu sema, “tazama, Nafikiri wanakwenda kumuokoa mvulana.”

Muulize, Unafikiri mvulana anajisikiaje kuwaona? kwanini??

SourceText: What if I can’t sing ABC and the other kids laugh at me?
text: Je itakuwaje kama siwezi kuimba ABC na watoto wengine wananicheka?

SourceText:
Ask, “how many people do you see in this picture? How many have hair?  What color is their clothes? Who is the tallest?”

Say, “guess what, the tallest is the teacher.”
text:
Muulize, “ni watu wangapi unawaona kwenye picha hii? Wangapi wana nywele? nguo zao ni za rangi gani? nani mrefu zaidi?

“Sema, Unajua nini, mrefu zaidi ni mwalimu”.

SourceText: "Then Teacher Jill will help you remember."
text: ''Kisha mwalimu Jill atakusaidia kukumbuka'',

SourceText: Ask, “Do you have a teacher? Who is your teacher?”
text: Muulize, “Una mwalimu? Mwalimu wako ni nani?"

SourceText: What if I'm scared of going to the dentist tomorrow?
text: Je itakuwaje kama ninaogopa kwenda kwa Daktari wa meno kesho?

SourceText:
Say, "Look! This looks like a dentist's room. Do you know what a dentist is?"
"Imagine your teeth are like little building blocks in your mouth. A dentist is a special helper who makes sure those building blocks stay strong and clean! They help keep your smile healthy and happy!”
text:
Sema, “Tazama! hiki kinafanana na chumba cha daktari wa meno. Unajua daktari wa neno ni nani?”

“Fikiria meno yako yanafanana na matofari kwenye mdomo wako. Daktari wa meno ni mtoa msaada maalum ambaye huhakikisha yale matofari yanakuwa masafi na imara! wanasaidia kutunza furaha na afya ya tabasamu lako!”

SourceText: "I will be right there holding your hand." Everybody gets scared. Mama says it’s okay.
text: ''Nitakuwa hapo nimekushika mkono'', kila mtu anaogopa, Mama anasema ni sawa.

SourceText:
Say, "Look! The boy is smiling! Maybe he's not scared anymore."
Then, smile really big and say, "See? This is my smile! It makes me happy to smile!"  Then ask: "Now you show me your smile! How does it feel when you smile?"
text:
Sema, “Tazama! Mvulana anatabasamu! nadhani haogopi tena.” 

Alafu, toa tabasamu kubwa na useme, “umeona? Hili ni tabasamu langu! ninajisikia mwenye furaha kutabasamu!” Alafu muulize: sasa unanionyesha tabasamu lako! unajisikiaje unapotabasamu?”

SourceText: Mom's Red Coat
text: Koti la mama Jekundu

SourceText: Mom needs to go away for work. I’ll miss her. Will it help if she leaves her red coat with me?
text: Mama anahitaji kusafiri kikazi, Nitamkumbuka sana. Akiniachia koti lake jekundu itasaidia?

SourceText: © Book Dash, 2022. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © Book Dash, 2002. Haki zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: I love Mom’s coat! It’s red and long and warm. And it smells like Mom!
text: Napenda koti la mama! Ni jekundu, refu na lenye joto. Na lina linanukia kama mama!

SourceText: Ask: what are they doing? What colour is her coat?
text: Uliza: Wanafanya nini? Koti lake ni la rangi gani?

SourceText: I love doing things with Mom! We picnic outside. She hugs me when I come home from school. We work in the garden. At night, she holds me tight until I fall asleep.
text: Napenda kufanya vitu na mama! Tunafanya pikiniki nje. Ananikumbatia ninapokuja nyumbani kutoka shule. Tunafanya kazi bustanini. Usiku, ananikumbatia sana mpaka ninalala.

SourceText: Describe what you see, or ask your child to tell you what they see.
text: Elezea unachokiona, au mwambie mtoto wako akwambie wanaona nini.

SourceText: "Good news!" says Mom. "I found a job! I will be away all week, but I’ll come home on weekends!"
text: "Habari njema" anasema mama." Nimepata kazi! Nitakuwa mbali wiki nzima, lakini nitakuja nyumbani siku wa mwisho wa wiki!"

SourceText: Mimic actions from the pictures or story, like the mom being excited.
text: Igiza matendo kutoka kwenye picha au hadithi, kama vile mama akiwa na furaha.

SourceText: "Who will hold me at night, Mom?" "Who will hug me, picnic with me, garden with me?"
text: "Nani atanikumbatia usiku, mama?" "Nani atanikumbatia, kufanya pikiniki na mimi, kufanya kazi za bustani na mimi?"

SourceText: "I can see that you are sad. I will leave my red coat here with you." "When you see it, remember that I love you and I’m coming back."
text: "Nakuona una huzuni,. Nitakuachia koti langu jekundu." " Utakapoliona kumbuka kwamba nakupenda na nitarudi."

SourceText: To help your child understand, explain what is happening. Say: Look, the mom has to go, but she is leaving her red coat behind for her son to comfort him.
text: Kumsaidia mtoto wako kuelewa, elezea nini kinatokea. Sema: Tazama, mama anatakiwa kuondoka, lakini anaacha koti lake jekundu kwaajili ya kumfariji mtoto wake.

SourceText: I drag the red coat outside – it’s my picnic blanket! It feels like Mom is with me.
text: Ninavuta koti jekundu nje - ni blanketi langu la pikiniki! Najiskia kama mama yupo na mimi.

SourceText: Oops! Juice spill!
text: Oops! Juisi imemwagika!

SourceText: Ask: Where is the boy? Where is his mom’s red coat? What is he doing?
text: Uliza: Kijana wa kiume yuko wapi? Koti jekundu la mama yake liko wapi? Anafanya nini?

SourceText: I am sad that Mom’s not waiting at the door when I come home. I put on her coat. It’s warm and it smells like her. It feels like a hug!
text: Nina huzuni mama hajanisubiri mlangoni ninapokuja nyumbani. Nina vaa koti lake. Ni la moto na linanukia kama yeye. Najiskia kama nimekumbatiwa!

SourceText: Oops! Paint!
text: Oops! rangi!

SourceText: Use descriptive words to talk about the pictures. Say: Look, he is wearing his mom’s red coat. He is holding a paint brush in one hand and a picture in the other hand.
text: Tumia maneno ya maelezo kuzungumzia picha. Sema tazama amevaa koti jekundu la mama yake. Ameshika brashi ya rangi mkono mmoja na picha kwa mkono mwingine.

SourceText: I help Gogo in the garden. The long coat on the branch scares away the chickens! It feels like Mom is gardening with us. Oops! Mud!
text: Namsaidia Bibi bustanini. Koti kubwa kwenye tawi linatisha kuku! Najiskia kama mama anafanya kazi bustanini na sisi. Oops! tope!

SourceText: Ask: Where is the red coat now? What animals can you see under the tree? Do they look the same, or are they different? Are they going in the same direction or in opposite directions?
text: Uliza: liko wapi koti jekundu sasa? Unaweza kuona wanyama gani chini ya mti? Je wanaonekana sawa au wako tofauti? Je wanaelekea upande mmoja au pande tofauti?

SourceText: When it’s dark, I miss Mom most. Gogo covers me with her warm coat. It feels like Mom is holding me as I fall asleep. Oops! Cookie crumbs!
text: Ikiwa giza. Namkumbuka sana mama, Bibi ananifunika na koti lake lenye joto. Ninajisikia kama mama ananishikilia ninapolala. Oops! makombo ya vireja!

SourceText: Ask: Where is the red coat now? What is the boy doing? Why do you think he is doing that? Do you think he might be missing his mom?
text: Uliza: Koti jekundu liko wapi sasa? Je mvulana anafanya nini? unafikiri ni kwa nini anafanya hivyo? Unafikiri atakuwa amemkumbuka mama yake?

SourceText: Mom’s red coat is warm and smells like...paint, juice, mud, and cookie crumbs! Oops! We need to wash it!
text: Koti la mama jekundu lina joto na linanukia kama....rangi, juisi,matope, na masalia ya vitafunwa!Oops! Tunahitaji kulifua!

SourceText: Say: Look, the red coat is hanging on the washing line. Ask: Why do you think they washed the coat? What else is hanging on the washing line? How many socks can you see?
text: Sema: Tazama, koti jekundu linaning'inia kwenye kamba. Uliza: Unafikiri kwanini walifua koti? Ni kitu gani kingine kipo kwenye kamba ya kuanikia nguo? unaweza kuona soksi ngapi?

SourceText: The wind blows the red coat off the washing line...up into the air! It flies over the fence! It flies over the taxi! Oops! Who did the coat fall on?
text: Upepo unapeperusha koti jekundu kwenye kamba...unalipeleka hewani! linapeperukia kwenye uzio! Linapeperukia kwenye taksi! Oops! Nani ameliangusha koti?

SourceText: Say: Look, the wind blew the red coat away. Ask: who do you think is under the coat? Why do you think so?
text: Semaa: Tazama, upepo umelipeperusha koti jekundu mbali, Uliza: Unadhani ni nani yuko chini ya koti? Kwanini unafikiri hivyo?

SourceText: I run and grab it! "Found you, coat!" The red coat smells like Mom again. "Oh!" "Found you, Mom! You’re back!"
text: Nakimbia na kulikamata! "Nimekukamata wewe koti" Koti jekundu linanukia kama mama tena. "Oh!"" Nimekupata, Mama! umerudi!"

SourceText: Demonstrate the emotions from the story. Say in a happy voice: hooray! His mom is back! Ask: how do you think he is feeling now?
text: Onyesha hisia kutoka kwenye hadithi. Sema kwa sauti ya furaha: huree! Mama yake amerudi! Uliza: Unafikiri anajiskiaje sasa?

SourceText: When Will Amma Be Back?
text: Ni lini Mama atarudi?

SourceText: Roja’s mother leaves for work early in the day. She promises to be back by bedtime. What will Roja do all day without Amma?
text: Mama yake Roja anaenda kazini mapema. Ameahidi kurudi muda wa kulala. Roja atafanya nini siku nzima bila mama?

SourceText: © Pratham Books, 2018. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © Vitabu vya Pratham, 2018. Haki zingine zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: Roja is sad. Amma is going to work. "I will be back before bedtime, kannamma," says Amma.
text: Roja ana huzuni. Mama anaenda kazini. "Nitarudi kabla ya muda wa kulala, kannamma," anasema mama.

SourceText: "But at what time?" asks Roja. "At exactly 9 o’clock tonight," replies Amma. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 6 o’clock in the morning.
text: " Lakini ni muda gani?"Roja anauliza. "Saa tatu kamili usiku," mama anajibu. Tick tock! Tick tock! Ni saa 12 kamili asubuhi.

SourceText: "I want Amma to give me milk. Not you!" says Roja to Appa. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 8 o’clock in the morning.
text: " Namtaka mama anipe maziwa. Sio wewe!" Roja anamwambia baba. Tick tock! Tick tock! Ni saa mbili kamili asubuhi.

SourceText: "Let’s buy potatoes, Thaatha!" says Roja. "But we had potatoes just yesterday. How about brinjal today?" Thaatha asks. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 10 o’clock in the morning.
text: "Na tununue viazi, babu" Roja anasema. "Lakini tulikuwa na viazi jana tu. Vipi kuhusu biringanya leo?" Babu anasema. Tick tock! Tick tock! Ni saa nne kamili asubuhi.

SourceText: "Paati, let’s eat. Thaatha is making pappadam!" Roja yells. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 1 o’clock in the afternoon.
text: ""Paati, hebu tule. Babu anatengeneza vitafunwa!" Roja alisema kwa sauti. Tick tock Tick tock! Ni saa saba kamili mchana.

SourceText: Honk! Honk! Roja’s Akka is back from school. "Paati says I will go to school with you after this summer. Won’t that be fun,Akka?" says Roja, excitedly. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 3 o’clock in the afternoon.
text: Hodi! hodi! Kaka yake Roja amerudi kutoka shule."Paati anasema nitaenda shule na wewe baada ya majira haya ya joto. Si itakuwa ya kufurahisha kaka?" anasema Roja kwa furaha. Tick tock! Tick tock! Ni saa tisa kamili mchana.

SourceText: "It’s time to go home, Roja," Appa calls out. "Just one last time!" shouts Roja. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 5 o’clock in the evening.
text: "Ni muda wa kwenda nyumbani, Roja " Baba aliita. "Mara moja tu ya mwisho" Roja alipiga kelele. Tick tock! Tick tock! Ni saa kumi na moja jioni.

SourceText: "Selvi, eat your dosai quickly! Only then will you become big and strong," says Roja. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 7 o’clock at night.
text: "Selvi, kula chapati yako haraka! Itakufanya uwe mkubwa na mwenye nguvu," anasema Roja, Tick tock! Tick tock! Ni saa moja kamili usiku.

SourceText: "And so, when the cap-seller threw down his cap, the monkeys threw their caps down too... "
text: "Na hivyo, muuza kofia aliporusha chini kofia yake, ngedere walirusha kofia zao chini pia..."

SourceText: "AMMMAAAA!" Roja shouts. "What did you do all day, Roja?" Amma asks. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is almost 9 o’clock at night.
text: "Mamaaaaa" Roja aliita kwa sauti. "Ulifanya nini siku nzima, Roja?" Mama anauliza. Tick tock! Tick tock! Ni takriban saa tatu kamili usiku.

SourceText: "I had a lot of fun today, Amma! Appa fed me breakfast. I bought brinjal with Thaatha. He made pappadam for lunch.
text: "Nilikuwa na vingi vya kufurahisha leo, Mama! Baba alinilisha kifungua kinywa. Nilinunua bilinganya na babu. Alitengeneza chapati kwajili ya chakula cha mchana.

SourceText: I picked up Akka from the school van. I played in the park. I fed Selvi dinner. Appa told me a story and now you are back!" Roja says, with a wide smile.
text: Nilimpokea kaka kutoka gari ya shule. Nilicheza sehemu ya michezo. Nilimlisha Selvi chakula cha usiku. Baba alinisimulia hadithi and sasa umerudi!" Roja anasema, kwa tabasamu kubwa.

SourceText: Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 9 o’clock at night!
text: Tick tock! Tick tock! Ni saa tatu kamili usiku!

SourceText:
**My Day**
Here are some things that Roja does at different times of the day. What did you do at the same time yesterday? Draw pictures of yourself doing these different things on a piece of paper.
1. Roja eats breakfast at 8 o’clock. What did you do at 8 o’clock yesterday?
2. Roja goes shopping at 10 o’clock. What did you do at 10 o’clock yesterday?
3. Roja eats lunch at 1 o’clock. What did you do at 1 o’clock yesterday?
text:
**Siku yangu**
Hivi ni baadhi ya vitu ambavyo Roja anafanya katika wakati tofauti katika siku. Ulifanya nini muda huo huo jana? Chora picha yako katika kipande cha kariatasi inayoonyesha unafanya vitu hivi mbalimbali. 
1. Roja anapata kifungua kinywa saa mbili kamili asubuhi. Ulifanya nini saa mbili kamili asubuhi jana?
2. Roja anaenda dukani saa nne kamili asubuhi. Ulifanya nini saa nne kamili asubuhi jana?
3. Roja anakula chakula cha mchana saa saba kamili. Ulfanya nini saa saba kamili mchana jana?

SourceText:
4. Roja picks up Akka from the school van at 3 o’clock. What did you do at 3 o’clock yesterday?
5. Roja plays in the park at 5 o’clock. What did you do at 5 o’clock yesterday?
6. Roja feeds Selvi at 7 o’clock. What did you do at 7 o’clock yesterday?
text:
4. Roja anampokea kaka kutoka kwenye gari ya shule saa tisa kamili alasiri. Ulifanya nini saa tisa kamili alasiri jana?
5. Roja anacheza kwenye sehemu ya michezo saa kumi na moja jioni. Ulifanya nini saa kumi na moja jioni jana?
6. Roja anamlisha Selvi saa moja kamili usiku. Ulifanya nini saa moja kamili usiku jana?

SourceText: Discuss the book’s cover. Ask: What do you see? What is the bee doing? Where is the bee lying down?”
text: Jadili jalada la juu la kitabu: Muulize: Unaona nini? Unafikiri  nyuki anafanya nini? Nyuki amelala wapi?’’

SourceText: The Bee and the Elephant
text: Nyuki na Tembo

SourceText: An elephant tries to help a little lost bee find his home. Is it the nest? The cave? Where does he live?
text: Tembo anajaribu kumsaidia nyuki mdogo aliyepotea,kupata nyumbani kwao. Je ni kiota? Ni pango? Anaishi wapi?

SourceText: "I am lost," said Little Bee. "I cannot find my home!" "Can you please help me, Mr. Elephant?"
text:
"Nimepotea," alisema nyuki mdogo. "Siwezi pata nyumbani kwetu!" "Tafadhali unaweza
nisaidia, Bwana. Tembo?"

SourceText: Say: “Oh no, I think the bee is lost, it is all alone.” Ask: “Can you tell how the bee is feeling? Why do you think so? Who do you see behind the bee?”
text: Sema:  “Oh hapana, nafikiri nyuki amepotea, yuko peke yake.” Muulize: unaweza kusema nyuki anajiskiaje? Kwanini unafikiri hivyo? Unamuona nani nyuma ya nyuki?"

SourceText: "Is this nest your home, Little Bee?" the elephant asked.
text: "Hiki kiota ni nyumbani kwako, Nyuki mdogo?" Tembo aliuliza.

SourceText: Say: “Look, the bee is sitting on the elephant's trunk! What is the elephant doing? Where is he putting the bee? Why do you think he is putting him there?”
text: Sema: “Angalia Nyuki amekaa kwenye mkonga wa tembo! Tembo anafanya nini? Amemuweka wapi nyuki? Unafikiri kwanini anamuweka pale?”

SourceText: "Oh no!" cried Little Bee. "This is a bird’s home."
text: "Oh hapana!" Alilia Nyuki mdogo. "Hapa ni nyumbani Kwa ndege."

SourceText: Ask: “How many animals can you see? Can you name them? Which one is the biggest? Which one is the smallest?”
text: Muulize: “Unaona wanyama wangapi” Unaweza kuwataja? Je ni yupi mkubwa zaidi? Ni yupi mdogo?

SourceText: "Is this cave your home?" asked the elephant.
text: "Hili pango ni nyumbani kwako?" aliuliza tembo.

SourceText: Say: “Look, there is the cave. Where could the elephant be taking the bee?” Ask: “Would you go to the cave?”
text: Sema: “Tazama,kuna pango.Tembo anampeleka wapi  nyuki?’’ Muulize: Je unaweza kwenda kwenye pango?"

SourceText: "Oh no! This is a bat’s home."
text: "Oh hapana! Hapa ni nyumbani Kwa Popo."

SourceText: Say: “Look, the elephant and bee are running away!” (mimic the sound and the action). Ask: “What are they running from? Can you show me how you  can run?”
text: Sema: Tazama, Tembo na nyuki wanakimbia!” (Iga sauti na kitendo). Muulize:  “Wanakimbia nini? Unaweza kunionyesha jinsi  unavyoweza kukimbia?”

SourceText: "Is this hive your home, Little Bee?"
text: "Huu mzinga ni nyumbani kwako, Nyuki mdogo?"

SourceText: Say: “Wala, there is a beehive! Finally, the bee is home!” Ask: How do you think the bee feels now? How do you think the elephant feels? How do you feel when you get home? Why do you feel like that?”
text: Sema: “Wala,Kuna mzinga wa nyuki! Hatimaye nyuki yuko nyumbani!” Muulize: "Unafikiri nyuki anajiskiaje sasa? Unafikiri tembo anajiskiaje? Unajiskiaje unapofika nyumbani? Kwanini unajiskia hivyo?"

SourceText: "Oh yes!" said Little Bee happily. "This is my home."
text: "Oh ndio!" alisema nyuki mdogo Kwa furaha. "Hapa ni nyumbani Kwangu."

SourceText: Use a picture to help your child count. Ask: “How many bees can you see? How many eyes do you see? Now count your eyes, how many eyes do you have?”
text:
Tumia picha kumsaidia mtoto wako kuhesabu. 
Muulize: “Unaona nyuki wangapi? Unaona macho mangapi? Sasa hesabu macho yako, una macho mangapi?”

SourceText: "Thank you for helping me, Mr. Elephant."
text: "Asante kwakunisaidia,Bwana Tembo."

SourceText: Say: “Look, the bees, the bird and the bats are flying. What sound do bees make when they fly? And what about birds?” Ask: “How many bees can you see? And how many bats can you see?”
text: Sema: “Tazama, nyuki, ndege na popo wanaruka. Nyuki hutoa mlio gani wanaporuka? Na vipi kuhusu ndege?” Muulize: “Unaweza kuona nyuki wangapi? Na ni popo wangapi unaweza kuwaona?”?

SourceText: Ask: “What do you think about this story? How would you feel if you were in the story? What would you have done if you were the elephant?”
text: Muulize: Unafikiri nini kuhusu hadithi hii? Ungejiskiaje kama ungekuwa kwenye hadithi? Ungefanyaje kama wewe ungekuwa tembo?

SourceText: Katiiti’s Song
text: Wimbo wa Katiti

SourceText: Every day, Katiiti’s mother calls her with a beautiful song. One day, a crafty gorilla tries to sing as sweetly as her mother.
text: Kila siku, Mama yake Katiti anamwita kwa wimbo mzuri. Siku moja, Sokwe mwerevu alijaribu kuimba vizuri kama mama yake.

SourceText: Katiiti lived in a village next to a forest.
text: Katiti anaishi kwenye kijiji karibu na msitu.

SourceText: She loved playing in the forest. Maama told her to be careful.
text: Anapenda kucheza msituni. Mama alimwambia awe makini.

SourceText: Every day Maama would sing their special song to call her.
text: Kila siku Mama anaimba wimbo wao maalumu kumwita.

SourceText: One day, Katiiti bumped into a gorilla.
text: Siku moja, Katiti alijigonga kwa Sokwe.

SourceText: She ran and hid in a cave.
text: Alikimbia na kujificha pangoni.

SourceText: Gorilla came and sang Maama’s song in a gruff voice.
text: Sokwe alikuja na aliimba wimbo wa Mama kwa sauti nzito na kali.

SourceText: Gorilla ate lots of bananas to make his voice sweeter.
text: Sokwe alikula ndizi nyingi kufanya sauti yake iwe nzuri.

SourceText: Gorilla sang sweetishly.
text: Sokwe aliimba vizuuuri.

SourceText: Gorilla went away and ate lots of honey to make his voice even sweeter.
text: Sokwe alienda mbali na alikula asali nyingi kuifanya sauti yake iwe nzuri zaidi.

SourceText: Gorilla sang as sweetly as Maama.
text: Sokwe aliimba vizuri kama Mama.

SourceText: Maama came just in time to chase away Gorilla.
text: Mama alikuja kwa wakati kumfukuza Sokwe.

SourceText: Katiiti and Maama sang all the way back home.
text: Katiti na Mama waliimba njia nzima wakiwa wanarudi nyumbani.

SourceText: A Beautiful Day
text: Siku Nzuri

SourceText: It’s a beautiful day for a picnic. Everyone wants to join in the fun.
text: Ni siku nzuri ya pikiniki. Kila mmoja anataka kujiunga kwenye furaha.

SourceText: "What a beautiful day," says Mom. "Wake up Nicholas."
text: "Siku nzuri namna gani," Mama anasema. "Amka Nicholaus."

SourceText: "Hello sun," says Nicholas. "Good morning birds."
text: "Haloo jua," Nicholaus anasema. "Habari za asubuhi ndege."

SourceText: Say: “Look, the boy just woke up.” Ask: “What do you think the mother is saying to the boy? Can you tell me how the boy is feeling? What is the baby pointing to? Who else sees what the baby sees?”
text: Sema: "Angalia, kijana ameamka." Uliza: "Unafikiri mama anamwambia nini mvulana? Unaweza kuniambia jinsi mvulana anavyohisi? Mtoto anaonyesha nini? Nani mwingine anaona kile mtoto anachokiona?"

SourceText: "It’s a lovely day," says Dad. "Let’s have a picnic by the river."
text: "Ni siku nzuri," Baba anasema. "Wacha tukatembelee mandhari ya ufukwe wa mto."

SourceText: "Can my friend Jacob come?" asks Nicholas.
text: "Je rafiki yangu Jakobo anaweza kuja?" Nicholaus anauliza.

SourceText: Say: “Wow, it's such a beautiful day.” Ask: What are they eating for breakfast? What did you eat for breakfast this morning? What can you see through their window? And what can you see through our window?”
text: Sema: "Wow, ni siku nzuri sana." Uliza: Wanakula nini kama kifungua kinywa? Umekula nini kama kifungua kinywa asubuhi ya leo? Unaweza kuona nini kupitia dirisha lao? Na unaweza kuona nini kupitia dirisha letu?"

SourceText: "Don’t forget me. I love picnics!" says Donkey. "And me. I want to come too!" says Dog.
text: "Usisahau. Napenda pikiniki!" Punda anasema. "Na mimi. Pia nataka kuja!" Mbwa anasema.

SourceText: "Follow us," say the birds.
text: "Tufuateni," Ndege wanasema.

SourceText: Ask: “How many children can you see? How are they feeling? Can you name all the animals? How many birds can you see? Which bird is flying the highest? And which bird is flying the lowest?”
text: Muulize: "Je! unaweza kuona watoto wangapi? Wanajisikiaje? Je, unaweza kutaja wanyama wote? Unaweza kuona ndege wangapi? Ni ndege gani anayeruka juu zaidi? Na ni ndege gani anayeruka chini zaidi?"

SourceText: Ask: “Where do you think they are going? Who is walking in the front? And who is walking at the back?”
text: Muulize: "Unafikiri wanaenda wapi? Ni nani anayetembea mbele yao? Na ni nani anayetembea nyuma?"

SourceText: "I’ll race you to that tree," Nicholas says.
text: "Nitakukimbizia kwenye ule mti!" Nicholaus anasema.

SourceText: Say: “Now the boy is pointing at the tree, I think they are getting ready to see who can reach the tree first. Ready, set, go!!!!!” Ask your child: “Who do you think will win the race? Let’s go to the next page to find out.”
text: Sema: "Sasa Mvulana  anaonyesha kwa kuelekezea kwenye mti, nadhani wanajiandaa kuona ni nani anayeweza kufika kwenye mti kwanza. Tayari, weka, nenda!!!!!" Muulize mtoto wako: “Unafikiri ni nani atashinda shindano hilo? Twende kwenye ukurasa unaofuata ili kujua."

SourceText: "I won, I won," says Donkey. "Not fair," says Nicholas. "You’ve got four legs."
text: "Nimeshinda, nimeshinda," Punda anasema. "Sio sawa," Nicholaus anasema. "Wewe una miguu minne anasema Nicholaus."

SourceText: Say: “Hurray! The monkey won the race”. Ask: Who looks tired? Why do you think he is tired?”
text: Sema: "Haya! Ngedere ameshinda mbio." Muulize: Nani anaonekana amechoka? Unafikiri kwa nini amechoka?”?

SourceText: "Look what I can do," says Nicholas.
text: "Angalia ninachoweza kufanya," Nicholaus anasema.

SourceText: "I bet you can’t do this," says Jacob.
text: "Nabashiri huwezi kufanya hiki." Jakobo anasema.

SourceText: Ask: “What are they doing? Can you do any of these moves? Show me!”
text: Muulize: "Wanafanya nini? Unaweza kufanya mojawapo ya matendo haya? Nionyeshe!"

SourceText: "Here’s our picnic spot," says Dad.
text: "Hapa ni eneo la mandhari yetu," Baba anasema.

SourceText: Describe the picture by saying, “Wow, mom and dad have found a beautiful picnic spot next to the river.” Ask: “How do you think everyone is going to feel about it?”
text: Eleza picha hiyo kwa kusema, "Lo, mama na baba wamepata sehemu nzuri ya pikiniki karibu na mto." Muulize: "Unafikiri kila mtu atahisije kuhusu hilo?"

SourceText: "Race you to the water!" says Jacob.
text: "Nakukimbizia kwenye maji!" Jakobo anasema.

SourceText: Ask: “What are they doing? Wheeee, they are jumping into the water! Who is making the biggest splash? Would you also jump in? Why or why not?”
text: Muulize: "Wanafanya nini? Weeee, wanaruka ndani ya maji! Ni nani anayepiga maji zaidi? Je, unaweza pia kuruka kwenye maji? Kwa nini au kama huwezi ni kwa nini?"

SourceText: "Come and eat, boys and girls," says Mom.
text: "Njooni tule, wavulana na wasichana," Mama anasema.

SourceText: Ask: “What is everyone eating? What would you choose to eat? Is everyone eating food? What about the baby? And what about the donkey?”
text: Muulize: "Kila mtu anakula nini? Ungechagua kula nini? Je, kila mtu anakula chakula? Vipi kuhusu mtoto? Na vipi kuhusu punda?"

SourceText: "Time to go home," says Mom. "Say goodbye to Jacob."
text: "Wakati wakurudi nyumbani," Mama anasema. "Mwambie Jakobo kwa heri."

SourceText:
Say: “Now it is time to go home (mimic waving and saying goodbye). Can you also wave?”

Ask: “Now tell me, how do you feel when you have to leave your friends after playing together? Why do you feel that way?”
text:
Sema: "Sasa ni muda wa kwenda nyumbani (igiza kupunga mkono na kusema kwaheri). Je, unaweza pia kupunga mkono?"

Muulize: “Sasa niambie, unajisikiaje unapolazimika kuachana na marafiki zako baada ya kucheza pamoja? Kwa nini unajiskia hivyo?”

SourceText:
Help your child learn new words. Say: Look, the sky is dark and the stars are out, it is time to sleep.” Then say: What is on the roof of their house? Where is the pumpkin? And where are the bricks?”

“Would you enjoy a picnic? Let’s have our lunch outside under the tree today and pretend to have our own picnic!”
text:
Msaidie mtoto wako kujifunza maneno mapya. Sema: Tazama mbingu ni giza na nyota ziko nje, ni wakati wa kulala. Kisha sema: Kuna nini juu ya paa la nyumba yao? Boga liko wapi? Na matofali yako wapi?

Je, unaweza kufurahia pikiniki? Hebu tule chakula chetu cha mchana nje chini ya mti leo na tujifanye tuna pikiniki yetu wenyewe!

SourceText: A trip to the tap
text: Safari ya kwenda bombani

SourceText: Oluhle fetches water at the tap every day. She gets to carry her favourite pink bucket. But one day it gets lost …
text: Maria huwa anachota maji bombani kila siku. Anatakiwa abebe ndoo yake anayoipenda ya rangi ya pinki. Lakini siku moja ilipotea…

SourceText: Oluhle wakes up early. She is excited to get water. “Come Mama, we have to be first today,” she calls.
text: Maria anaamka mapema. Anafurahia kufata maji. "Njoo Mama, tunatakiwa kuwa wa kwanza leo," aliita.

SourceText: On the way they meet Nathi and Unathi. They are going to the tap with their mother.
text: Wakiwa njiani walikutana na Tamala na Tamali. Wanaenda bombani na mama yao.

SourceText: Oluhle and her friends play while the grown-ups get water. “Oluhle, your bucket is full,” says Mama.
text: Oluhle na rafiki zake wanacheza wakati wakubwa wanachota maji. "Oluhle, ndoo yako imejaa," anasema Mama.

SourceText: At home, Oluhle takes a bath. Mama goes to work and Oluhle stays with Makhulu.
text: Nyumbani, Olhle anaoga. Mama anenda kazini na Oluhle anabaki na Mkhulu.

SourceText: In the afternoon Makhulu starts to make supper. She needs more water. She calls Oluhle so they can go to the tap.
text: Mchana Makulu anaanza kupika chakula cha jioni. anahitaji maji zaidi. Anamwita Maria ili waende bombani.

SourceText: “Makhulu, I can’t find my bucket. I searched everywhere,” says Oluhle. Makhulu helps her look, but the bucket is nowhere to be found.
text: "Makulu, siioni ndoo yangu. Nimetafuta kila mahali," anasema Maria. Makulu anamsaidia kutafuta, lakini ndoo haionekani popote.

SourceText: Makhulu thinks of a plan. She gets a 2-litre bottle from the cupboard and fetches paints and paint brushes.
text: Makulu anafikiria mpango. Anachukua chupa mbili ndogo kutoka kabatini na anachukua rangi na brashi za kupakia rangi.

SourceText: Makhulu makes a bucket from the water bottle. She paints it pink. “Here’s a recycled bucket, Oluhle!”
text: Makulu anatengeneza ndoo kutoka kwenye chupa ya maji. Anapaka rangi ya pinki. " Hii hapa ni ndoo iliyotengenezwa tena, Maria "

SourceText: “Thank you, Makhulu,” says Oluhle. She is excited to go to the tap with her new recycled bucket.
text: "Asante, Makulu," anasema Maria. Anafurahia kwenda bombani akiwa na ndoo yake mpya iliyotengenezwa.

SourceText: The next day Unathi and Nathi bring two bottles to Makhulu. “Makhulu, could you please make recycled buckets for us?”
text: Siku iliyofuata Tamala na Natanieli walimletea Makulu chupa mbili. "Makulu, tafadhali unaweza kutugengenezea ndoo?"

SourceText: Makhulu paints their buckets yellow and blue, their favourite colours. Nathi and Unathi are happy. Oluhle is happy too.
text: Makulu anapaka ndoo zao rangi ya njano na bluu, rangi zao pendwa. Tamali na Tamala wamefurahi. Maria amefurahi pia.

SourceText: The friends can’t wait to show off with their new buckets. “Can we go to the tap now?” they ask.
text: Marafiki wana hamu ya kuringishia ndoo zao mpya. " Tunaweza kwenda bombani sasa?" waliuliza.

SourceText: Fifi and Teddy
text: Fifi na Teddy

SourceText: Fifi has a brown teddy bear that she loves very much. But where is Teddy?
text: Fifi ana mdori wa rangi ya kahawia ambaye anampenda sana. Lakini Teddy yuko wapi?

SourceText: Fifi has loved Teddy since she was a baby.
text: Fifi alimpenda Teddy tangu alipokuwa mdogo.

SourceText: Say: “Look, there is a girl and a teddy.” Ask: “Who do you think this teddy belongs to?”
text: Sema: "Tazama, kuna msichana na mdoli." Muulize: "Unafikiri mdoli huyu ni wa nani?"

SourceText: Fifi eats with Teddy. Fifi plays with Teddy.
text: Fifi anakula na Teddy. Fifi anacheza na Teddy.

SourceText: Point at the picture and Ask: “What do you think the girl and teddy are doing?” Point to the picture of the girl on the swing and ask again: “How do you think she is feeling? Why do you say that?”
text: Elekeza kwenye picha na Muulize: "Unafikiri msichana na mdoli wanafanya nini?" Elekeza kwenye picha ya msichana aliye kwenye bembea na muulize tena: "Unafikiri anajiskiaje? Kwa nini unasema hivyo?"

SourceText: Fifi takes Teddy wherever she goes. And they curl up together every night.
text: Fifi anaenda na Teddy popote anapoenda. Na wanacheza pamoja kila siku.
