SourceText: Ask: “Who is sitting at the back of the car? Where do you think they might be going? Where is teddy sleeping? Do you sleep with anything in your bed?”
text: Muulize: "Nani ameketi nyuma ya gari? Unafikiri wanaweza kuwa wanaenda wapi? Mdoli analala wapi? Je, unalala na kitu chochote kitandani?"

SourceText: Fifi knows she cannot take Teddy to school. So every morning she leaves Teddy on her bed.
text: Fifi anajua hawezi kwenda shule na Teddy. Hivyo kila asubuhi anamuacha Teddy.

SourceText: Say: “Oh no! Where is the girl? Teddy is alone. How do you think Teddy feels?”
text: Sema: "La! Msichana yuko wapi? Mdoli  yuko peke yake. Unafikiri Mdoli anajisikiaje?"

SourceText: One day, when she comes back from school, Teddy is not there!
text: Siku moja, alipokuwa akirudi kutoka shule, Teddy hakuwepo!

SourceText:
Say: “Look who's back. Oh no, Teddy is not there.” Mimic for your child a surprised expression.

Ask: “how would you feel if your special toy went missing?”
text:
Sema: "Angalia nani amerudi. La hasha, Mdoli hayupo." Muigizie mtoto wako usemi wa mshangao.

Muulize: "Ungejiskiaje kama mdoli wako pendwa haonekani?"

SourceText: Ask: “What is the girl looking for? Where is she looking? Where do you think teddy might have gone?”
text: Muulize: "Msichana anatafuta nini? Anatafuta wapi? Unafikiri mdoli anaweza kuwa ameenda wapi?"

SourceText: Ask: “Where is she looking now? Where could teddy be hiding?” Mimic searching and feeling frustrated.
text: Muulize: "Anaangalia wapi sasa? Mdoli atakuwa amejificha wapi?" Igiza kutafuta  na kuhisi kukatishwa tamaa.

SourceText: “What’s wrong, Fifi?” asks Mom.
text: "Nini shida, Fifi alimuuliza Mama.

SourceText: Describe what is happening. Say: “The girl made a good plan. After searching on her own, she went to ask her mother for help. Remember that you can always ask for help if you need it.”
text: Eleza kinachoendelea. Sema: "Msichana alifanya mpango mzuri. Baada ya kutafuta yeye mwenyewe, alikwenda kumuomba mama yake msaada. Kumbuka kwamba muda wowote unaweza kuomba msaada ukiuhitaji."

SourceText: Teddy is missing!
text: Teddy haonekani!

SourceText: Say: “Poor girl, she is crying because she can’t find her teddy. Do you remember yesterday when you were crying because you were frustrated with your little sister? What helped you to feel less frustrated?”
text: Sema: “Maskini msichana, analia kwa sababu hampati mdoli wake. Je, unakumbuka jana ulipokuwa ukilia kwa sababu ulichanganyikiwa na mdogo wako wa kike? Ni nini kilikusaidia kupunguza kuchanganyikiwa?”

SourceText: “No, darling. Teddy just had a bath!”
text: "Hapana. Teddy ametoka kuoga"

SourceText: Say: “Jippy! Look, there is teddy! Why do you think teddy is hanging on the washing line?”
text: Sema: "Jippy! Tazama, kuna mdoli! Unafikiri kwa nini mdoli ananing'inia kwenye kamba ya kuanikia nguo?"

SourceText: “There you are, Teddy!”
text: "Upo, Teddy!"

SourceText: Ask: “Why is the girl smiling and jumping up and down? What has made you feel this happy lately? Do you remember feeling happy when you scored a goal when we were playing soccer together?”
text: Muulize: Kwanini Binti anatabasamu na kuruka ruka? Nini kimekufanya ujisikie furaha baadaye? Unaikumbuka ile hali ya furaha uliyojiskia ulipofunga goli wakati tunacheza mpira pamoja?

SourceText: Ask: Now tell me, what did you think about this story? What did you learn?”
text: Muulize: Sasa niambie, ulifikiria nini kuhusu hadithi hii? Ulijifunza nini?

SourceText: Boiled, scrambled or fried? How does Luzuko want his eggs?
text: Yamechemshwa. yamevurugwa wakati wa kukaanga yamekuwa vipande vipande, Ni Vipi Luzuko anataka mayai yake?

SourceText: Good morning, Luzuko!
text: Habari za asubuhi, Luzuko!

SourceText: It’s time for breakfast.
text: Ni muda wa kifungua kinywa.

SourceText: How do you want your eggs?
text: Unataka mayai yako yaweje?

SourceText: Do you want boiled eggs, Luzuko?
text: Unataka mayai ya kuchemshwa Luzuko?

SourceText: I like boiled eggs, but ...
text: Napenda mayai ya kuchemshwa, lakini...

SourceText: Do you want scrambled eggs, Luzuko?
text: Unataka mayai ya kukaangwa yaliyovurugwa, Luzuko?

SourceText: I like scrambled eggs, but ...
text: Napenda mayai yaliyokaangwa yaliyovurugwa, lakini...

SourceText: Do you want fried eggs, Luzuko?
text: Unataka mayai ya kukaangwa, Luzuko?

SourceText: I like fried eggs, but ...
text: Napenda mayai ya kukaangwa, lakini ...

SourceText: Well? How do you want your eggs, Luzuko?
text: Vizuri? Unataka mayai yako yaweje, Luzuko?

SourceText: Today, I just want a bowl of porridge.
text: Leo! Nataka tu bakuli la uji.

SourceText: Lebo and Gogo's Tea Party
text: Tafrija ya Lebo na Bibi

SourceText: Lebo is excited to have a day of adventure with Gogo. When Gogo hurts herself, she can’t do anything that Lebo wants to do. What can Gogo and Lebo do to have fun together?
text: Lebo amefurahi kuwa na siku ya kwenda safari ya matembezi na bibi. Bibi alipojiumiza, hawezi kufanya chochote kila ambacho Lebo anataka kufanya. Bibi na Lebo wanaweza kufanya ili kufurahi pamoja?

SourceText: Lebo is at Gogo’s farm. She is bored with chasing the animals. "Now you chase me, Gogo!" Lebo shouts as she races past. "Slow down, Lebo," Gogo says, hurrying to catch up.
text: Lebo yupo shambani kwa bibi. Amechoshwa na kukimbiza wanyama."Sasa nikimbize mimi, Bibi!" Lebo alisema kwa sauti huku akipita mbio. "polepole, Lebo," Bibi anasema, unaharakisha kumkamata.

SourceText: Describe the picture by pointing at the different images and say, “Look at this! Who do we see here? It’s a little girl and her grandma. Do you think they might be at a farm? What do you think they are doing?”
text: Elezea picha kwa kuonyesha ukilekezea picha mbalimbali na sema,: " Tazama hii! Tunaona nini hapa? Ni msichana mdogo na bibi yake. Unafikiri watakuwa shambani? Unafiriki wanafanya nini?"

SourceText: Gogo trips over a rock while chasing Lebo. "Ouch!" she screams. Gogo has hurt her ankle.
text: Bibi anapita kwenye muamba huku akimkimbiza Lebo. "Ouch" alipiga kelele. Bibi ameumia kwenye kiwiko cha mguu.

SourceText: Say, “Oh no! It looks like grandma might trip. She’s about to fall. I hope she will be okay.”
text: Sema, " Oh hapana! Inaonekana bibi anaweza kujikwaa. Anakaribia kuanguka. Natumaini atakuwa sawa."

SourceText: She comes back from the doctor with a special boot and crutches. "Gogo, come back to the city with us so that we can take care of you," says Lebo’s mom. "I won’t leave my farm. I will manage on my own," Gogo replies, stubbornly.
text: Amerudi kutoka kwa daktari akiwa na buti na gongo maalumu. "Bibi, rudi na sisi jijini ini tuweze kukuangalia," anasema mama yake Lebo. "Sitaliacha" shamba langu. Nitaweza kujiangalia mimi mwenyewe," Bibi alijibu, kwa ukali.

SourceText:
Help the child to learn new words by pointing at the picture and naming the things you see. Say, “This is a special boot” and “These are crutches.” Then explain: “The doctor gave these to grandma because her leg is hurt.”

Ask, “How do you think grandma feels? What makes you say that?”
text: Msaidie mtoto kujifunza maneno mapya kwa kuonyesha kwenye picha na kutaja majina ya vitu unavyoviona. Sema, "Hili ni buti maalum" na * Haya ni magongo." Halafu elezea: "Daktari alimpa haya bibi kwasababu mguu wake umeumia?"

SourceText: "Gogo, you must come. We will have so much fun!" Lebo says, excitedly.
text: "Bibi, ni lazima uje, tutakuwa na vingi vya kufurahisha!" Lebo anasema, kwa furaha.

SourceText: Say, “Look, the girl is giving her grandma a hug, how kind! Would you like to give me a hug too?” (When the child hugs you, respond warmly with) “Mmm, that feels so nice. Thank you for the lovely hug!”
text: Sema, "Tazama, msichana anamkumbatia bibi yake, ni mwema kweli! Ungependa kunikumbatia pia?" (Mtoto anapokukumbatia, pokea kwa uchangamfu) "Mmm, najiskia vizuri sana. Asante kwa kunikumbatia kwa upendo"!

SourceText: During the drive, Lebo bounces on her seat. She thinks of all the wild adventures she and Gogo will have in the city.
text: Wakati gari inaendeshwa, Lebo alirukaruka kwenye siti. Anafikiria mambo yote mazuri ambayo yeye na bibi watakuwa nayo jijini.

SourceText: Say, “Now, let’s look and talk together!” Point to the picture and ask your child, “How many houses can you see? How many cars are there? How many animals can you find? What color is the car? What color are the roofs of the houses? Can you tell me the color that both animals have?
text: Sema, "Sasa, hebu tuangalie na tuzungumze pamoja!" Onyesha kwenye picha na muulize mtoto wako, "Unaweza kuona nyumba ngapi?" Kuna magari mangapi pale? Ni wanyama wangapi unaweza kupata? Gari hilo ni la rangi gani? Paa za nyumba ni za rangi gani? Unaweza kuniambia rangi za hao wanyama wote?

SourceText: When they arrive at the house, Gogo rests on the sofa.
text: Walipofika kwenye nyumba, Bibi alipumzika kwenye sofa.

SourceText: Help your child learn new words by pointing to things in the picture and saying their names. Ask your child to repeat after you. For example, you can say: ‘This is a lamp. These are crochet hooks. This is wool. This is a remote control.”
text: Msaidie mtoto wako kujifunza maneno mapya ukionyesha kwa kuelekezea vitu kwenye picha na kutaja majina yake. Muombe mtoto wako arudie baada yako. Kwa mfano, unaweza kusema: ‘Hii ni taa. Hizi ni sindano za kufumia. Hii ni pamba. Hii ni rimoti.”

SourceText: Lebo dashes into the lounge. "Gogo, Gogo, I know what we can do today! We can go to the mall. There are lots of shops with nice toys and ice cream!" "I’m afraid I can’t. The mall is too big, and I will get so tired."
text: Lebo anaingia kwenye chumba cha kupumzika. "Bibi, bibi, najua tunawezafanya nini leo! Tunaweza kwenda kwenye jengo kubwa la kuuza vitu. Kuna maduka mengi yenye vitu vizuri vya kuchezea na ashklim!" "Naogopa siwezi. Jengo hilo ni kubwa sana, na nitachoka sana."

SourceText:
Say, “look at the thought bubble above the girl’s head, could she be thinking of going to the shopping mall” 

Ask, “Have you ever been to the shopping mall?” If yes, “how was it? What did you do? Who did you go with?”
text:
Sema, "tazama kwenye ishara ya mawazo juu ya kichwa cha msichana;, anaweza kuwa anafikiria kwenda kwenye maduka makubwa" 

Muulize, "Je, umewahi kwenda kwenye maduka makubwa?" Kama ndiyo, "ilikuwaje? Ulifanya nini? Ulienda na nani?"

SourceText: "Gogo, Gogo, I know what we can do today! We can go to the park!" "I’m afraid that won’t work. The dogs in the park will run around and could make me fall again."
text: "Bibi, Bibi, Najua tunawezafanya nini leo! Tunaweza kwenda sehemu ya michezo!" "Naogopa haitasaidia. Mbwa wa pale watanikimbiza na nitaweza kuanguka tena."

SourceText: Point at the thought bubble above the girl's head and say, “Now, let's look into the girl’s thought bubble again, what do you think she is thinking?
text: Onyesha kwa kuelekezea kwenye ishara ya kuwaza iliyo juu ya kichwa cha msichana na sema, “Sasa hebu tuangalie tena kwenye ishara ya mawazo ya msichana, unafikiri anawaza nini?

SourceText: A second later, Lebo’s eyes are wide with excitement. "Gogo, Gogo, I know what else we can do today. Let’s go to the beach." "I’m sorry, Lebo. I’m afraid my crutches will sink into the soft sand."
text: Sekunde moja baadae, Macho ya lebo yalitanuka kwa furaha. "Bibi, bibi, Najua nini kingine tunawezafanya leo. Twende ufukweni." "Samahani Lebo, Ninaogopa magongo yangu yatazama kwenye mchanga."

SourceText: Point at the thought bubble again and say, “Wow, the girl is now thinking of something else, i wonder what could be going on in her mind.”
text: Onyesha tena kwa kuelekezea kwenye ishara ya lindi la mawazo na sema, “Waooo, msichana anafikiria kitu kingine, sijui nini kitakuwa kinaendelea akilini mwake.”

SourceText: Lebo is quiet while Gogo knits. Suddenly she has an idea!
text: Lebo amekaa kimya wakati Gogo anafunga. Mara alikuwa na wazo!

SourceText: Point to the girl and say: "Look at her, she looks like she’s really thinking about something."Then ask the child: "Can you show me what you look like when you're thinking really hard?"
text: Onyesha kuelekezea kwa msichana na usema, “Mtazame, anaonekana anafikiri kweli kuhusu kitu flani.” Halafu muulize mtoto: Unaweza kunionyesha unaonekanaje wakati unapokuwa unafikiria sana?”

SourceText: "Gogo, Gogo, I know what we can do today! Let’s have a tea party. Gogo, you can sit here. I will bring everything to you because you are hurt."
text: "Bibi, Bibi, Najua nini tunawezafanya leo! Na tufanye tafrija ya chai. Bibi, unawezakaa hapa. Nitakuletea kila kitu kwasababu umeumia"

SourceText:
Say, “Look! Maybe the girl is thinking about having a tea party. She brought many cups and a kettle, even though it's just her and grandma. Can you see her face? She looks very, very happy!”
Then say, “This is how I look when I’m happy. Now, can you show me your happy face?”
text:
Sema, “Tazama! labda msichana anafikiria kuhusu kufanya tafrija ya chai. Alileta vikombe vingi na birika, Ingawa wapo yeye tu na bibi. Unaweza kuona uso wake? Anaonekana anafuraha sana sana.!”
Halafu sema, “Hivi ndivyo ninavyoonekana ninapokuwa na furaha. Sasa, unaweza kunionyesha uso wako wa furaha?

SourceText:
Say, "Finally, everyone is having a tea party! Even Teddy is joining in with tea and biscuits. How fun is that?"
Then ask: "How do you think everyone feels?" "What do you think about the story? Did you like it? Why or why not?"
text:
Sema, “Hatimaye, kila mmoja amefanya tafrija ya chai! Hata mdoli anajumuika kwenye chai na biskuti. Ni furaha iliyoje?”
Alafu muulize, “Unafikiri kila mmoja anajiskiaje?” ”Unafikiri nini kuhusu hii hadithi? Umeipenda? Kwanini umeipenda au kwanini hujaipenda?”

SourceText: Lesedi’s Sandbox
text: Lesedi na kisanduku cha mchanga

SourceText: Lesedi dreams of going to the beach. He wants to feel the sand between his toes and build a sandcastle. So his parents come up with a plan…
text: Lesedi aliota ndoto ya kwenda ufukweni. Anataka kushika mchanga kupata hisia kuhusu mchanga katikati ya vidole vyake na kujenga ngome ya mchanga. Hivyo wazazi wake walikuja na mpango…

SourceText: It’s the holidays and I’d love to go to the beach, but we have never been. I wonder what it feels like to play in the sea sand.
text: Ni wakati wa likizo na ningependa kwenda ufukweni ila hatujawahi kwenda. Nawaza itakuwaje tukichezea mchanga wa bahari.

SourceText: Describe what you see, or ask your child to tell you what they see. Ask: where do you think this boy wants to go?
text: Elezea unachokiona au muulize mtoto wako akwambie anaona nini. Uliza: unafikiri huyu mvulana anataka kwenda wapi?

SourceText: Surprise! "Look what we made you. A sandbox," exclaims Lesedi’s dad. Dad says he used some of his old tyres. Mom painted them with all my favourite colours: blue, red and yellow.
text: Kwa mshangao! "Angalia tulichokutengenezea. Kisanduku cha mchanga!" Baba anasema alitumia magurudumu yake ya zamani, Mama akapaka rangi ninazozipenda, blue, nyekundu na njano.

SourceText: Point to boy and ask: “How do you think he is feeling? What do you think he is going to do next?”
text: Mnyooshee kidole mvulana na umuulize: Unafikiri anajiskiaje? Unafikiri anaenda kufanya nini baadae?’

SourceText: I can’t wait to get inside. I climb into my sandbox and my feet feel so warm and squishy.
text: Nina hamu ya kuingia. Nikipanda kwenye kisanduku cha mchanga miguu yangu itahisi joto na kulowa.

SourceText: Mimic actions from the pictures or story. Pretend to put your feet in the sand and wiggle your toes.
text: Igiza Vitendo vya kwenye picha au hadithi. Jifanye unaweka miguu yako kwenye michanga na utikise vidole vyako.

SourceText: Look! I’m at the beach. That looks like a good spot to spread my blanket. I set up my umbrella, but the wind blows it away.
text: Angalia! Niko ufukweni. Pale panaonekana kama ni sehemu nzuri ya kutandika blanketi langu. Nimeweka mwamvuli wangu, lakini upepo unaupeperusha.

SourceText: Mimic the sound of the wind and the umbrella blowing away. Demonstrate surprise and ask your child how they would feel if that happened to them.
text: Iga sauti ya upepo na mwavuli unaopeperukia mbali. Onyesha mshangao na muulize mtoto wako angejiskiaje ikiwa hilo lingetokea kwake.

SourceText: The ocean makes a roaring sound. I run on the beach, daring the waves to catch me as I make footprints in the sand.
text: Bahari ina mvumo wa kutisha. Nakimbia kwenye ufukwe, nikitishia mawimbi yanikamate, huku nikiacha alama za miguu yangu kwenye mchanga.

SourceText: Mimic the sound of the ocean or the movement of the waves. Point to the footprints in the sand and explain what this is.
text: Iga sauti ya bahari au mvumo wa mawimbi. Onyesha alama za nyayo za kwenye mchanga na uelezee hiki ni nini.

SourceText: Using my bucket and spade, I dig for shells. They come in many shapes and sizes.
text: Kwa kutumia ndoo yangu na chepeo, Nachimba kupata magamba. Yanakuja katika maumbo na ukubwa mbalimbali.

SourceText: Ask your child: How many shells can you see? What colours are they? Are they all the same shape? Which shells are big? Which shells are small?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Ni magamba mangapi unayaona? Yana rangi gani? Je yote yana maumbo sawa? Magamba yapi makubwa? Magamba yapi madogo?

SourceText: Let me build a sandcastle. Wow, that’s huge!
text: Ngoja nitengeneze kasri ya mchanga. Jamani ni kubwa hiyo!

SourceText: Describe the picture to your child or ask them what they see. Ask: do you like to play in the sand? Why or why not?
text: Ielezee picha kwa mtoto wako au muulize anachokiona. Muulize unapenda kucheza kwenye mchanga na kwanini?

SourceText: It’s lunchtime! Maybe I should have a strawberry jam sandwich. Mmm, my favourite.
text: Ni muda wa chakula cha mchana! Labda nile mkate wenye jam ya stroberi. Mmm naipenda sana.

SourceText: Ask your child: where is he sitting? What is he eating?  What would you like to eat if you went to the beach?
text: Muulize mtoto wako amekaa wapi? anakula nini, Je ungependa kula nini ukienda ufukweni?

SourceText: For dessert, Mom brings me some chocolate ice cream.
text: Kwa kiburudisho, Mama huniletea chokoleti na ashkilimu.

SourceText: Ask your child: what is she holding in her hand? Who is she giving it to?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Ameshika nini mkononi mwake? Ni nani amempa?

SourceText: I lie on my blanket enjoying my ice cream and gaze at the sky turning pink.
text: Nalala kwenye blanketi langu, nikiifurahia ashkilimu yangu na kuangalia paa la anga likibadilika kuwa la pinki.

SourceText: Use descriptive words and explanations to talk about the pictures. This helps your child learn new words. The big, round orange sun. The pink and blue sky with clouds. The boy relaxing on his blanket, enjoying his delicious ice cream.
text: Tumia maneno ya maelezo kuzungumzia picha. Hii inamsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza maneno mapya. Jua kubwa la duara la rangi ya chungwa Anga ya pinki na bluu yenye mawingu. Mvulana amepumzika kwenye blanketi lake, anaifurahia aishkilimu yake tamu.

SourceText: Lesedi’s mom and dad watch him, their eyes beaming with pleasure. "I’m so happy we could make his dream come true right here at home," Lesedi’s mom says.
text: Baba na mama yake Lesedi wanamwangalia, macho yao yamejaa furaha. "Nina furaha sana tunaweza kufanya ndoto zake kweli zikatimia hapa nyumbani," mama yake Lesedi anasema.

SourceText: Talk about what the characters might be thinking or feeling. Ask: how does the boy feel? Why do you think he feels that way? Why are the parents smiling?
text: Zungumza kuhusu kile ambacho wahusika wanaweza kuwa wanafikiria au kujiskia. Muulize: Mvulana anajiskiaje ni kwanini anajiskia hivyo? Kwanini wazazi wanatabasamu?

SourceText: Thank you, Mom and Dad. Today was the happiest day of my life!
text: Asanteni, Mama na Baba. Leo ilikuwa ni siku ya furaha kwenye maisha yangu.

SourceText: Ask your child: Is his clothes and hands dirty or clean? Why? What do you think he should do next?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Je nguo na mikono yake ni michafu au misafi? Kwanini? unafikiri anapaswa kufanya nini baadae?

SourceText: Ask your child: what did you think about the story? You could also pretend to have your own beach adventure with your child.
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Ulifikiria nini kuhusu hadithi hii? Unaweza kuigiza kuwa na safari yako ya ufukweni na mtoto wako.

SourceText: Discuss the book’s cover. Ask your child: What do you see? What is the woman pointing to?
text: Jadili jalada la kitabu. muulize mtoto wako: Unaona nini? Unafikiri mwanamke anaonyesha nini?

SourceText: Little Shoots
text: Maswali ya mtoto

SourceText: Layo can’t wait to grow. But just like the bamboo seeds he and grandma plant, it might take a little longer than he wants!
text: Layo anatamani kukua. Lakini kama mbegu ya muanzi waliyopanda yeye na bibi yake, Inaweza kuchukua muda kidogo kuliko alivyotaka!

SourceText: "When will I grow?" asks Layo.
text: "Nitakua lini? anauliza Layo.

SourceText: Ask: what is the boy holding in his hand? What can you see in the photo?
text: Uliza: mvulana ameshika nini mkononi kwake? Unaweza kuona nini kwenye picha?

SourceText: "I don’t know," replies Baba. "Soon," says Mama.
text: "Sijui," alijibu Baba. "Hivi punde" anasema Mama.

SourceText: "When you are ready," says Grandma.
text: "Utakapokuwa tayari," anasema Bibi.

SourceText: Ask: how many people are sitting down? Who is standing? What is she carrying? Where is the cat? Can you see any other animals?
text: Uliza: ni watu wangapi wamekaa chini? Nani amesimama? Kwanini analia? Paka yuko wapi? Unaweza kuona wanyama wengine?

SourceText: Grandma takes Layo to the farm. "Let us plant some seeds."
text: Bibi anaenda na Layo shambani."Tupande baadhi ya mbegu."

SourceText: Ask: Where are they going? What are they looking at? How many orange animals can you see? Which birds are flying? Where is the mouse?
text: Uliza: Wanakwenda wapi? Wanaangalia nini? Unaweza kuona wanyama wangapi wenye rangi ya machungwa? Ni ndege wangapi wanaruka? Panya yuko wapi?

SourceText: In one field they plant corn, and in another, melon.
text: Kwenye eneo moja walipanda mahindi ya bisi, na kwenye lingine matikiti.

SourceText: "What are these?" asks Layo. "Bamboo seeds," replies Grandma.
text: "Ni nini hivi?" anauliza Layo. "mbegu za Muanzi," anajibu Bibi.

SourceText: Use the pictures to help your child practice counting. You can ask your child to count, or count out loud for your child. Ask: How many yellow seeds are there? How many black seeds? How many seeds does she have in her left hand? And how many seeds does she have in her right hand? How many seeds are there altogether?
text: Tumia picha kumsaidia mtoto wako ahesabu kwa vitendo. Unaweza kumwambia mtoto wako ahesabu, au hesabu kwa sauti kwaajili ya mtoto wako. Uliza: Kuna mbegu za njano ngapi pale? Kuna mbegu ngapi nyeusi? Ana mbegu ngapi kwenye mkono wake wa kushoto? Na ana mbegu ngapi kwenye mkono wake wa kulia? Kuna mbegu ngapi jumla kwa pamoja zote?

SourceText: Ask questions to help your child understand what is happening. Ask: What is the boy looking at? What can you see outside the window?
text: Uliza maswali kumsaidia mtoto wako kufahamu nini kinatokea. Uliza: Mvulana anatazama nini? Unaweza kuona nini nje ya dirisha?

SourceText: "The corn and melon have grown well," says Grandma. "What about the bamboo?" asks Layo.
text: "Mahindi ya bisi na mattkiti yamekua vizuri," anasema Bibi. " Vipi kuhusu Muanzi?" anauliza Layo.

SourceText: "They will grow when they are ready."
text: "Vitakuwa vitakapokuwa tayari"

SourceText: Describe and explain the pictures. Say: Look, the seeds they planted have grown. Some of the seeds have grown into tall corn plants. Other seeds have grown into big, round watermelons. What other plants can you see?
text: Fafanua na elezea picha. Sema: Tazama, mbegu walizopanda zimekua. Baadhi ya mbegu zimekua mimea ya mahindi marefu. Mbegu zingine zimekua matikiti maji makubwa, ya mviringo. Mimea gani mingine unaweza kuiona?

SourceText: Ask: Where is the boy standing? What is growing next to him? What is he looking at?
text: Uliza: Mvulana amesimama wapi? Nini kimeota karibu yake? Anatazama nini?

SourceText: "Everything grows in its own time," says Grandma.
text: "Kila kitu kinakua kwa wakati wake," anasema Bibi.

SourceText: Make links between the pictures and your child’s world. Ask: What colour are their curtains? What colour curtains do we have at home? What do you see on their table? What do we have on our table?
text: Tengeneza muunganiko kati ya hizo picha na dunia ya mtoto wako. Uliza: Mapazia yao yana rangi gani? Mapazia tuliyo nayo nyumbani yana rangi gani? Unaona nini juu ya meza yao? Tuna nini kwenye meza yetu?

SourceText: "They have grown well," says Grandma.
text: "Vimekua vizuri,"anasema Bibi.

SourceText: Ask: What are they looking at? How do you think they are feeling? Why?
text: Uliza: Wanatazama nini? Unafikiri wanajiskiaje? kwanini?

SourceText: Describe and explain the pictures. Say: Look, the three boys from the photo are now older.
text: Elezea na dadavua picha. Sema: Tazama, wavulana watatu wa kwenye picha sasa ni wakubwa.

SourceText: “You have grown well.”
text: "Umekua vizuri."

SourceText: Ask: what looks different in this picture? What has changed?
text: Uliza: Nini kinaonekana tofauti katika picha hii? Nini kimebadilika?

SourceText: Reflect on the story with your child. Ask: What happened in this story? What was the story about? What did you think of the story?
text: Tafakari na mtoto wako juu ya hadithi. Uliza: Nini kilitokea kwenye hadithi hii? Hadithi ilikuwa inahusu nini? Ulikuwa unafikiria nini kuhusu hadithi?

SourceText: Look out, Luthando!
text: Angalia nje Lusajo!

SourceText: Luthando is very good at listening and very good at smelling, but he’s not so good at looking where he is going. He walks into puddles and bumps his head. What could be the problem?
text: Lusajo ni mzuri sana katika kusikiliza na mzuri sana katika kunusa, lakini sio mzuri wa kutazama kule anakokwenda. Anaingia kwenye madimbwi na anajigonga kichwa chake. Tatizo linaweza kuwa ni nini?

SourceText: "Listen!" says Luthando. "What do you hear?" asks Sonto. "Saturday." "What does Saturday sound like?" "It’s quieter than Friday," says Luthando. "Everyone’s still sleeping."
text: "Sikiliza" anasema Lusajo. "Unasikia nini?" anauliza Saidi. "Jumamosi" "Jumamosi inasikika kama nini?" "Iko kimya kuliko ijumaa," anasema Lusajo. " Kila mmoja amelala"

SourceText: "I must fix Gogo’s gate today," Daddy says.
text: "Ni lazima nitengeneze geti la Bibi leo," Baba anasema.

SourceText: "An ice cream for anyone who helps me carry the shopping home," Mama says. "We’ll help you, Mama," say the children.
text: "Nitampa asklimu yeyote atakayenisaidia kubeba vitu nyumbani kutoka dukani,"anasema Mama. "Tutakusaidia, Mama," wanasema watoto.

SourceText: "Look out, Luthando!" "Hawu!" "You’re so funny," Sonto laughs.
text: "Tazama nje, Lusajo!" " Hawu!": Unachekesha sana," Saidi anacheka.

SourceText: "I hear a motorbike," says Luthando.
text: "Nasikia pikipiki," anasema Lusajo.

SourceText: "There’s no motorbike," says Sonto, looking all around.
text: "Hakuna pikipiki," anasema Saidi, akiangalia kila mahali.

SourceText: A motorbike zooms past. "You’re very good at hearing, Luthando."
text: Pikipiki imepita,''Una uwezo mkubwa wa kusikia, Lusajo''

SourceText: "Look out, Luthando!" "Hawu!" says Luthando as he steps into a puddle.
text: "Tazama nje, Lusajo" "Hawu!" anasema Lusajo kadili anavyokanyaga dimbwi.

SourceText: "Look how wet you are," says Mama.
text: "Tazama ulivyolowa," anasema Mama.

SourceText: "Daddy’s home." "How do you know, Luthando?" asks Sonto.
text: "Baba yupo nyumbani." "Umejuaje, Lusajo?" anauliza Saidi.

SourceText: "I can smell his cooking," says Luthando sniffing the air. "You’re also good at smelling," Mama says.
text: "Nawezajua harufu ya mapishi yake," anasema Lusajo akinusa hewa. " Wewe ni mzuri wa kutambua harufu," anasema Mama.

SourceText: "Look out, Luthando!" "Ouch!" "Watch where you’re walking," Mama says. "Luthando’s not so good at looking," says Sonto.
text: "Tazama nje, Lusajo" "Angalia unapotembea," Mama anasema. "Lusajo si mzuri sana, katika kuangalia" anasema Saidi.

SourceText: "What do you see, Luthando?" asks the friendly woman. Luthando squeezes his eyes together. He sees black squiggles on the wall.
text: "Unaona nini, Lusajo?" Rafiki yake mama anauliza. Lusajo anafinya macho yake pamoja. Anaona michoro ya rangi nyeusi ukutani.

SourceText: He looks through a pair of glasses. "I see letters," he says. "Excellent!"
text: Alitazama kupitia jozi ya miwani. " Naona herufi," anasema. "Safi sana"

SourceText: "Look, Gogo!" "You have glasses," says Gogo, clapping her hands. "How wonderful. Tell me what you see."
text: ''Angalia, Bibi!'' Una miwani,''anasema Bibi, anapiga makofi.'' Ni vizuri sana. Niambie unaona nini.''

SourceText: "I see bugs and ants and spiders and bees. I see EVERYTHING now."
text: '' Ninaona Mende na Mchwa na buibui na Nyuki. Ninaona kila kitu sasa.''

SourceText: "Gogo, your face has cracks," says Luthando, touching Gogo’s face. "Hayi...Luthando! Those aren’t cracks. They’re lines on my face from getting old and laughing at all the funny things you say."
text: ''Bibi, uso wako una nyufa,'' anasema Lusajo, anashika uso wa bibi. ''Hayi...Lusajo! Hizo sio nyufa. Ni mistari usoni mwangu inayotokana na kuzeeka na vyote vya kuchekesha ulivyosema."

SourceText: "Don’t..."
text: ''Hapana'...''

SourceText: "Look, a puddle!" says Luthando. Too late!
text: ''Angalia, dimbwi!'' anasema lusajo. Umechelewa!

SourceText: My inside weather
text: Hali ya hewa ndani yangu

SourceText: Sometimes our feelings are hard to talk about, but everyone knows how to talk about the weather.
text: Wakati mwingine ni ngumu kuzungumza kuhusu hisia zetu, lakini mmoja anajua kuzungumza kuhusu hali ya hewa.

SourceText: It’s easy to talk about the weather outside, even if it changes all the time.
text: Ni rahisi kuzungumzia hali ya hewa ya nje hata kama hubadilika muda wowote.

SourceText: Describe the picture and say, “Look up! The sun is out and the sky is mostly blue, with just a few fluffy grey things floating around. That means it's going to be a super fun day to play outside!”
text: Elezea picha na useme, “Tazama juu? Jua limetoka na anga ina rangi ya bluu sana, kukiwa na vitu vichache vyenye rangi ya kijivu vinavyoelea. Hiyo inamaanisha itakuwa ni siku ya kufurahisha sana kucheza nje.”

SourceText: But it’s hard to talk about the weather inside me. Sometimes it feels like people don’t understand.
text: Lakini ni vigumu kuzungumzia hali ya hewa ya ndani mwangu. Wakati mwingine inahisiwa kama watu hawaelewi.

SourceText:
Point at the thought bubbles around the girl and say, “Look at this girl, could she be thinking about the weather? 


Ask, “Point at the thought that shows rain, point at the one that shows cloudy weather and point at the one that shows sunny weather. Now tell me, which one is your favourite? Why or why not?”
text:
Onyesha kwa msichana kwa kuelekezea kwenye alama inayoonyesha kufikiria jambo na useme, “Tazama huyu msichana, anaweza kuwa anafikiria hali ya hewa?

Mwambie, “Onyesha kwa kuelekezea kwenye ishara ya mawazo yanayoonyesha hali ya hewa ya wingu na onyesha kwa kuelekeza ile inayoonyesha hali ya jua. Sasa niambie ni lipi unalolipenda zaidi? Kama ndio kwa nini na kama siyo kwanini?”

SourceText: Do you feel like that too?
text: Na wewe unahisi hivyo?

SourceText: Say, “Now look at the mother and the girl having a conversation, maybe they are discussing the weather.”
text: Sema,” Sasa mwangalie mama na msichana wanazungumza. Labda wanazungumza kuhusu hali ya hewa.”

SourceText: Some days my mind is full of sunshine and rainbows. I feel like I can do anything.
text: Siku nyingine jua na upinde vina nikaa sana akilini. Najihisi kama naweza kufanya jambo lolote.

SourceText:
Point at the picture and say, “Let’s have a look at the girl’s thought bubble again.’

Ask, “What are the two things in her thought bubble that she is maybe thinking about? What colors are they?”
text:
Elekezea kwenye picha na useme, “Hembu tuangalie tena anachofikiria msichana.’

Muulize. Ni vitu gani viwili vilivyo kwenye mawazo yake ambavyo anaweza akawa anafikiria? Vina rangi gani?”

SourceText: On other days my head is full of fog and clouds. It’s hard to listen to what people are saying or to remember things.
text: Siku zingine kichwa kinawaza ukungu na mawingu. Inakuna vigumu kusikiliza kipi watu wanasema au kukumbuka vitu.

SourceText: Point at the girl and say, “Let's look at the girl again, It looks like she is now thinking about the clouds.”
text: Onyesha kwa kuelekezea kwa msichana na useme, “Hebu tumtazame msichana huyo tena, Inaonekana kana kwamba sasa anafikiria juu ya mawingu.”

SourceText: I sometimes wake up feeling like it’s windy and wild in my head. I feel tired and grumpy.
text: Wakati mwingine naamka nikihisi kama kuna upepo na dhoruba kichwani mwangu. Najihisi kama kichwa kimejaa na kina uchovu.

SourceText:
Say, “Oh no! She seems really frustrated. Perhaps the weather is really confusing her.”

Ask, “Now tell me, how do you act when you are frustrated or confused.”
text:
Sema, "La hapana! Anaonekana kuchanganyikiwa sana. Labda hali ya hewa inamchanganya sana."

Muulize, "Sasa niambie, unafanyaje wakati umekata tamaa au kuchanganyikiwa."

SourceText: And sometimes it feels like it’s raining inside me. It can be a drizzle making me feel sad, or a storm making me feel angry.
text: Na wakati mwingine nahisi kama kunyeshewa ndani mwangu. Inaweza kuwa manyunyu yanayonifanya nijihisi kuwa na huzuni au dhoruba inayonifanya niwe na hasira.

SourceText: Help the child learn new words by pointing and naming different things and say, “Let's learn new words! See this light rain? We call it "drizzling." Can you say "drizzling"? Now, look at that big, loud rain with thunder and lightning! That's a "storm." Can you say "storm"? Drizzling is soft rain, and a storm is big and loud rain!
text: Msaidie mtoto kujifunza maneno mapya kwa kuonyesha ukielekezea na kutaja vitu mbalimbali na kusema, "Hebu tujifunze maneno mapya! Ona mvua hii nyepesi? Tunaiita "manyunyu." Je, unaweza kusema "manyunyu"? Sasa, angalia mvua hiyo kubwa, kubwa yenye ngurumo na radi! Hiyo ni "dhoruba." Je, unaweza kusema "dhoruba"? Manyunyu ni mvua za rasharasha, na radi kubwa ni mvua kubwa!

SourceText: Sometimes the weather inside me doesn’t match the weather outside.
text: Wakati mwingine hali ya hewa ndani mwangu hailingani na hali ya hewa ya nje.

SourceText: Point at the picture and say, “Let's look at the dress the girl is wearing, what color is the dress? What color are the dots on the dress? How many dots on the dress can you see?
text: Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye picha na useme, “Hebu angalia nguo aliyovaa msichana, nguo hiyo ni ya rangi gani, doti za  kwenye vazi ni za rangi gani, unaweza kuona doti ngapi kwenye nguo hiyo?

SourceText: Sometimes my inside weather doesn’t match how I want to feel or how I think I should feel.
text: Wakati mwingine hali ya hewa ya ndani hailingani na namna ninavyotaka au ninavyofikiria ingekuwa.

SourceText: Point at the picture and ask again, “Let's peek outside! What do you see? Look at the big, bright sun! What color is it? Now, count the pretty flowers outside. One, two, three... How many flowers are there? What colors are the flowers? Are they yellow? Maybe some purple? And what about the green stuff all over the ground? That's the grass! What color is the grass?”
text: Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye picha na umuulize tena, "Hebu tuchunguze nje! Unaona nini? Angalia jua kubwa, linang’aa! Ni rangi gani? Sasa, hesabu maua mazuri nje. Moja, mbili, tatu... Kuna maua mangapi? Maua ni ya rangi gani? Je, ni ya njano? Labda ni rangi ya zambarau? Na vipi kuhusu vitu vya kijani vilivyo juu ya ardhi? Hizo ni nyasi! Nyasi ni rangi gani?"

SourceText: Is that okay? Yes, of course it is.
text: Hiyo ni sawa? Ndiyo, ni sawa.

SourceText:
Say, “Look at the mother and the girl looking at each other as they engage in a conversation.”

Ask, “Now tell me, how many eyes does the girl and the mother have? `how many eyes do you have? How many hands does the mother have? How many hands do you have?
text:
Sema, “Tazama mama na msichana wakitazamana wanapozungumza.”

Muulize, "Sasa niambie, msichana na mama wana macho mangapi? una macho mangapi? Mama ana mikono mingapi? Una mikono mingapi?

SourceText: The best thing to do when we feel like our inside weather is strange is to tell someone we love, and talk about it.
text: Kitu sahihi cha kufanya tunapohisi kama hali ya hewa ya ndani ni ngeni, nikumwambia mtu unayempenda na kulijadili.

SourceText: Point at the couch and say, “Okay, now let's count legs! First, look at this couch. Count how many legs it has. One, two, maybe more? How many? Now, let's count your legs! How many legs do you have? Are the number of legs the same on the couch and on you?
text: Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye kochi na useme, "Sawa, sasa tuhesabu miguu! Kwanza, tazama hili kochi. Hesabu lina miguu mingapi. Moja, miwili, labda na zaidi? Ngapi? Sasa hebu hesabu miguu yako! Una miguu mingapi? Je, idadi ya miguu ni sawa na ya kwenye kochi na ya kwako?

SourceText: They’ve got inside weather too, and they’ll understand.
text: Nao pia wanapata hali ya hewa, wataelewa.

SourceText: Ask, “What are your thoughts about this story? Do you like it? Why or why not?
text: Muulize. “Una mawazo gani kuhusu hadithi hii? Umeipenda? Kama umeipenda kwanini na kama hujaipenda kwanini?

SourceText: Bring your child’s attention to the book’s cover. Ask: What are they doing? What do you think this story could be about?
text: Fanya mtoto wako awe makini kwenye jalada la kitabu. Uliza: wanafanya nini? Je unafikiri hadithi hii inahusu nini?

SourceText: The Things That Really Matter
text: Vitu ambavyo ni muhimu

SourceText: What are the most important things to take with you on a trip? Join Zuki, Tando, Mama and Papa on their eventful journey to find out.
text: Ni vitu gani muhimu zaidi kubeba safarini? Ungana na Zuki, Thando, Mama na Baba kwenye safari yao kujua ni nini.

SourceText: We are going on a trip. I ask Mama what to pack. She says, "The things that really matter."
text: Tunakwenda safarini. Namuuliza mama nini nifungashe. Mama anasema, "Vitu ambavyo ni muhimu."

SourceText: Describe what you see, or ask your child to tell you what they see. Ask: what are they doing? Where do you think they could be going?
text: Elezea unachokiona, au muulize mtoto wako akwambie anachokiona. Uliza wanafanya nini? Unafikiri wanaweza kuwa wanaenda wapi?

SourceText: We stop at the windmill for breakfast. The jungle gym is so much fun. I forget my toy.
text: Tulisimama kwa ajili ya kifungua kinywa kwenye kinu cha upepo. Mazoezi ya msituni ni mazuri. Nilisahau mdori wangu.

SourceText: Discuss what the characters are doing. Ask: what are the children doing? Who is waving? Why are they waving?
text: Jadili kile wanachofanya wahusika. Uliza: watoto wanafanya nini? nani anapunga mkono? Kwanini wamekaa wanapunga mkono?

SourceText: I am sad in the car, but Tando is happy. "Hooray! Now you can play with me!" he says.
text: Nina huzuni ndani ya gari, lakini Tando anafuraha. Alisema "Huree! Unaweza kucheza na mimi sasa."

SourceText: Use descriptive words to talk about the pictures. Say: Look, they are wearing their seatbelts because they are in the car. Why do you think they are wearing seatbelts?
text: Tumia maelezo ya maneno kuzungumza kuhusu picha. Sema: Tazama, amefunga mkanda sababu wako ndani ya gari. Unafikiri kwanini wamejifunga mikanda?

SourceText: We stop at a farm to see some animals. Tando is searching so hard for a springbok, a monkey gets away with his headphones.
text: Tulisimama kwenye shamba la ufugaji kuona baadhi ya wanyama. Tando anatafuta kwa juhudi ili amuone Paa, nyani aliondoka na spika za masikioni.

SourceText: Ask your child to count the animals, or count them for your child. Ask questions to help your child understand what is happening. Ask: what is the monkey doing? Does the boy know what is happening?
text: Mwambie mtoto wako ahesabu wanyama au mhesabie mtoto wako. Uliza maswali ili kumsaidia mtoto wako kuelewa kinachotokea. Uliza: Ngedere anafanya nini? Mvulana anajua kinachoendelea?

SourceText: He is sad in the car, but I am happy. "Hooray! Now you can sing with me!" I say.
text: Anahuzuni kwenye gari, lakini mimi nina furaha. "Huree! Nasema sasa unaweza kuimba na mimi."

SourceText: Talk about what the characters might be thinking or feeling. Ask: how does the boy feel? Why do you think he feels that way?
text: Zungumza kuhusu nini wahusika wanaweza kuwa wanafikiria au kujiskia. Uliza: Huyu mvulana anajiskiaje? Kwanini unafikiri anajiskia hivyo?

SourceText: We stop at a roaring waterfall. We are so excited, we are pushing and pulling.
text: Tulisimama sehemu ya maporomoko ya maji. Tunafuraha sana, tunavuta na kuvutwa.

SourceText: Papa falls in the water, and so does his map.
text: Baba alianguka kwenye maji, na ramani yake pia.

SourceText: Ask: what are they looking at? Say: oh no! Someone fell over! You can mimic the actions, like taking a picture, or falling down.
text: Uliza: Wanaangalia nini? Sema: Oh hapana! Mtu alianguka! Unaweza kuiga vitendo, kama vile kupiga picha, au kuanguka chini.

SourceText: He is sad in the car, but Mama is happy. "Hooray! Now I can help you find our way!" she says.
text: Ana huzuni ndani gari, lakini mama anafuraha, "Huree! Sasa naweza kukusaidia kupata ufumbuzi," mama anasema.

SourceText: Ask: how does the father feel? Why do you think he feels that way? Why is he wet?
text: Uliza: Baba anajiskiaje? Kwanini unafikiri anajiskia hivyo? Kwanini ameloana?

SourceText: We stop at the roadside vendor to buy some mielies.
text: Tulisimama kwa mchuuzi pembezoni mwa barabara kununua mahindi.

SourceText: Mama bends over to pick the best ones, and her glasses fall and  break.
text: Mama aliinama kuchagua yaliyo bora na miwani yake ikadondoka na kuvunjika.

SourceText: Ask: Why did they get out of the car? What is the man in the hat selling? What happened to the women’s glasses? Why did that happen?
text: Uliza: Kwanini walitoka nje ya gari? Mwanaume aliyevaa kofia anauza nini? Nini kimetokea kwenye miwani ya huyo mama? Kwanini ilitokea vile?

SourceText: Mama is sad in the car, but Papa is happy. "Hooray! Now we can find our way together!" Papa says.
text: Mama ana huzuni kwenye gari, lakini baba anafuraha. Baba alisema, "Huree! Sasa tunaweza kutafuta ufumbuzi kwa pamoja."

SourceText: Ask: how many people are in the car? How many are sitting at the front? And how many are sitting at the back?
text: Uliza: Ni watu wangapi wako kwenye gari? Ni wangapi wamekaa mbele? Na wangapi wamekaa nyuma?

SourceText: We stop on an ancient hill to get a view of the valley. Papa is making silly jokes for us to smile for the picture, but...
text: Tulisimama kwenye kilima kizuri kupata mandhari ya bonde. Baba anafanya utani ili tutabasamu kwa ajili ya kupiga picha lakini...

SourceText: To help your child understand, explain what is happening. Say: Look, there is smoke coming out of the car. Do you think there might be something wrong with the car?
text: Ili kumsaidia mtoto wako kuelewa, eleza kinachotokea. Sema: Tazama. Kuna moshi unatokea kwenye gari: Je unafikiri kunaweza kuwa na tatizo kwenye gari?

SourceText: When we get back to the car, it won’t start. Everyone stops laughing. "Don’t worry..." says Mama. "We can still have a good time. We are the things that really matter."
text: Tutakaporudi kwenye gari, halitawaka. kila mmoja anaacha kucheka. ''Usijali....'' anasema Mama. ''Bado tunaweza kuwa na wakati mzuri. Sisi ndio muhimu."

SourceText: Demonstrate the emotions from the story with your voice and face. Say: Look, they are all feeling sad. Why do you think they are feeling that way?
text: Onyesha hisia kutoka kwenye hadithi. hisia zionekane kwa kupitia uso na sauti: Sema: Tazama, wote wanajiskia huzuni. Unafikiri kwanini wanajiskia? hivyo?

SourceText: And so, we do have a good time. By playing and singing and finding our way together, while enjoying the best mielies.
text: Na hivyo, tuna muda wa kutosha. Wa kuimba na kucheza na kutafuta ufumbuzi, wakati tunafurahia mahindi matamu.

SourceText: Ask: Where are they sitting? What are they doing? How do you think they are feeling now?
text: Uliza: Wamekaa wapi? Wanafanya nini? Unafikiri wanajiskiaje sasa?

SourceText: Discuss the book’s cover. Ask your child: What do you see? Where do you think they might be going?
text: Jadili jalada la kitabu. Muulize mtoto wako: Unaona nini? Unafikiri wanaweza kuwa wanaenda wapi?

SourceText: To The Top!
text: Kileleni!

SourceText: Climb the mountain with us! Look out for many tiny creatures… and BIG views. If we help each other, we can get to the top!
text: Panda mlima na sisi! Angalia nje kuna viumbe vidogo... na maoni makubwa. Kama tutasaidiana, tunaweza kufika kileleni!

SourceText: Describe the pictures, or ask your child to tell you what they see. Where are they? Where are they going? Respond with interest and enthusiasm.
text: Elezea picha, au muulize mtoto wako akwambie anachokiona. Wako wapi? Wanaenda wapi? Jibu kwa kuonyesha umevutiwa na kwa shauku.

SourceText: Describe and explain the pictures. Look, here is a bird with a sharp beak and a long tail. The flowers are big and colourful. The father is holding a long stick that helps him to climb the mountain.
text: Elezea picha. Tazama, huyu ni ndege ana mdomo uliochongoka na ana mkia mrefu. Maua ni makubwa na yenye rangi. Baba ameshika fimbo ndefu inayomsaidia kupanda mlima.

SourceText: Ask your child to point and name the animals. How many bees are flying? Where are the ants walking? Can we count them? Where is the frog hiding?
text: Mwambie mtoto wako akuonyeshe na kutaja wanyama. Ni nyuki wangapi wanaruka? Sisimizi wanaelekea wapi? Je tunaweza kuwahesabu? Je chura amejificha wapi?

SourceText:
Ask your child: What is the father pointing at? What animal does the rock look like?
What is the girl doing?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Baba anaonesha nini? Mwamba unafanana na mnyama gani. Msichana anafanya nini?

SourceText: Ask your child: What are they doing? Why are they stopping? What can you see around them?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Wanafanya nini? Kwanini wameacha? Unaweza kuona nini karibu yao?

SourceText:
Discuss what the characters are doing. 
Why are they sitting down? What are they eating? What would you like to eat if you were there?
text:
Jadili kile wahusika wanachofanya.
Kwanini wamekaa chini? Wanakula nini? Ungependa kula nini kama ungekuwa pale?

SourceText: Mimic the sound of the wind and the hat blowing away. Ask: What happened to her hat? Why did that happen?
text: Igiza sauti ya upepo na kofia ikipeperuka. Uliza: Nini kilitokea kwa kofia yake? Kwanini lilitokea?

SourceText: Ask: Who found the hat? How does the girl feel now that her hat has been found?
text: Uliza: Nani aliipata kofia? Msichana anajiskije sasa kofia yake imepatikana?

SourceText: Ask: What is the girl feeling? Why is she feeling that way? What can her father do to help?
text: Uliza: Msichana anajiskia nini? Kwanini anajisikia vile? Baba yake anaweza kufanya nini kumsaidia?

SourceText: Ask your child: Why is she sitting on her father’s shoulders? How is she feeling now?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Kwanini amekaa kwenye mabega ya baba yake? Anajisikiaje sasa?

SourceText: Ask your child: Where is the frog sitting? What is the bird doing? Who is sitting at the top of the hill?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Chura amekaa wapi? Ndege anafanya nini? Nani amekaa juu ya kilima?

SourceText: Ask: why are they sitting down? What are they looking at? How would you feel after climbing such a big mountain?
text: Uliza: Kwanini wamekaa chini? Wanatazama nini? Ungejisikiaje baada ya kupanda mlima mkubwa namna hii?

SourceText: Act out events from the book at a later stage. Go for a walk with your child and see what animals and birds you can spot as you walk. Or, collect different hats around your house and make a game out of hiding them and trying to find them.
text: Igiza matukio kutoka kwenye kitabu kwa hatua za baadae. Katembee na mtoto wako na muone wanyama na ndege mnaoweza kuwaona kadili mtakavyokuwa mnatembea. Au, kusanya kofia mbalimbali karibu na nyumba yenu na mtengeneze mchezo wa kuzificha na kujaribu kuzitafuta.

SourceText: Where is Lulu?
text: Lulu yupo wapi?

SourceText: Where is Lulu and why is she hiding?
text: Lulu yupo wapi na kwanini anajificha?

SourceText: "Oh, no!"
text: "Oh, Hapana!"

SourceText: "Lulu! It’s time to go," calls Ma.
text: "Lulu! Ni wakati wakurudi Nyumbani!" Mama anaita.

SourceText: Where is Lulu? Is she under the sofa? Is she behind the curtain?
text: Lulu yupo wapi? Je yupo chini ya kochi? Je yupo nyuma ya pazia?

SourceText: Where is Lulu? Is she next to the stove? Is she in the cupboard?
text: Lulu yupo wapi? Je yupo mbele ya jiko? Je yupo ndani ya kabati?

SourceText: "Lulu! It’s time to go. Where are you?" calls Ma.
text: "Lulu! Ni wakati wa kurudi nyumbani upo wapi?" Mama anaita.

SourceText: "There you are!" "I don’t want to gooo!"
text: "Hapo ulipo!" "Sitaki kuondoka!"

SourceText: "We have to go," says Ma. "But I really like this one!"
text: "Tunatakiwa kuondoka," Mama anasema. "Lakini kiukweli napenda hiki."

SourceText: "I really like this one!"
text: "Kiukweli napenda hiki!"

SourceText: "And this one." "And this one." "And this one."
text: "Na hiki." "Na hiki." "Na hiki."

SourceText: "See? You return books and borrow more." "YAY!"
text: "Ona? Umerudisha vitabu na unaazima zaidi." "NDIO!"

SourceText: Where is Lulu now?
text: Lulu yupo wapi sasa?

SourceText:
Ouma’s
Amazing Flowers
text: Maua mazuri ya Jane

SourceText: Ouma has amazing flowers! Robyn wants to pick them all …
text: Ouma ana maua mazuri ya ajabu! Robyn anataka kuyachukua yote …

SourceText: Ouma has a window box full of amazing flowers. Robyn wants to pick them all!
text: Jane ana boksi la dirishani lililojaa maua mazuri. Robby anataka kuyachukua yote!

SourceText: Please don’t pick the flowers, Robyn! Ouma loves to see them when she opens her curtains.
text: Tafadhali usichume maua, Robyn! Jane anapenda kuyaona anapofungua mapazia yake.

SourceText: Butterflies dance around the petals. It’s so lovely to have these visitors.
text: Vipepeo wanacheza kuzunguka maua. Inapendeza sana kuwa na wageni hawa.

SourceText: The bees use the flowers to make delicious honey.
text: Nyuki wanatumia maua kutengeneza asali tamu.

SourceText: The flowers bring joy to everyone who walks past Ouma’s house.
text: Maua yanaleta furaha kwa kila mtu ambaye alipita nyumbani kwa Jane.

SourceText: The neighbour likes to smell them when he visits for tea.
text: Majirani wanapenda harufu yake anapowatembelea kwa ajili ya chai.

SourceText: Sometimes, sunbirds drink the sweet nectar from the flowers.
text: Wakati mwingine, ndege hunywa majimaji matamu ya kwenye ua.

SourceText: Look, a tiny beetle! It shines in the sun. And there’s a fat caterpillar!
text: Tazama mende mdogo, anang'aa juani, na kuna kiwavi mnene!

SourceText: Please don’t pick Ouma’s flowers, Robyn! They won’t stay fresh very long.
text: Tafadhari usichume maua ya Jane, Robyn! Hayatakuwa mazuri kwa muda mrefu.

SourceText: "I won’t pick them, Ouma," says Robyn, even though she really wants to. She feels a little bit sad!
text: ''Sintayachuma Jane,'' anasema Robyn, hata kama anataka sana. Anajisikia huzuni kidogo!

SourceText: Ouma doesn’t want Robyn to be sad. "Okay, Robyn," says Ouma. "You can pick your favourite flower."
text: Jane hataki Robyn awe na huzuni,''Sawa Robyn,'' anasema Jane. ''unaweza kuchuma ua unalolipenda,''

SourceText: "And I have an idea ... Let’s plant more flowers together!"
text: ''Nina wazo... Ngoja tupande maua pamoja!''

SourceText: Baby’s First Family Photo
text: Picha ya kwanza ya mtoto akiwa na familia

SourceText: Baby’s family is excited about their first family photo. What will Mama, Papa, Big Sister, Baby and Gogo wear?
text: Familia ya mtoto mdogo inafurahishwa na picha yao ya kwanza ya kifamilia. Ni nini atavaa Mama, Baba, dada mkubwa, mtoto na Bibi?

SourceText: Whose bright orange wrapper is this? It is Mama’s.
text: Hiki kilemba cha rangi ya chungwa ni cha nani? Ni cha Mama.

SourceText: Ask your child questions about the pictures. Ask: What is she wearing on her head? What colour is it?
text: Muulize mtoto wako maswali kuhusu picha. Uliza: Amevaa nini kichwani kwake? ina rangi gani?

SourceText: Whose blue shirt is this? It is Papa's.
text: Hili shati la bluu ni la nani? Ni la Baba.

SourceText: Describe the pictures to your child. Say: Look, he is wearing a shirt with blue patterns and a blue tie. His glasses are also blue.
text: Muelezee mtoto wako picha. Sema: Tazama. amevaa shati la michoro ya bluu na tai ya bluu. Miwani yake pia ni ya bluu.

SourceText: Whose yellow head wrap is this? It is Gogo's.
text: Hiki kitambaa cha kichwani cha rangi ya njano ni cha nani? Ni cha Bibi.

SourceText: Ask: Who can you see? What is she wearing? Why do you think she is wearing glasses? Do you know someone who wears glasses?
text: Uliza: Unaweza kumuona nani? Amevaa nini? Kwanini unafikiri amevaa miwani? Unamfahamu yeyote anayevaa miwani?

SourceText: Whose pretty red dress is this? It is Big Sister’s.
text: Gauni hii nzuri nyekundu ni ya nani? Ni ya dada mkubwa.

SourceText: Describe the pictures to help your child learn words. Say: Look, she has tied her hair with big green and red bows. The patterns on the bows are the same pattern as her dress.
text: Elezea picha kumsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza maneno. Sema: Tazama, amebana nywele zake na vibanio vikubwa vya kijani na pindo nyekundu. Miundo kwenye pinde ni kama miundo kwenye gauni yake.

SourceText: Whose green and yellow flowery dress is this? It is mine!
text: Gauni hili lenye maua ya kijani na njano ni la nani? Ni langu!

SourceText: Make links between the pictures and your child’s world. Ask: What is she wearing? What are you wearing today? What colours are your clothes today? And what colours are my clothes?
text: Tengeneza muunganiko kati ya picha na dunia ya mtoto wako. Uliza: Amevaa nini? Unavaa nini leo? Nguo zako ni za rangi gani leo? N nguo zangu ni za rangi gani?

SourceText: "I love my orange wrapper." Mama twirls.
text: "Nakipenda kitenge changu chenye rangi ya chungwa." Mama alizunguka kwa kucheza.

SourceText: Ask: What is she doing? Why do you think she is doing that?
text: Uliza: Anafanya nini? Unafikiri kwanini anafanya vile?

SourceText: "I love my blue shirt." Papa bows.
text: "Nalipenda shati langu la bluu." Baba aliinama kwa heshima.

SourceText: Ask: What is he doing? Let’s try to do the same move as him.
text: Uliza: Anafanya nini? Hebu tujaribu kufanya vilevile kama yeye.

SourceText: "I love my yellow head wrap." Gogo jiggles.
text: "Nakipenda kitambaa changu cha kichwani cha njano." Bibi alijizungusha kwa kucheza kwa furaha.

SourceText: Use the pictures to teach your child about different shapes. Say: How many circles or round shapes can you see? What colours are they? Look, her clothes are covered in a yellow diamond pattern.
text: Tumia picha kumfundisha mtoto wako maumbo tofauti. Sema: Kuna miduara mingapi au maumbo ya duara unayoweza kuona? Zile ni rangi gani? Tazama, nguo zake zimefunikwa kwenye miundo ya almasi.

SourceText: "I love my pretty red dress." Big Sister jumps up and down.
text: "Nalipenda gauni langu zuri jekundu." Dada mkubwa aliruka juu na chini.

SourceText: Ask: What colours are on her dress? What colour shoes is she wearing? What is she doing?
text: Uliza: Kuna rangi gani kwenye gauni yake? Amevaa viatu vya rangi gani? Anafanya nini?

SourceText: "I love my green flowery dress." I clap my hands.
text: "Nalipenda gauni langu lenye maua ya kijani." Napiga makofi.

SourceText: Mimic actions from the story, like clapping hands. Ask: why do you think she is clapping her hands? How is she feeling?
text: Igiza matendo kutoka kwenye hadithi, kama kupiga makofi, Uliza: Unafikiri kwanini anapiga makofi mikono yake? Anajisikiaje?

SourceText: We are ready.
text: Tupo tayari.

SourceText: SNAP!
text: Picha!

SourceText: Ask: What are they going to do now? Why do you say that? How many people are there?
text: Uliza: Wanaenda kufanya nini sasa? Kwanini unasema hivyo? Kuna watu wangapi pale?

SourceText: Make links between the pictures and your child’s world. Do we have a family photo? Who is in it? Or, should we take a family photo later when we are all together? What do you want to do for our family photo?
text: Tengeneza kiungo kati ya picha na dunia ya mtoto wako. Tuna picha ya familia? Nani yuko humo? Tupige picha ya familia baadae tutakapokuwa sote pamoja? Unataka kufanya nini kwenye picha yetu ya familia/?

SourceText: Brave Bora
text: Bora Shujaa

SourceText: Going to the doctor can be scary! Can Bora overcome his fears, with a little help from Baba and Jojo?
text: Kwenda kwa daktari inaweza kuogopesha! Bora anaweza kuushinda uoga wake. kwa msaada kidogo kutoka kwa Baba na Jojo?

SourceText: Bora is sitting at the clinic with Baba. Jojo, his stuffed monkey, came too. Jojo is sleeping in Bora’s bag.
text: Bora amekaa kliniki na Baba. Ngedere wake aitwaye Jojo alikuja pia. Jojo amelala kwenye begi la Bora.

SourceText: "I don’t like needles. They hurt!" says Bora.
text: ''Sipendi sindano. Zinaumiza!''anasema Bora.

SourceText: "An injection helps make you healthy. It’s okay to be scared, Bora. Baba will be right here with you. And Jojo too."
text: ''Sindano zinasaidia kukufanya uwe na afya njema. Ni sawa kuwa na hofu, Bora. Baba atakuwa hapa pamoja na wewe. Na Jojo pia.''

SourceText: "Bora Baraka!" a loud voice calls. "Let’s go Bora, " says Baba. "It’s your turn."
text: '' Bora Baraka!'' kwa sauti kubwa,'' Twende Bora,''anasema Baba. ''Ni zamu yako''

SourceText: "Let’s come back tomorrow Baba!" says Bora.
text: ''Turudi kesho Baba!''anasema Bora.

SourceText: "Remember what Baba said you will get for being brave enough to get your injection?" asks Baba. "A red  lollipop! Okay, I’m coming," says Bora.
text: ''Kumbuka baba alichosema, ukiwa jasiri ukachoma sindano? Baba anauliza. " pipii ya kijiti nyekundu!" Sawa, nakuja," Bora anasema.

SourceText: The doctor smiles at Bora. "Is this your  monkey? Can we examine him too?" she asks.
text: Daktari alitabasamu kwa Bora. ''Huyu ni Ngedere wako? Tunaweza kumchunguza pia? anauliza.

SourceText: Bora looks at Baba, then at Jojo, and nods.
text: Bora anamwangalia Baba, pia Jojo na kutikisa kichwa.

SourceText: "Now, it’s your turn," she says. "Will you help me give your monkey a small injection so he feels better?" asks the doctor.
text: ''Sasa, ni zamu yako.''anasema''Unaweza kunisaidia kumchoma Ngedere wako sindano ndogo, ili ajisikie vizuri?''anauliza daktari.

SourceText: "TOOP!" says the doctor as she gives Jojo the monkey an injection.
text: ''TOOP!''anasema daktari wakati akimchoma sindano Jojo Ngedere.

SourceText: "Now, it’s your turn. Is that a superhero on your T-shirt?" she asks.
text: ''Sasa,''ni zamu yako. Je huyo ni shujaa kwenye flana yako?''anauliza.

SourceText: "TOOP!" She says as she gives Bora the injection.
text: ''TOOP!''Anasema huku akimpatia Bora sindano.

SourceText: "Ouch!" shouts Bora. "Hey, that wasn’t so bad!"
text: ''Ouch'' anapiga kelele Bora. Hey, Haikuwa mbaya sana!''

SourceText: "I know it stings a little, but we’re done and you have been very brave!" says the doctor.
text: ''Najua inauma kidogo, ila tumemaliza na umekuwa shujaa sana!''anasema daktari.

SourceText: "One red lollipop for our brave Bora!"
text: ''Pipi moja nyekundu ya kijiti kwa ajili ya shujaa wetu!''

SourceText: And Also!
text: Na Pia

SourceText: Thabo’s make-believe world has no room for his little sister, Keitu. But she has other ideas!
text: Uigizaji wa Thabo unaamini kuwa dunia haina nafasi kwa dada yake mdogo, keitu, lakini ana mawazo mengine!

SourceText: Thabo pretends that his bed is a raft on the sea!
text: John anaigiza kuwa kitanda chake ni chelezo ya kwenye Bahari!

SourceText: His little sister Keitu says, "Yes ! And also! There are sharks."
text: Dada yake mdogo John anayeitwa Kabula , anasema "Ndiyo! Na pia! Kuna papa."

SourceText: "No!" says Thabo.
text: "Hapana" John anasema.

SourceText: Thabo pretends that their taxi is a spaceship!
text: John anajifanya kuwa taksi yake ni meli inayoelea angani!

SourceText: His little sister Keitu says, "Yes! And also! Watch out for shooting stars!"
text: Dada yake mdogo John anayeitwa Kabula, anasema "Ndiyo! Na pia! Kuwa muangalifu na nyota zinazotoa risasi!"

SourceText: Thabo pretends the playground is a jungle!
text: John anajifanya eneo lake la kuchezea ni msitu!

SourceText: His little sister Keitu says, "Yes! And also! We are lions."
text: Dada yake mdogo John anayeitwa Kabula anasema "Ndiyo! Na pia! Sisi ni simba."

SourceText: "No," says Thabo.
text: John anasema, "Hapana!".

SourceText: "Oh!" says Thabo, "Wait! Wow! Yes! That’s a great idea!"
text: "Oh!" John anasema, "Subiri! Waoo! Ndiyo! Hilo ni wazo zuri!"

SourceText: "I know!" says Keitu.
text: "Najua!" Kabula anasema.

SourceText: Thabo pretends to be a lion! Keitu also pretends to be a lion!
text: John anajifanya kuwa simba! Kabula pia anajifanya kuwa simba!

SourceText: Thabo pretends the other kids are a river of crocodiles!
text: John anajifanya kuwa watoto wengine wote mamba wa kwenye mto!

SourceText: Keitu says, "Yes! And also! We can jump on this log to float away."
text: Kabula anasema "Ndiyo! Na pia! Tunaweza kuruka kwenye hili gogo na kuondoka kwa kuelea."

SourceText: "Yes! And also!" Thabo says, "We can slide down the rainbow!"
text: "Ndiyo. Na pia!" John anasema, " Tunaweza kuteleza kwenye upinde wa mvua!"

SourceText: Keitu says, "Yes! And also! Watch out for the dinosaurs!"
text: Kabula anasema "Ndiyo! Na pia! Kuwa muangalifu na Dino!"

SourceText: Thabo says, "I had the best day playing pretend with you."
text: 'John anasema, 'Nilikuwa na siku nzuri nimecheza nikiigiza niko na wewe.''

SourceText: Keitu says, "And also! We should play again tomorrow!"
text: Kabula anasema, "Na pia! Kesho tucheze tena!"

SourceText: Angry Akku
text: Akku mwenye hasira

SourceText: Akku is having an awful day and it’s making her very, VERY angry. Read this book to find out how Akku's anger melts away, and get ideas on what to do when YOU are very, VERY angry.
text: Akku ana siku mbaya na imemkasirisha sana. Soma kitabu hiki ujue namna hasira za Akku zilivyoyeyeka na upate ushauri unavyohitaji kufanya ukiwa umekasirika

SourceText: When the last school bell rang, all the children laughed and screamed with joy. All, except Akku. Akku was ANGRY!
text: Kengele ya mwisho shuleni ilipopigwa kila mtoto alicheka na kupiga kelele kwa furaha. wote, ispokuwa Akku. Akku alikuwa amekasirika!

SourceText: Describe and point at the children in the picture and say, “Hmmm.. It looks like all the children are happy and dancing except for this one. She looks really sad, I wonder what could be wrong.”
text: Elezea na onyesha kuelekezea kwa watoto kwenye picha na useme, "Hmmm.. Inaonekana watoto wote wana furaha na wanacheza isipokuwa huyu mmoja. Anaonekana mwenye huzuni sana, nashangaa nini kinaweza kuwa tatizo."

SourceText: "Akku! Akku! Look at the pretty sunflowers!" said Appa, as they rode through a field. "GRRMPH! They’re TOO YELLOW! They’re making my eyes hurt!" said Akku.
text: "Akku! Akku! Angalia yale maua ya kupendeza!" alisema Baba, walipoendesha kupitia uwanjani. "GRRMPH! Ni ya njano sana, yanasabisha macho yangu kuuma!" alisema Akku.

SourceText:
Help the child to learn new words by pointing at different items in the picture and say, “Look at this picture. I'm going to point to things, and you say the words after me, okay?”
Then say, "These are sunflowers. Can you say 'sunflowers'? That is a bicycle. Can you say 'bicycle'? Those are palm trees. Can you say 'palm trees'? And that is a huge tree trunk. Can you say 'tree trunk'?"
text:
Msaidie mtoto kujifunza maneno mapya kwa kuonyesha kuelekezea vitu tofauti kwenye picha na useme, "Tazama picha hii. Nitaonyesha kuelekezea vitu, na wewe usema maneno baada yangu, sawa?"
Kisha useme, "Hizi ni alizeti. Unaweza kusema 'alizeti'? Hiyo ni baiskeli. Unaweza kusema 'baiskeli'? Hiyo ni mitende. Unaweza kusema 'mitende'? Na hilo ni shina kubwa la mti. Unaweza kusema 'shina la mti'?

SourceText: "Akku! Akku! Look! Look at all the monkeys!" said Appa, pointing at the roof of their house. "CHEEE!" said Akku. "SHOOO! Go AWAY!  SHOOO!"
text: "Akku! Akku! Waone hawa Ngedere!" alisema Baba huku akionesha paa la nyumba. "CHEE!" alisema Akku. "Shooo! Ondoka! Shoo!"

SourceText: Point in the picture and say, “What is that on the roof? Is that what I think it is?”
text: Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye picha na useme, "Ni nini hicho juu ya paa? Je! ninavyofikiria ndio hivyo?"

SourceText:
Say, “Oooh, are those monkeys on the roof?”

Ask, “How many monkeys do you see? How many monkeys have tails? How many monkeys have big grey beards?
text:
Sema, “Oooh, je, hao ni nyani juu ya paa?”

Muulize, "Unaona nyani wangapi? Ni nyani wangapi wana mikia? Ni nyani wangapi wana ndevu kubwa za kijivu?

SourceText: "Here, drink some buttermilk," said Appa. "It’ll cool you  down." "HRRRM!" said Akku. "I DON’T WANT ANY!" "Try a sip, at least?" "OKAY! FINE!" said Akku, and tried a sip. It wasn’t all that bad. She had another sip. And another. In no time, the glass was empty.
text: "Hapa, kunywa maziwa kidogo," alisema Baba. "Itakutuliza." "Sihitaji!" "Jaribu kuonja kidogo." "Sawa basi!" Akku alisema, na akajaribu kuonja. Haikuwa mbaya hivyo. Alionja tena. Na tena. Muda si muda, kikombe kilibaki tupu.

SourceText:
Say, “Imagine you're this girl, and there are monkeys around! Would you feel a little bit scared? Maybe!”
Ask, “If you felt scared, what could you do to feel better? Could you take a deep breath? Maybe close your eyes for a second? Or maybe you'd want to hold someone's hand? What do you think would help you feel calm?”
text:
Sema, "Fikiria wewe ni huyo msichana, na kuna nyani karibu! Je, unahisi unaweza kuogopa kidogo? Labda!"

Muulize,"Ikiwa ulijiskia kuwa na wasiwasi, ungefanyaje ili kujisikia vizuri? Je, unaweza kuvuta pumzi ndefu? Labda kufunga macho yako kwa sekunde moja? Au labda ungetaka kumshika mtu mkono? Unafikiri nini kingekusaidia kujisikia utulivu?"

SourceText: "Would you like a vada?" asked Appa. "FFEHH!" said Akku. "Just one little bite?" "Okay, FINE!" said Akku, and took a bite. It was quite good. She took another bite. And another. In no time, the plate was empty.
text: "Utahitaji kalimati?" aliuliza Baba. "Hamna!"alisema Akku. "Kidogo tu ya kuonja." "Sawa, safi!" alisema Akku, na akang'ata. Ilikuwa tamu kabisa. Aling'ata tena. Na tena. Muda si muda sahani lilikuwa tupu.

SourceText: Say, “Now look at the girl again. It looks like the father gave her something nice to eat. Perhaps to get her smile, but still, she doesn't look happy. I wonder what could have upset her.”
text: Sema, "Sasa mtazame msichana huyo tena. Inaonekana baba alimpa chakula kizuri. Labda ili kumfanya tabasamu, lakini bado, haonekani kuwa na furaha. Nashangaa ni nini kilikuwa kimemkera."

SourceText: "Good girl," said Appa. "Now will you tell me why you’re so angry?" "NO!" said Akku. "Was it something I did?" "NO!" "Was it something Amma did?" "NO!" "Did something bad happen in school today?" "MAYBE!" "Oho."
text: "Safi binti," alisema Baba. "Sasa utaniambia ni nini kinakukasirisha?" "Hapana!" alisema Akku. "Kuna kitu nilifanya?" "Hapana!" "Kuna jambo Mama alikufanyia?" "Hapana!" "Kuna chochote kibaya kilichotokea shuleni leo?" "Labda!" "Naam".

SourceText: Ask, “If you were this girl, and something had upset you, how would you react?”
text: Muulize, “Kama ungekuwa huyu msichana, na jambo fulani likakukera, ungefanyaje?”

SourceText: "Would you like to draw it?" asked Appa. "Here’s a nice sheet of paper and some crayons." "Okay, FINE!" said Akku.
text: "Ungependa kukichora?" aliuliza Baba. "Hiki hapa kipande kizuri cha karatasi." "Sawa basi!" alisema Akku.

SourceText: Ask, “Now tell me, how many crayons do you see in this picture? How many papers do you see? What do you think the girl is going to do with the paper and crayons?
text: Muulize, "Sasa niambie, unaona kalamu ngapi kwenye picha hii? Unaona karatasi ngapi? Unafikiri msichana atazifanyia nini karatasi na kalamu za rangi?

SourceText: Akku drew a brick... "This is the STUPID BRICK that I tripped over this morning," said Akku. "You’re right. That IS a VERY STUPID brick!" said Appa.
text: Akku alichora tofari... "Hili ni lile tofali jinga lililonikwaa asubuhi," alisema Akku. "Umegonga ndipo, hilo ni tofari jinga sana!" alisema Baba.

SourceText: Ask, “What color is the girl using to draw on a paper? What shape is the drawing? Can you guess what he is drawing?
text: Muulize, "Msichana anatumia rangi gani kuchora kwenye karatasi? Mchoro ni wa sura gani? unaweza kukisia anachora nini?”?

SourceText: And Akku drew a boy... "This is Bikku, a VERY BAD BOY! He laughed when I fell down!" said Akku. "You’re right," said Appa. "He shouldn’t have laughed at you."
text: Akku alichora kijana... "Huyu ni Bikku. Kijana mbaya sana! Alicheka nilipoanguka!" alisema Akku. "Umesema sawa sawa," alisema Baba. "Hakutakiwa kukucheka."

SourceText: Say, “Hmmm! there is another drawing, i wonder who this could be. Who do you think this is?
text: Sema, "Hmmm! kuna mchoro mwingine, sijui huyu anaweza kuwa nani. Unafikiri huyu ni nani?

SourceText: And Akku drew an idli... "This is my idli," said Akku. "It fell out of my lunch box when I tripped over the STUPID BRICK!"
text: Na Akku alichora idli... "Hii ni Biskuti yangu." Akku alisema "Ilianguka nje ya mkebe wangu wa chakula nilipotegwa na tofali na kuanguka!"

SourceText: Point at the picture and say, “That looks like something to eat. What color is it? What shape is it? How many dots are inside the drawing?”
text: Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye picha na useme, "Hicho kinaonekana kama kitu cha kula. Ni rangi gani? Ina umbo gani? Ndani ya mchoro kuna nukta ngapi?"

SourceText: And Akku drew a crow... "This is the VERY BAD CROW that flew off with my idli," said Akku. "The crow must have been very hungry," said Appa.
text:
Na Akku akachora Kunguru... "Huyu ni kunguru mbaya sana aliyechukua 
chapati yangu," Akku alisema. "Huenda kunguru alisikia njaa sana," Baba alisema.

SourceText:
Point at the picture making a sad sound and say, “Oh no, a bird flew away with a biscuit, what will the girl eat?”

Ask, “Now show me how a bird flies. Do you think you can catch it?”
text:
Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye picha inayotoa sauti ya huzuni na useme, "La hapana, ndege aliruka na biskuti, msichana atakula nini?"

Muulize, "Sasa nionyeshe jinsi ndege anavyoruka. Je, unafikiri unaweza kumkamata?"

SourceText: And Akku drew her teacher... "This is my teacher, Amala Miss," said Akku. "She helped me up when I fell down. And then she hugged me." "That’s nice of her," said Appa "And then she pinched my cheeks. I DON’T LIKE IT when my cheeks are pinched." "Oho! That must have HURT, no?" "A little bit. But I’m okay now." "That’s good."
text: Na Akku alimchora mwalimu wake... "Huyu ni mwalimu wangu, Bi. Amala," Akku alisema. "Alinisaidia nilipoanguka kisha akanikumbatia." "Huo ndio uzuri wake," alisema Baba. "Kisha alifinyaa mashavu yangu. Sipendi kufinywa mashavu." "Salale! Hio iliumiza sana, hapana?" "Kiasi tu. Ila niko sawa." "Hiyo ni sawa."

SourceText:
Point at the picture and say, “There is another drawing.” 

Connect what is in the book with the child’s experience by pointing at the hand in the picture and saying, “How many fingers can you see? How many fingers do you have? What color is the hand? What color is your hand?”
text:
Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye picha na useme, "Kuna mchoro mwingine." 

Unganisha kile kilicho kwenye kitabu na uzoefu wa mtoto kwa kuonyesha kuelekezea kwenye mkono kwenye picha na kusema, "Je! unaweza kuona vidole vingapi? Una vidole vingapi? Mkono ni rangi gani? Mkono wako una rangi gani?"

SourceText: "See how well you draw, Akku?" said Appa. "You’re a real artist! Will you draw something for Amma too?" "OH-kay!" said Akku, and started drawing some more. "This is a little white mouse... and this is a boat... and this is a coconut tree..."
text: "Angalia namna unavyochora vizuri Akku?" Alisema Baba. "Wewe ni msanii wa kweli! Utachora kitu cha Amma, pia?" "Sawa!" Akku alisema, na akaanza kuchora zingine zaidi. "Hii ni panya ndogo... na hii ni meli... na huu ni mnazi..."

SourceText: Point at the feet and say, “Now look at the fathers feet. How many feet does he have? How many feet do you have? How many toes does he have? How many toes do you have?
text: Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye miguu na useme, “Sasa tazama miguu ya baba, ana miguu mingapi, ana vidole vingapi? una vidole vingapi?

SourceText: "And this is a sun flower... and this is your cycle, Appa... and this is a dog... and this is a frog..." In no time, Akku had forgotten all about the STUPID BRICK that made her trip and fall. And about the BAD BOY who laughed at her. And about the IDLI- STEALING CROW. And Akku even forgot about being ANGRY.
text: ''''Na hii ni alizeti.... na hii ni baiskeli yako Baba.... na huyu ni mbwa.... na huyu ni chura....''''Kwa kipindi kifupi, Akku alikuwa amesahau na lile tofali lililomuangusha. Na kuhusu yule kijana mkorofi aliyemcheka. Na kuhusu BISKUTI.... Kunguru aliyeiba. Na Akku akasahau alikuwa amekasirika.

SourceText:
Reflect on the girl's drawings and say, “Wow, she made so many pictures.”

Ask, “How do you think she feels now after drawing all of them? Maybe drawing made her feel better and calmer?”
Then say, “When I feel mad, sometimes I go for a walk, or sing a little song, or read a fun book, or listen to music. These things help me feel calm again. Now it's your turn! When you feel angry, what do you do to feel calm? Tell me!”
text:
Tafakari juu ya michoro ya msichana huyo na useme, “Wow, alitengeneza picha nyingi sana.”

Muulize, "Unafikiri anajisikiaje sasa baada ya kuchora zote? Labda kuchora kumemfanya ajisikie vizuri na kutulia?"
Kisha sema, "Ninapohisi kuchanganyikiwa, nyakati fulani naenda matembezini, au kuimba nyimbo, au kusoma kitabu cha kufurahisha, au kusikiliza muziki. Mambo haya hunisaidia kuhisi utulivu tena. Sasa ni zamu yako! Unapohisi hasira, unafanya nini ili kujisikia utulivu? Niambie!"

SourceText:
10 Things to Do If You Feel ANGRY like Akku:
1. Laugh loudly and jump around with your arms in the air!
2. Slowly – very, very slowly – breathe in, and breathe out!
3. Drink some water! Or buttermilk! 
4. Eat a piece of fruit! Or a vada!
5. Tell a grown-up about how you’re feeling!
6. Write about how you’re feeling!
7. Draw it out! Paint it!
8. Play with a pile of clay!
9. Make up a song about your anger! Sing it aloud!
10. Dance like a monkey!
text:
Vitu kumi vya kufanya ukikasirika kama Akku;
1. Cheka kwa sauti na urukeruke huku mikono yako ikiwa hewani!
2. Polepole tu vuta pumzi ndani tena nje.!
3. Kunywa maji kidogo au maziwa!
4. Kula kipande cha tunda au chakula!
5. Mwambie mkubwa unavyojisikia!
6. Andika unavyojisikia!
7. Chora! paka rangi!
8. Cheza na mchanga!
9. Tunga wimbo kuhusu hasira zako na uuimbe!
10. Cheza kama Ngedere!

SourceText: Ask, “Can you tell me what you think about the story? Did you like it? Why or why not?”
text: Muulize, "Je, unaweza kuniambia nini unafikiri kuhusu hadithi? Je, uliipenda? Kwanini uliipenda au kwa nini hukuipenda?"

SourceText: Beloved Daughter
text: Binti mpendwa

SourceText: Natabo has run away from her home! Do you know why?
text: Natabo amekimbia nyumbani! Unajua ni kwanini?

SourceText:
