text: ©African Storybook Initiative, 20016. Haki zingine zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: This is Natabo. She has six brothers.
text: Huyu ni Natabo. Ana kaka sita.

SourceText: Her parents give her a small pot. She loves it.
text: Wazazi wake walimpa chungu kidogo. Anakipenda.

SourceText: One day her brothers break the pot.
text: Siku moja kaka zake walikivunja.

SourceText: Natabo cannot find her pot. She cries and cries.
text: Natabo haoni chungu chake. Analia na kulia.

SourceText: Natabo runs away. She climbs a tall tree.
text: Natabo anakimbia. Anapanda mti mrefu.

SourceText: Her parents find her. "Please come down," they ask.
text: Wazazi wake wakamkuta. "Tafadhali shuka chini," walimuomba.

SourceText: Her brothers sing, "Please come down."
text: Kaka zake wanaimba, "Tafadhali shuka chini"

SourceText: Natabo makes fun of their song.
text: Natabo anaufanyia mzaha wimbo wao.

SourceText: Then Natabo's friend comes. "Please come down," she sings.
text: Halafu rafiki wa Natabo anakuja. "Tafadhali njoo chini," anaimba.

SourceText: Natabo's friend sings until she comes down from the tree.
text: Rafiki wa Natabo anaimba mpaka anakuja chini kutoka kwenye mti.

SourceText: The friends walk home together.
text: Marafiki walitembea pamoja kwenda nyumbani.

SourceText: Everyone celebrates that Natabo is home. Natabo gets a new pot!
text: Kila mmoja anasherehekea kuwa Natabo yupo nyumbani. Natabo anapata sufuria mpya!

SourceText: Big Blue Bus
text: Basi kubwa la bluu

SourceText: Ebei and his mother are waiting for the big blue bus. Where is it?
text: Ebei na Mama yake wanasubiri basi kubwa la bluu. Liko wapi?

SourceText: There was only one bus in Ebei's village. It was big and blue. It was very noisy.
text: Kulikuwa na basi moja tu katika kijiji cha Ebei. Lilikuwa basi kubwa lenye rangi ya bluu. Lilinguruma sana.

SourceText:
Describe the picture and say, “Look, there is a big blue bus. It is the only bus in this village and people love it a lot.”

Ask, “Have you seen a bus in your village? If yes, what color is it?
text:
Elezea picha na useme, "Angalia, kuna basi kubwa la bluu. Ndiyo basi pekee katika kijiji hiki na watu wanalipenda sana."

Muulize, "Je, umeona basi katika kijiji chako? Kama ndiyo, ni la rangi gani?

SourceText: "Tomorrow we will go to town," said Ebei's mother. "We will buy your school uniform."
text: Siku moja mama yake Ebei alisema, "Kesho tutaenda mjini kununua sare yako ya shule."

SourceText:
Say, "Look at this little cloud above their heads! That's a thought bubble. It shows what they might be saying to each other."
Ask, "Hmm... what do you think the mommy and her son are talking about in their thought bubbles?"
text:
Sema, "Angalia wingu hili dogo juu ya vichwa vyao! Hiyo ishara ya kuwaza kitu. Inaonyesha kile wanachoweza kuambiana."
Muulize, "Hmm... unafikiri mama na mwanae wanazungumza nini katika ishara ya mawazo?"

SourceText: Ebei was very excited. They would travel in the big blue bus. He could not sleep that night.
text: Ebei alifurahi sana. Kumbe atasafiri katika lile basi kubwa la bluu! Usiku huo hakuweza kulala vizuri.

SourceText: Say, "Hmm... look at the boy. He's in bed, but he's not sleeping! He's still thinking about what his mommy said. Maybe she told him something super fun and exciting!"
text: Sema, "Hmm... mwangalie mvulana. Yuko kitandani, lakini hajalala! Bado anafikiria kile ambacho mama yake alisema. Labda alimwambia jambo la kufurahisha na la kusisimua!"

SourceText: When his mother came to wake him, Ebei was already dressed.
text: Mamake alipoenda kumuamsha, Ebei alikuwa tayari amevaa.

SourceText: Say, “Wow, the boy is up and ready, I wonder where he might be going?”
text: Sema, “Waooo, mvulana ameamka na yuko tayari, sijui anaweza kuwa anaenda wapi?”?

SourceText: Ebei and his mother walked to the bus stop. They waited for the big blue bus. But the bus did not come.
text: Ebei na mamake walienda kwenye kituo cha basi. Walisubiri lile basi kubwa la bluu. Basi halikufika.

SourceText:
Point at the picture and say, "Look at the boy and his mommy! What color is his shirt? What color are his pants? And what color are his shoes? Now, what color is Mommy's dress? What color are her shoes? And what color is her bag?”
Now point at the different items and ask, “Wow! Look at Mommy's dress! Can you count how many round circles are on it? Let's look at the trees! Can you count how many trees you can see in the picture?"
Then point to the road sign and say, "Hmm, that's a sign next to the boy. Can you guess what that sign might 
mean? Maybe it tells the bus to stop, or maybe it shows where to go!"
text:
Onyesha kwa kuelekezea picha na useme, "Angalia mvulana na mama yake! Shati lake ni la rangi gani? Kaptula yake ni ya rangi gani? Na viatu vyake ni vya rangi gani? Sasa mavazi ya Mama ni ya rangi gani? Viatu vyake vina rangi gani? Na begi lake ni la rangi gani?"
Sasa onyesha kuelekezea kwenye vitu mbalimbali na umuulize, "Lo! Angalia nguo ya Mama! Je, unaweza kuhesabu ni miduara mingapi iliyo juu yake? Hebu tuangalie miti! Je, unaweza kuhesabu ni miti mingapi unaweza kuona kwenye picha?"
Kisha onyesha kuelekezea kwenye alama ya barabarani na useme, "Hmm, hiyo ni alama karibu na mvulana. Je, unaweza kuhisi alama hiyo ina maanisha nini? labda inaelezea gari lisimame au labda inaonyesha wapi pa kwenda"

SourceText: Other people arrived at the bus stop. They complained because the bus was late. "Where is the bus?" they asked.
text: Watu wengine walifika kwenye kituo cha basi. Wote walilalamika kuwa basi lilichelewa. Mmoja aliuliza, "Basi limetuacha?"

SourceText:
Say, "Look! More people came to the bus stop! They're all waiting for the bus. Hmm, maybe the bus is taking a little while. Oh no!" 
Ask, "Now, count all the people waiting for the bus. How many are there now? Have you ever ridden on a bus before?"
text:
Sema, “Tazama! Watu zaidi walikuja kituo cha basi! Wote wanasubiri basi. Hmm, Labda basi litachukua muda kidogo, Oh hapana!”

Uliza, “Sasa, hesabu watu wote wanaosubiri basi. Wapo wangapi sasa? Umewahi kupanda basi hapo awali?"

SourceText: Ebei was worried. "We will not be able to go to town," he thought. "I will not be able to get my uniform."
text: Ebei alikuwa na wasiwasi. "Tusipokwenda mjini, sitapata sare yangu ya shule," aliwaza.

SourceText:
Say, "Look at the boy! He's waiting and waiting for the bus, and now he looks a little bit worried because it's getting late. Sometimes, when I'm worried, I get a little bit grumpy, like this..." (make a slightly worried or grumpy face).”
Ask, "Now, can you show me what your face looks like when you feel worried?"
text:
Sema, “Mtazame mvulana! Anasubiri na kusubiri basi, na sasa anaonekana kuwa na wasiwasi kidogo kwasababu inazidi kuchelewa. Wakati mwingine, nikiwa na wasiwasi, napata huzuni kidogo, kama hii…”(onyesha wasiwasi kidogo au sura ya wasiwasi).” 

Muulize, “Sasa, unaweza kunioyesha uso wako unavyokuwa unapokuwa unajiskia wasiwasi?”

SourceText: Some people gave up and went home. Ebei cried. He did not want to go. "We will wait a bit longer," said his mother.
text: Baadhi yao walikata tamaa wakarudi nyumbani. Lakini Ebei alilia akakataa kurudi. "Tutasubiri zaidi," mama yake alimtuliza.

SourceText:
Point at the picture and say, "Look! Some people are going away from the bus stop, but some are still waiting. Look at that boy over there... oh no! He looks like he is crying."
Ask, "How do you think that boy might be feeling? Why do you think he feels that way? What do you do when you feel sad?"
text:
Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye picha na useme, "Angalia! Watu wengine wanaenda mbali na kituo cha basi, lakini wengine bado wanasubiri. Mwangalie mvulana yule pale... la, hapana! Anaonekana kama analia."

Muulize, "Unafikiri mvulana huyo anaweza kuwa anajisikiaje? Unafikiri kwa nini anajiskia hivyo? Unafanyaje unapojiskia huzuni?"

SourceText: Suddenly, they heard a noise. They saw dust in the air. The bus was coming!
text: Ghafla, walisikia mngurumo. Wakaona vumbi hewani. Basi lilikuwa linakuja kwa kasi.

SourceText:
Say, “Look! Everyone's looking that way! Their faces look like something’s happening! Maybe... is that the bus coming?"
Ask, "How do you think the people are feeling now? Are they excited? Maybe a little bit tired of waiting? What do you think?"
text:
Sema, "Angalia! Kila mtu anaangalia hivyo! Nyuso zao zinaonekana kama kitu kinatokea! Labda... je, basi hilo linakuja?"
Muulize, "Unafikiri watu wanajisikiaje sasa? Je, wamefurahia? Labda wamechoka kidogo kusubiri? Unafikiria nini?"

SourceText: But this bus was not blue. It was not big. It was red and small. The people did not want to get in this bus.
text: Basi halikuwa la bluu wala halikuwa kubwa. Basi lile lilikuwa dogo na jekundu. Waliosubiri waliliangalia tu na hawakuingia ndani.

SourceText:
Act surprised and say, "Oops! That's not the blue bus! Okay, look closely at this bus.”
Ask, “What color is it?"
text:
fanya kwa mshangao na kusema, "Lo! Hilo si basi la bluu! Sawa, angalia basi hili kwa makini."
Muulize, "Lina rangi gani?"

SourceText: "Get in! Get in!" shouted the driver. "We are very late today," he called.
text: Dereva aliwaita, "Ingieni! Ingieni! Tumechelewa sana leo."

SourceText: Help the child to learn new words. Point at the different items in the picture and say, “Okay, let's learn some new words! Look at this picture..."Say purse." (Wait for the child to repeat). Point to the briefcase, "Say briefcase." (Wait for the child to repeat). Point to the steering wheel, "Say steering wheel." (Wait for the child to repeat). Point to the rondavel, "Say rondavel." (Wait for the child to repeat)
text: Msaidie mtoto kujifunza maneno mapya. Onyesha ukielekezea vitu tofauti kwenye picha na useme, “Sawa, tujifunze maneno mapya! Angalia picha hii..."Sema mfuko wa fedha." (Subiri mtoto arudie). Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye mkoba, "Sema mkoba." (Subiri mtoto arudie). onyesha kuelekezea usukani, "Sema usukani." (Subiri mtoto arudie). Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye mzunguko, “Sema mzunguko”, (Subiri mtoto arudie)

SourceText: Ebei and his mother got in first. Soon everyone else got in the small red bus.
text: Ebei na mamake walikuwa wa kwanza kuingia. Mara wote waliingia ndani ya basi lile dogo jekundu.

SourceText: Say, "Yay! Look! They're on the bus now! That means it's time to go! Hooray!"
text: Sema, "La! Tazama! Wako kwenye basi sasa! Hiyo inamaanisha ni muda wa kwenda! Hureeee!"

SourceText: Ebei looked out the window. He saw more people at the bus stop.
text: Ebei alichungulia dirishani. Aliwaona watu wengi zaidi wakiingia ndani ya basi.

SourceText:
Point at each of the different people in the picture and say, "Look at all these people! See their shirts? Everyone has a different color on their top!
Ask, "What color is this shirt? What about this one? Tell me the color of this top! And what color is this one right here?. 
Say, let's now look at what you are wearing. Then ask, “what color is your clothes? What about mine?”
text:
Onyesha kwa kuelekezea watu tofauti kwenye picha and sema, “Tazama watu wote hawa! “Ona mashati yao? Kila mmoja nguo yake ya juu ina rangi tofauti!
Uliza, “Shati hili ni la rangi gani? Vipi kuhusu hili? Niambie rangi ya nguo hii ya juu! Na hii hapa ni rangi gani?
Sema, hembu sasa tuangalie umevaa nini. Halafu uliza, “Nguo zako ni za rangi gani? Vipi kuhusu yangu?

SourceText: Even more people were running to catch the bus. But they were too late. The red bus was full. It left for town.
text: Mara basi likaondoka. Ebei aliwaona watu wengine wakikimbia kulifikia basi. Walikuwa tayari wamechelewa.

SourceText:
Say, "Uh oh! Look! The bus drove away, and some people missed it! They're running super fast to try and catch it! One person looks a little stuck.”
Ask, “What would you do if the bus left you behind? Would you run after it too? Can you show me how you would run?"
text:
Sema, " ah oh! Tazama! Basi liliondoka, na watu wengine walilikosa! Wanakimbia haraka sana kujaribu kulikamata! Mtu mmoja anaonekana kukwama kidogo."


Muulize, "Ungefanya nini ikiwa basi lingekuacha? Je, ungelikimbiza pia? Unaweza kunionyesha ungekimbia namna gani?"



Muulize, "Ungefanya nini ikiwa basi lingekuacha? Je, ungelikimbiza pia? Unaweza kunionyesha ungekimbia namna gani"

SourceText: "Where is the big blue bus?" asked Ebei's mother. "It broke down," replied the driver. "We are fixing it. It will come tomorrow."
text: Mamake Ebei alimuuliza dereva, "Liko wapi basi kubwa la bluu?" Dereva alimjibu, "Samahani mama, basi la bluu liliharibika. Linatengenezwa Kesho litakuja."

SourceText: Say, "Look at the little cloud above their heads! That's like a thought bubble. I think the mother is asking the bus driver about the blue bus. Hmm... where could it have gone?"
text: Sema, “Tazama wingu dogo juu ya vichwa vyao! Hiyo ni kama ishara ya kufikiria jambo. Nafikiri mama anamuuliza dereva wa basi kuhusu basi la bluu. Hmm…litakuwa limeenda wapi?”?

SourceText: Ebei did not care about the colour of the bus. He did not care about the size. This bus was going to town!
text: Ebei hakujali rangi wala ukubwa wa basi. Alifurahi kuwa basi lile lilikuwa linawapeleka mjini. Hatimaye, atanunuliwa sare ya shule.

SourceText: Ask the child to share their thoughts about the story and say, “Now tell me, what do you think about the story? What did you like the most about it?”
text: Muombe mtoto akushirikishe mawazo yake kuhusu hadithi na useme, "Sasa niambie, una maoni gani kuhusu hadithi hiyo? Ulipenda nini zaidi kwenye hadithi?"

SourceText: Decision
text: Uamuzi

SourceText: A village takes a decision together to change their lives for the better.
text: Kijiji kilichukua uamuzi wa pamoja kubadilisha maisha yao yawe mazuri.

SourceText: My village had many problems. We made a long line to fetch water from one tap.
text: Kijiji changu kilikuwa na matatizo mengi. Tulipanga foleni ndefu kuchota maji kutoka kwenye bomba moja.

SourceText:
Describe the picture and say, “Look at this picture! Wow, lots and lots of people are waiting by the tap. They all want to get some water. Hmm, why are they all lined up like that? Maybe the water is coming out super slow?”

Ask, “What do you think?”
text: Elezea picha na useme, "Angalia picha hii! Lo, watu wengi wanasubiri karibu na bomba. Wote wanataka kuchota maji. Mmh, kwa nini wote wamejipanga hivyo? Labda maji yanatoka polepole sana?"

SourceText: We waited for food donated by others.
text: Tulisubiri chakula cha msaada kilichotolewa na wengine.

SourceText:
Point at the picture again and say, “Look at another queue, could the people be queuing for something else?”

Ask, “Let's look at the people who are wearing red, how many are they? How about those wearing green?”

Then say, “Now let's look at the clothes you are wearing, what colors are they?”
text:
Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye picha tena na useme, “Angalia foleni nyingine, je watu wanaweza kuwa kwenye foleni kutafuta kitu kingine?”

Muulize, "Hebu tuangalie watu waliovaa nyekundu, ni wangapi? Vipi kuhusu wale waliovaa kijani?"

Kisha sema, “Sasa hebu tuangalie nguo ulizovaa, ni za rangi gani?”

SourceText: We locked our houses early because of thieves.
text: Tulifunga nyumba zetu mapema kwasababu ya wezi.

SourceText:
Point at the picture and say, “Look at this picture! See the mother? She's closing the door with a key, click, click! And look, the window is also closed tight.”
Ask, “Hmm, why do you think mommy is locking the door? What do you think?
text:
Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye picha na useme, "Angalia picha hii! unamuona mama? Anafunga mlango kwa ufunguo, kwichi kwichi! Na tazama, dirisha pia limefungwa vizuri."

Muulize, "Hmm, unafikiri kwa nini mama anafunga mlango? Unaonaje?

SourceText: Many children dropped out of school.
text: Watoto wengi waliacha shule.

SourceText: Ask, “Can you tell me what is happening in this picture?”
text: Muulize, “Unaweza kuniambia nini kinatokea kwenye picha??

SourceText: Young girls worked as maids in other villages.
text: Wasichana wadogo walifanya kazi kama wasaidizi wa nyumbani kwenye vijiji vingine.

SourceText:
Point at the picture and say, “Look, those are young girls. They are supposed to be in school but it looks like they are working as maids.”


Ask, “Do you think it's important for children to go to school? Why do you think so?
text:
Onyesha kuelekezea kwenye picha na useme, "Tazama, hao ni wasichana wadogo. Walitakiwa wawe shuleni lakini -inaonekana wanafanya kazi kama vijakazi."

Muulize, "Je, unafikiri ni muhimu kwa watoto kwenda shule? Kwa nini unafikiri hivyo?

SourceText: Young boys roamed around the village while others worked on people's farms.
text: Mvulana mmoja mdogo alizungukazunguka kijijini wakati wengine walifanya kazi kwenye mashamba ya watu.

SourceText:
Point at the picture and say, “There seems to be many boys moving around the village. I wonder what they could be doing?”

Ask, “Now tell me, how many boys do you see in this picture?
text:
Elekeza kwenye picha na useme, "Inaonekana kuna wavulana wengi wanaozunguka kijijini. Nashangaa wanaweza kuwa wanafanya nini?"

Muulize, “Sasa niambie, unaona wavulana wangapi kwenye picha hii?

SourceText: When the wind blew, waste paper hung on trees and fences.
text: Upepo ulipovuma takataka za karatasi zilining"inia kwenye miti na uzio.

SourceText:
Say, “Look at this picture! Whoa, the wind is super strong! See how everything is flying around? Even the papers are stuck on the tree!
Now, look at the man. The wind is taking his hat! How do you think he feels right now? Is he happy? Sad? Silly? Tell me what you think!
text:
Sema, "Tazama picha hii! Lo, upepo una nguvu sana! Tazama jinsi kila kitu kinavyozunguka? Hata karatasi zimekwama kwenye mti!

Sasa, mwangalie mwanaume. Upepo unachukua kofia yake! Unafikiri anajisikiaje sasa hivi? Je, ana furaha? anasikitika? anajiskia mzembe? Niambie unafikiri nini!!

SourceText: People were cut by broken glass that was thrown carelessly.
text: Watu walikatwa na chupa zilizovunjika na kutupwatupwa kwa uzembe.

SourceText: Say, “Oh no! Look at the boy's foot. Is that blood? Uh oh! What happened? There are so many broken things on the floor. Did he maybe step on them? It's a good idea to wear your shoes so your feet don't get hurt!
text: Sema, La! Angalia mguu wa mvulana. Hiyo ni damu? Lo! Nini kilitokea? Kuna vitu vingi vilivyovunjika kwenye sakafu. Je, labda alivikanyaga? Ni wazo zuri kuvaa viatu vyako ili miguu yako isiumie!

SourceText: Then one day, the tap dried up and our containers were empty.
text: Halafu siku moja, maji yalikatika bombani na vyombo vyetu havikuwa na maji.

SourceText:
Describe the characters emotions and say, “Okay, imagine everyone in the village is feeling a little bit sad and worried. The water tap is empty! That means no water to drink, no water to wash our hands, and maybe even no water for the plants.”
Ask, "Why do we need water? What do you use water for?" Tell me what you think!”
text:
Elezea hisia za wahusika na useme, "Sawa, fikiria kila mtu kijijini ana huzuni na wasiwasi kiasi. Bomba la maji ni tupu! Hiyo inamaanisha hakuna maji ya kunywa, hakuna maji ya kunawa mikono, na labda hata hakuna maji ya kumwagilia mimea."

Muulize, "Kwa nini tunahitaji maji? Unatumia maji kufanyia nini?" Niambie unafikiri nini!”

SourceText: My father walked from house to house asking people to attend a village meeting.
text: Baba yangu alitembea nyumba hadi nyumba kuomba watu wahudhurie mkutano wa kijiji.

SourceText: Say, “Let's count the people in this picture! One, two, three... how many are there? Now, who is super tall? Can you point to the tallest person? And who is tiny? Point to the shortest person!”
text: Sema, "Hebu tuhesabu watu katika picha hii! Moja, mbili, tatu... wako wangapi? Sasa, nani ni mrefu sana? Je, unaweza kuonyesha kuelekezea kwa mtu mrefu zaidi? Na ni nani mdogo? Onyesha mtu mfupi zaidi!"

SourceText: People gathered under a big tree and listened.
text: Watu walikusanyika chini ya mti mkubwa na walisikiliza.

SourceText: Describe the picture and say, “Look! See all those people sitting under the big tree? They're talking about things that are making them sad in their village. Like, there's no water to drink, yucky trash all over the place, and broken stuff everywhere. Maybe they're talking together to try and make things better!”
text: Elezea picha na useme, "Tazama! Unawaona watu hao wote wameketi chini ya mti mkubwa? Wanazungumza kuhusu mambo ambayo yanawahuzunisha katika kijiji chao. Kama vile, kukosa maji ya kunywa, takataka nyingi kila mahali, na vitu vilivyovunjika kila mahali. Labda wanazungumza pamoja ili kujaribu kufanya mambo kuwa mazuri!"

SourceText: My father stood up and said, "We need to work together to solve our problems."
text: Baba yangu alisimama na alisema.,"Tunahitaji kufanya kazi pamoja kutatua matatizo yetu."

SourceText: Ask, “Do you think it's a good idea for them to talk and help each other fix these problems? Why do you think that?”
text: Muulize, "Je, unafikiri ni wazo zuri kwao kuzungumza na kusaidiana kurekebisha matatizo haya? Kwanini Unafikiria hivyo?"

SourceText: Eight-year-old Juma, sitting on a tree trunk shouted, "I can help with cleaning up."
text: Juma mwenye umri wa miaka nane amekaa kwenye tawi kubwa la mti alisema kwa sauti, " Naweza kusaidia kufanya usafi."

SourceText:
Say, “Wow! Even kids helped fix problems in their town! That's super cool, right?”

Ask, “Imagine if your friends had a problem, and you had a problem too. Would you help your friends think of ways to solve their problem?”
text:
Sema, "Waoo! Hata watoto walisaidia kutatua matatizo katika mji wao! Hiyo ni nzuri sana, sivyo?"

Muulize, “Hebu fikiria ikiwa marafiki zako walikuwa na tatizo, na wewe pia una tatizo. Je, ungewasaidia marafiki zako kufikiria njia za kutatua tatizo lao?”?

SourceText: One woman said, "The women can join me to grow food."
text: Mwanamke mmoja alisema, "Wanaweka wanaweza kuungana na mimi kulima mazao ya chakula."

SourceText:
Point at the women in the picture and say, “Look at the ladies in the picture. See that bubbly cloud over their heads? That's their thinking bubble!”


Ask, “What do you think is going on inside their heads? What do you think they are saying to each other? Tell me your ideas!”
text:
Onyesha kuelekezea wanawake kwenye picha na useme, "Watazame wanawake kwenye picha. Ona wingu hilo lenye mvuto lililo juu ya vichwa vyao? Hiyo ni ishara ya wao kufikiria jambo!"

Muulize, "Unafikiri nini kinaendelea ndani ya vichwa vyao? Unafikiri wanaambiana nini? Niambie mawazo yako!"

SourceText: Another man stood up and said, "The men will dig a well."
text: Mwanaume mwingine alisimama na alisema, " Wanaume watachimba kisima."

SourceText:
Point at the men in the picture, “Now let's look at these two men. See that bubbly cloud over their heads? That's their thinking bubble!”


Ask, “What do you think is going on inside their heads? What do you think they are saying to each other? Tell me your ideas!”
text:
Onyesha kuelekezea kwa mwanaume kwenye picha, Sasa tuangalie wanaume hawa wawili. Angalia hilo wingu lenye mvuto juu ya vichwa vyao? Hiyo ni ishara ya wao kufikiria jamboi!”

Muulize, "Unafikiri nini kinaendelea ndani ya vichwa vyao? Unafikiri wanaambiana nini? Niambie mawazo yako!"

SourceText: We all shouted with one voice, "We must change our lives." From that day we worked together to solve our problems.
text: Sote tulipiga kelele kwa sauti, "Ni lazima tubadilishe maisha yetu." Toka siku ile tulifanya kazi pamoja kutatua matatizo yetu.

SourceText: Point at the people in the picture and say, “Look! Everyone is helping to fix their problem together. See all those happy faces? Even the little girl looks like she's dancing because they figured it out! Yay for them! They solved it! Isn't that super great?”
text: Onyesha kuelekezea watu kwenye picha na useme, "Tazama! Kila mtu anasaidia kutatua matatizo yao pamoja. Ona nyuso hizo zote zenye furaha? Hata msichana mdogo anaonekana kama anacheza kwa sababu walisuluhisha pamoja! Je! hiyo si ni nzuri sana?"

SourceText: Emotions Come and Go
text: Hisia huja na kwenda

SourceText: Look out for the emotions you feel and why!
text: Angalia hisia unazojiskia na kwanini!

SourceText: © African Storybook Initiative, 2019. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © African Storybook Initiative, 2019. Haki zingine zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: Ada is chuckling because she heard a funny story. She is smiling. What is Ada feeling?
text: Ada anacheka kwa sababu alisikia hadithi ya kuchekesha. Anatabasamu. Ada anahisi nini?

SourceText: Gisa is feeling grumpy. He has a scowl on his face. Why is he irritated?
text: James anahisi hasira. Ana mkunjo kwenye paji la uso. Kwa nini amekasirika?

SourceText: Yuadoo is scared of the dark. Everyone feels fear sometimes. But Yuadoo can ask for help.
text: Adela anaogopa giza. Kila mtu huhisi hofu wakati mwingine. Lakini Adela anaweza kuomba msaada.

SourceText: Chidubem is worried about his school work. He can tell his teacher. He can ask for help.
text: Chidu ana wasiwasi juu ya kazi yake ya shule. Anaweza kumwambia mwalimu wake. Anaweza kuomba msaada.

SourceText: Lushan is playing around! It's okay to be silly sometimes.
text: Nathan anacheza cheza! Ni sawa kufanya mchezo wakati mwingine.

SourceText: Eruro is feeling sad. It's okay to cry. Emotions come and go.
text: Ethan anajisikia mwenye huzuni. Ni sawa kulia. Hisia huja na kuondoka.

SourceText: Ayator is bursting with happiness. He is joyful. Emotions come and go.
text: Zawadi amejawa na furaha. Yeye amefurahi. Hisia huja na kuondoka.

SourceText: Hadiza is bored. She needs to find something to do.
text: Hadija anahisi kuchoka. Anahitaji kupata kitu cha kufanya.

SourceText: Ayo is angry. He is frustrated. Anger is a difficult feeling.
text: Ayo amekasirika. Amechanganyikiwa. Hasira ni hisia ngumu.

SourceText: Labake is excited. What's the cause of her excitement? Mother made her favourite food.
text: Lizi amefurahishwa. Je! Ni nini sababu ya kufurahi kwake? Mama alitayarisha chakula akipendacho.

SourceText: Zege felt sleepy. He was very tired. "But wait, is 'sleepy' an emotion?" asks Efe.
text: Zakayo alihisi usingizi. Alikuwa amechoka sana. "Lakini, 'kuhisi usingizi' ni hisia?" Sefu anauliza.

SourceText: Efe is confused! Can you answer his question?
text: Sefu amechanganyikiwa! Je! Unaweza kujibu swali lake?

SourceText: Tega is feeling surprise and shock. He heard some gossip. Is it true?
text: Tumaini anahisi mshangao na mshtuko. Alisikia uvumi fulani. Ni ukweli?

SourceText: Yebo is sick. She feels miserable. She needs some medicine and rest to feel better.
text: Aisha ni mgonjwa. Anahisi huzuni. Anahitaji dawa na kupumzika ili ajisikie vizuri.

SourceText: Sekyen is feeling content. She has finished her chores. Now she can play.
text: Selina anahisi kutosheka. Amemaliza kazi zake za nyumbani. Sasa anaweza kucheza.

SourceText: Vandefan does not have chores today. He shows two thumbs up to Sekyen. "Good job, now let's play!" he says.
text: Victor hana kazi leo. Anamwonyesha Selina vidole viwili. "Kazi nzuri, sasa hebu tucheze!" anasema.

SourceText: Jasu Loves Football
text: Jasu na Mpira

SourceText: Jasu loves football. She loves kicking the ball, hard! But she doesn't have her own ball. Jasu comes up with a plan.
text: Jasu ni msichana aliyependa kucheza mpira. Lakini hakukuwa na mpira. Jasu alitafuta mbinu!

SourceText: © Room to Read, 2016. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © Room to Read, 2016. Haki zingine zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: Jasu liked to play football.
text: Alitamani sana kucheza mpira.

SourceText: Say, “On ho, the girl lost her ball. How will she play football” Ask, “Do you play football? Why or why not?”
text: Sema: “Oh hapana, msichana amepoteza mpira wake. Atachezaje mpira” Muulize: “Unacheza mpira wa miguu? kama ndio kwanini au kama hapana kwanini??

SourceText: But she lost her ball!
text: Lakini alipoteza mpira wake.

SourceText:
Say, “Look, a boy is playing with a ball, could that be the girl's ball?”

Ask, “How would you feel if you were the girl?”
text:
Sema: “Tazama, mvulana anacheza mpira, inaweza kuwa ni mpira wa msichana?”
Muulize: “Ungejiskiaje kama ungekuwa ni yule msichana?”

SourceText: She looked for old socks, scrap paper, and thread.
text: Jasu alitafuta soksi, karatasi na kamba.

SourceText:
Point at the following items and ask the child to name them. Point at each item and ask, “what is this?. 

Ask: “What do you think the girl is doing?”
text:
Onyesha kwa kuelekezea vitu vifuatavyo na mwambie mtoto avitaje. Onyesha kwa kuelekezea kwenye kila kitu na muulize: “Hiki ni nini?.

Muulize: “Unafikiri msichana anafanya nini?”?

SourceText: She made a ball.
text: Alitengeneza mpira.

SourceText:
Say, “Wow, is that a ball in a girl's hands? Could that mean she was making a ball?”

Ask, “Can tell me the colors you see on the ball.? What colors are the girls' shoes, dress and top. What colors are the mothers dress and top?”
text:
Sema: “Waoo, Huo ni mpira mikononi mwa msichana? Hiyo inamaanisha kuwa alikuwa anatengeneza mpira?”

Muulize’ “Unaweza kuniambia rangi unazoziona kwenye mpira? Viatu, gauni, blauzi vya msichana vina rangi gani. Gauni na blauzi ya mama yake vina rangi gani?”

SourceText: Jasu kicked her ball everywhere she went.
text: Kila alipokwenda Jasu aliupiga mpira.

SourceText:
Say, “look, the girl is kicking her ball.” 

Ask, “do you know how to kick a ball? Can you show me how you kick a ball?”
text:
Sema: “ Tazama, msichana anapiga mpira wake.” 
Muulize,” Je unajua kupiga mpira? Unaweza kunionyesha jinsi unavyopiga mpira?”?

SourceText: Jasu went to visit her grandpa. She kicked her ball into his mango tree. Some mangoes dropped.
text: Alipokwenda kwa babu aliupiga mpira juu. Mpira ulidondosha maembe machanga.

SourceText:
Say, “Oh no, is that the girls ball on the tree?”

Ask, “How do you think the ball got there? How do you think the two mangoes on the ground got there?”
text:
Sema,” Oh hapana, je ule ni mpira wa msichana juu ya mti?”

Muulize, “Unafikiri mpira umefikaje hapo? Unafikiri maembe yaliyo chini yamefikaje?”

SourceText: Grandpa wasn’t happy. He told Jasu to be careful. Jasu apologized.
text: Babu hakufurahia. Alimwambia Jasu awe mwangalifu. Jasu alimwahidi babu kutorudia tena.

SourceText:
Say, “There is grandpa talking to the girl. What could he be saying to her? Could the ball have hit the mangoes?”

Ask, “What would you do if you were the girl and your ball caused grandpa’s mangoes to fall?”
text:
Sema, “ Kuna babu anaongea na msichana. Anaweza kuwa anamwambia nini? Mpira unaweza kuwa umepiga maembe?

Uliza: “ Ungefanya nini kama ungekuwa ni yule msichana na mpira wako ndio ungekuwa umesababisha maembe ya babu kuanguka?

SourceText: Jasu went to the market with her mother.
text: Jasu alikwenda sokoni na mama yake.

SourceText: Say, “Look, a girls seems to be going somewhere with her mother, I wonder where they could be going.”
text: Sema. “Tazama, msichana anaonekana anaenda sehemu flani na mama yake, Sijui wanaweza kuwa wanaenda wapi.”

SourceText: She kicked her ball.
text: Jasu aliupiga mpira.

SourceText:
Help your child learn new words. Say: “Look, there is a palm tree, a man riding a bicycle, a woman carrying a basket, mother running on sandals and a scuff flying off as the mother runs.” 

Then say: “ Show me a palm tree, show me a bicycle, show me a basket, show me a pair of sandals and show me a scuff”
text:
Msaidie mtoto wako ajifunze maneno mapya. Sema: “Tazama, kuna mtende, mtu anaendesha baiskeli, mwanamke amebeba kikapu, mama anakimbilia viatu na kilemba kinapeperuka kadili mama anavyokimbia.”

Halafu sema: “Nionyeshe mtende, nionyeshe baiskeli, nionyeshe kikapu, nionyeshe viatu, na nionyeshe kilemba”

SourceText: It landed in a basket of tomatoes. Tomatoes fell to the ground!
text: Mpira ukamwaga nyanya.

SourceText:
Say, “Oh no, tomatoes fell on the ground.” Ask, “How many tomatoes are on the ground? What color are they? Have you seen tomatoes before? Where have you seen them?” 

Ask, “How do you think the woman whose tomatoes fell off is feeling? How would you feel if your favourite food fell off?”
text:
Sema, “Oh hapana, nyanya imeanguka chini. “Muulize, “ Kuna nyanya ngapi chini”? Ni za rangi gani? Umewahi kuona nyanya kabla? Uliziona wapi?“

Muulize: “ Unafikiri mwanamke ambaye ndiye  mwenye nyanya zilizodondoka chini anajiskiaje? Ungejiskiaje kama chakula chako pendwa kingedondoka?”

SourceText: Mama told Jasu not to play around. Jasu apologized again.
text: Mama alimwambia Jasu asicheze sokoni. Jasu aliomba msamaha.

SourceText:
Ask the child to name the fruits and vegetables in the picture. Point at the different fruits and vegetables and say, “what do we call this fruit? What do we call these vegetables?” 

Then point at different fruits and vegetables in the picture and ask the child to name colors. Ask, “What color is this?”

Then ask, “Which is your favourite fruit? Which is your favourite vegetable?”
text:
Mwambie mtoto ataje majina ya  matunda na mboga za majani za kwenye picha. Onyesha kwa kuelekezea matunda tofauti na mboga za majani na sema, “tunda hili tunaliitaje”? Mboga hizi za majani tunaziitaje?
Halafu onyesha matunda tofauti na mboga za majani kwenye picha na mwambie mtoto ataje majina ya rangi. Muulize: “Hii ni rangi gani”?

Halafu muulize: “ Unapenda tunda gani? Unapenda mboga gani za majani?

SourceText: Jasu carried her ball all the way home.
text: Jasu alihuzunika akaubeba mpira wake hadi nyumbani.

SourceText:
Say, “Look, the girl and the mother are walking home from the markert.”

Ask, “what is the girl carrying in her hands? How many items are in the mothers basket? What colors are they?

Say, “Look at the child and Mommy” and ask, "Can you see anything that looks the same on the child and Mommy's clothes and shoes?"
text:
Sema, “Tazama, msichana na mama wanatembea kwenda nyumbani kutoka sokoni.”
Muulize,”msichana amebeba nini mikononi mwake? Kuna vitu vingapi kwenye kikapu cha mama? Ni vya rangi gani?

Sema, “Watazame mtoto na mama’ na muulize, “Unaweza kuona kitu chochote kinachoonekana sawa kwenye nguo ya mtoto na za mama na viatu?”?

SourceText: At home, Jasu went to the playground with her friends. They played happily.
text: Alipofika, aliwafuata marafiki zake wakacheze uwanjani.

SourceText: Say, “Look, the girl is now home with her friends and they are ready to play together.” Ask, “do you have friends that you play with? How many friends do you have? Are they boys or girls?
text: Sema, “Tazama, msichana sasa yuko nyumbani na rafiki zake na wapo tayari kucheza pamoja.” Muulize, “Una marafiki unaocheza nao? Una marafiki wangapi? Ni wavulana au wasichana?

SourceText: Grandpa was happy that Jasu is playing in a safe place. He bought Jasu a nice new ball. Every evening, the neighborhood kids gathered to play at the playground.
text: Babu alikuwa na furaha kwamba Jasu anacheza sehemu salama. Alimnunulia Jasu mpira mpya mzuri. Kila jioni, watoto wa majirani walikusanyika kucheza pamoja.

SourceText: Say, “Look, there is grandpa, I think he is watching the girl and her friends as they play together. Ask, “how do you think the kids feel? How do you feel when you play with your friends?
text: Sema, “Tazama,  babu,  Nafikiri anamtazama msichana na marafiki zake wanavyocheza pamoja. Muulize, “Unafikiri watoto wanajiskiaje? Unajiskiaje unapocheza na rafiki zako?

SourceText: Jasu likes kicking the new ball with her friends...
text: Jasu anapenda kuchezea mpira mpya na rafiki zake...

SourceText:
Say, “Wow, I wonder if the playground is near their house? If it is, grandpa can watch them and they will be safe”

Ask, “Do you also play with your friends close to your house too?”
text:
Sema, “Waoo, Sijui uwanja wa michezo utakuwa karibu na nyumba yao? kama ndivyo, babu anaweza kuwaangalia na watakuwa salama”

Muulize, “Wewe pia unacheza na rafiki zako karibu na nyumbani? “Pia unacheza na rafiki zako wa karibu na nyumba yenu?”?

SourceText: ...but Jasu still loves her old ball, too.
text: ...lakini Jasu bado anaupenda mpira wake wa zamani pia.

SourceText: Say, “Now tell me, what do you think of this story? Do you like it? If not, why don't you like it?”
text: Sema, “ Sasa niambie, unafikiriaje kuhusu hadithi hii? Umeipenda? Kama sivyo, kwanini hujaipenda?"

SourceText: Discuss the book’s cover. Ask: What do you see? Where is the millipede shongololo sitting?
text: Jadili ganda la kitabu. Uliza: Unaona nini? Jongoo shongololo amekaa wapi?

SourceText: Shongololo's Shoes
text: Viatu vya Shongololos

SourceText: Shongololo has lost his shoes, and the other animals are NOT being very helpful. Will he ever find them?
text: Shogololo amepoteza viatu vyake, na wanyama wengine sio wa msaada sana. Je ataviona?

SourceText: © Book Dash, 2016. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © Book Dash, 2002. Haki zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: Where are all my shoes? I know I left them here!
text: Viatu vyangu viko wapi? Nafahamu niliviacha hapa!

SourceText: Use descriptive words and explanations to talk about the pictures. The long millipede has many tiny little feet. I think he is looking for his shoes. I see some yellow boots scattered across the floor. Do you think those are his shoes?
text: Tumia maneno ya kujielezea na kudadavua kuzungumza kuhusu picha. Jongoo mrefu ana miguu mingi midogo. Nafikiri anatafuta viatu vyake. Naona buti za njano zimetawanyika kwenye sakafu. Unafikiri hivyo ni viatu vyake?

SourceText: I haven’t seen your shoes. Go ask Snail!
text: Sijaviona viatu vyako. Nenda umuulize konokono!

SourceText: Ask your child questions to help them think about what is happening. Ask: What is he holding in his hand? Who do you think that belongs to?
text: Uliza mtoto wako maswali kumsaidia afikiri kuhusu nini kinaendelea. Uliza: Ameshika nini mkononi mwake.? Unafikiri ile ni ya nani?

SourceText: No shoes here. Go ask Giraffe.
text: Hakuna viatu hapa. Nenda umuulize Twiga.

SourceText: To help your child understand, explain what is happening. Say: Look, the snail is using one of the millipede’s shoes as a shell for his back. Ask: how do you think the shongololo feels about that?
text: Kumsaidia mtoto wako kuelewa, elezea nini kinatokea. Sema: Tazama, Konokono anatumia moja ya viatu kama gamba kwa mgongo wake. Uliza: unafiri Jongoo anajiskiaje kuhusu hilo?

SourceText: I’m in a hurry – go ask Frog.
text: Mimi nina haraka. Nenda umuulize Chura.

SourceText: Ask: What does the giraffe have on her head? What is she doing? Can you count all her spots?
text: Uliza: Twiga ana nini kichwani kwake? Anafanya nini? Unaweza kuhesabu madoa yake?

SourceText: Shoes? How many? Go ask Flamingo.
text: Viatu? Vipo vingapi? Nenda umuulize Korongo.

SourceText: Ask: Where is the frog sitting? What colours can you see in this picture?
text: Uliza: Chura amekaa wapi? Unaweza kuona rangi gani kwenye hii picha?

SourceText: Seen your shoes? No, not me.
text: Umeona viatu vyako? Hapana, siyo mimi.

SourceText: Mimic actions from the story. Say: Look, the flamingo is standing on one leg. Can you stand on one leg like flamingo?
text: Igiza vitendo kutoka kwenye hadithi. Sema: Tazama, ndege flamingo amesimama kwa mguu mmoja. Unaweza kusimama kwa mguu mmoja kama ndege flamingo?

SourceText: Will I ever find my shoes?
text: Hivi, nitavipata viatu vyangu?

SourceText: Talk about what the characters might be thinking or feeling. Ask: how does he feel? Why do you think he feels that way?
text: Ongea kuhusu kile ambacho wahusika wanaweza kufikiria au kujiskia. Uliza: Anajiskiaje? Unafikiri kwanini anajiskia hivyo?

SourceText: Shoes, eh? You should ask the Monkeys.
text: Viatu, eeh? Ungewauliza Nyani.

SourceText: Ask: What is the fox using the shoe for? What do you think is in the shoe? Would you drink something out of a shoe?
text: Uliza: Mbweha anatumia kiatu kwaajili ya nini? Unafikiri ndani ya kiatu kuna nini? Ungeweza kunywa kitu flani kutoka kwenye kiatu?

SourceText: Hello hello? We’re busy. Go ask Owl, she knows everything!
text: Hallo, hallo? Tuna kazi nyingi. Nenda umuulize Bundi, anafahamu kila kitu!

SourceText: Use a lively, playful voice, with different voices for different characters. Pretend to be the monkeys talking to each other in funny voices.
text: Tumia sauti yenye uchangamfu, ya kucheza, yenye sauti tofauti kwa wahusika tofauti, Igiza kuwa kama Ngedere wanaoongea wao kwa wao kwa sauti za kufurahisha.

SourceText: Hmm. I have an idea. Why don’t you ask Lion?
text: Hmm, nina wazo. Kwanini usimuulize Simba?

SourceText: Connect what is happening in the book with your child’s experiences. Say: Look, the owl is reading a book, just like us. What are some of your favourite books or stories?
text: Unganisha nini kinatokea kwenye kitabu na uzoefu wa mtoto wako. Sema: Tazama, bundi anasoma kitabu, kama sisi. Je ni vitabu gani au hadithi gani unazipenda zaidi?

SourceText: These are yours? I’ll give them all back if you come to my party!
text: Hivi ni vya kwako? Nitavirudisha kama utakuja kwenye sherehe yangu!

SourceText: Ask: what does the lion have in his hair? How many shoes can you see? Which of all the animals has the most shoes?
text: Uliza: Simba ana nini kwenye nywele zake? Unaweza kuona viatu vingapi? Ni mnyama gani kati ya wanyama wote ana viatu vingi zaidi?

SourceText: Use the pictures to help your child practice counting. You can ask your child to count, or count out loud for your child. Say: how many animals are there? And how many flags? Can you count all of Shongololo's yellow shoes?
text: Tumia picha kumsaidia mtoto wako kufanya mazoezi ya kuhesabu. Unaweza kumwambia mtoto wako kuhesabu. au mhesabie mtoto wako kwa sauti. Sema: Wanyama wangapi wako pale? Na bendera ngapi? unaweza kuhesabu viatu vyote vya njano vya Jongoo?

SourceText: Act out events from the book at a later stage. You can hide shoes around the house for your child to try and find. Think of funny or creative places to hide the shoes!
text: Igiza matukio ya hatua za mbele kutoka kwenye kitabu. Unaweza kuficha viatu karibu na nyumba ili mtoto wako ajaribu kuvitafuta. Fikiria sehemu ya kufurahisha au ya ubunifu ya kuficha viatu!

SourceText: What’s next?
text: Nini kinafata?

SourceText: Once the school bell rings, the excitement begins. Grandpa picks Fatima up from school. What adventures will they have?
text: Mara kengele ya shule inapolia, furaha inaanza. Babu anamchukua Fatima kumpeleka shule Watakuwa na matukio gani ya kufurahisha?

SourceText: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).
text: Kazi hii imepewa leseni chini ya Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

SourceText: Fatima is always busy! She loves to run and play.
text: Daima Fatima anakuwa bize (anakuwa na mambo mengi)! Anapenda kukimbia na kucheza.

SourceText: Her favourite part of the day is when Grandpa arrives. "How should we spend our day, Fatima?" asks Grandpa.
text: Kitu anachokipenda zaidi katika siku ni pale Babu anafika. "Fatima, Je tunapaswa kuitumiaje siku yetu?" anauliza Babu.

SourceText: "I know!" says Fatima. "Let’s go to the park."
text: "Najua!" anasema Fatima. "Twende kwenye Bustani."

SourceText: "I can see the whole world from up here," Fatima shouts.
text: "Kutokea hapa juu naweza kuiona sehemu kubwa sana." Fatima aliongea kwa sauti.

SourceText: "I have an idea!" "Let’s play superheroes and pick up the litter," says Fatima.
text: "Nina wazo!" "Tucheze mchezo wa mashujaa na tuokote takataka," alisema Fatima.

SourceText: "Great stuff! Now you can see all the flowers." "What’s next?" asks Grandpa.
text: "Safi! Sasa unaweza kuona maua yote" "Nini kinafata?" anauliza Babu.

SourceText: "Weeeeeeeee!" "What a crazy cool kid you are!" says Grandpa. "What’s next?"
text: "Weeeeeeeee!" "Wewe ni mtoto mzuri sana!" anasema Babu. "Nini kinafata?"

SourceText: "How about something cold and delicious?" says Fatima.
text: "Unaonaje tupate kitu chochote cha baridi na kitamu?" Anasema Fatima

SourceText: "What’s next, kiddo?" asks Grandpa. Fatima yawns. "Let’s go home."
text: "Tufanye nini tena, Mtoto?” anasema Babu. Fatima anapiga miayo.

SourceText: "Hello, Fatima," says Mum. "What did you and Grandpa do today?"
text: "Mambo, Fatima," anasema Mama. "Mlifanya nini pamoja na Babu leo?" "Sio sana" wote walisema

SourceText: "Not much!" they both say.
text: "Sio sana" wote walisema.

SourceText: "What should we do tomorrow?" asks Fatima.
text: "Tufanye nini kesho?" Anauliza Fatima.

SourceText: Fatima hurries to bed. She is excited for her next adventure with her best friend, Grandpa.
text: Fatima fanya haraka ukalale. Anafurahia matembezi yake yanayofuata na rafiki yake kipenzi Babu.

SourceText: SHHHHH!
text: SHHHHH!

SourceText: Shh! Baby is asleep! Why is everyone making so much noise?
text: Shh! Mtoto amelala! Kwanini kila mtu anapiga kelele sana?

SourceText: Baby is sleeping. zzzzzzzzzzzz
text: Mtoto amelala. zzzzzzzzzzzz

SourceText: DOOF DOOF! DOOF Shh, Sister! Baby is sleeping!
text: DOOF DOOF! DOOF Shh, dada! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: CLANG CLANG CLANG! Shh, Brother! Baby is sleeping!
text: KLANG KLANG KLANG! Shh, Kaka! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: WOOF WOOF WOOF! Shhh, dog! Baby is sleeping!
text: WOOF WOOF WOOF! Shhh, mbwa! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: Beepity Beep! Beepity Beep! Shhh, phone! Baby is sleeping!
text: Triiiiii Triii! Triiiii Triii! Shhh, simu! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: TOOT TOOT TEETOOT! Shhhh, radio! Baby is sleeping!
text: DUU DUU DUU! Shhh, Redio! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: Brmmm Brmmm BRMMM! Shhhhh, truck! Baby is sleeping!
text: Bruummm Bruummm BRUUMMM! Shhhh, Lori! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: CLICKITY CLACK CLICKITY CLACK! Shhhhh, train! Baby is sleeping!
text: KLIKITII KLIKITII KLIKITII KLIKITII! Shhhhh, treni! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: Ba dubba dubba Dubba dubba! Shhhhhhhhh, helicopter! Baby is sleeping!
text: Toko toko toko toko chwiiiiiii! Shhhhhhh, helikopta! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: Baby is awake!
text: Mtoto ameamka!

SourceText: DOOF CLANG WOOF BEEP TOOT BRMMM CLICKITY BADUBBA
text: DOOF CLANG WOOF BEEP TOOT BRMMM CLICKITY BADUBBA

SourceText: Baby is noisy! CLANG WOOF BEEP BRMM CLICKITY TOOT CLICKITY DOOF BADUBBA! WOOF CLANG DOOF WOOF CLICKITY BAD CLANG DOOF WOOF BRMMM BEEP
text: Mtoto anapiga kelele! CLANG WOOF BEEP BRMM CLICKITY TOOT CLICKITY DOOF BADUBBA! WOOF CLANG DOOF WOOF CLICKITY BAD CLANG DOOF WOOF BRMMM BEEP

SourceText: Lost Toy
text: Mdoli aliyopotea

SourceText: A child has lost their favorite toy. They are so sad. Will some kind strangers help?
text: Mtoto amepoteza mdoli wake anaoupenda. Anahuzuni sana. Kuna wasamaria watakaomsaidia?

SourceText:
Describe what is happening in the picture and say, "Look over here! See the boy? He's holding his toy really close, like he loves it a lot!"
Ask, "Do you have toys? Do you love your toys too?"
text:
Elezea kinachotokea kwenye picha na useme, "Angalia pale! Unamwona mvulana? Ameshikilia mdoli wake kwa karibu, anampenda sana!"

Muulize, "Je! una midoli? Unaipenda midoli yako?"

SourceText: Say, “Oh no! It looks like the boy is crying. I wonder what could have happened. Perhaps he doesn't want to leave? Or maybe he forgot his toy? Hmmm…!
text: Sema, "La hapana! inaonekana kama mvulana analia. Nashangaa ni nini kimemtokea. Labda hataki kuondoka? Au labda alisahau mdoli wake? Mmmmh...!

SourceText:
Say, “Look at the boy! He looks really, really sad. See that big cloud above his head? That's a thought bubble, like what he's thinking inside.”
Ask, "What do you think he's thinking about that makes him so sad? How can you tell he's feeling sad? What does your face look like when you are sad?"
text:
Sema, "Mtazame mvulana huyo! Anaonekana mwenye huzuni sana. Unaona wingu hilo kubwa juu ya kichwa chake? Huo ni wingi wa  mawazo, kama vile kuna anachofikiria"

Muulize, "Unafikiri anafikiria nini kinachomfanya awe na huzuni sana? Unaweza kuielezeaje huzuni anayojiskia? Uso wako huwa unaonekanaje ukiwa na huzuni?"

SourceText: Describe the picture and say, “Oh no! The boy is really sad, he doesn't want to ride a taxi without his toy. Where could it have gone?”
text: Elezea picha na useme, "La! Mvulana ana huzuni sana, hataki kupanda teksi bila mdoli wake. Utakuwa umeenda wapi?"

SourceText: Point at the toy in the picture and say, “Look, is that the boy’s toy in that bag?  I wonder how it got there.
text: Onyesha kuelekezea mdoli kwenye picha na useme, "Angalia, huo ni mdoli wa mvulana kwenye lile begi? Nashangaa ulifikaje kule.

SourceText:
Say, “Wow, look what we have here. It is a market, they are selling so many things. Now let's explore them together.

Point at the different items and ask the child to name them. Ask, “what is this?” 

Then help the child to count by saying, “Now tell me, how many taxis do you see? How many fish are they selling? How many bundles of bananas do they have? How many people are there?”
text:
Sema, “Waoo, tazama tulicho nacho hapa, ni soko, wanauza vitu vingi sana. Sasa hembu tuvichunguze pamoja.


Onyesha kuelekezea vitu mbalimbali na umwombe mtoto avipe majina. Muulize, "hii ni nini?" 

Kisha msaidie mtoto kuhesabu kwa kusema, "Sasa niambie, unaona teksi ngapi? Wanauza samaki wangapi? Wana kiasi gani cha ndizi? Kuna watu wangapi?"

SourceText: Act worried and sad then say, “Oh no, is the toy falling off the bag? Not again!”
text: Igiza wasiwasi na huzuni kisha useme, "La, je, mdoli anaanguka kutoka kwenye begi? hapana haanguki tena!"

SourceText:
Say, “Look, there is a dog bucking at the toy”. Mimic the sound of a bucking dog, then say, “I wonder if it will be able to catch the toy from falling onto the ground.”

Ask, “Do you have dogs at home or in your village? Do you like them? Why or why not?
text:
Sema, "Tazama, kuna mbwa anaubwekea mdoli". Iga sauti ya mbwa anayebweka, kisha useme, "Sijui kama ataweza kumnasa mdoli asianguke chini."


Muulize, "Je, una mbwa nyumbani au kijijini kwako? Unawapenda? kama ndiyo Kwanini au kama huwapendi ni kwanini?

SourceText: Say, “Wow, it looks like the dog was able to rescue the toy. What an amazing dog.”
text: Sema, "Waoo, inaonekana kama mbwa aliweza kuokoa mdoli. Ni mbwa wa ajabu kama nini."

SourceText:
Point at the items in the picture and say, “Now let's play a spotting game! Look at grandpa's clothes, this toy, and this dog. Can you find the same color on all of them?
Let's do it like this: "Grandpa has a white shirt. Look! The dog is also white!" Now you try! Find a color that's the same on grandpa, the toy, and the dog. What color did you find?
text:
Onyesha kuelekezea vitu vilivyo kwenye picha na useme, “Sasa tucheze mchezo wa kuona! Angalia nguo za babu, mdoli huyu, na mbwa huyu. Je, unaweza kupata rangi sawa kwa wote?

Hebu tufanye hivi: "Babu ana shati nyeupe. Tazama! Mbwa pia ni mweupe!" Sasa jaribu! Tafuta rangi inayofanana na babu, mdoli na mbwa. Umepata rangi gani?

SourceText:
Say, “Look, is that grandpa with the toy. Did grandpa find the lost toy?”

Point at the boy and say, “Look at the boy, I wonder how he might be feeling seeing his toy.”
text:
Sema, "Tazama, Huyo ni babu aliye na mdoli. Je, babu alipata mdoli aliyopotea?"

Onyesha kuelekezea kwa mvulana na kusema, "Mtazame mvulana, nashangaa jinsi anavyojiskia anapoona mdoli wake."

SourceText: Ask, “Now tell me, how do you think the boy feels now that he got his lost toy back? How would you feel if something you love got lost? Why?
text: Muulize, "Sasa niambie, unafikiri mvulana anajiskiaje sasa baada ya kupata mdoli wake aliyekuwa amepotea? Ungejiskiaje ikiwa kitu unachokipenda kitapotea? Kwa nini?

SourceText: What’s at the Park?
text: Kuna nini mbugani?

SourceText: Zoey loves finding things in the park. One day, she gets a big surprise.
text: Zoi anapenda kutafuta vitu mbugani. Siku moja, alistukizwa na jambo kubwa la furaha.

SourceText: Down the road from Zoey’s house, there is a big, green park.
text: Barabarani kwa chini kutoka nyumba ya Zoi, kuna bustani kubwa ya kijani.

SourceText: Zoey is quite shy, but she loves to play in the park. Every day after school, Zoey and Granny go there to play.
text: Zoi ana aibu sana, Lakini anapenda kucheza bustanini. Kila siku baada ya kutoka shule, Zoi na Bibi wanaenda pale kucheza.

SourceText: Granny needs glasses to see. But she can hear very well. Zoey is good at finding things. Even better than Granny!
text: Bibi huhitaji miwani kuona. Lakini anaweza kusikia vizuri sana. Zoi ni mzuri katika kupata vitu. Zaidi kuliko Bibi!

SourceText: She can find birds and bugs.
text: Anaweza kupata ndege na mende.

SourceText: She can find the prettiest flowers and the tallest trees.
text: Anaweza kupata maua mazuri na miti mirefu zaidi.

SourceText: And she’s very good at finding Granny’s secret sweets.
text: Na ni mzuri sana katika kupata vitu vitamu vya siri vya bibi.

SourceText: “What’s that noise behind the tree?” asks Granny. “Does it sound like a bird?” asks Zoey. “No,” says Granny. “It sounds much bigger than a bird. Can you see what it is?”
text: "Hiyo ni sauti gani nyuma ya mti?" bibi anauliza. "Inaonesha ni kama sauti ya ndege?" anauliza Zoi. "Hapana," anasema bibi. "Ni kama kubwa kuliko ya ndege. Unaweza kuona ni nini hicho?

SourceText: “It’s a dog!” says Zoey.
text: " Ni mbwa!" Zoi anasema.

SourceText: “Phew!” says Granny. “This dog is very smelly!”
text: "Fyuuu!" Bibi anasema. "huyu mbwa ananuka sana!"

SourceText: The next day, Zoey comes home from school and packs her bag. “Are you ready to go to the park?” asks Granny. “Yes, please,” says Zoey. “Granny, look who’s outside!” says Zoey.
text: Siku iliyofuata, Zoi alirudi nyumbani kutoka shule na aliandaa begi lake. "Upo tayari kwenda mbugani?" bibi anauliza. "Ndio, tafadhali," anasema Zoi. "Bibi, angalia nani yupo nje!" Zoi anasema.

SourceText: “You found us!” says Zoey. “Now, let’s give you a bath.”
text: "Umetupata!" Zoi anasema. " Sasa, ngoja tukuogeshe."

SourceText: And from that day on, Zoey, Granny and their new friend played in the park every day.
text: Na toka siku ile na kuendelea, Zoi, bibi na rafiki yao mpya walicheza mbugani kila siku.

SourceText: Zibu and Zizo
text: Zibu na Zizo

SourceText: Zibu and Zizo are twin brothers. They are similar, but different. Being different is not bad, it’s great.
text: Zibu na Zizo ni ndugu wa kiume mapacha. Wanafanana, lakini ni tofauti. Kuwa tofauti sio mbaya, ni nzuri.

SourceText: Zibu and Zizo are twin brothers. ‘They look the same,’ people always say.
text: Zibu na Zizo ni ndugu wa kiume mapacha. "Wanafanana," watu wanasema daima.

SourceText:
Describe the picture and say, “look, these are twin brothers, they look almost the same, like two peas in a pod. 

Then say, "But... hmm... look closely! Can you see anything that's a little bit different between them?"
text:
Elezea picha na sema,”Tazama hawa ni mapacha wa kiume, wanafanana sana, kama njegere zilivyo ndani ya ganda.

Alafu useme, “lakini….hmm…..tazama kwa umakini! unaweza kuona chochote  ambacho ni tofauti kati yao?

SourceText: Mama buys them the same clothes. They go to the same school.
text: Mama huwanunulia nguo zilizo sawa. Wanasoma shule moja.

SourceText:
Say, “The two brothers are now going to school in their uniform.” 

Ask, “what is the color of their uniform?
text:
Sema, “Ndugu wawili wa kiume wanakwenda shule wakiwa wamevalia sare za shule.”

Muulize, “Sare zao zina rangi gani?

SourceText: Zibu and Zizo both like banana bread.
text: Zibu na Zizo wote wanapenda mkate wa ndizi.

SourceText: Ask, “can you tell me what is on the table? How many slices of bread do you see?
text: Muulize. “ Unaweza kuniambia nini kipo juu ya meza? Unaviona vipande vingapi vya mkate?

SourceText: Sometimes Zibu and Zizo say ... Hello!! ... at the same time.
text: Wakati mwingine Zibu na Zizo husalimia kwa pamoja.

SourceText:
Say, “look, one of them is waving his hand. Perhaps he is greeting someone” 

Ask, “show me how you greet people when you meet them.”
text:
Sema,  “tazama, mmoja wao anapunga mkono . Labda anasalimia mtu flani”

Mwambie., “Nionyeshe jinsi unavyosalimia watu unapoonana nao,”

SourceText: Zibu likes soccer.
text: Zibu hupenda soka.

SourceText: Ask, “Tell me, what do you think the boy in this picture is doing?”
text: Uliza, “Niambie, unafikiri mvulana kwenye picha hii anafanya nini?”

SourceText: Zizo likes drawing pictures.
text: Zizo hupenda kuchora picha.

SourceText:
Ask, “What about this one? What do you think he is doing?”

Ask again, “can you tell me the number of pencils and brushes you can see on the floor.”
text:
Uliza, Vipi kuhusu hii? Unafikiri anafanya nini?”

Uliza tena, “unaweza kuniambia idadi ya penseli na brashi unazoweza kuziona sakafuni.?.

SourceText: Zibu likes to talk to people.
text: Zibu hupenda kuongea na watu.

SourceText:
Ask, “Can you tell me what you think is happening in this picture.”

Then ask, “how many children can you see? Point at the different children and ask, “what is the color of their clothes?”
text:
Uliza, “Unafikiri ni nini kinatokea kwenye picha hii.”

Halafu uliza, “Unaweza kuona watoto wangapi? Onyesha kwa watoto fofauti kwa kuwaelekezea na uliza, “nguo zao ni za rangi gani?”

SourceText: Zizo likes to keep to himself.
text: Zizo hupenda kukaa mwenyewe.

SourceText: Say, “Look, the boy is reading a book. I wonder what he could be reading about?”
text: Sema. “Tazama, mvulana anasoma kitabu. Sijui atakuwa anasoma kuhusu nini?”

SourceText: Zibu likes counting numbers. He wants to be an accountant.
text: Zibu hupenda kuhesabu namba. Anataka kuwa mhasibu.

SourceText:
Say, "Look! So many numbers! The boy looks like he's counting them."
Ask, "Can you help me count the numbers? Let's see... how many numbers are red? Now, how many numbers are green? Let's now count the blue numbers. How many blue ones are there? Last one! Can you count how many numbers are yellow?”
text:
Sema, “Tazama! kuna namba nyingi! Mvulana anaonekana kama anazihesabu.”
Uliza, “Unaweza kunisaidia kuhesabu namba? Hebu tuone…  Namba ngapi ni nyekundu? Sasa, namba ngapi ni za kijani? Hebu sasa tuhesabu namba za bluu. Za bluu zipo ngapi? Ya mwisho! Unaweza kuhesabu namba ngapi ni za njano?”

SourceText: Zizo likes learning new words. He wants to write books.
text: Zizo hupenda kujifunza maneno mapya. Anataka kuandika vitabu.

SourceText:
Say, "Look! A pink book! And guess what's on the cover? A kitty! Mimic the cat sound and say, "Meow! Meow!" 
Then ask, "Can you try to make a kitty sound?"
text:
Sema, “Tazama! Kitabu cha pinki! Na kisia kuna nini kwenye jalada? Paka! Igiza sauti ya paka na sema, Nyaaau! nyaaau!

Halafu uliza, “Unaweza kujaribu kuigiza sauti ya paka!"?

SourceText: ‘How come Zibu and Zizo look the same, but like different things?’ ask the children at school.
text: Inakuwaje Zibu na Zizo wanafanana, lakini wanapenda vitu tofauti?" watoto wanauliza shuleni.

SourceText: Describe the picture and say, "Look at these kids! They're looking at the twin brothers and thinking, 'Hmm, why do they like different things even though they look the same?'"
text: Elezea picha na sema, “Tazama hawa watoto! Wanawaangalia mapacha wa kiume na wanafikiria  “Hmm, kwanini wanapenda vitu tofauti ingawa wanafanana?”

SourceText: We look the same, but we are different and like different things and that's okay.'
text: Tunaonekana sawa, lakini tuko tofauti na tunapenda vitu tofauti na hiyo ni sawa."

SourceText: Ask, "Do you think it's okay for twin brothers to like different things, like maybe one likes cars and the other likes blocks? Why do you think that?"
text: Muulize “Unafikiri ni sawa kwa wale mapacha wa kiume kupenda vitu tofauti, kama vile labda mmoja hupenda magari na mwingine hupenda viboksi vya kuchezea? Kwanini unafikiria hivyo?” ?

SourceText: Yes you can!
text: Ndio unaweza!

SourceText: Join Teacher Langa’s class as they share what they want to be when they grow up. Let’s see what they say!
text: Jiunge na darasa la mwalimu Langa wanaposhirikisha kile wanachotaka kuwa watakapokua wakubwa. Na tuone wanasema nini!

SourceText: “What do you want to be when you grow up?” asks Teacher Langa.
text: "Unataka kuwa nani utakapokuwa mkubwa? '' anauliza mwalimu Langa.

SourceText: Say: “Hmmm I can see lots of different children in this picture. They all look different and are doing different things. What do you see?”
text: Sema: “Hmmm Naweza kuona watoto wengi tofauti tofauti kwenye picha hii. Wote wako tofauti na wanafanya vitu tofauti tofauti. Unaona nini?"

SourceText: Khutso shouts, “I want to be a cook!”
text: Kuso anapiga kelele,'' Nataka kuwa mpishi!''

SourceText: Ask: “What do you think is happening in this picture?” If the child is unable to explain the picture, help them to understand what is happening by saying, “the boy is thinking of becoming a chef when he grows up.”
text: Muulize: Unafikiri nini kinatokea katika picha hii? Kama mtoto anashindwa kuielezea picha, msaidie kufahamu nini kinatokea kwa kusema “mvulana anafikiria kuwa mpishi atakapokuwa mkubwa..”.

SourceText: I love helping my mom bake and cook at home.” Nandi says, “No! That’s a girl’s job. My mom does all the cooking at home.” “Yes he can, Nandi. You can be anything you want to be,” says Teacher Langa. The class chants, “Yes you can!”
text: Napenda kumsaidia mama kuoka na kupika nyumbani.'' Anasema Nandi, ''Hapana! Hiyo ni kazi ya kike. Mama yangu ndiye anapika nyumbani.'' Ndio anaweza, Nandi. Unaweza kuwa chochote kile unataka kuwa,''anasema Mwalimu Langa. darasa linaimba,''Ndio unaweza!''

SourceText: Ask: What is different between this picture and the previous one? Something is falling on someone’s head - can you spot who? How do they feel?”
text: Muulize: Kuna tofauti gani kati ya picha hii na ile iliyopita? Kitu kinaanguka juu ya kichwa cha mtu - unaweza kumwona nani? Wanajisikiaje?”

SourceText: Milani says, “I want to build houses like my dad.”
text: Milani anasema,''Nataka kuwa mjenzi wa nyumba kama baba yangu.''

SourceText: Ask: “What is she thinking of becoming one day?”
text: Muulize: "Anafikiria kuwa nani siku moja?"

SourceText: “No you can’t, that’s dangerous!” yells Phathu. “Yes she can, Phathu, as long as she loves it,” replies Teacher Langa. The class chants, “Yes she can!”
text: ''Hapana huwezi, Hiyo ni hatari!'' Patu anapiga kelele.'' Ndio anaweza, Patu, ilimradi anaipenda,'' anajibu mwalimu Langa. Darasa linaimba, ''Ndio unaweza!''!

SourceText: Ask: “How many children are in this picture? And how many of them are on the ladder? And if two climbed off, how many would there be on the ladder then?”
text: Muulize: "Ni watoto wangapi wapo kwenye picha hii? Na ni wangapi kati yao wako kwenye ngazi? Na ikiwa wawili walipanda, ni wangapi wangekuwa kwenye ngazi?"

SourceText: Sthelo says, “I want to be a nurse.”
text: Selo anasema, ''Nataka kuwa muuguzi.''

SourceText: Say: “Look, the boy is thinking of becoming a nurse when he grows up.” Ask: “Would you like to become a nurse when you grow up? Why or why not?”
text: Sema: “Tazama, kijana anafikiria kuwa muuguzi atakapokuwa mtu mzima. muulize: "Je, ungependa kuwa muuguzi utakapokuwa mtu mzima? Kwanini au kama sio, kwanini?"

SourceText: The class bursts out laughing. “What is so funny?” asks Teacher Langa. Nandi replies, “Nurses are girls.” “There are male nurses too,” says Teacher Langa. “So class, can Sthelo be a nurse? The class booms, “Yes he can!”
text: Darasa lilinaangua kicheko.'' Nini kinachekesha? anauliza mwalimu Langa. Nandi anajibu, ''Wauguzi ni wasichana,'' Kuna wauguzi wanaume pia,''anasema mwalimu Langa.'' kwahiyo darasa, Selo anaweza kuwa Muuguzi? Darasa linapiga kelele, ''!

SourceText: Ask: Why do you think other kids are laughing? Point to the child hanging on the pole and say: “How do you think he is feeling? Why do you think he is feeling that way? Do you think it is because the other children are saying he can’t be a nurse because he is a boy? Did you know that men and women can be nurses, just like men and women can be doctors?”
text: Muulize: Unafikiri kwa nini watoto wengine wanacheka? Onyesha mtoto anayening'inia kwenye mti na useme: "Unafikiri anahisije? Kwa nini unafikiri anajihisi hivyo? Unafikiri ni kwa sababu watoto wengine wanasema hawezi kuwa muuguzi kwa sababu yeye ni mvulana? Je, unajua kwamba wanaume na wanawake wanaweza kuwa wauguzi, kama vile wanaume na wanawake wanavyoweza kuwa madaktari?"

SourceText: “I want to be an artist and draw pretty pictures,’’ says Liyana.
text: ''Nataka kuwa msanii na kuchora picha nzuri,'' Liyana anasema.

SourceText: Ask: “What do you think this child wants to be when she grows up? What is she painting? How do you think she feels? Why does the woman in the picture look worried?”
text: Muulize: "Unafikiri mtoto huyu anataka kuwa nani akiwa mkubwa? Anachora nini? Unafikiri anajisikiaje? Kwa nini mwanamke aliye kwenye picha anaonekana kuwa na wasiwasi?"

SourceText: “That’s not a real job,” says Khutso and rolls his eyes. “That sounds lovely, Liyana!” replies teacher Langa. “Can Liyana be an artist?” “Yes she can!” shouts the class!
text: '' Hiyo sio kazi rahisi,''Kuso anasema na akiangaza macho.'' Hiyo ni nzuri Liyana!"" mwalimu Langa anajibu.''Je Liyana anaweza kuwa msanii?''Ndio anaweza!'' Darasa linapiga kelele!

SourceText: Describe what the children are wearing, and compare the colours and clothes with what you and your child are wearing.
text: Eleza watoto wanavaa nini, na ulinganishe rangi na nguo na mavazi ambayo wewe na mtoto wako mmevaa.

SourceText: “I want to be an alarm clock,” says Phathu.
text: ''Nataka kuwa mpiga kengele,'' Patu anasema.

SourceText: Say: “Hmmm, what does this child want to be? An alarm clock!? What do you think about that?”
text: Sema: "Hmmm, mtoto huyu anataka kuwa nani? Saa ya kengele!? Una maoni gani kuhusu hilo?"

SourceText: “Huh?” “What do you think, class?” asks Teacher Langa. The class booms, “Yes you can! Yes you can!”
text: ''Huh?'' ''Darasa, mnafikiriaje?'' mwalimu Langa anauliza. Darasa linapiga kelele, ''Ndio unaweza! Ndio unaweza!''

SourceText: Ask: “Who has short hair in this picture? Who has long hair? And your hair? Is it short or long? And my hair?”
text: Muulize: "Ni nani aliye na nywele fupi kwenye picha hii? Nani ana nywele ndefu? Na nywele zako? Je, ni fupi au ndefu? Na nywele zangu?"

SourceText: Nandi hasn’t shared what she wants to be when she grows up. What do you think she could be?
text: Nandi hajashirikisha kile anachotaka kuwa atakapokuwa mkubwa. Unafikiri anaweza kuwa nani?

SourceText: Ask: “What did you think of the story? What did you like about it? Do you know that you can be anything you want? Then say, “Yes you can!”
text: Muulize: "Unafikiria nini juu ya hadithi? Ulipenda nini juu yake? Unajua kwamba unaweza kufanya kazi yoyote unayotaka? Kisha sema, "Ndiyo unaweza!"

SourceText: Yellow Earth, Brown Earth
text: Dunia ya njano, Dunia ya kahawia (brown)

SourceText: Avi is an explorer. A cloud-watcher, a seed-sorter and a puddle-splasher. Travel to Avi’s favourite place — the Earth — in this book about noticing and recognising patterns.
text: Avi ni mpelelezi. mtazama mawingu, mpangaji wa mbegu, kinyunyizo cha majii, Safari ya kwenda sehemu anayoipenda Avi - Dunia - katika kitabu hiki inahusu kutambua na kujua mifumo.

SourceText: Avi wakes up early. It is a good day. Avi is visiting Yellow Earth today. Yellow flowers, dried-up flowers, tiny flowers. Yellow flowers—
text: Avi huamka mapema. Ni siku nzuri. Avi anatembelea dunia ya njano leo. Maua ya njano, maua ya njano yaliyokaushwa, maua madogo, maua ya njano-

SourceText: Avi makes bunches.
text: Avi hutengeneza mashada.

SourceText: Point at the picture and ask, “tell me, what do you see in this picture?”
text: Onyesha picha kwa kuilelekezea kwa kidole na uliza. “niambie, unaona nini kwenye picha hii?”

SourceText: Avi looks for the perfect stick to poke the earth with. Smooth stick bumpy stick. Smooth stick—
text: Avi hutafuta kijiti kinachofaa zaidi cha kutikisia dunia. Fimbo laini, fimbo yenye matuta, fimbo laini

SourceText: Avi keeps looking for treasures.
text: Avi anaendelea kutafuta hazina.

SourceText: Ask, “what do you think the boy is doing?
text: Muulize,"Unafikiri mvulana anafanya nini?

SourceText: Avi collects seeds. Brown seeds, black seeds, red seeds, green seeds. Brown seeds, black seeds— Yellow Earth is a happy place.
text: Avi hukusanya mbegu. Mbegu za rangi ya kahawia, mbegu nyeusi, mbegu nyekundu, mbegu za kijani, mbegu za kahawia, mbegu nyekundu - Dunia ya njano ni mahali pa furaha.

SourceText:
Say, “look, the boy collected seeds.”
Ask, “how many groups of seeds do you see? What colours are they? Which group has more seeds?
text: Sema, “Tazama, mvulana alikusanya mbegu,” Muulize, “unaona makundi mangapi ya mbegu? Ni ya rangi gani? Kundi gani lina mbegu zaidi?

SourceText: Avi is visiting Grey Earth today.
text: Avi anatembelea Dunia ya rangi ya kijivu leo.

SourceText: Big puddle, small puddle, no puddle. Big puddle, small puddle—
text: Dimbwi kubwa, dimbwi dogo, hakuna dimbwi, dimbwi kubwa, dimbwi dogo ---

SourceText: Point at the picture and say, “there is a bird flying over the grey earth.” then mimic the action of flying and ask the child to do the same.
text: Onyesha kuielekezea picha na sema, “kuna ndege anapaa kwenye dunia ya kijivu. “halafu igiza kitendo cha kupaa na mwambie mtoto afanye hivyo hivyo.

SourceText: Drip! Drop! Plish! Drip—
text: Drip,! Drop! Pish! Drip---

SourceText: Grey Earth is a wet place.
text: Dunia ya rangi ya kijivu ni mahali penye ubichi/unyevunyevu.

SourceText:
Say, "Listen! It's so wet outside! It's been raining, and I can hear the raindrops going... drip, drop, drip, drop!" (Mimic the "drip, drop" sounds. you can also tap your finger like raindrops).”
Ask, "Can you say drip, drop like this? Drip, drop!"
text:
Sema, “Sikilliza! nje kumelowa sana! Imekuwa inanyesha, na naweza kusikia matone ya mvua yanadondoka ndo, ndo, ndo, ndo!” (Igiza sauti za “ndo, ndo”. Pia unaweza kugonga kidole chako kama matone ya mvua).”
Uliza, “Unaweza kusema ndo, ndo kama hivi? Ndo! ndo!”!

SourceText: Avi is visiting Brown Earth today. CRUNCH crunch CRUNCH crunch—
text: Avi anatembelea dunia ya kahawia leo. kwachu kwachu kwachu kwachu---

SourceText: Avi stomps on the dry ground.
text: Avi hukanyaga ardhi iliyokauka.

SourceText: Say, “Look, the child is playing.” Ask, “how do you think the child feels? How do you feel when you play?
text: Sema, “ Tazama, mtoto anacheza”, Muulize , “Unafikiri mtoto anajiskiaje? Unajiskiaje unapocheza?

SourceText: Avi smiles at the bright sun. Long cloud, round cloud, thin cloud. Long cloud— Brown Earth is a joyful place.
text: Avi hutabasamu kwenye jua kali. Wingu refu, wingu la mzunguko, wingu refu--- Dunia ya rangi ya kahawia ni mahali pa furaha.

SourceText: Describe the picture by pointing at it and make a real life comparison by saying, "Look up! See the clouds? Wow! Some clouds are long like a wiggly worm, some are round like a ball, and some are super thin, like a tiny little string!
text: Elezea picha kwa kuonyesha ukiielekezea na ufananishe na maisha halisi kwa kusema, “ Tazama! Ona mawingu? Waoo! Baadhi ya mawingu ni marefu kama mnyoo, baadhi ni ya nviringo kama mpira, na baadhi ni membamba sana, kama kamba ndogo!

SourceText: Avi watches the Earth change every year. Yellow Earth, Grey Earth, Brown Earth—
text: Avi huangalia mabadiliko ya dunia kila mwaka. Dunia ya njano, dunia ya kijivu, dunia ya kahawia

SourceText:
Point at the trees in the picture and say, “"Look! Wow! The trees are so pretty and yellow!” 

Then point at the grass and say, “And look at the grass! Some of it is yellow, and some of it is brown."
text:
Onyesha miti kwa kuilekezea kwenye picha na sema, “”Tazama! Waoo! Miti ni mizuri sana na ya njano!”

Halafu onyesha kwenye nyasi na sema, “Na tazama kwenye nyasi! Baadhi yake ni njano, na baadhi yake ni kahawia.”

SourceText: Avi is looking for a stick.
text: Avi anatafuta fimbo.

SourceText: Off to Yellow Earth again!
text: Nenda tena kwa dunia ya njano!

SourceText: Ask, “what do you think the boy wants to do?”
text: Muulize,"Unafikiri mvulana anafanya nini?”

SourceText: Patterns Are All Around Us The day, the week, the month and the year — all have patterns that repeat. The seasons change every year and come back the same way. Every year, winter is followed by summer, which is followed by the monsoon. Look around you and try to spot these patterns. Go back to the beginning of the book and look for patterns you might have missed.
text: Miundo ipo imetuzunguka. Siku, wiki, mwenzi na mwaka-- vyote vina miundo inayojirudia. Ni kwasababu majira hubadilika kila mwaka na inajirudia kwa jinsi hiyo hiyo. Kila mwaka, majira ya baridi yanafuatiwa na majira ya joto, ambayo yanafuatiwa na upepo wa msimu. Angalia pande zote na jaribu kuangalia miundo hii. Nenda nyuma mwanzo wa kitabu na tafuta miundo ambayo pengine uliikosa.

SourceText: Say, “Now tell me, what do you think of this story? What did you like or not like?”
text: Muulize: Sasa niambie, ulifikiria nini kuhusu hadithi hii? Ulijifunza nini?

SourceText: Why is Nita Upside Down
text: Kwanini Nita yupo juu chini

SourceText: Nita’s hanging upside down. Can she turn the right way round?
text: Nita ananing'inia juu chini. Anaweza kuzunguka kurudi kwenye mkao wa kawaida?

SourceText: Nita’s hanging upside down, her long hair tickling at the ground. The trees, the grass, the everything is all the wrong way round.
text: Nita ananing"inia juu chini, nywele zake zinagusa ardhini. Miti, nyasi, kila kitu kimekaa kwa jinsi isiyo sahihi.

SourceText: Her feet, they poke into the sky. Little Navi’s walking by. He says ‘I’ve seen you here before. You’re upside down again! What for?’
text: Miguu yake, inapiga angani. Navi mdogo anatembea. Anasema '' Nimeshawahi kukuona hapa hapo nyuma" Upo juu chini tena! Kwaajili ya nini

SourceText: His feet swim lightly in the air. She tries to hide behind her hair. ‘It’s h-h-h-hard to t-t-talk’, she says to him. ‘I’m not the same. I don’t fit in.’
text: Miguu yake inaogelea kidogo hewani. Anajaribu kujificha nyuma ya nywele zake, 'Ni ngu-ngu-ngu-ngumu ku-ku-ku-kuongea,' anamwambia, siko sawa. sitoshei.'

SourceText: Navi takes her by the hand. He wants to help her understand. They climb to Navi’s look-out spot. From up here they can see a lot. They perch and have a quiet stare at children playing here and there.
text: Navi anamshika mkono. Anataka kumsaidia aelewe. Wanapanda hadi eneo kutokea Navi anapotazama. Kutokea pale juu wanaweza kuona vingi. Wanakaa na kuwatazama kwa utulivu watoto wanaocheza hapa na pale.

SourceText: Those kids are not tthe same at all. Abe’s round.
text: Wale watoto hawafanani /sio wale wale kabisa. Zamu ya Abe.

SourceText: Chi’s freckled,
text: Madoa ya Chi,

SourceText: Lala’s extra tall.
text: Lala ni mrefu zaidi.

SourceText: Bambam’s wild and must be free,
text: Mwitu ya Bambam ni lazima iwe huru

SourceText: while Lulu’s reading quietly.
text: huku Lili akisoma kimya kimya.

SourceText: Look at Freya's crazy hair.
text: Angalia nywele za Freya zinachekesha.

SourceText: And Sid wears glasses everywhere.
text: Na Sid huvaa miwani kila mahali.

SourceText: And me, I am just skin and bone. And you are you. You’re not alone. Each human’s sort of strange, you see. That makes you just the same, like me. This world is really one big game. To play, we can’t all be the same.
text: Mimi ni ngozi tu na mifupa. Na wewe ni wewe. Hauko peke yako. Kila aina ya binadamu ni ya ajabu, unaona. Hii inawafanya mfanane, kama mimi. Kweli dunia hii ni mchezo mmoja mkubwa. Katika kucheza hatuwezi kufanana wote.

SourceText: Nita feels the right way round, thanks to the new friend she’s found. Upside down was never fun. Now she plays with everyone.
text: Nita anaona njia sahihi, shukrani kwa fafiki mpya, amepatikana. Juu chini haikuwa furaha kamwe. Sasa hucheza na kila mmoja.

SourceText: Discuss the book’s cover. Ask: What do you see? What do you think this story is about?
text: Jadili ganda la kitabu. Uliza: Unaona nini? Unafikiri hadithi hii inahusu nini?

SourceText: When I grow up
text: Nitakapo kuwa mkubwa

SourceText: I don’t know what I want to be when I grow up. Can you help me choose?
text: Sijui nataka kuwa nani nitakapo kuwa mkubwa. Unaweza kunisaidia kuchagua?

SourceText: You can say: Look, the girl is holding a big sunflower. What colour is the flower’s petals? And what colour is the stem? Have you ever seen such a big flower in real life?”
text: Unaweza kusema: Tazama, msichana ameshikilia ua kubwa  la alizeti. Ua lina rangi gani?  Na shina lina rangi gani? Umewahi kuona ua kubwa namna hii katika maisha yako?”

SourceText: What do I want to be when I grow up?
text: Ninataka kuwa nani nitakapokuwa mkubwa?

SourceText: Ask: “What is that? (mimic barking sounds). Ask your child to think about dogs they know: where have they seen them? What are they like?
text: Muulize: “ Hicho ni nini? (igiza sauti ya kubweka). Mwambie mtoto wako afikirie kuhusu mbwa anayewajua: Aliwaona wapi? wanafanana na nini? ?

SourceText: Say: “Wow, the girl is dancing.” Ask: How do you think the girl feels? Do you love to dance? How do you feel when you dance?”
text:
Sema: Waoo, msichana anacheza.”
Muulize: Unafikiri msichana anajiskiaje? Unapenda kucheza? Unajiskiaje wakati unapocheza??

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a dancer and dance on a stage.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. Nataka kuwa msanii wa kucheza na nicheze kwenye jukwaa.

SourceText: Ask: “How many ballet shoes can you see? What colors are they?”
text: Muulize:” Unaviona viatu vingapi vya kamba? Ni vya rangi gani?”

SourceText: Describe the picture and say: “Look, there is a puppy with a Firefighter. The firefighter is holding a fire hose. He uses it to put out big fires.”
text: Elezea picha na useme: “Tazama, kuna mbwa mdogo na mzimamoto. Mzima moto anashikilia bomba la kuzimia moto. analitumia kuzima moto mkubwa”

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a firefighter and put out big fires.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. Nataka kufanya kazi katika jeshi la Ukoaji kitengo cha zimamoto na kuzima moto mkubwa.

SourceText: Ask: “Would you like to be a firefighter? Why or Why not?”
text: Muulize: “ Unapenda kuwa mzimamoto?  kama unapenda ni kwanini na kama haupendi ni kwanini?”

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a nurse and make sick people better.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. Nataka kuwa muuguzi na kuwafanya wagonjwa wajiskie nafuu.

SourceText: Say: “Look now she is a nurse”. Ask: Have you seen a nurse before? Where did you see a nurse? Would you like to be a nurse or a doctor? Why or why not?”
text:
Sema: “Tazama yeye ni muuguzi sasa”. 
Muulize:  Umewahi kumuona muuguzi kabla? Ulimuona wapi Muuguzi? Je unapenda kuwa muuguzi au daktari? kama unapenda ni kwanini na kama haupendi ni kwanini?”

SourceText: Say: “Wow, there is a teddy with a nurse. I wonder how he is feeling.” Ask: “How do you think a teddy is feeling? Why do you think he is feeling that way?”
text:
Sema: “Waoo, Mdoli yuko na muuguzi. Nashangaa anajiskiaje?
Muulize:” unafikiri mdoli anajiskiaje? unafikiri kwa nini anajiskia hivyo?”?

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a musician and play in a band.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. nataka kuwa mwanamuziki na kucheza kwenye bendi.

SourceText: Say: “Ohhh, the girl is holding a guitar. I think she is a musician.” Ask: “Do you love music? What songs do you like?”
text: Sema: “Ohhh, Msichana ameshikilia gitaa. Nafikiri yeye ni mwanamuziki.” Muulize: Je unapenda muziki? unapenda nyimbo gani?’’?
