SourceText: Describe and explain what you see in the picture. Point to the spanner and say: “this is a spanner. A spanner is used to grip, tighten or loosen screws and nails.” (mimic the action of using a spanner). This will help a child to learn new words “grip”, “tighten” and “loosen”.
text: Elezea na dadavua unachokiona kwenye picha. Elekezea kwenye spana na useme: “hii ni spana. Hii ni spana inatumika kushika, kukaza, au kulegeza skrubu na misumali.” (Igiza kitendo kwa kutumia spana). Hii itamfanya mtoto ajifunze maneno mapya “Kushika”, “kukaza” na “kulegeza”.

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a mechanic and fix cars and tractors.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. nataka kuwa fundi magari na kurekebisha magari na matrekta.

SourceText: Say: “Spanners are used by mechanics to fix cars and other vehicles.” Ask: “Where on this car do you think we can use a spanner?”
text:
Sema: “Spana hutumiwa na mafundi kutengeneza magari na vyombo vingine vya usafiri”, 
Muulize: “ Unafikiri kwenye gari hii ni sehemu gani tunaweza kutumia spana?"

SourceText:
Say: “Look, she is writing down letters from the alphabet on the board”. Ask: Can you recognise any of these letters? Say: “Let’s sing the alphabet song together - A, B, C, D, E, F, G….”  

You can also point to the different letters and name different words that start with that letter.
text:
Sema: “Tazama, anaandika herufi kutoka kwenye alfabeti za kwenye ubao”. Muulize: Unaweza kuzitambua herufi hizi? Sema: “Ngoja tuimbe wimbo wa Alfabeti pamoja- A,B,C,D,E,F,G…..”

Unaweza pia kuonyesha herufi tofauti na kutaja maneno tofauti yanayoanza na herufi hizo.

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a teacher and teach children to read and write.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. Nataka kuwa mwalimu na kufundisha watoto kusoma na kuandika.

SourceText: Ask: “Does your teacher also write on the board at school? What do you like most about school? And what don’t you like?”
text: Muulize: “Je mwalimu wako pia huwa anaandika kwenye ubao shuleni? Unapenda nini zaidi kuhusu shule? Na nini hupendi?

SourceText: Say: “Look - now she is wearing a soccer outfit.” Ask: “What colour are her pants? What colours are her socks? And What colours are her shoes?”
text: Sema:  “Tazama-sasa amevaa nguo za kuchezea mpira wa miguu”,  “Kaptura ina rangi gani? soksi zake zina rangi gani? Na viatu vyake vina rangi gani?

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a soccer player and score the winning goal.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. Nataka kuwa mchezaji wa mpira na kufunga goli la ushindi.

SourceText: Say: “Here is a soccer ball.” Ask: “What colours are the ball? What shape is the ball? What can you see here at home that is the same shape?”
text: Sema: “Huu ni mpira wa miguu”, Muulize: “Mpira una rangi gani? Mpira una umbo gani? Unaona kitu gani hapa nyumbani chenye umbo sawa na mpira?”

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be an astronaut and fly to the moon.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa, Nataka kuwa mwana anga na kuruka hadi mwezini.

SourceText: Say: “Look, there is the moon, and here are more planets! Do you know how to get to the moon? You have to be an astronaut.”
text: Sema: “Tazama, kuna mwezi, na hapa ni nyota nyingi!  Je unajua jinsi ya kufika mwezini? Lazima uwe mwana anga.”

SourceText:
Say: “What is an astronaut? An astronaut is a person who is trained to travel to space. They travel to space in a spacecraft. A spacecraft is a vehicle that is designed to fly and operate in outer space. How cool is that?”

Ask: “Would you like to go to space? Why or why not?”
text:
Sema: “Mwana anga ni nini?’ Mwana anga ni mtu ambaye amefundishwa kusafiri angani. Anasafiri na chombo cha angani. Chombo cha angani ni chombo cha usafiri kilichobuniwa kupaa na kufanya kazi katika eneo la anga. Ni nzuri kwa namna gani?” 

Muulize: “Ungependa kwenda angani?
Kwanini ungependa na kwa nini usingependa?”?

SourceText:
Say: “Now she is a chef. She cooks delicious food for everyone.”

Make links between the pictures and your child’s world. Ask: “Who cooks for you at home? Do you like making food, or helping to prepare our meals?”
text:
Sema: “Sasa binti ni mpishi. Hupika chakula kitamu kwa kila mmoja.”

Unganisha kati ya picha na dunia ya mtoto wako. Muulize: Nani huwa anakupikia nyumbani? Unapenda kutengeneza chakula, au kusaidia kuandaa vyakula vyetu?”

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a chef and make food for my family and friends.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa, Nataka kuwa mpishi na kuandaa chakula cha familia yangu na marafiki.

SourceText: Say: “Hmmmm. Those biscuits look delicious” (and mimic smelling the biscuits or making eating sounds). Ask: “Do you love biscuits? Can you count the number of biscuits in the picture? What colors and shapes are these biscuits?”
text:
Sema: “Hmmmm. Hizo biskuti zinaonekana ni tamu” ( na igiza kunusa harufu ya biskuti au tengeneza sauti za kula).
Muulize: “ Unapenda biskuti? Unaweza kuhesabu idadi ya biskuti za kwenye picha? Biskuti hizi zina rangi na maumbo gani?

SourceText:
Ask or say: “What is the girl thinking about? Perhaps she is thinking about what she wants to be when she grows up.”

Say (while pointing to each thought): “perhaps she is deciding whether she wants to be a dancer…or an astronaut…., or a teacher one day?”
text:
Muulize: “ Msichana anawaza kuhusu nini? Labda anawaza kuhusu anataka kuwa nani atakapokuwa mkubwa.”

Sema: ( huku ukielekezea kidole kwa kila wazo)”labda anaamua ikiwa anataka kuwa mchezaji  au mwana anga… au  Mwalimu siku moja?”

SourceText: When I grow up, I can choose whatever I want to be!
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa, Naweza kuchagua niwe nani!

SourceText: What do you want to be when you grow up?
text: Unataka kuwa nani utakapokuwa mkubwa?

SourceText: Ask: “What would you want to be when you grow up? Why?”
text: Muulize: "Ungependa kuwa nani ukiwa mtu mzima? Kwa nini?"

SourceText: Ask: Which of these items have you seen at home, outside, or in our community? Which one is your favourite and why?”
text: Muulize: Ni kipi kati ya hivi vitu umeviona nyumbani, nje, au katika jamii zetu? Ni kipi umekipenda zaidi na kwanini?"

SourceText:
Ask: “What do you think about this story?”

Then say: “Do you know that there are many different things that you can be when you grow up? How exciting!”
text:
Muulize: "Una maoni gani kuhusu hadithi hii?"

Kisha sema: “Je, unajua kwamba kuna mambo mengi tofauti-tofauti ambayo unaweza kuwa nayo unapokuwa mtu mzima?

SourceText: What's In The Pot?
text: Kuna nini kwenye Chungu?

SourceText: Sam can’t wait for supper. What’s in the pot? Wait and see.
text: Sam hawezi kusubiri chakula cha usiku. Kuna nini kwenye Chungu? subiri uone.

SourceText: “What’s for supper?” asked Sam. “It’s a surprise”, said Mama, putting a big pot on the stove.
text: ''Tunakula chakula gani usiku?'' anauliza Sam. '' Ni cha kufurahisha na kushangaza','' alisema Mama. Anatenga sufuria kubwa jikoni.

SourceText: She added a jug of water. Sam was worried. “Are we having water for supper?” he wailed. “It’s a surprise. Wait and see.” replied Mama.
text: Aliongeza jagi la maji. Sam alikuwa na wasiwasi. ''Chakula cha usiku?''alihuzunika. Ni mshangao. Subiri uone. alijibu Mama.

SourceText: “Can I help?” asked Sam. “I could stir.”
text: ''Naweza kusaidia?'' aliuliza Sam. ''Ningeweza kuchochea.''

SourceText: “You are still a bit short,” said Mama. “The pot might fall over. But you can help me by fetching things.”
text: ''Bado ni mfupi,'' Mama anasema ''Chungu kinaweza kudondoka. ila unaweza kunisaidia kwa kubea vitu','

SourceText: "Can you bring me an onoin, please." "This doesn't smell very nice."
text: '' Tafadhali unaweza kuniletea kitunguu, Hii haina harufu nzuri sana.''

SourceText: "They will taste nice once they are cooked."
text: ''Zitakuwa na ladha nzuri zikiwa zimepikwa,''

SourceText: “Now I need some tomatoes. No, that is an apple. The tomatoes are also round and red, but you will find them in the fridge.”
text: ''Sasa nahitaji nyanya. Hapana, hiyo ni apple/tufaa. Nyanya pia ni za mduara na nyekundu. lakini utazikuta kwenye friji.''

SourceText: “Can you bring me potatoes. They are round and brown.”
text: ''Unaweza kuniletea viazi. Ni vya mviringo na vina rangi ya kahawia.''.

SourceText: “Is supper ready yet?”
text: ''Je chakula cha usiku kiko tayari?''

SourceText: “If you are hungry you can eat the apple while you wait.” “What about these?” “No, we won’t need biscuits. We can save those for after supper.”
text: "Kama una njaa unaweza kula epo/tofaa wakati ukisubiri." " Vipi kuhusu hizi?" " Hapana, hatuhitaji biskuti. Tunaweza kutunza hizo kwaajili ya chakula cha jioni."

SourceText: “What’s in the pot?”
text: ''Kuna nini kwenye sufuria?''

SourceText: “It’s a surprise. Wait and see.”
text: ''Cha kufurahisha na kushangaza. Subiri uone.''

SourceText: “What about this?” “That is a watermelon. It will be too big for the pot.” “See if you can find some spinach. It is also green.”
text: ''Vipi kuhusu hili?'' ''Hilo ni tikiti maji. litakuwa kubwa sana kwenye sufuria,''Angalia kama unaweza kupata mchicha. Pia ni wa kijani.''

SourceText: “Please get some bread. No, it won’t go into the pot but on the table.”
text: ''Tafadhari chukua mkate. Hapana hauwezi kuingia kwenye sufuria labda juu ya meza,''

SourceText: Mama carried the pot to the table and started to dish up. “What’s in the pot?” asked Sam.
text: Mama alibeba sufuria juu ya meza na akaanza kuonja. Kuna nini kwenye sufuria? aliuliza Sam.

SourceText: “Soup!” My favourite!
text: ''Supu'' Ndio nachokipenda zaidi!

SourceText: Tlotlego's Tea Party
text: Tafrija ya chai ya Tito

SourceText: Tlotlego is hosting a tea party! But something strange keeps happening while he is setting the table.
text: Tito anaandaa tafrija ya chai! Lakini kuna jambo la ajabu linatokea mara kwa mara wakati akiwa anaendelea kuandaa meza.

SourceText: Tlotlego is hosting a tea party for the WHOLE family. “How many people are coming for tea, Koko?” “You, me, Mama, and Papa. And your little sister, Tshiamo.”
text: Tito anaandaa tafrija ya chai kwaajili ya familia nzima. " Ni watu wangapi wanakuja kwaajili ya chai, Bibi?" "Wewe, mimi, Mama, na Baba na dada yako mdogo Shani"

SourceText: Tlotlego counts the teacups as he takes them from the kitchen. “One, two, three, four, and one for Koko!”
text: Tito anahesabu vikombe vya chai kadili anavyovichukua kutoka jikoni. "Moja, mbili, tatu na moja kwaajili ya Bibi"

SourceText: Tlotlego goes to the stoep and places the teacups down on the table. “One, two, three, four, and ... ?” “I only see four cups,” says Koko, “but we are five people.” “When I was in the kitchen before, there were five cups!” Tlotlego exclaims.
text: Tito anaenda barazani na anaweka vikombe chini mezani. "Moja, mbili tatu, nne na ...?" " Naona vikombe vinne tu." anasema Bibi, " lakini tupo watu watano." " Nilipokuwa jikoni kabla, vilikuwa vitano!" Tito anashangaa.

SourceText: Tlotlego counts the pretty little plates as he takes them from the cupboard. “One, two, three, four, and five! There’s a plate for each of us.”
text: Tito anahesabu sahani nzuri ndogondogo kadili anavyozichukua toka kabatini, "Moja, mbili, tatu, nne na tano! Sahani zipo za kila mmoja wetu."

SourceText: Tlotlego goes to the stoep and places the plates next to the teacups.“One, two, three, four, and ... ?” “I only see four plates,” says Koko, “but we are five people.”
text: Tito anaenda kwenye eneo aliloandaa na anaweka sahani karibu na vikombe vya chai. " Moja, mbili, tatu, nne na ...?" " Naona sahani nne tu," Bibi anasema, "lakini tuko watu watano."

SourceText: Tlotlego counts the biscuits as he takes them from the jar. “One, two, three, four, and five!”
text: Tito anahesabu biskuti kadili anavyozitoa kutoka kwenye mtungi. "Moja, mbili, tatu, nne na tano!"

SourceText: Tlotlego goes to the stoep and places the biscuits on the plates.
text: Tito anaenda kwenye sehemu ya mwinuko katika mazingira ya nyumbani kwao na anaweka biskuti kwenye sahani.

SourceText: “One, two, three, four, and ... ?” “I only see four biscuits,” says Koko, “but we are five people.”
text: "Moja, mbili, tatu, nne, na ...?" " Naona biskuti nne tu," anasema Bibi, "lakini tupo watu watano."

SourceText: Tlotlego is very confused. He knows he has been counting correctly. Before he had five biscuits, and now there are only four. HOW did the biscuits become less?
text: Tito amechanganyikiwa sana. Anajua alihesabu kwa usahihi. Kabla alikuwa na biskuti tano, na sasa kuna nne tu. Biskuti zimekuwaje pungufu?

SourceText: Tlotlego counts the sugar cubes as he takes them from the jar. “One, two, three, four, and five!”
text: Tito anahesabu pakiti za sukari kadili anavyozichukua kutoka kwenye mtungi. "Moja, mbili, tatu, nne, na tano!"

SourceText: Tlotlego goes to the stoep and places the sugar cubes on the table. This time, he is sure he hears a giggle. “One, two, three, four, and ... ?” “Five!” shouts a voice from under the table.
text: Tito anaenda kwenye sehemu ya mwinuko katika mazingira ya nyumbani kwao na anaweka pakiti za sukari mezani. Safari hii, ana hakika amesikia kicheko. " Moja, mbili, tatu, nne, na ...??" "Tano!: sauti ya juu ilitokea chini ya meza.

SourceText: Tlotlego bends down to look under the table. To his shock, he sees a complete tea set laid out under the table! There are the missing teacup, plate, biscuit, and sugar cube. FIVE!
text: Tito anainama chini kuangalia chini ya meza. kwa mshtuko, anaona seti ya chai iliyokamilika imewekwa chini ya meza! Hizo ni vikombe, sahani, biskuti na sukari zilizokuwa zimekosekana. TANO!

SourceText: When Mama and Papa come home from work, they all have tea on the stoep. One, two, three of them having tea at the table, and two of them having tea below!
text: Baba na mama watakapokuja nyumbani kutoka kazini, wote watapata chai kwenye sehemu ya mwinuko kwenye mazingira ya pale nyumbani kwao. Mmoja, wawili, watatu wao kupata chai mezani, na wawili wao kupata chai chini!

SourceText: The one on the middle
text: Yule aliye katikati

SourceText: Khanyiswa is not the first born. She’s not the last born. She’s the one in the MIDDLE!
text: Khanyiswa sio mtoto wa kwanza. Yeye sio mtoto wa mwisho. Yeye ni wa katikati!

SourceText: I am the middle one. Not the first born. Not the last born. The one in the middle!
text: Mimi ni wa katikati. Sio mtoto wa kwanza. Sio mtoto wa mwisho. Ni yule wa katikati!

SourceText: The one in the middle can be easy to forget.
text: Yule wa katikati ni rahisi kusahau.

SourceText: And easy to leave out.
text: Na rahisi kutoka.

SourceText: But that’s okay because I am also the one with IDEAS!
text: Lakini hiyo ni sawa kwasababu mimi pia nina mawazo!

SourceText: Look what I can make from just this cardboard box! A BEAUTIFUL house... with real doors and windows.
text: Angalia ninachoweza kutengeneza kutoka kwenye hili boksi! Nyumba nzuri... yenye milango na madirisha ya uhakika.

SourceText: My house has an extra special bed, and a MAGIC SLIDE.
text: Nyumba yangu ina kitanda cha ziada na bembea ya maajabu.

SourceText: Some days my house is also a shop.
text: Kuna wakati nyumba yangu pia inakuwa duka.

SourceText: And on other days it’s a VERY FANTASTIC show.
text: Na kwa siku zingine inakuwa onyesho zuri la kushangaza.

SourceText: Sometimes my house is just for me!
text: Wakati mwingine nyumba yangu ni kwa ajili yangu!

SourceText: And that’s the best place for me.
text: Na hapo ndipo mahali pazuri zaidi kwangu.

SourceText: And sometimes it’s a house for three! I am the middle one. Not the first born. Not the last born. The one in the middle!
text: Na wakati mwingine ni nyumba yetu watatu! Mimi ni wa katikati. Siyo mtoto wa kwanza. Siyo mtoto wa mwisho. Ni yule wa katikati!

SourceText: The best thing ever
text: Jambo bora ambalo halikuwahi kutokea

SourceText: Muzi loves to build with his toys. But when he leaves them behind to travel to uGogo’s house, he discovers something very special about the world. And he learns something new about himself.
text: Muzi anapenda kujenga na midoli yake. Lakini anawaacha ili kusafiri kwenda nyumbani kwa bibi yake, anagundua kitu cha pekee sana kuhusu Dunia na anajifunza kitu kipya kuhusu yeye mwenyewe.

SourceText: Muzi loves to build things. He dreams of building the best thing ever.
text: Muzi anapenda kujenga vitu. Ana ndoto ya kujenga kitu ambacho hakijawahi kutokea.

SourceText: Once he built a shelter for his toys. But it wasn’t the best thing ever.
text: Aliwahi kujenga makazi ya midoli yake. Lakini hayakuwa bora kuliko.

SourceText: Yesterday he built a bridge for his animals. It was a good thing. But not the best...
text: Jana alijenga daraja kwaajili ya wanyama wake. Ilikuwa kitu kizuri. Lakini si bora...

SourceText: Today Muzi is going to visit uGogo. He is sad. Without his toys, how can he build the best thing ever?
text: Leo Muzi anaenda kumtembelea bibi. Ana huzuni. Bila hii midoli, anawezaje kujenga kitu bora kuliko"?

SourceText: At the bus stop, Muzi is amazed. He sees red things and blue things. Small things and big things. New things and old things.
text: Kwenye kituo cha basi. Muzi anashangaa. Anaona vitu vyekundu na vitu vya bluu. Vitu vidogo na vitu vikubwa. Vitu vipya na vitu vya zamani.

SourceText: Muzi has a new idea for building the best thing ever.
text: Muzi ana wazo jipya la kujenga kitu ambacho hakijawahi kutokea.

SourceText: On the road to uGogo’s, Muzi finds many things. Long things and short things. Round things and square things.
text: Njiani kuelekea kwa Bibi, Muzi alipata vitu vingi. Vitu virefu na vitu vifupi. Vitu vya mviringo na vitu vilivyokuwa katika umbo la pembe nne.

SourceText: By the riverside, Muzi finds more things. Soft things and pointy things. Green things and brown things.
text: Pembeni ya mto, Muzi alipata vitu zaidi. Vitu vya kawaida na vitu vya maana. Vitu vya kijani na vitu vya kahawia.

SourceText: Look, Muzi! We are here.
text: Angalia, Muzi! Tupo hapa.

SourceText: While uGogo bakes for the hungry travellers... Muzi builds.
text: Wakati Bibi huoka kwaajili ya wasafiri wenye njaa... Muzi hujenga.

SourceText: Gogo, Gogo! says Muzi. The world is full of toys. Look what I can build.
text: Bibi, Bibi! anasema Muzi. Dunia imejaa midoli. Tazama naweza kujenga nini.

SourceText: Oh, Muzi, laughs Gogo. A new house for me. This is the best thing ever!
text: Oh, Muzi, anamcheka bibi. Nyumba mpya kwaajili yangu. Hili ni jambo bora haijawahi tokea!

SourceText: Teju's Shadow
text: Kivuli cha Teju

SourceText: Teju is worried. Something keeps following him! What could it be?
text: Teju ana wasiwasi. Kitu flani kinaendelea kumfuatilia! Kinaweza kuwa nini?

SourceText: © Book Dash, 2019. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © Book Dash, 2002. Haki zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: “What’s that?”
text: "Ni nini hicho?"

SourceText: Teju hides. “It won’t find me here!”
text: Teju anajificha. "Hakitanipata hapa!"

SourceText: He runs. “Why are you following me?”
text: Anakimbia. "Kwanini unanifuata?"

SourceText: Leave me ALONE!
text: Niache!

SourceText: Go away. Go away.GO AWAY! “Teju! What are you doing?” “It won’t go away!” “Your shadow?”
text:
Nenda huko. Nenda huko. NENDA HUKO! "Teju! unafanya nini?" 
 "Hakiwezi kuondoka!" "Kivuli chako?"

SourceText: “It follows me everywhere! It’s like a super secret spy!”
text: "Kinanifuata kila sehemu! Ni kama jasusi wa siri sana!"

SourceText: “Well, there’s one way to make a shadow disappear...”
text: "Vizuri, kuna njia moja kufanya kivuli kiondoke..."

SourceText: MAMA!
text: MAMA!

SourceText: Later that night in Teju’s bedroom, the light goes off...  ...and then on. And off... ...and on. Teju can’t sleep.
text: Baadae usiku ule chumbani kwa Teju, Taa ilizimika... ...na ikawaka tena. Na ikazima... ...na ikawaka. Teju anashindwa kulala.

SourceText: <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>
text: <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>

SourceText: “What’s wrong Teju?” “It only goes away in the dark, but I’m scared of the dark!” Mum gives Teju a big hug. “Do you want to see something amazing?”
text: "Nini shida Teju?" "Kinaondoka kwenye giza tu, lakini naogopa giza!" Mama anamkumbatia Teju. "Unataka kuona kitu kizuri cha kushangaza?"

SourceText: OOOHHHH! AAAAHH!
text: OOOHHHH! AAAAHH!

SourceText: Mum and Teju make shadow puppets until he falls asleep.
text: Mama na Teju wanatengeneza vimdoli vya kivuli hadi analala.

SourceText: “Cool!” After school, Teju waits for Mum. “I’m bored.” Teju stands up, he jumps, he dances.His shadow does the same.
text: "Safi!" Baada ya shule, Teju anamsubiri Mama. " Nimechoka/sijisikii vizuri." Teju anasimama, anarukaruka, anacheza. Kivuli chake kinafanya hivyohivyo.

SourceText: When he goes to bed that night, Teju leaves his night Light on. “Goodnight Shadow!”
text: Alipoenda kulala usiku ule, Teju aliacha taa inawaka. " Usiku mwema kivuli!"

SourceText: Paint Dat, Plant Day
text: Kupaka rangi ya Dat, siku ya kupanda

SourceText: Avi enjoys plant day, music day and paint day, and being busy throughout the week. Join in as Avi potters about the house, in this book about noticing and recognising patterns.
text: Avi aliifurahia siku ya kupanda, siku ya muziki na siku ya kupaka rangi, na kuwa na mambo mengi ya kufanya wiki nzima. Ungana nao kadili ambavyo Avi anafinyanga nyumba, katika kitabu hiki kinachohusu kutambua na kujua miundo.

SourceText: Avi stretches and jumps out of bed. Today is Plant Day.
text: Avi anajinyoosha na kuruka nje ya kitanda. Leo ni siku ya kupanda.

SourceText: Mama takes out the seeds. Avi places them carefully in the pots. Small pot, tall pot, square pot. Small pot— Avi waters the plants.
text: Mama anatoa mbegu nje. Avi anaziweka kwenye vyungu kwa uangalifu. Chungu kidogo, chungu kirefu, chungu cha pembe nne. Chungu kidogo -- Avi anamwagilia mimea.

SourceText: Avi washes the brushes. Papa mixes the paints. Today is Paint Day. Swish, dip, squash, swirl. Swish, dip— Avi loves mixing the colours.
text: Avi huosha brashi, Baba huchanganya rangi. Leo ni siku ya kupaka rangi. Swish, chovya, boga, zungusha, swish, chovya-- Avi anapenda kuchanganya rangi.

SourceText: Today is Fixing Day. Mama and Avi tighten the screws on the table. Tighten, thamp! Tighten, thamp! Avi checks to see if the table is still wobbly.
text: Leo ni siku ya marekebisho. Mama na Avi wanakaza skrubu kwenye meza. Kaza, thamp! kaza, thamp! Avi anakagua kuona kama meza bado inatikisika.

SourceText: Today is Cleaning Day. Avi helps Mama and Papa dust everything. Dhup, wipe, cough, clean. Dhup, wipe— ACHOO!
text: Leo ni siku ya kufanya usafi. Avi humsaidia Mama na Baba kufuta vumbi vitu vyote. Dhup, futa, kukohoa, safisha, Dhup, futa--- ACHOO!

SourceText: Today is Sheet Day. Avi is changing the sheets on the beds. Pull, tuck, pull, tuck, pat-pat. Pull, tuck—
text: Leo ni siku ya shuka. Avi anabadilisha mashuka kitandani. Vuta, piga, vuta, piga, vuta, funga--

SourceText: Avi lines up all the cushions and pillows on the floor. Cushion, cushion, pillow, bolster. Cushion, cushion— JUMP!
text: Avi anapanga foronya zote na mito sakafuni. Foronya, Foronya, foronya, mito, kuimarisha, foronya, foronya--- RUKA!

SourceText: Music Day is Avi’s favourite. No one stops the loud sounds! Dham-dhoom- japh, dham- dhoom- japh. Avi hits the drums again. Dham—
text: Siku ya muziki ni siku pendwa ya Avi. Hakuna anayezima sauti kubwa! Dham,-dhoom-japh, dham,-dhoom-japh

SourceText: It is Bird Day. Avi watches the birds with Mama and Papa. Brown bird, slow-walker, long legs. Brown bird—
text: Ni siku ya ndege. Avi anawatazama ndege na Mama na Baba. Ndege wa kahawia, mtembea polepole, miguu mirefu, ndege wa kahawia

SourceText: Avi yawns. He is tired but excited about waking up in the morning. Tomorrow is Plant Day again!
text: Avi anapiga mwayo. Amechoka lakini amefurahia kuhusu kutembea asubuhi. Kesho ni siku ya kupanda tena!

SourceText: Patterns Are All Around Us. The days, the weeks, the months, and the years always follow a pattern. Look at the days in your week. Is any day kept for a special activity? Make a calendar for yourself and fill it with the patterns you see.
text: Miunganiko iko kila mahali imetuzunguka. Siku, Wiki, Miezi, na Miaka daima hufuata muunganiko. Angalia Siku katia wiki yako. Je, kuna siku yoyote kwaajili ya shughuli maalum? Tengeneza kalenda yako mwenyewe na ijaze miunganiko unayoona.

SourceText: My little garden
text: Bustani yangu ndogo

SourceText: A little boy and his dad find a plot full of litter. Can they turn it into something wonderful?
text: Kijana mdogo na baba yake waliona shamba lililojaa takataka. Je wanaweza kuligeuza kuwa kitu kizuri?

SourceText: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).
text: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

SourceText: Mama, What's For Lunch
text: Mama. Tunakula chakula gani mchana

SourceText: Join Thabo and his sister Tumi for magical lunches with Mama!
text: Ungana na John na dada yake Tumi kwenye chakula cha maajabu cha mchana na Mama!

SourceText: “Hurry,Thabo. Mama is making lunch,” calls Tumi.
text: ''Harakisha.John, Mama anapika chakula cha mchana,'' anaita Tumi.

SourceText: Ask your child to describe the picture: “What is the girl doing? What else is happening?”
text: Mwambie mtoto wako aielezee picha: “Msichana anafanya nini”? Nini kingine kinatokea?

SourceText: “Where are you going, Thabo?”
text: ''Unaenda wapi John?''

SourceText: Ask your child: “What do you think the boy is doing? Why do you think the boy is doing that?”
text: Muulize mtoto wako: “Unafikiri mvulana anafanya nini? Unafikiri kwanini mvulana anafanya vile?

SourceText: His friends don’t understand why he chooses lunch over their game, but Thabo has a secret. Mama’s lunches are special.
text: Rafiki zake hawaelewi kwa nini anachagua chakula dhidi ya mchezo wao. Lakini John ana siri. Chakula cha mama cha mchana ni maalumu.

SourceText: Point to the boy and ask: “How do you think the boy is feeling? What do you think he is going to do next? Can you also describe the feelings of the other children, how do you think they feel?”
text: Muonyeshe kwa kumuelekezea kidole mvulana na umuulize: “Unafikiri mvulana anajiskiaje? Unafikiri atafanya nini baadae? Unaweza pia kuelezea hisia za watoto wengine, Unafikiri wanajiskiaje?”

SourceText: On Monday, Mama shapes their food like little bugs that wriggle and crawl, making Tumi shriek in fright. “EEEE!” But they are yummy fruit and vegetables, and not very scary at all.
text: Siku ya Jumatatu, Mama hutengeneza chakula chenye maumbo ya wadudu wadogo wanaotambaa na hivyo kumfanya Tumi alie kwa hofu.''EEE!'' lakini ni matunda matamu na mboga, na sio za kutisha hata kidogo.

SourceText: Point to different images and ask your child to name them. You can ask: “How did they make those shapes out of the food? What foods are red? And what food is green?”
text: Onyesha picha tofauti kwa kidole na mwambie mtoto wako azipe majina. Unaweza kumuuliza: “Walitengenezaje hayo maumbo kutoka kwenye chakula? Vyakula gani ni vya rangi nyekundu? Na chakula gani ni cha rangi ya kijani?

SourceText: On Tuesday, she makes a lion that roars so loudly the house shakes. “ROAR!” ut it’s just delicious pasta and cheese.
text: Siku ya Jumanne, anatengeneza Simba anayeunguruma kwa sauti kubwa na kutikisa nyumba,'' Mngurumo mkubwa wa Simba!,'' kumbe ni Tambi tamu zenye jibini.

SourceText:
Use descriptive words and explanations to talk about pictures. This helps your child learn new words. “Look, they have created a roaring lion out of the pasta and cheese.”

Then mimic the sound of the roaring lion.
text:
Tumia maneno na maelezo yanayodadavua na kuzungumzia kuhusu picha. Hii husaidia mtoto wako kujifunza maneno mapya. “Tazama, wametengeneza simba ananguruma kutokana na tambi na jibini.”

Halafu igiza sauti ya simba ananguruma.

SourceText: On Wednesday, Mama creates a chicken that wakes up the whole street. “CLUCK CLUCK PAKAA!” But it’s just a plate of juicy fruit.
text: Siku ya Jumatano, mama anatengeneza kuku ambaye anawaamsha wote mtaani.“KOKORIKOOOOOOO!” Lakini ni sahani tu ya matunda ya juisi.

SourceText:
Point to the image and ask your child what the picture looks like. You can ask: “What animal did they make? (mimic the sound of a chicken). What did they use for the chicken’s tail? And what did they use for its beak?” 

You can ask: Have you seen chickens in our area?
text:
Onyeshea picha na muulize mtoto wako picha inafanana na nini. Unaweza kuuliza: “Walitengeneza mnyama gani? (Igiza sauti ya kuku). Walitumia nini kutengeneza mkia wa kuku? Na walitumia nini kutengeneza mdomo?”

Unaweza kumuuliza: Umeona kuku katika eneo letu?

SourceText: On Thursday, she builds a noisy truck. Thabo and Tumi cover their ears. “VROOOM!” But it’s a sweet strawberry jam sandwich.
text: Siku ya alhamisi, alitengeneza lori lenye kelele. John na Tumi waliziba masikio yao. ^VRUUUUM!^ Lakini ni mkate mtamu wa jamu ya stroberi.

SourceText: Ask: What did they make here? What did they use to make it? Then say, “oh no! that’s a noisy truck, let's cover our ears.”
text: Muulize: Walitengeneza nini hapa? Walitumia nini kutengenezea hiyo? Halafu sema, “oh hapana! hiyo ni sauti ya gari kubwa ya mizigo, na tuzibe masikio yetu.”

SourceText: On Friday, Mama makes a beautiful garden filled with flowers, birds and ladybugs. “TWEET TWEET!” But it’s healthy pap, beans and a crunchy salad
text: Siku ya ijumaa, Mama hutengeneza bustani nzuri inayojaa maua, ndege na wadudu.^TWIIT TWIIT!^ Lakini ni ugali wenye afya, maharage na kachumbari

SourceText: Ask: “How many insects can you see? And how many trees can you see? What colors are the leaves on the trees? Are they all the same shape?”
text: Muulize: “Unaweza kuona wadudu wangapi? Na unaweza kuona miti mingapi? Majani ya kwenye miti yana rangi gani? Je, yote yana umbo sawa?”

SourceText: “Mama, what’s for lunch?” asks Tumi. “Yes, Mama,” says Thabo. “What are you making today?”
text: ^Mama, tunakula nini mchana? Tumi anauliza. ^Ndio, mama,^ anasema John. ^Unaandaa nini leo?^

SourceText: Ask: “How many people are sitting down and how many are standing? What can you see that is blue? And what can you see that is pink?”
text: Muulize: “Ni watu wangapi wamekaa chini na ni wangapi wamesimama? Unaweza kuona nini chenye rangi ya bluu? Na nini unaweza kuona chenye rangi ya pinki?

SourceText: Thabo and Tumi can’t wait another second. Their tummies are grumbling. Finally, Mama is ready. “What is it Mama?” asks Thabo, licking his lips.
text: John na Tumi hawawezi kusubiri kwa sekunde zaidi. Matumbo yao yanaunguruma. Mwisho, Mama amemaliza kuandaa chakula. ^Ni nini hiyo mama?^ John anauliza, akilamba midomo yake.

SourceText: Ask: “Why do you think the boy is licking his lips? What do you do when you are hungry?”
text: Muulize: “Unafikiri kwanini mvulana analamba midomo yake? Unafanya nini unapokuwa na hasira?”

SourceText: It’s Thabo, Tumi and Mama! “Mmm, our favourite, your famous stew and rice.” “Thank you, Mama!”
text: Ni John, Tumi na Mama! ^Mmm, ni chakula tunachokipenda, kitoweo chako maarufu na wali.". "Asante mama!"

SourceText: Say: “Yey, the food is finally ready!” Ask: How many dishes can you see? How many people do you think are going to eat? How do you think the boy is feeling now that the food is ready? How do you normally feel when you are given food?”
text: Sema: “Yey, hatimaye chakula kipo tayari!” Unaweza kuona vyombo vingapi? Unafikiri ni watu wangapi wanaenda kula? Unafikiri mvulana anajiskiaje sasa kwamba chakula kipo tayari? Kwa kawaida huwa unajiskiaje pale unapopewa chakula?

SourceText: What will Mama make on Sunday?
text: Mama ataandaa nini siku ya Jumapili?

SourceText:
Ask: “Can you name the different foods in the picture? What food do you like? And what food don’t you like?

Let’s go to the kitchen and cut up some food into interesting shapes like they did in the story!”
text:
Muulize: “Unaweza kutaja majina mbalimbali ya vyakula vya kwenye picha? Na ni chakula gani hukipendi?

Twende jikoni tukakate baadhi ya vyakula katika maumbo ya kuvutia kama walivyofanya kwenye hadithi!”

SourceText: Let's go on a litter hunt
text: Wacha tuendelee kuondoa takataka

SourceText: The yard is a mess. How will the children clean up?
text: Uwanja ni mchafu sana, Je watoto watausafishaje?

SourceText: Papa says, “This yard is a MESS. The wind blew the rubbish in.” Mama says, “Let’s go on a litter hunt. First look for tins.” Papa says, “Wear these gloves.” Yuck!
text: Baba anasema, '' Huu uwanja ni MCHAFU SANA. Upepo ulileta takataka." Mama anasema, ''Twendeni tukaondoe takataka. Kwanza angalieni makopo.''Baba anasema,'' Vaa glavu hizi,'' Uchafu!

SourceText: We’re going on a tin hunt. We look up high and down low. We look under the bushes and against the fence.
text: Tunakwenda kuokota makopo. Tunatazama juu na chini kabisa. Tunaangalia chini ya vichaka na kwenye uzio.

SourceText: We’ve found red tins and green tins, rusty tins and shiny tins, clean tins and dirty tins. Yuck!
text: Tumepata makopo mekundu na ya kijani, makopo yenye kutu na makopo yanayong'aa, makopo masafi na makopo machafu. Uchafu!

SourceText: What must we do with all these tins? Find a bin and put them in! Now look for plastic.
text: Tufanye nini na makopo haya? Tafuta pipa na uweke humo! sasa tafuta plastiki.

SourceText: We’re going on a plastic hunt. We look up high and down low. We look behind the chicken coop and in front of the house.
text: Tunakwenda kuondoa takataka za plastiki, Tunaangalia juu na chini kabisa. Tunatazama nyuma ya banda la kuku na mbele ya nyumba.

SourceText: We’ve found milk bottles and bottle tops, shopping bags and sucker sticks, straws and broken buckets. Yuck!
text: Tumepata chupa za maziwa na vifuniko vya chupa, mifuko ya kubebea vitu na mirija ya kunywea vinywaji na ndoo zilizopasuka. Uchafu!

SourceText: What must we do with all this plastic? Find a bin and put it in! Now look for paper.
text: Tufanye nini na hizi plastic zote? Tafuta pipa na uweke humo! sasa tafuta karatasi.

SourceText: We’re going on a paper hunt. We look up high and down low. We look near the water barrel and on top of the bench.
text: Tunakwenda kuokota karatasi. Tunaangalia juu na chini kabisa. Tunaangalia karibu na pipa la maji na juu ya benchi.

SourceText: We’ve found wet paper and dry paper, cardboard boxes and newspaper, old paper plates and dirty tissues. Yuck!
text: Tumepata karatasi iliyoloana na karatasi kavu, boksi na gazeti, sahani za karatasi za zamani na tishu chafu. Uchafu!

SourceText: What must we do with all this paper? Find a bin and put it in! What else can you look for? Hmm ...
text: Tufanye nini na karatasi zote hizi? Tafuta pipa na uweke humo! Nini kingine unaweza kuangalia? Hmm...

SourceText: There’s no more mess! Wow! This place is so clean. Thanks, litter hunters.
text: Hakuna tena uchafu sana! Waoo! Mahali hapa ni pasafi sana. Asante, waokotaji wa takataka.

SourceText: You deserve a treat! And remember ... what must you do with your litter? Find a bin and put it in!
text: Unastahili pongezi! Na kumbuka... unalazimika kufanya nini na takataka zako? Tafuta pipa na uweke humo!

SourceText: How do you sleep?
text: Unalalaje?

SourceText: Can you sleep with one eye open? Can you sleep in a tree? Pula has a bed, but he wants to know how other creatures sleep.
text: Unaweza kulala jicho moja likiwa wazi? Unaweza kulala kwenye mti? Pula ana kitanda, ila anataka kujua viumbe vingine vinalalaje.

SourceText: How do you sleep, bird? I fly in my sleep
text: Unalalaje ndege? ninaruka usingizini

SourceText: How do you sleep, bat? I sleep upside down.
text: Unalalaje, popo? Ninalala kichwa chini miguu juu.

SourceText: How do you sleep, bullfrog? I rest on my side
text: Unalalaje Chura? Napumzika kwa upande

SourceText: How do you sleep, octopus? I change colour in my dreams.
text: Unalala namna gani, Pweza? nabadilisha rangi kwenye ndoto zangu.

SourceText: How do you sleep, duck? We take turns to guard each other.
text: Unalala namna gani bata? Tunapeana zamu kulindana.

SourceText: How do you sleep, baby owl? I sleep on my face.
text: Unalalaje, bundi mtoto? Nalalia uso wangu.

SourceText: How do you sleep, otter? We sleep holding hands.
text: Unalalaje ota? Tunalala huku tumeshikana mikono.

SourceText: How do you sleep, walrus? I sleep on the land and under the water.
text: Unallalaje walrus? Nalala juu ya ardhi na chini ya maji.

SourceText: How do you sleep, giraffe? We sleep on each other.
text: Unalalaje twiga? Tunalala tukiwa tumeegamiana.

SourceText: How do you sleep, meerkat? We sleep in a heap.
text: Unalalaje, miakati? Tunalala kwenye lundo.

SourceText: How do you sleep, Pula? Good night! Sleep tight!
text: Unalalaje, pula? Usiku mwema! lala vyema!

SourceText: Grandpa Farouk’s garden
text: Bustani ya Babu Faruku

SourceText: Amir loves Grandpa Farouk’s garden. But it’s dying. What can Amir do to help?
text: Amiri anaipenda bustani ya Babu Faruku. Lakini inakufa. Amiri anaweza kufanya nini kusaidia?

SourceText: Deep in the city, surrounded by houses and bricks and tar, you’ll find Grandpa Farouk’s garden.
text: Ndani kabisa ya Jiji, kumezungukwa na nyumba na matofali na lami, utaikuta bustani ya Babu Faruku.

SourceText: Amir visits Grandpa once a week. He loves the leaves and flowers and trees.
text: Amiri huwa anamtembelea mara moja kwa wiki. Anapenda majani na maua na miti.

SourceText: Amir helps to water the plants. He helps with the compost, and works with his Grandpa all day.
text: Amiri anasaidia kumwagilia mimea. Anasaidia kuweka mboji, na hufanya kazi na babu yake siku nzima.

SourceText: When they finish, they feast on a harvest of fruit. One day, Grandpa didn’t eat his pear. “What’s wrong?” asked Amir.
text: Wanapomaliza, wanasherehekea mavuno ya matunda. Siku moja, Babu hakula peasi lake. " shida ni nini?" Amiri anauliza.

SourceText: “My garden is dying,” replied Grandpa. “Why?” asked Amir. “Look closely,” said Grandpa. “Some pests are eating the plants.”
text: "Bustani yangu inakufa" Babu alijibu. "Kwanini?" Amiri aliuliza. "Angalia kwa karibu," alisema Babu. "Kuna wadudu wanakula mimea."

SourceText: “We need ladybirds!” said Grandpa. “They are the bugs that eat the pests that kill the plants. Without ladybirds, the garden will die.” “I’ll bring you a bug or two,” said Amir.
text: "Tunahitaji wadudu" alisema Babu. "Ni mende ambao wanakula wadudu wanaoua mimea. Bila wadudu hao, bustani itakufa." " Nitakuletea mdudu mmoja au wawili," amiri alisema.

SourceText: For a whole week, Amir looked and searched and collected. He found one ladybird on the sports field.
text: Kwa wiki nzima, Amiri aliangalia na alitafuta na alikusanya. Alikuta mdudu mmoja kwenye eneo la michezo.

SourceText: Two more at the shop. Three at the park.
text: Wawili zaidi dukani. Watatu mbugani.

SourceText: And four behind the TV. Next week, Amir went to visit Grandpa Farouk, and showed him his jar of ten bugs. “You’ve done well, oh my boy, you’ve done well,” Grandpa said, with a tear in his eye.
text: Na wanne nyuma ya TV. Wiki iliyofuata, Amiri alienda kumtembelea Babu Faruku, na alimuonesha chupa yenye wadudu kumi. "umefanya vizuri, oh kijana wangu, umefanya vizuri," Babu alisema, akitokwa na machozi machoni mwake.

SourceText: Grandpa was very happy. The ladybirds were very hungry!
text: Babu alifurahi sana. Wadudu walikuwa na njaa sana!

SourceText: The ladybirds ate the pests, and the garden blossomed.
text: Nyenyere walikula wadudu waharibifu na bustani ikachanua.

SourceText: From that day on, Grandpa Farouk’s garden did what gardens should do. It grew and grew and grew.
text: Kuanzia siku ile na kuendelea, bustani ya Babu Faruku ilifanya kile ambacho bustani zinatakiwa kufanya. Ilikua na kukua na kukua.

SourceText: Colours
text: Rangi

SourceText: A white bear likes colours a lot, and he falls in love with new ones all the time. Join him as he explores a world of rainbows.
text: Dubu mweupe hupenda sana rangi, na huwa anapenda nyingine mpya kila wakati. Ungana nae anapochunguza dunia ya upinde wa mvua.

SourceText: © Room to Read, 2015. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: Haki zote zimehifadhiwa © Room to Read, 2015. Imetolewa chini ya CC BY 4.0 license.

SourceText: Bear likes colours.
text: Dubu hupenda rangi.

SourceText: Now, her ears are yellow.
text: Sasa, maskio yake ni ya njano.

SourceText: Now, her tummy is brown.
text: Sasa, Tumbo lake ni la kahawia.

SourceText: Now, her mouth is red.
text: Sasa, Mdomo wake ni mwekundu.

SourceText: Now, her hands are blue.
text: Sasa, mikono yake ni ya bluu.

SourceText: Now, her back is green.
text: Sasa, Mgongo wake ni wa kijani.

SourceText: Now, her legs are pink.
text: Sasa, Miguu yake ni ya pinki.

SourceText: Now, Bear is colourful!
text: Sasa, Dubu ana rangi!

SourceText: Oh no! Where did all her the_colours go?
text: Hapana! Rangi zake zote zimeenda wapi?

SourceText: Circles in the park
text: Miduara kwenye mbuga

SourceText: Golu and Tama go to the park to play. What do they see all around them? This wordless book introduces circles, semi-circles and quarter-circles.
text: Golu na Tama wanaenda mbugani kucheza. Wanaona vilivyowazunguka? Hiki kitabu kisicho na maneno kinatambulisha miduara, nusu miduara na robo miduara.

SourceText: © Pratham Books, 2021. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © Vitabu vya Pratham, 2021. Haki zingine zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: Circle Semi-circle Quarter-cricle How many semi-circles make a circle? How many quarter-circles make a semi-circle?
text: Nusu duara-Robo-duara Je ni nusu duara ngapi hufanya duara? Ni robo duara ngapi hufanya nusu duara?

SourceText: Discuss the book’s cover.  Ask: What do you see? What do you think this story is about?
text: Jadilli jalada la kitabu. Uliza: Unaona nini? Unafikiri hadithi hii inahusu nini?

SourceText: Lefa's Bath
text: Lefa anaoga

SourceText: Lefa wants her bath, but where does all the water go?
text: Lefa anataka kuoga, lakini maji yake yote yameenda wapi?

SourceText: This work is licensed under a [Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).
text: Kazi hii imepewa Kibali na [Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

SourceText: Ask your child: what is the girl doing? Why do you think she is doing that? What animals are those? How many are there?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Msichana anafanya nini? Unafikiri ni kwanini anafanya hivyo? hao ni wanyama gani? Wako wangapi?

SourceText: Mimic sounds and actions from the story, like the cows drinking the water.
text: Igiza sauti na vitendo kutoka kwenye hadithi, kama vile n’gombe wanakunywa maji.

SourceText: Say: oh no! Where has all the water gone? How do you think the girl is feeling?
text: Sema: Oh hapana! maji yameenda wapi? Unafikiri msichana anajiskiaje?

SourceText: Use descriptive words to talk about the pictures. Say: she is pouring water from her yellow bucket into the large orange bath.
text: Tumia maneno ya maelezo kuzungumzia picha. Sema: Msichana anamimina maji kutoka kwenye ndoo yake ya njano na kumiminia katika beseni kubwa la kuogea la rangi ya machungwa.

SourceText: Say: look! The ducks are splashing in the water! What do you think will happen next?
text: Sema: Tazama bata wanarusha maji! Je unadhani nini kitatokea baada ya hapo?

SourceText: Say: oh no! The bath has been emptied again! How did that happen? How is the girl feeling now?
text: Sema: Oh hapana! Benseni la kuogea halina maji tena! Nini kimetokea? Je msichana atajiskiaje sasa?

SourceText: Ask: What is the girl doing now? What animal can we see coming closer?
text: Uliza: Msichana anafanya nini sasa hivi? Ni mnyama gani tunamuona anakuja kwa karibu?

SourceText: Ask your child: What is the pig doing? What is happening to the water? Can the girl see what is happening?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Je nguruwe anafanya nini? Nini kinatokea kwenye maji? Je msichana anaweza kuona nini kinatokea?

SourceText: Say: oh no! What happened to the bath now? How is the girl feeling?
text: Sema: Oh hapana! Nini kinatokea kwenye beseni la kuogea sasa? Je msichana anajiskiaje?

SourceText: Use your voice and face to demonstrate emotions from the pictures. Say: look, she is crying? Why do you think she is feeling sad? How do you think the animals are feeling?
text: Tumia sauti na uso wako kuonyesha hisia kutoka kwenye picha. Sema: Tazama, analia? unafikiri ni kwanini anajiskia huzuni? Unafikiri wanyama wanajiskiaje?

SourceText: Ask: what are the animals doing? Why are they doing that? Say: Can you count the buckets of water? Are they all the same colour? What colours can you see?
text: Uliza: Wanyama wanafanya nini? Kwanini wanafanya hivyo? Sema: Unaweza kuhesabu ndoo za maji? Je wote wana rangi moja? Je unaweza kuona rangi gani?

SourceText: Ask: How do you think the girl is feeling now? Why?
text: Uliza: Unafikiri msichana anajiskiaje sasa? Kwanini?

SourceText: Reflect on the story with your child. Ask: What did you think about the story? How would you feel if you were in the story? What would you have done?
text: Tafakari juu ya hadithi na mtoto wako. Uliza: Ulifikiri nini kuhusu hadithi? Ungejiskiaje kama ungekuwa kwenye hadithi? Ungefanya nini?

SourceText: List of Things
text: Orodha ya vitu

SourceText:
Make a list of healthy activities that you like to do. Here are some suggestions:
* Listening to your favourite music
* Going for a walk (if possible)
* Doing some exercise
* Drinking a cup of tea by yourself
* Calling up a friend
* Singing, dancing, praying, or reading
* Sitting in the sun with your eyes closed
* Watching your favourite TV show

Pick one and do it today!
text:
Tengeneza orodha ya shughuli zinazoleta afya unazopenda kufanya. Haya ni baadhi ya mapendekezo:
* Kusikiliza muziki unaoupenda
* Kwenda matembezini (kama inawezekana)
* Kufanya mazoezi
* Kunywa kikombe cha chai peke yako
* Kumpigia rafiki simu
* Kuimba, kucheza, kusali, au kusoma
* Kuketi juani huku umefumba macho
* Kutazama kipindi cha runinga unachokipenda

Chagua shughuli moja na uifanye leo!

SourceText: Take a moment for yourself first.
text: Chukua muda kwa ajili yako mwenyewe kwanza.

SourceText: It is great to hear you are feeling positive today. You make a real difference for your family!
text: Inafurahisha kusikia unajisikia vizuri leo. Unafanya mabadiliko ya kweli kwa familia yako!

SourceText: Life has its great and hard moments – that is okay. You are on the right track.
text: Maisha yana nyakati ngumu na nzuri – hiyo ni sawa. Uko kwenye njia sahihi.

SourceText: It is normal to have hard days as a parent. Take a deep breath and know you are not alone!
text: Ni kawaida kuwa na siku ngumu kama mzazi. Vuta pumzi ndefu na ujue hauko peke yako!

SourceText: Creating time and space for children to play is as important as eating and sleeping!
text: Kutengeneza muda na nafasi kwaajili ya watoto kucheza ni muhimu kama ilivyo kula na kulala!

SourceText: When you join your child in playful activities, you take their learning to the next level. You might even have some fun yourself.
text: Unapojiunga na mtoto wako katika shughuli za kucheza, unapelekea kujifunza kwao kuwa kwenye kiwango cha juu. Unaweza hata kujifurahisha mwenyewe.

SourceText: Sometimes children play with friends, and other times, on their own. Sometimes play is busy and loud, and other times it is quiet and relaxed. No matter what it looks like, when children play, they learn. Today we will look at ways you can support your child through play. You don’t need special toys or a lot of time. What’s important is that you have some fun together.
text: Wakati mwingine watoto hucheza na marafiki, na wakati mwingine peke yao. Wakati mwingine wanacheza sana na kwa sauti na nyakati zingine kunakuwa na ukimya na utulivu. Haijalishi inavyoonekana, watoto wanapocheza wanajifunza. Leo tutaangalia njia ambazo unaweza kuzitumia kumsaidia mtoto wako kupitia mchezo. Hauna haja ya kuwa na midoli maalumu au muda mwingi. Jambo muhimu ni kuwa na furaha pamoja.

SourceText: In @global.app_name, we use the image of a garden to think about what children need in their lives to grow and thrive. Let’s see how play forms a part of the garden image.
text: Katika @global.app_name, tunatumia picha ya bustani kufikiri kuhusu nini wanahitaji watoto katika maisha yao kukua na kustawi. Hembu tuone ni kwa namna gani mchezo unafanya sehemu ya picha ya bustani.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: In the same way that fertiliser boosts plant growth, playing with your child is the magic ingredient that supercharges their learning and development.
text: Kama jinsi ilivyo mbolea, huongeza ukuaji wa mmea, kucheza na mtoto wako ni kiungo cha muhimu sana ambacho husaidia kujifunza kwake na ukuaji.

SourceText: Fertiliser or “plant food” boosts the quality of the soil around the plant and the plant’s growth. When you sprinkle playfulness throughout your interactions with your child, it will make a big difference to their development. It doesn’t have to be a lot at once, but doing it regularly can improve your relationship while also helping your child learn important skills.
text:
Mbolea au’’Chakula cha mmea’’ huongeza ubora wa udongo karibu na mmea na ukuaji wa mmea. Vivyo hivyo, mwingiliano wa kucheza na mtoto wako utaongeza uwezo wake wa kujifunza.
Ukijigawa na kuwa sehemu ya mchezo na mtoto wako muda wote, italeta mabadiliko makubwa katika ukuaji wake, si lazima iwe kwa kiasi kikubwa kwa mara moja, ila kwa kufanya mara kwa mara inaboresha uhusiano wako, huku pia ikimsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza juzi muhimu.

SourceText: There is no right or wrong way to play. The important thing is to have fun together.
text: Hakuna njia sahihi au mbaya ya kucheza. Kitu cha muhimu ni kufurahia pamoja.

SourceText: Here are some ideas for supporting your child through play:
text: Haya ni baadhi ya mawazo mbalimbali ya njia tofauti za kumsaidia mtoto wako kupitia mchezo:

SourceText:
**Create space and time for children to play.**

Children enjoy playing in the presence of their parents. Create space for them to play around you. Give your child praise and encouragement as they play.
text:
**Tengeneza nafasi na muda wa watoto kucheza.**

Watoto hufurahia kucheza mbele ya wazazi wao. Watengenezee nafasi ya kucheza karibu yako. Msifie mtoto wako na mtie moyo wanapocheza.

SourceText:
**Join your child in their play from time to time.** 
Look for opportunities to sit down and engage in a positive way with what your child is doing. Even 10 minutes will boost your child’s development.
text:
**Jiunge na mtoto wako katika mchezo wake mara kwa mara.**
Tafuta fursa ili kukaa chini na kushiriki kwa njia chanya na kile anachofanya mtoto wako. Hata dakika kumi itaongeza maendeleo ya mtoto wako.

SourceText: Connecting with your child in a playful way every day helps your child to feel close to you, and it helps them to grow and learn. Joining your child in play does not mean taking over what they are doing or telling them what to do differently. It means being part of the activity in a way that your child will enjoy.
text: Kuungana na mtoto wako kwa njia ya kimichezo kila siku husaidia mtoto wako kujiskia yuko karibu na wewe, na humsaidia kukua na kujifunza. Kujiunga na mtoto wako kwa njia ya kimchezo haimaanishi ni kumnyang'anya anachofanya au kumwambia afanye nini tofauti. Inamaanisha kuwa sehemu ya shughuli kwa mtindo ambao mtoto wako atafurahia.

SourceText:
**Keep it joyful and fun!**
Being playful does not mean that your child won’t respect you or take you seriously: play actually helps to strengthen your relationship with your child. And when relationships are strong, dealing with stress and challenges become easier.
text:
**Endelea kufanya iwe ya furaha na kuburudisha!**
Kuwa kimchezo haimaanishi kuwa mtoto wako hatakuheshimu au kutokukuchukulia kwa uzito unaotakiwa: kimsingi mchezo husaidia kuimarisha uhusiano wenu na mtoto wako. Na pale ambapo mahusiano ni imara, kushughulika na msongo wa mawazo na changamoto inakuwa rahisi.

SourceText:
When I first heard that playing with my child was important, I was not interested in trying it. My father never used to play with me when I was a child. I didn’t think it was something that parents do. But one day, I saw my child playing outside and I decided to take a closer look. I was actually amazed at what my child had built with just rocks, sticks and some cardboard boxes. I told my child I thought that it looked really great. Together we created animals using cardboard pieces and some sticks. It was quite fun to build something together, and to see how much my child enjoyed it.

I really like that ParentApp has suggestions for different activities that I can do with my child. It makes it easier for me to decide what to do when my child and I are together.
text:
Mara ya kwanza niliposikia kwamba kucheza na mtoto wangu ni muhimu, sikuvutiwa kujaribu. Baba yangu hakuwahi kucheza na mimi nilipokuwa mtoto, sikufikiria kuwa ni jambo ambalo wazazi wanafanya. Lakini siku moja nilimuona mtoto wangu anacheza nje, niliamua kuangalia kwa ukaribu. Kwa kweli nilishangazwa na kile mtoto wangu alichokuwa amejenga kwa mawe na kwa vijiti tu na baadhi ya maboksi. Nilimwambia mtoto wangu nadhani inaonekana nzuri kweli. Pamoja tukatengeneza wanyama kwa kutumia mawe, vipande vya maboksi na baadhi ya vijiti. Ilikuwa ni furaha sana kujenga kitu pamoja na kuona jinsi mtoto wangu alivyofurahi.

Nimeipenda sana Programu ya wazazi ya malezi ina mapendekezo ya shughuli mbalimbali ambazo naweza kufanya na mtoto wangu. inafanya iwe rahisi kwangu kuamua nini cha kufanya tukiwa pamoja na mtoto wangu.

SourceText: Did you know that you can use play to your advantage?
text: Ulijua kwamba unaweza kutumia kucheza kwa faida yako?

SourceText: Playful interactions can help your child cooperate and follow instructions.
text: Ukishiriki kucheza unaweza kumsaidia mtoto wako kushirikiana na kufuata maelekezo.

SourceText:
Sometimes children don’t want to cooperate or listen, which is very frustrating for parents. Our first reaction might be to yell, scream or threaten our child so that they will listen or do as we say. This may seem like a good idea in the moment, but it doesn’t help us or our children long term.  
Because children love to play games, be silly and have fun, you can use this to help your child cooperate and complete tasks. They won’t even realise they are doing as they are told!
text: Wakati mwingine watoto hawataki kushirikiana au kusikiliza, jambo ambalo linachanganya wazazi.  Kitu tunachofanya cha kwanza inaweza kuwa ni kuwakaripia, kuwagombeza au kuwatisha watoto wetu ili wasikie au wafanye kama tunavyowaambia. Hili linaweza kuonekana kama ni wazo zuri kwa wakati huo, lakini haitusaidii sisi au watoto wetu  kwa kipindi kirefu. Kwa Sababu watoto wanapenda kucheza michezo, kufanya mizaha, na kufanya vichekesho vya kujifurahisha, unaweza kutumia hii kusaidia mtoto wako kushirikiana na kukamilisha kazi. Hawawezi kufikiria hata kuwa wanafanya kama walivyoambiwa!

SourceText: It is normal to feel frustrated when our children don’t cooperate. But sometimes it can be more effective to work *with* your child than *against* them.
text: Ni kawaida kujiskia kuchanganyikiwa pale watoto wetu wanapokuwa hawatoi ushirikiano. Lakini wakati mwingine inaweza kuwa na matokeo zaidi kufanya kazi *na* mtoto wako kuliko kufanya kazi *dhidi* yake.

SourceText: Playful interactions are a great way to do this. **Let’s take a look at an example:**
text: Muingiliano/kucheza pamoja ni njia nzuri kufanya hili. **Hebu tuangalie mfano:**

SourceText: I don't want to go to sleep!
text: Sitaki kwenda kulala!

SourceText: I want a @data.characters.nandi.name-sized glass submarine to see the creatures at the bottom of the ocean! And a pet giant squid to do water ballet there with me!
text: Nataka miwani kubwa kama ya @data.characters.nandi.name ya kutumia kwenye manowari kutazama viumbe chini ya bahari na pweza mzuri na mkubwa wacheze na mimi kwenye maji!

SourceText: I want to build myself a pair of butterfly wings and zoom to the roof of the sky where I’ll see all the world and everything in it!

SourceText: Look here, @data.characters.nandi.name. Here is your very own adventure boat. It’s waiting to take you wherever you want to go. See, put your head here...that’s right...and I’ll just tuck you in...there we go...now, off you go! Adventure awaits ...
text: "Tazama hapa @data.characters.nandi.name. Hii ni boti yako kabisa ya kujivinjari. Inakusubiri ikupeleke popote unapotaka. Ona, weka kichwa chako hapa..., hiyo ni sawa... na nitakuvutia ndani... sasa tunaenda... ondoka! kujivinjari kunakusubiri"

SourceText: Question time
text: Muda wa maswali

SourceText: Let’s think about what happened in this story:
text: Hembu tufikiri kuhusu nini kilitokea katika hadithi hii:

text: Mama alijiskiaje pale ambapo @data.characters.nandi.name hakutaka kwenda kulala?
note: The string @data.characters.nandi.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Frustrated
text: Kuchanganyikiwa

SourceText: Yes, the mother may have been feeling all of these things. It can be really difficult when our children do not want to go to sleep.
text: Ndio, huenda mama amekuwa akijiskia vyote hivi, inaweza kuwa vigumu kweli pale watoto wetu wanapokuwa hawataki kwenda kulala.

SourceText: Question time:
text: Muda wa maswali:

SourceText: What did her mother do to help her fall asleep?
text: Mama alifanya nini kumsaidia alale?

Yeye na @data.characters.nandi.name walitunga hadithi ya kufurahisha pamoja ambayo ilimsaidia @data.characters.nandi.name kulala.

text: Ingawa tunaweza kuelewa ni kwa nini mama yake @data.characters.nandi.name angehisi kutaka kupiga kelele, mama yake @data.characters.nandi.name alifanya jambo la busara. Yeye na @data.characters.nandi.name walitunga hadithi ya kufurahisha pamoja ambayo ilimsaidia @data.characters.nandi.name kulala.

SourceText: Awake
