SourceText: Yes, all of these are true. @data.characters.nandi.name was struggling to sleep, and yelling would not have helped @data.characters.nandi.name to fall asleep.
text: Ndio, haya yote ni kweli. @data.characters.nandi.name alikuwa anahangaika kulala, na kumkaripia kusingemsaidia @data.characters.nandi.name kulala.

SourceText: Here are some more ideas for using play to help your child to cooperate with what you need them to do.
text: Haya ni baadhi ya mawazo zaidi kwaajili ya kutumia mchezo kusaidia mtoto wako kushirikiana na kile unachotaka afanye.

SourceText: Listen for more ideas:
text: Sikiliza mawazo zaidi:

SourceText:
Let’s say your child is busy playing an animal game but it’s time for dinner. You could say: can you hop to the table like a frog or fly there like an eagle? 

Or if your child’s toys are spread all over the house and you want them to pack it away, pretend a cardboard box or other object is a boat that fishes out all the toys and brings them to shore. 

Or, make up a silly song with silly instructions (put your pants on your head) to distract your child when they don’t want to get dressed.
text:
Labda tuseme mtoto wako yupo bize anacheza mchezo wa mnyama lakini ni muda wa chakula cha usiku. Ungeweza kusema: Unaweza kurukia mezani kama chura au kupaa mpaka pale kama tai?

Au kama vitu vya kuchezea vya mtoto wako vimesambaa kila mahali kwenye nyumba na unataka kuviweka vizuri, igiza kama box au kitu kingine ni boti linalovua vitu hivyo vyote na kuvileta ufukweni.
Au, tengeneza wimbo wa utani na wenye maelekezo ya utani (weka nguo yako kichwani) kumvuruga mtoto wako anapokuwa hataki kwenda kuvaa.

SourceText: Book activities can be playful too! Here are some ways that you can make book activities fun.
text: Shughuli za kitabu zinaweza kuwa za kimchezo pia. Hizi ni baadhi ya njia ambazo unawezatumia kufanya shughuli za kitabu kuwa za kufurahia.

SourceText: Use a lively, playful voice, with different voices for different characters.
text: Tumia sauti hai, ya kucheza, na sauti tofauti kwa wahusika tofauti.

SourceText: Listen to this example:
text: Sikiliza mfano huu:

SourceText: “Look! Here are two white ducks and one BIG green frog! Hmm, what do you think the frog might be saying to the ducks? Maybe Mr Frog is saying: “croak, come - let’s jump into the water and make a big splash! Ready? One, two, three - jump!”
text: "Tazama! Hapa kuna bata wawili weupe na chura MKUBWA wa kijani! Hmm, unafikiri chura anawaambia nini bata? Labda Bwana Chura anasema: "krook, njoo - hebu turukie kwenye maji na tutengeneze mshtuko mkubwa? Moja, mbili, tatu - ruka"!

SourceText: You can mimic different actions from the story.
text: Unaweza kuigiza vitendo tofauti kutoka kwenye hadithi.

SourceText: This is a great way to keep children engaged and helps them understand what is happening in the story.
text: Hii ni njia nzuri kufanya watoto washiriki na huwasaidia kuelewa nini kinatokea kwenye hadithi.

SourceText: You can also mimic different sounds from the story, like animal sounds, vehicle sounds, or nature sounds.
text: Unaweza pia kuigiza sauti tofauti kutoka kwenye hadithi kama sauti za wanyama, sauti za magari au sauti za asili.

SourceText:
Three easy ways to make book activities fun:

1. Use a lively, playful voice to bring the story to life
2. Mimic different actions from the story
3. Mimic different sounds from the story
text:
Njia tatu rahisi kufanya shughuli za kitabu kuwa za kufurahisha:

1. Tumia sauti changamfu na ya kuchezesha ili kufanya hadithi iwe hai
2. Igiza vitendo tofauti kutoka kwenye hadithi
3. Igiza sauti tofauti kutoka kwenye hadithi

SourceText: Remember: If children are having fun, they are learning. Book activities do not have to be serious. It is about sharing the book in a way that you and your child will enjoy, not about being strict or being right.
text: Kumbuka: Ikiwa watoto wanafurahia, wanajifunza. Shughuli za vitabu hazihitaji kuwa makini. Ni suala la kushirikishana kitabu kwa mtindo ambao wewe na mtoto wako mtafurahia, sio suala la kuwa mkali au kuwa sahihi.

SourceText:
Small actions, big results! Parents who practise at home get better results.

For your home practice:
🤝 Make some time to interact with your child in playful ways.
📖 Use books and stories to have fun together.
😌 Remember to make time for yourself to have fun and relax too.
text:
Matendo madogo, matokeo makuwa! Wazazi ambao hufanya kwa vitendo nyumbani wanapata matokeo bora.

Kwaajili ya kufanya mazoezi yako ya nyumbani:
🤝Tengeneza muda flani kuchangamana na mtoto wako katika njia za kimichezo.
📖Tumia vitabu na hadithi kuburudika pamoja.
😊Kumbuka kutengeneza muda kwaajili yako mwenyewe kuburudika na kupumzika.

SourceText: Praise Yourself
text: Jisifie

SourceText:
Self-praise can be really helpful, especially when we have difficult days. 

Think of your week and finish the following phrase: “This week, I am proud of myself for …” It can be anything, not just things about being a parent!

Think of one thing you did well today. Now wrap your arms around yourself and give yourself a big HUG!
text:
Kujisifia kunaweza kusaidia sana, hasa wakati tunapokuwa na siku ngumu.

Fikiria jinsi wiki ilivyokuendea halafu umalizie tungo ifuatayo: "Wiki hii, ninajivunia kwa…" Kinaweza kuwa kitu chochote, siyo mambo ya malezi tu!

Fikiria jambo moja ulilofanya vizuri leo. Sasa jifumbate kwa mikono yako mwenyewe halafu UJIKUMBATIE kwa nguvu!

SourceText: Self-care is a key parenting tool. It starts with recognising how we feel.
text: Kujithamini ni muhimu kwa malezi. Inaanza na kutambua jinsi tunavyojiskia.

SourceText: Great. And amazing that you are using this app – it shows your commitment as a parent. Make sure you give yourself credit and praise for what you are doing.
text: Safi sana. Na inapendeza sana kuona unatumia programu hii – inaonyesha jinsi unavyojitoa kwa dhati kama mzazi. Hakikisha unajitambua na kujisifia kwa kile unachokifanya.

SourceText: Every day has its highs and lows. Praise yourself for being here and trying – you are moving forward.
text: Kila siku kuna kupanda na kushuka. Jisifie kwa kuwa hapa na kujaribu – unasonga mbele.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult right now. Take a deep breath and know that you are valued.
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo ni magumu sasa hivi. Vuta pumzi ndefu na ujue kuwa unathaminiwa.

SourceText: This week, we want to talk about the environment you **CREATE** for your child.
text: Wiki hii, tunataka kuzungumza kuhusu mazingira **UNAYOTENGENEZA** kwaajili ya mtoto wako.

SourceText: A positive environment helps children feel safe and helps them learn.
text: Mazingira mazuri huwasaidia watoto kujiskia salama na huwasaidia kujifunza.

SourceText:
In ParentApp for Kids, we use the image of a garden to think about what children need in their lives to grow and thrive. 

Let’s see how **creating a positive environment** forms part of the garden image.
text:
Kwenye programu ya wazazi ya malezi ya watoto, tunatumia taswira ya bustani kufikiri kile ambacho watoto wanahitaji katika maisha yao ili wakue na kustawi.

Ngoja tuone jinsi mchezo unavyokuwa katika sehemu ya picha ya bustani.

SourceText: In the same way that all plants need sunlight to grow, all children need praise and positive encouragement from their caregivers.
text: Kwa jinsi hiyo kwamba mimea yote inahitaji jua kukua, watoto wote wanahitaji kusifiwa na kutiwa moyo na walezi wao.

SourceText:
Children thrive when caregivers respond to them with warmth, acceptance and praise. Just as the sun rises and sets every day, try to give your child some positive attention every day. 

Remember that what gets light will grow. When parents give positive attention to good behaviour with praise, children will be encouraged to behave that way more often in the future.
text:
Watoto hustawi pale walezi wanapowaitikia kwa uchangamfu, kuwapokea na kuwasifia. Kama vile jua linavyochomoza na kutua kila siku, jaribu kumpa mtoto wako umakini kila siku.

Kumbuka kwamba, kinachopata mwanga kitakua. Pale wazazi wanapokuwa makini kwa tabia nzuri na kusifia, watoto watatiwa moyo kuendelea zaidi kuwa na tabia hiyo kila wakati katika maisha yao baadae.

SourceText: Here’s how you can create a positive environment for your child:
text: Hivi ndivyo unaweza kutengeneza mazingira mazuri kwa mtoto mtoto wako:

SourceText:
**Give positive instructions**

Positive instructions are more effective than negative instructions. Telling children what we DO want them to do works better than telling them to STOP doing something.
text:
**Toa maelekezo mazuri**

Maelekezo mazuri na chanya ni mazuri zaidi kuliko maelekezo mabaya. Kuwaambia watoto nini TUNATAKA wao wafanye vizuri badala ya kuwaambia waache kufanya kitu fulani.

SourceText:
Let’s say you are visiting a friend, and your children are playing together. As they play, you notice that your child sometimes shares the toys and other times grabs the toy from her friend. Instead of saying: “stop grabbing that toy!” you could say: “give your friend a chance to play with the toy” 

It is easier for children to follow instructions that tell them what they should do, rather than what they shouldn’t do.
text:
Hembu tuseme unamtembelea rafiki, na watoto wako wanacheza pamoja. Wanapocheza utagundua kuwa mtoto wako wakati mwingine anachezea mdoli wake pamoja na mtoto mwingine na wakati mwingine anamnyang”anya mdoli rafiki yake. Badala ya kusema “acha kunyang”anya huyo mdoli”! Ungeweza kusema; “ mpe rafiki yako sasa achezee mdoli wako”
Ni rahisi kwa watoto kufuata maelekezo ya kuwaambia nini wanatakiwa kufanya, kuliko kuwaambia waache au kuwakataza kufanya jambo fulani.

SourceText: Need some convincing? Let’s do an exercise:
text: Unahitaji kuelezewa zaidi? Hembu tufanye zoezi:

SourceText:
DO NOT THINK ABOUT AN ELEPHANT.

What are you thinking about?
text:
USIFIKIRI KUHUSU TEMBO.

Unafikiri kuhusu nini?

SourceText:
You probably DID think about an elephant...

‘Don’t do’ instructions make children think about that thing.

Sometimes they do not understand what we DID want from them.

Also they often don’t like being told not to do things (just like most of us).
text:
Labda ulifikiria kuhusu Tembo…

Usifanye kwa vitendo maelekezo uliyoyatoa, fanya watoto wafikirie kuhusu kile kitu.

Wakati mwingine hawaelewi tulitaka nini kutoka kwao.

Pia mara nyingi hawapendi kuambiwa wasifanye vitu (ni kama ilivyo kwa wengi wetu).

SourceText:
NOW, THINK ABOUT A CHEETAH! 

What are you thinking about?
text:
SASA, FIKIRI KUHUSU DUMA!

Je, unafikiri kuhusu nini?

SourceText: That’s right - a cheetah! Positive, clear instructions help children focus on what they should be doing.
text: Hiyo ni sawa duma! Maelekezo ya wazi na yenye tija yanasaidia watoto kufatilia kile wanachotakiwa kufanya.

SourceText:
Before, I used to raise my children the way I was raised: I would tell them “don’t do this, don’t do that.” We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learnt about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my children. It took time to learn to say “please do this” instead of “don’t do this.” 

My children and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done.
text:
Kabla, nilizoea kulea watoto wangu kwa namna ambayo nililelewa: Niliwaambia “usifanye hivi, usifanye vile.” Tulizoea kugombana mno, lakini mambo yamebadilika kweli nilipojifunza kuhusu kutoa maelekezo yenye tija.

Sasa nazingatia tabia ninayotaka kuiona, na kutoa maelekezo rahisi na ya wazi kwa watoto wangu. Ilichukua muda kujifunza kusema “tafadhali fanya hili” badala ya “usifanye hili”
Watoto wangu na hata mume wangu wananiambia kwamba wanapenda namna hii ya kufanya vitu, kwa sababu sasa wanajua nini kinatakiwa kufanyika.

SourceText:
**Use praise to encourage positive behaviour**
If we praise our children when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!
text:
**Tumia sifa kuhimiza tabia nzuri**
Kama tunasifia watoto wetu wanapofanya vizuri, tutawaona wakifanya vitu vyenye tija zaidi na zaidi!

SourceText: Sometimes it is hard to think of what to praise your child for! Here are some ideas from other parents:
text: Wakati mwingine ni ngumu kufikiria kitu cha kumsifia mtoto wako! Haya ni baadhi ya mawazo kutoka kwa wazazi wengine:

SourceText: Ideas for praise:
text: Mawazo ya namna ya kumsifia mtoto wako:

SourceText:
Being kind to someone 
Sharing their toys
Packing away their things 
Saying 'please' or 'thank you' 
Helping out around the house
Listening
text:
Kuwa mwema kwa mtu flani
Kutumia midoli yao pamoja na wengine
Kupanga vitu vyao
Kusema “ tafadhali” au “asante”
Kusaidia kazi za nyumbani
Kusikiliza

SourceText: **Question time:**
text: **Muda wa maswali:**

SourceText: Think about the last time someone thanked you, or said you did something great.
text: Kumbuka mara ya mwisho mtu alipokushukuru, au kusema umefanya jambo zuri sana.

SourceText: How did it make you feel?
text: Ulijisikiaje?

SourceText: Loved
text: Kupendwa

SourceText: Valued
text: Kuthaminiwa

SourceText: Parents usually do not get thanked or praised enough.
text: Mara nyingi wazazi hawashukuriwi au kusifiwa vya kutosha.

SourceText: How does it make you feel when nobody says "thank you"?
text: Je, unajisikiaje usipoambiwa "asante" na mtu yeyote?

SourceText: Tired
text: Kuchoka

SourceText: Your child can feel this way too. That's what makes this week's parenting tool simple but important: Praise them for what they do right.
text: Mtoto wako anaweza kujiskia hivi pia, Hili ndilo linafanya zana ya malezi ya wiki hii kuwa ya kawaida lakini muhimu. Wasifie kwa kile wanachofanya vizuri.

SourceText: Let’s look at a story to see how you can use praise and positive attention to encourage your child to follow instructions:
text: Hembu tuangalie hadithi kuona jinsi unavyoweza kutumia sifa na umakini wenye tija kuhimiza mtoto wako kufuata maelekezo:

SourceText: It’s so lovely to see you playing so nicely together, @data.characters.f3_girl.name and @data.characters.f3_boy_wheelchair.name. In five minutes it will be time to come inside and wash up.
text: Inapendeza sana kuona mnavyocheza vizuri pamoja, @data.characters.f3_girl.name and @data.characters.f3_boy_wheelchair.name. Ndani ya dakika tano itakuwa ni muda wa kuingia ndani na kuoga.

SourceText: What does the caregiver do before she informs her children that they will have to stop playing in five minutes’ time? She first brings attention to their positive behaviour of playing nicely together. This is a clever way to make it easier for the children to accept the next instruction.
text: Je, mlezi anafanya nini kabla ya kuwajulisha watoto wake kwamba wataacha kucheza ndani ya dakika tano? Kwanza ataweka umakini kwenye tabia yao nzuri ya kucheza vizuri pamoja. Hii ni njia ya kijanja kufanya watoto wakubali maelekezo yanayofuata.

SourceText: Catch!
text: Kamata!

SourceText: Let’s reflect on the children’s perspective:
text: Hembu tutafakari juu ya mtazamo wa mtoto:

SourceText: The children are having fun playing in the garden. They might not want to stop playing in five minutes’ time. If their mother came out and told them to come inside immediately (instead of giving them some warning), they may have found it difficult to listen and do what she asked.
text: Watoto wanafurahia kucheza kwenye bustani. Huenda hawataki kuacha kucheza ndani ya dakika tano. Ikiwa mama yao angetoka na kuwaambia waingie ndani mara moja ( badala ya kuwapa onyo) Huenda wangepata ugumu wa kusikiliza na kufanya kile alichowambia.

SourceText: @data.characters.f3_girl.name, @data.characters.f3_boy_wheelchair.name - it’s time to put the ball away and come inside now.
text: @data.characters.f3_girl.name, @data.characters.f3_boy_wheelchair.name - ni wakati wa kuweka mpira kando na kuingia ndani sasa.

SourceText: The caregiver uses her children’s names so that she makes sure they will pay attention to what she is saying. She tells them exactly what she wants them to do. This makes it easier for her children to follow her instructions.
text: Mlezi hutumia majina ya watoto wake ili kuhakikisha wanakuwa makini na anachokisema. Huwaambia kwa usahihi kile ambacho anataka wafanye. Hii inafanya iwe rahisi kwa watoto wake kufuata maelekezo yake.

SourceText: Thank you for coming inside when I asked you to. Please go wash your hands and then I will tell you a story.
text: Asante kwa kuja ndani pale nilipowaambia mje. Tafadhali nendeni mkanawe mikono yenu na halafu nitawasimulia hadithi.

SourceText: Let’s reflect on the caregiver’s actions:
text: Hembu tutafakari juu ya vitendo vya mlezi:

SourceText: The caregiver praises her children for their positive behaviour before giving them another instruction. As parents I’m sure some of you are thinking: why should I praise my child for just doing the basic things that they should be doing?! That’s a normal thought to have. But praise actually helps you as a parent and can make your life easier. By praising her children before giving them a new instruction, the children are more likely to listen and do what the caregiver is asking.
text: Mlezi anawasifia watoto wake kwa tabia nzuri kabla ya kuwapa maelekezo mengine. Kama wazazi, nina hakika baadhi yenu mnafikiria kwanini nimsifie mtoto wangu kwaajili tu ya kufanya mambo ya msingi ambayo anatakiwa ayafanye? Hayo ni mawazo ya kawaida kuwa nayo. Lakini kusifia kimsingi inakusaidia wewe kama mzazi na inaweza kufanya maisha yako yawe rahisi. Kwa kuwasifia watoto wake kabla ya kuwapa maelekezo mapya, Watoto wanaelekea kusikiliza na kufanya kile ambacho mlezi anawaambia.

SourceText: Thank you for washing up so nicely. Let’s sit down and read a story together.
text: Asante kwa kunawa vizuri. Hebu tukae chini na tusome hadithi pamoja.

SourceText: Let’s reflect:
text: Hembu tutafakari:

SourceText: By using clear, positive instructions and praise to encourage her children, this caregiver successfully managed to get her children to stop their game, come inside and wash their hands. This happened without threats, screaming, tears or tantrums. By reinforcing the praise with a simple reward - like reading a story together - she helps her children to follow instructions more easily in the future.
text: Kwa kutumia maelekezo ya wazi na mazuri na kusifia watoto wake, huyu mlezi anafanikiwa kuwafanya watoto wake waache mchezo wao na waende ndani na kuosha mikono yao. Hii ilitokea bila vitisho, kukaripia, machozi au hasira. Kwa kuimarisha kusifia na kwa zawadi ndogo - kama kusoma hadithi pamoja - huwasaidia watoto wake kufuata maelekezo kirahisi zaidi hapo baadae.

SourceText: Remember that what gets light will grow!
text: Kumbuka kwamba kinachopata mwanga kitakua!

SourceText: Positive instead of negative attention works much better to encourage children to behave the way we want them to.
text: Badala ya umakini mbaya, umakini mzuri hufanya kazi vizuri zaidi kuwatia moyo watoto wawe na tabia ile ambayo tunataka wawe nayo.

SourceText: Book activities are a great opportunity to give your child positive attention.
text: Shughuli za kitabu ni njia nzuri inayompa mtoto wako fursa chanya na ya umakini.

SourceText: Here are some ideas for how you can create positive interactions during book activities:
text: Haya ni baadhi ya mawazo kwaajili ya jinsi unavyoweza kutumia shughuli za vitabu kuungana:

SourceText: As you go through the book together, respond to what your child is saying in a positive and enthusiastic way.
text: Mnapopitia kitabu pamoja, mjibu mtoto wako kwa kile anachosema kwa njia nzuri na kwa shauku.

SourceText:
Using positive responses such as “great”, “well done”, “that’s right”, “yes, tell me more”, “let’s try”, “how about” or “let’s see” during book activities will encourage your child to feel confident to interact with the book and with you. 
When you speak in a positive and enthusiastic way, your child will feel excited and will be eager to learn from the book and the story.
text:
Kutumia majibu chanya kama vile ‘nzuri”, “ umefanya vizuri”, “ hiyo ni sawa”, “ndio, niambie zaidi”, “hembu tujaribu”, “ vipi kuhusu” au “ hembu tuone” wakati wa shughuli za kitabu itamtia moyo mtoto na kumfanya ajisikie jasiri kuchangamana na kitabu na wewe.
Unapozungumza vizuri na kwa shauku, mtoto wako atajisikia furaha na atakuwa na hamu kujifunza kutoka kwenye kitabu na hadithi.

SourceText: Avoid being critical or negative.
text: Epuka kuwa mkosoaji na kutokukubaliana.

SourceText: Being critical will discourage your child from speaking or engaging in the activity.
text: Kuwa mkosoaji kutamkatisha tamaa mtoto wako katika kuongea au kushiriki kwenye shughuli.

SourceText:
Book activities do not have to be serious. It is about sharing the book in a way that you and your child will enjoy, not about being strict or being right. 
So, if your child makes a mistake, avoid being critical or negative. You don’t have to be hard on your child, or make fun of them when they don’t know something.
When your child points to a picture and calls it the wrong name – for example pointing to a tomato and calling it an apple, all you need to do is respond with the correct word. Instead of saying “no, that is wrong! How can you say that’s an apple?!” just respond by saying “that’s a tomato” This will help them learn the correct word, without making them feel discouraged to try again.
text:
Shughuli za kitabu hazihitaji kuzichukulia kwa uzito. Inahusu tu kushirikishana kitabu kwa jinsi ambayo wewe na mtoto wako mtafurahia, haihusiani na kuwa mkali au kuwa sahihi. Hivyo, kama mtoto wako anafanya makosa, epuka kuwa mkosoaji au kuwa tofauti naye. Hutakiwi kumuwekea mtoto wako vikwazo. Au kumfanyia mzaha pale anapokuwa hajui kitu fulani.
Mtoto wako anapoonesha picha na kuiita jina ambalo si sahihi - kwa mfano kuonesha nyanya na kuiita ni tofaa/epo, unachohitaji kufanya ni kuitikia kwa neno sahihi. Badala ya kusema "hapana, hiyo si sawa! Unawezaje kusema hilo ni tofaa/epo?!" itikia kwa kusema "hiyo ni nyanya" Hii itamsaidia kujifunza neno sahihi, bila kumfanya ajisikie kuvunjika moyo kujaribu tena.

SourceText:
Three easy ways to use book activities to create positive interactions:
1. Respond in a positive way to what your child is saying
2. Avoid being critical or negative
3. Praise your child’s efforts.
text:
Njia tatu za kutumia shughuli za kitabu kutengeneza mahusiano chanya

1. Itikia kwa njia chanya kile mtoto wako anachosema
2. Epuka kuwa mkosoaji au kutofautiana naye
3. Sifia juhudi za mtoto wako.

SourceText: Kindness and praise help children feel safe and confident, which helps them learn.
text: Ukarimu na kusifia kunasaidia watoto kujiskia salama na jasiri, kitu ambacho kinawasaidia kujifunza.

SourceText:
Small actions, big results! Parents who practice at home get better results.

For your home practice:
🤝 Find opportunities to give your child positive attention every day.
📖 Share books with your child in a fun and positive way.
😌 Remember to praise yourself too for your hard work as a parent.
text:
Vitendo vidogo, matokeo makubwa, wazazi wanaofanya mazoezi nyumbani hupata matokeo makubwa.
🤝 Tafuta fursa za kumpa mtoto wako umakini kila siku.
📖 Shirikishana vitabu na mtoto wako katika njia ya kufurahisha na nzuri.
😌 Kumbuka kujisifia wewe mwenyewe pia kwa kazi nzuri unayoifanya kama mlezi.

SourceText: Why EXPLORE
text: Kwanini KUCHUNGUZA

SourceText: How to EXPLORE
text: Jinsi ya KUCHUNGUZA

SourceText: The power of EXPLORE
text: Nguvu ya KUCHUNGUZA

SourceText: Using books to EXPLORE
text: Kutumia Vitabu KUCHUNGUZA

SourceText: Body Scan
text: Uchunguzi wa mwili

SourceText:
Here is an activity to relax your body: 

Sit comfortably and close your eyes if you can. 
Imagine a golden ring scanning your body from your feet to your head.  
Pay attention as it moves up and down your body. Are there any areas that feel tense? Numb? Painful?  
Focus on those areas for a moment. Breathe into the area and, when you breathe out, try to let go of any tension or pain.  
Do this for a few breaths.  

Open your eyes. How does your body feel now?

You can also try this next time you find yourself lying in bed unable to sleep!
text:
Hapa kuna shughuli ya kupumzisha mwili wako:

Kaa kwa utulivu halafu ufumbe macho yako ukiweza.
Vuta picha kuwa pete ya dhahabu inauchunguza mwili wako kuanzia unyayoni hadi utosini.
Sikiliza kwa makini pindi inapojongea kwenda juu na chini ya mwili wako. Je, kuna maeneo yoyote yaliyokakamaa? Yaliyo na ganzi? Yaliyo na maumivu?
Tulia kwenye maeneo hayo kwa muda. Vutia pumzi kwenye eneo hilo na, unaposhusha pumzi, jaribu kuachilia hali yoyote ya kukakamaa au ya maumivu.
Fanya hivi kwa kuvuta pumzi kadhaa.

Fumbua macho yako. Je, mwili wako unahisije sasa?

Unaweza pia kujaribu hii wakati mwingine unapojikuta umelala kitandani huwezi kupata usingizi!

SourceText: Well done! You have completed the ParentApp modules, building important skills to take care of yourself and your family.
text: Umefanya vizuri! Umekamilisha mada za Programu ya Malezi, ukijenga ujuzi muhimu wa kujitunza wewe na familia yako.

SourceText: Listen to your congratulations message:
text: Sikiliza ujumbe wako wa pongezi:

SourceText:
Greetings parents! 
Congratulations on completing the ParentApp modules! This is a huge achievement. It shows such care for your family, and for yourself. 
Today we are celebrating and reflecting on our journey together. 
Let’s take a look at what we have learnt and how you can continue using the ParentApp skills and tools.
text:
Salamu wazazi! 
Hongera kwa kukamilisha mada ya Programu ya Wazazi ya Malezi! Haya ni mafanikio makubwa. Inaonyesha kujijali wewe mwenyewe na familia yako. 
Leo tunasherehekea na kutafakari safari yetu pamoja. 
Hebu tutazame ambacho tumejifunza na jinsi unavyoweza kuendelea kutumia ujuzi na zana za Programu ya Wazazi ya Malezi.

SourceText: You and your family have learnt so much. Let’s think back and see what has changed:
text: Wewe na familia yako mmejifunza mengi sana. Wacha tufikirie na tuone kilichobadilika:

SourceText: Listen and reflect:
text: Sikiliza na utafakari:

SourceText:
Close your eyes and relax. 
Think of your family life before you started your journey with this app. How did you manage your stress? How did you spend time with your child? 
Now, think of where you are today. How do you take care of yourself now? How has your relationship with your child changed? How do you support your child to play and learn?
Notice all the new things you have learned. Notice how these changes have made a positive impact on your life.
text:
Fumba macho yako na pumzika.
Fikiria juu ya maisha ya familia yako kabla ya ulipoanza safari na programu hii. Uliwezaje kushughulikia msongo wa mawazo? Ulitumiaje muda na mtoto wako?
Sasa, fikiria upo wapi leo. Unajitunzaje wewe mwenyewe sasa? Ni kwa namna gani uhusiano wako na mtoto wako umebadilika? Ni kwa jinsi gani unamsaidia mtoto wako kucheza na kujifunza? Zingatia mambo yote mapya uliyojifunza. Angalia ni kwa jinsi gani mabadiliko haya yameleta matokeo mazuri kwenye maisha yako.

SourceText: How do you feel about what you have learnt and the changes you made?
text: Unajiskiaje kuhusu ulichojifunza na mabadiliko uliyoyafanya?

SourceText: Wonderful! Keep celebrating these successes and remember that every step forward – big or small - is something to be proud of.
text: Safi! Endelea kusherehekea mafanikio haya na kumbuka kwamba kila hatua mbele - kubwa au ndogo - ni kitu cha kujivunia.

SourceText: We understand – making changes can take time. You can always revisit the modules in the app – sometimes looking back can spark new ideas.
text: Tunaelewa - kufanya mabadiliko kunaweza kuchukua muda. Daima unaweza kiutembelea tena mada katika programu wakati mwingine kurudia kuangalia nyuma inaweza kuleta mawazo mapya.

SourceText: Thank you for being honest. Change can be challenging and facing obstacles is normal. The fact that you are reflecting on this shows your dedication as a parent.
text: Asante kwa kuwa mkweli. Mabadiliko yanaweza kuwa ni changamoto na kukutana na vikwazo ni kawaida. Kitendo cha wewe kutafakari juu ya hili kunaonyesha kujitolea kama mzazi.

SourceText: During this journey, we shared ideas for how to care for yourself. Here’s a reminder:
text: Katika safari hii, tulishirikishana mawazo ya jinsi ya kujijali. Hapa unakumbushwa:

SourceText: Taking a pause helps us to feel calmer in stressful moments.
text: Kuchukua pumziko inatusaidia kujiskia kutulia tunapokuwa na msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText: Be kind to yourself
text: Uwe mwema kwako mwenyewe

SourceText: Being a parent can be hard. Show yourself kindness and remind yourself of what you can be proud of.
text: Kuwa mzazi inaweza kuwa ngumu. Jitendee wema wewe mwenyewe na ujikumbushe kile unachoweza kujivunia.

SourceText: Connect with others - you are not alone.
text: Ungana na wengine - hauko peke yako.

SourceText: Don’t hesitate to reach out for support when you need it. Sharing challenges with trusted people can lighten your emotional load and help you find solutions.
text: Usiogope kutafuta msaada unapohitaji. Kuwashirikisha changamoto watu unaowaamini inaweza kupunguza mzigo wa kihisia na kukusaidia kupata suluhisho.

SourceText: Remember that caring for others starts with caring for yourself.
text: Kumbuka kwamba kujali wengine kunaanza na kujijali mwenyewe.

SourceText: Have you managed to take care of yourself?
text: Umeweza kujijali mwenyewe?

SourceText: Well done! It takes real strength to recognize that caring for yourself isn’t selfish-it’s what lets you show up as the parent you want to be.
text: Umefanya vizur! Inahitaji nguvu ya kweli kutambua kwamba kujijali si ubinafsi-ni jambo linalokuwezesha kukuonyesha unataka kuwa mzazi wa namna gani..

SourceText: No
text: Hapana

SourceText: That’s okay – we know how hard it can be. Self-care isn’t about perfection; it’s about small moments that add up over time. So keep going.
text: Hiyo ni sawa- Tunajua jinsi inavyoweza kuwa ngumu. Kujijali sio ukamilifu; Ni kuhusu muda mfupi ambao huongezeka kwenye muda wako. Kwa hiyo endelea.

SourceText: Make time to **connect** with your child one-on-one. Focus on them and show interest in what they are doing or saying.
text: Tenga muda **kuungana** na mtoto wako ana kwa ana. Zingatia na onyesha kuvutiwa na kile wanachofanya au kusema.

SourceText: **Create** a positive environment for your child. Use praise to encourage the behaviour you want to see more of.
text: **Tengeneza** mazingira rafiki kwaajili ya mtoto wako. Msifie kumtia moyo kwa tabia ambazo unataka kuziona zaidi.

SourceText: **Play** is the best way for children to learn. Join your child in their play and have fun together.
text: **Kucheza** ni njia bora kwa watoto kujifunza. Ungana na watoto wako kwenye michezo yao na mfurahie pamoja.

SourceText: Let’s take a look at some of the powerful parenting skills we discussed:
text: Hebu tuangalie baadhi ya juzi za malezi zenye nguvu tulizojadili::

SourceText: Remember that words are powerful. **Talk** to your child to help them understand. Talk with kindness.
text: Kumbuka kwamba maneno yana nguvu. **Zungumza** na mtoto wako ili kumsaidia kuelewa. Zungumza kwa wema.

SourceText: Help your child **build** the skills they need to cope with challenges. Talk about feelings and model healthy ways of coping.
text: Msaidie mtoto wako **kujenga** ujuzi anaohitaji ili kukubaliana na changamoto. Zungumza kuhusu hisia na uige njia zenye afya za kukubaliana.

SourceText: Support your child to **explore** and learn from the world around them. Come up with solutions to problems together.
text: Msaidie mtoto wako **Kuchunguza** na kujifunza kutoka kwenye ulimwengu unaomzunguka. Tafuteni suluhisho la matatizo kwa pamoja.

SourceText: Watch this video for a reminder of how the elements in the garden reflect important parenting tools:
text: Tazama video hii kukukumbusha jinsi vipengele kwenye bustani vinaonyesha zana muhimu za malezi:

SourceText: During this journey, we shared many ideas for using books and stories to help children learn.
text: Wakati wa safari hii, tulishirikisha mawazo mengi ya kutumia vitabu na hadithi kuwasaidia watoto kujifunza.

SourceText: Use books to CONNECT
text: Tumia vitabu KUUNGANA

SourceText: Make book activities part of your routine, and use it as a time to spend quality time together.
text: Fanya shughuli za kitabu kuwa sehemu ya utaratibu wako, na uutumie kama muda wa kutumia wakati mzuri pamoja.

SourceText: Use books to CREATE positive experiences
text: Tumia vitabu KUTENGENEZA uzoefu mzuri

SourceText: Respond in a positive way to what your child is saying and avoid being critical.
text: Jibu kwa njia nzuri kwa kile mtoto wako anachosema na epuka kuwa mkosoaji.

SourceText: Use books to PLAY
text: Tumia vitabu KUCHEZA

SourceText: Make book activities fun by using a playful voice, and mimic sounds and actions from the story.
text: Fanya shughuli za kitabu zifurahishe kwa kutumia sauti ya kucheza, na uige sauti na vitendo kutoka kwenye hadithi.

SourceText: Let’s revisit some of the main ideas for learning through books:
text: Hebu tupitie upya baadhi ya mawazo muhimu ya kujifunza kwa njia ya vitabu:

SourceText: Use books to TALK
text: Tumia vitabu KUZUNGUMZA

SourceText: Name and describe what you see in the pictures, ask questions and listen to what your child shares.
text: Taja na ueleze kile unachokiona kwenye picha, uliza maswali na usikilize kile ambacho mtoto wako anashirikisha.

SourceText: Use books to BUILD life skills
text: Tumia vitabu KUJENGA stadi za maisha

SourceText: Use stories to discuss different feelings, experiences and actions. Reflect on what happened in the story and what you have learned.
text: Tumia hadithi kujadili hisia, uzoefu na vitendo tofauti. Tafakari juu ya kile kilichotokea katika hadithi na kile ulichojifunza.

SourceText: Use books to EXPLORE
text: Kutumia Vitabu KUCHUNGUZA

SourceText: Explore different ideas and learn about the world by asking questions about the story. Explore differences and similarities between what you see in the book and your child’s life.
text: Chunguza mawazo tofauti na ujifunze kuhusu ulimwengu kwa kuuliza maswali kuhusu hadithi. Chunguza tofauti na mfanano kati ya kile unachokiona kwenye kitabu na maisha ya mtoto wako.

SourceText: Completing the ParentApp modules is only the starting point. Real success comes from continuing to use what you’ve learned in daily life.
text: Kukamilisha mada za Programu ya wazazi ya malezi ndio sehemu ya kuanzia. Mafanikio ya kweli huja kwa kuendelea kutumia yale uliyojifunza katika maisha ya kila siku.

SourceText: To build on what you are already doing, here are three tips to keep going:
text: Ili kuendeleza kile ambacho tayari unafanya, hapa kuna vidokezo vitatu vya kuendelea:

SourceText: Keep in touch
text: Endelea kuwasiliana

SourceText: Keep in touch with other parents. Meet regularly, call or text to give each other parenting support.
text: Endelea kuwasiliana na wazazi wengine. Kutana mara kwa mara, piga simu au tuma ujumbe ili kupeana msaada wa malezi.

SourceText: Use the power of routine
text: Tumia nguvu ya ratiba ya kawaida

SourceText: Make time in your daily or weekly schedule for quality time with your child.
text: Tenga muda katika ratiba yako ya kila siku au ya wiki kwa muda bora na mtoto wako.

SourceText: Make an IDEAS box
text: Tengeneza sanduku cha MAONI

SourceText: On pieces of paper, write down some of your favorite ParentApp relax, read or play activities. When you feel stuck, reach into the box and grab an idea!
text: Kwenye vipande vya karatasi, andika baadhi ya shughuli unazopenda za Programu ya Wazazi ya malezi ya kupumzika, kusoma au kucheza. Unapohisi kukwama, fika kwenye kisanduku na uchukue wazo!

SourceText: Pause to Respond
text: Simama kwa muda ili ujibu

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Do your children ever make you feel like screaming? 

Give yourself a 10-second pause. Breathe in and out slowly 5 times. 

Then try responding in a calmer way.

Millions of parents say this helps – A LOT.
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Je, watoto wako huwa wanakufanya utake kufoka?

Jipumzishe kwa sekunde 10. Vuta pumzi ndani na nje taratibu mara 5.

Kisha jaribu kujibu kwa utulivu zaidi.

Mamilioni ya wazazi wanasema hii inasaidia - SANA.

SourceText: Taking a moment for YOU makes a big difference for everyone!
text: Kuchukua muda kwa ajili yako mwenyewe huleta mabadiliko makubwa kwa kila mtu!

SourceText: Great that today is going well! What is one thing that has gone well today? Remember to praise yourself for it.
text: Ni jambo zuri sana kwamba siku ya leo inaenda vizuri! Je, ni jambo gani moja ambalo limeenda vizuri leo? Kumbuka kujisifia kwa hilo.

SourceText: Every day has its good and hard parts. Praise yourself for everything you have done so far – you are amazing.
text: Kila siku ina nyakati zake nzuri na ngumu. Jisifu kwa kila kitu ambacho umefanya hadi sasa – uko vizuri sana.

SourceText: Sorry to hear you are feeling difficult feelings today. Well done for recognising those emotions and trying to be calm and kind to yourself. You are setting a great example for your family.
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kuwa leo unajisikia vibaya. Hongera kwa kutambua hisia hizo, na kujaribu kuwa mtulivu na kuwa mwema kwako mwenyewe. Unaweka mfano mzuri kwa familia yako.

SourceText:
Dealing with challenges is a part of life. 

Parents can help children **BUILD** the skills they need to cope when life gets tough.
text:
Kukabiliana na changamoto ni sehemu ya maisha.

Wazazi wanaweza kuwasaidia watoto **KUJENGA** ujuzi wanaohitaji ili kustahimili maisha yanapokuwa magumu.

SourceText: Life is challenging and ever changing. As parents, our job is not to remove all obstacles or problems from our children’s lives. Instead, we can create a kind and supportive environment where we show our children that it is okay to make mistakes, and where we help them to manage stress and frustration in healthy ways. This allows children to feel more confident in their ability to deal with difficult circumstances.
text: Maisha yana changamoto na yanabadilika kila wakati. Kama wazazi, kazi yetu si kuondoa vikwazo au matatizo yote katika maisha ya watoto wetu. Badala yake, tunaweza kutengeneza mazingira rafiki na ya kuunga mkono ambapo tunawaonyesha watoto wetu kwamba ni sawa kufanya makosa, na ambapo tunawasaidia kuzuia msongo wa mawazo na kuchanganyikiwa kwa njia zinazofaa. Hii inaruhusu watoto kujisikia ujasiri zaidi katika uwezo wao wa kukabiliana na hali ngumu.

SourceText: Let’s see how **building coping skills** forms part of the garden image.
text: Hebu tuone ambavyo **ujenzi wa ujuzi wa kukabiliana** yanavyounda sehemu ya taswira ya bustani.

SourceText: Young plants need protection and support to grow into strong plants that can survive droughts or storms. In the same way, parents can help their children build the skills they need to cope with challenges.
text: Mimea midogo inahitaji ulinzi na usaidizi ili kukua na kuwa mimea yenye nguvu ambayo inaweza kustahimili ukame au dhoruba. Vivyo hivyo, wazazi wanaweza kuwasaidia watoto wao kujenga ujuzi wanaohitaji ili kukabiliana na changamoto.

SourceText: Gardeners can’t control the weather, but there are things they can do to protect their plants and help them recover after a storm. In the same way, you can help your child to build the skills they need to cope with challenging circumstances. When parents use positive coping skills in their own lives, children learn to do the same. And when children feel safe and supported by their parents, they are able to face challenges and overcome setbacks with more confidence.
text: Watunzaji wa bustani hawawezi kudhibiti hali ya hewa, lakini kuna mambo ambayo wanaweza kufanya ili kulinda mimea yao na kuisaidia kupona baada ya dhoruba. Vivyo hivyo, unaweza kumsaidia mtoto wako kujenga ujuzi anaohitaji ili kukabiliana na hali ngumu. Wazazi wanapotumia stadi nzuri za kukabiliana na hali zao za maisha, watoto hujifunza kufanya vivyo hivyo. Na watoto wanapojiskia kuwa salama na kuungwa mkono na wazazi wao, wanaweza kukabiliana na matatizo na kushinda vikwazo kwa kujiamini zaidi.

SourceText: Here are some ideas for helping children build the skills they need to cope with challenges.
text: Haya hapa ni baadhi ya mawazo ya kuwasaidia watoto kujenga ujuzi wanaohitaji ili kukabiliana na changamoto.

SourceText:
**Talk about feelings**
 Noticing and talking about feelings help children learn to express and manage their emotions – even the difficult ones.
text:
**Mazungumzo kuhusu hisia**
Kutambua na kuzungumza kuhusu hisia inasaidia watoto kujifunza kuonyesha na kushughulikia hisia zao - hata zile ngumu.

SourceText:
Use words to describe your and your child’s emotions, so they can learn to do the same. This may be hard at first, but it is an important step to help manage emotions. 
Describe how you see your child’s emotion in a calm way. For example:
“I notice you’re stomping your feet and talking loudly. What are you feeling?”
Share your own feelings with your child. For example: 
“I know I feel the same way when I can’t go out when I want to.”
This shows your child that it’s okay to share their feelings. They will learn to recognise emotions in themselves and others too.
text:
Tumia maneno kuelezea hisia zako na za mtoto wako, ili wajifunze kufanya hivyo. Hii inaweza kuwa ngumu mwanzoni, lakini ni hatua muhimu ya kuwasaidia kushughulikia hisia.
Elezea jinsi unavyoona hisia za mtoto wako kwa njia ya utulivu. Kwa mfano: "Ninaona unakanyaga miguu yako na kuzungumza kwa sauti kubwa. Unajiskiaje?" Mshirikishe mtoto wako hisia zako mwenyewe. Kwa mfano:
"Najua najiskia hivyo hivyo pale ninaposhindwa kutoka wakati ninapotaka."
Hii inamuonyesha mtoto wako kuwa ni sawa kushirikisha hisia zao. Watajifunza kutambua hisia zao na za watu wengine pia.

SourceText:
**Show them how**
 Children learn a lot by watching their parents. So, instead of telling your child how to cope with a challenging situation, show them with your own behaviours.
text:
**Waonyeshe ni jinsi gani**
Watoto hujifunza mengi kwa kutazama wazazi wao. Kwa hivyo, badala ya kumwambia mtoto wako jinsi ya kukabiliana na hali ngumu, waonyeshe kwa tabia zako mwenyewe.

SourceText: Listen for examples:
text: Sikiliza kwaajili ya mifano:

SourceText:
You are a powerful role-model for your child. When you demonstrate healthy ways to handle stress, frustration or big emotions in your own life, your child will learn to do the same. For example:
 When you feel overwhelmed, say out loud: “I’m feeling frustrated right now, so I’m going to take a few deep breaths to calm down.” This helps children see that strong emotions are normal and manageable.
 Or, after a stressful phone call, you might say: “That call made me feel stressed, so I’m going to go outside and listen to music on my phone to help myself feel better”. 
 Or, when you make a mistake, say, “That didn’t go as planned, but it’s okay. I can try again”
text:
Wewe ni mfano mzuri wa kuigwa kwa mtoto wako. Unapoonyesha njia nzuri za kushughulikia msongo wa mawazo, kuchanganyikiwa au hisia kubwa katika maisha yako, mtoto wako atajifunza kufanya vivyo hivyo. Kwa mfano:
Unapohisi kuelemewa, sema kwa sauti: “Ninahisi kuchanganyikiwa sasa hivi, kwa hiyo nitavuta pumzi kidogo ili nitulie.” Hii huwasaidia watoto kuona kwamba hisia kali ni za kawaida na zinaweza kukabiliwa.
Au, baada ya kupigiwa simu yenye kusababisha msongo wa mawazo, unaweza kusema: "Simu hiyo imeniletea msongo wa mawazo, kwa hivyo nitaenda nje na kusikiliza muziki kwenye simu yangu ili kunisaidia kujisikia vizuri". 
Au, unapofanya makosa, sema, "Hilo halikuenda kama ilivyopangwa, lakini ni sawa. Ninaweza kujaribu tena"

SourceText: Let’s see how @data.characters.f2_father.name supports @data.characters.f2_boy.name to overcome a challenging situation:
text: Hebu tuone ni namna gani @data.characters.f2_father.name humsaidia @data.characters.f2_boy.name kukabiliana na hali ya changamoto:

SourceText: Five kicks in a row! You seem really proud to have made it to five, Dennis!
text: Umepiga mara tano! Unaonekana kujivunia kweli kufanikiwa kufikia tano, Dennis!

SourceText: Let’s do 10!
text: Hebu tufanye kumi!

SourceText: Whoops! There goes our ball!
text: Oooooops! mpira wetu umeenda kule!

SourceText: Stupid ball! Now we can’t play anymore!
text: Mpira wa hovyo! Sasa hatuwezi kucheza zaidi!

SourceText: I can see your hands are in fists and that you are feeling angry about the ball @data.characters.f2_boy.name. I understand - you wanted to do more kicks, and now we don’t have a ball. It’s okay to feel upset.
text: Naweza kuona mikono yako umekunja ngumi na kwamba unajiskia hasira kuhusu mpira @data.characters.f2_boy.name. Naelewa - ulitaka kupiga zaidi, na sasa hatuna mpira. Ni sawa kujiskia kukasirika.
note: The string @data.characters.f2_boy.name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Let’s take a deep breath and go inside to drink some cold water. When the neighbours come home, we can go collect our ball from their garden.
text: Hebu tuvute pumzi ndefu na twende ndani tukanywe maji. Wakati Bwana (Mabula) atakaporudi nyumbani kwake, tutakwenda kuchukua mpira kwenye bustani yake.

SourceText: It can be hard when things don’t go our way. We all feel angry sometimes. Well done for taking a deep breath and coming inside. We will have another chance to play tomorrow.
text: Inaweza kuwa ngumu pale ambapo mambo hayaendi jinsi tunavyotaka. Sote tunajiskia hasira nyakati flani. Umefanya vizuri kwa kuvuta pumzi ndefu na kuja ndani. Tutapata nafasi nyingine ya kucheza kesho.

SourceText: Let’s talk this through together.
text: Hebu tuzungumzie hili pamoja

SourceText: How did @data.characters.f2_boy.name feel when he lost the ball?
text: @data.characters.f2_boy.name alijiskiaje alipopoteza mpira?
note: The string @data.characters.f2_boy.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Have another look at his facial expression and body language. He is frowning and his hands are in fists. He is feeling angry.
text: Angalia tena uso wa Dennis! na lugha ya mwili.Anakunja uso na amekunja ngumi mikono yake. Anajiskia hasira.

SourceText: Angry
text: Hasira

SourceText: Yes, he is feeling angry because he lost the ball and they had to stop playing.
text: Ndio, Dennis anajiskia hasira kwasababu amepoteza mpira na ilibidi waache kucheza

SourceText: What does @data.characters.f2_father.name do to support @data.characters.f2_boy.name?
text: @data.characters.f2_father.name anafanya nini kumsaidia @data.characters.f2_boy.name?

SourceText: He names the emotions that @data.characters.f2_boy.name is feeling
text: Anataja  hisia zile ambazo @data.characters.f2_boy.name anajiskia
note: The string @data.characters.f2_boy.name should not be translated.

SourceText: That’s right. By naming @data.characters.f2_boy.name’s emotions, @data.characters.f2_father.name helps @data.characters.f2_boy.name to learn to recognise these feelings in future. @data.characters.f2_father.name also normalizes how @data.characters.f2_boy.name feels and supports him to manage his feelings of anger.
text: Hiyo ni sawa. Kwa kutaja majina ya hisia za @data.characters.f2_boy.name, @data.characters.f2_father.name anamsaidia @data.characters.f2_boy.name kujifunza kutambua hisia hizo hapo baadae. @data.characters.f2_father.name pia aliifanya hali aliyoiskia @data.characters.f2_boy.name kuwa ya kawaida. na kumsaidia kushughulikia hisia za hasira.

SourceText: He blames @data.characters.f2_boy.name for what happened
text: Anamlaumu @data.characters.f2_boy.name kwa kilichotokea
note: The string @data.characters.f2_boy.name should not be translated.

SourceText: He does not get frustrated with @data.characters.f2_boy.name. He names and describes what @data.characters.f2_boy.name is feeling and tells him that he understands. He also normalizes these feelings and supports @data.characters.f2_boy.name to manage them.
text: Hakuchanganyikiwa na @data.characters.f2_boy.name. Alitaja na kuelezea alivyojiskia @data.characters.f2_boy.name na alimwambia kwamba anaelewa. Pia alizifanya hisia kuwa ni kawaida na anamsaidia @data.characters.f2_boy.name kuzishughulikia.

SourceText: He tells @data.characters.f2_boy.name that it’s okay to feel that way
text: Anamwambia @data.characters.f2_boy.name kwamba ni sawa kujiskia vile
note: The string @data.characters.f2_boy.name should not be translated.

SourceText: Yes. @data.characters.f2_father.name shows  @data.characters.f2_boy.name that all feelings – even difficult ones like anger – are normal to feel.
text: Ndio. @data.characters.f2_father.name anamuonyesha @data.characters.f2_boy.name kwamba ni kawaida kujiskia hisia zote - hata zile ngumu kama hasira.

SourceText: He helps @data.characters.f2_boy.name to manage his feelings
text: Anamsaidia @data.characters.f2_boy.name kushughulikia hisia zake
note: The string @data.characters.f2_boy.name should not be translated.

SourceText: That’s right. After @data.characters.f2_father.name helps @data.characters.f2_boy.name to recognise what he is feeling, he supports @data.characters.f2_boy.name to take a deep breath as a healthy way to manage his anger. @data.characters.f2_father.name also talks to @data.characters.f2_boy.name about it afterwards, to help him reflect and learn from the experience.
text: Hiyo ni sahihi. Baada ya @data.characters.f2_father.name kumsaidia @data.characters.f2_boy.name kutambua alivyokuwa anajiskia, anamsaidia kuchukua pumzi ndefu kama njia yenye afya kushughulikia hasira yake. Baadae @data.characters.f2_father.name pia anazungumza na @data.characters.f2_boy.name kuhusu hiyo yaliotokea ili kumsaidia kutafakari na kujifunza kutoka kwenye uzoefu.

SourceText:
Book activities offer many opportunities to help children learn key life skills. 

Here are some ideas for using books and stories to help children build their social and emotional skills.
text:
Shughuli za vitabu hutoa fursa nyingi za kuwasaidia watoto kujifunza stadi muhimu za maisha.

Haya hapa ni baadhi ya mawazo ya kutumia vitabu na hadithi ili kuwasaidia watoto, kujenga ujuzi wao wa kijamii na kihisia.

SourceText: Use stories to discuss different feelings, experiences and actions.
text: Tumia hadithi kujadili hisia, uzoefu na vitendo tofauti.

SourceText: This helps children better understand their own experiences, and the behaviours of others too.
text: Hii huwasaidia watoto kuelewa vyema uzoefu wao wenyewe, na tabia za wengine pia.

SourceText: Watch this video for an example of how you can use stories to build your child’s understanding of different emotions and behaviours.
text: Tazama video hii kama mfano wa jinsi unavyoweza kutumia hadithi kujenga uelewa wa mtoto wako kuhusu hisia na tabia tofauti.

SourceText:
Three easy ways to use book activities to build your child’s skills:
1. Talk about what the characters are feeling
2. Ask questions about what the characters are doing and why
3. Reflect together on the story and what you have learned
text:
Njia tatu rahisi za kutumia shughuli za vitabu kujenga stadi za maisha:
1. Zungumzia kuhusu wahusika wanavyojisikia
2. Uliza maswali kuhusu  wahusika wanafanya nini na  kwanini
3. Tafakari kile kilichotokea kwenye hadithi  na kile ulichojifunza.

SourceText:
Small actions, big results! Parents who practice at home get better results.

For your home practice:
🤝 Use challenging moments as an opportunity to model healthy coping skills.
📖 Use story books to learn about different feelings and actions.
😌 Setbacks and challenges are a normal part of life. Remember to be kind to yourself.
text:
Vitendo kidogo, matokeo makubwa! Wazazi wanaofanya mazoezi kwa vitendo nyumbani wanapata matokeo mazuri. Hii ni kwa mazoezi yako ya nyumbani:
🤝 Tumia nyakati zenye changamoto kama fursa ya kuiga ujuzi mzuri kiafya wa kukabiliana na hali hiyo.
📖Tumia hadithi kujifunza kuhusu hisia, mawazo na vitendo tofauti.
😌Vikwazo na changamoto ni vitu vya kawaida kwenye maisha. Kumbuka kujitendea wema wewe mwenyewe.
