SourceText: REFLECT
text: TAFAKARI

SourceText: Celebrate and reflect on everything you have learnt on your ParentApp journey.
text: Sheherekea na tafakari kila kitu ulichojifunza kwenye safari ya Programu ya wazazi ya malezi.

SourceText:
Well done for finishing the REFLECT module! 
Here is a song to celebrate you!
text:
Umefanya vizuri kumaliza mada ya KUTAFAKARI!
Huu ni wimbo wa kukusheherekea!

SourceText: Being a parent is stressful!
text: Kuwa mzazi inaleta msongo wa mawazo!

SourceText: When we feel stressed or overwhelmed, it can be difficult to look after ourselves, and our children.
text: Tunapopata msongo wa mawazo au kuelemewa, inaweza kuwa ngumu kujitunza sisi wenyewe na watoto wetu.

SourceText: That’s why every ParentApp module starts with a “Relax” activity to help you slow down and take a moment for yourself.
text: Ni kwasababu hiyo kila mada ya programu ya wazazi ya malezi inaanza na shughuli ya "kupumzika" kukusaidia kupunguza kasi na kupata muda kwaajili yako mwenyewe.

SourceText: Breathe to Three
text: Vuta pumzi mara Tatu

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Use the magic power of three to stay connected and relax.

Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.

Do you feel any different? Deep breathing helps our whole body and mind to calm down. 

Well done on taking a pause.
text:
Funga macho yako.
Tumia nguvu ya maajabu ya tatu kubaki kwenye muunganiko na pumzika.
Vuta pumzi ndani na uhesabu mpaka tatu 1,2,3
Toa pumzi nje na uhesabu mpaka tatu 1,2,3
Vuta pumzi ndani na uhesabu mpaka tatu 1,2,3
Toa pumzi nje na uhesabu mpaka tatu 1,2,3

Unaskia tofauti yoyote? Kuvuta pumzi kwa kina inasaidia mwili mzima na akili kutulia.

Umefanya vema kwa kutulia.

SourceText: Being a great parent also means taking time to care for yourself every day. It starts with recognising how you feel.
text: Kuwa mzazi mahiri pia humaanisha kupata wakati wa kujitunza kila siku. Inaanza na kutambua jinsi unavyojiskia.

SourceText: So good to hear you are feeling well today. You are incredible!
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa unajisikia vizuri leo. Uko vizuri!

SourceText: We all have days where we just don’t know. That is okay! You are here and that is what matters.
text: Sisi sote tuna siku ambazo hatuzielewi. Hiyo ni sawa! Uko hapa na hicho ndicho cha muhimu.

SourceText: Being a parent can be hard. But you are here and that shows you want to keep improving things. That is a big accomplishment already!
text: Kuwa mzazi inaweza kuwa ngumu. Lakini uko hapa na hiyo inaonyesha kuwa unataka kuendelea kuboresha mambo. Hayo ni mafanikio makubwa tayari!

SourceText: Well done for starting your ParentApp journey, it’s good to have you here.
text: Umefanya vizuri kuanza safari yako ya Programu ya wazazi ya malezi ya watoto, Ni jambo jema kuwa na wewe hapa.

SourceText: Listen to your welcome message:
text: Sikiliza ujumbe wako wa ukaribisho:

SourceText:
A very warm welcome to you - dear parent! We are thrilled that you have decided to join our community of caregivers. The fact that you are using ParentApp right now means that your children, their wellbeing and development is important to you. The aim of this app is to guide and support you in your important role as a parent. 

As parents ourselves, we know how hard parenting can be - how tired, frustrated and overwhelmed we all sometimes feel. 

We know that an app can’t solve all your problems, but we hope that ParentApp can make you feel slightly less alone, and make things feel just a little bit easier and more manageable.
text:
Karibu sana - mpendwa mzazi! Tumefurahi sana kwa kuwa umeamua kujiunga kwenye jumuiya yetu ya wazazi. Ni kweli kwamba unatumia Programu ya wazazi ya malezi sasa, hii inamaanisha kuwa ustawi na maendeleo ya watoto wako ni muhimu kwako. Lengo la programu hii ni kukuongoza na kukusaidia katika jukumu hili muhimu kama mzazi.

Sisi wenyewe kama wazazi, tunajua jinsi ambavyo suala zima la malezi linavyoweza kuwa gumu - la kuchosha, la kuchanganya na wakati mwingine la kuelemea.

Tunajua kwamba programu haiwezi kutatua matatizo yako yote, ila tunatarajia programu inaweza kufanya mambo yawe rahisi kidogo na kuyadhibiti zaidi.

SourceText: Yes, let’s go!
text: Ndio, twende!

SourceText: Great! Let’s take a look at what you can expect from ParentApp.
text: Vizuri! hebu tuangalie nini unategemea kwenye programu ya wazazi ya malezi ya watoto.

SourceText: Not yet – I have questions…
text: Bado - Nina maswali…

SourceText: We understand! Let’s first take a look at what you can expect from ParentApp.
text: Tunaelewa! Hebu tuangalie kwanza nini unakitegemea kutoka programu ya wazazi ya malezi ya watoto.

SourceText: ParentApp for Kids includes 7 core modules. Each module focuses on a specific parenting strategy to support you in your important role as a parent.
text: Programu ya wazazi ya malezi ya watoto inajumuisha mada 7 za msingi. Kila mada huzingatia mbinu maalum kukusaidia wewe kwenye kazi yako muhimu kama mzazi.

SourceText:
Every ParentApp module will support you to:
1. build a strong relationship with your child
2. use books and stories to boost your child’s learning
3. take care of yourself
text:
Kila mada ya programu ya wazazi ya malezi ya watoto itakusaidia:
1. Kujenga uhusiano imara na mtoto wako
2. Kutumia vitabu na hadithi kupandisha kujifunza kwa mtoto wako
3. Kujijali wewe mwenyewe

SourceText:
One of the main goals of ParentApp for Kids is to help you build a strong and loving relationship with your child. Strong relationships with parents set children up for success in life. That’s why ParentApp offers tried and tested parenting tools to support you in your role as a parent.  

We know how important your child is to you, and that you want the very best for them. That’s why ParentApp has a digital library with books and guidance for how to use them to help your child learn. 

Lastly: because we know how important YOU are to your children, ParentApp supports you to take care of yourself too.
text:
Moja ya malengo makuu ya Programu ya wazazi ya malezi ya watoto ni kukusaidia kujenga uhusiano wa upendo na imara na mtoto wako. Mahusiano imara na wazazi huleta mafanikio kwenye maisha ya watoto. Na kwasababu hiyo Programu ya wazazi inatoa zana za malezi zilizojaribiwa na kupimwa kukusaidia wewe katika kazi  yako kama mzazi.

Tunajua  jinsi ambavyo mtoto wako alivyo muhimu sana kwako, ma kwamba unamtakia mema zaidi. Ndio maana Programu ya wazazi ina maktaba ya kidijitali yenye vitabu na muongozo wa jinsi ya kuvitumia kumsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza.

Mwisho: kwasababu tunajua ni jinsi gani WEWE ni muhimu kwa watoto wako Programu ya wazazi ya malezi hukusaidia kujijali wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: **ParentApp supports you to take care of yourself.**
text: **Programu ya wazazi ya malezi inakusaidia wewe kujijali.**

SourceText:
We often don’t look after ourselves enough. But this is so important, especially as a parent! 

Reducing our stress and treating ourselves well helps us AND our children.
text:
Mara nyingi hatujiangalii sisi wenyewe vya kutosha. Lakini hii ni muhimu sana, hasa kama mzazi!

Kupunguza msongo wa mawazo ni kujitibu sisi wenyewe vizuri inatusaidia sisi NA watoto wetu.

SourceText: Why is my wellbeing important to my child?
text: Kwanini ustawi wangu ni muhimu kwa mtoto wangu?

SourceText: Great question. Caring for others starts with caring for yourself.
text: Swali zuri. Kuwajali wengine kunaanza na kujijali wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: Remember that you cannot pour from an empty cup.
text: Kumbuka kwamba huwezi kumimina kutoka kwenye kikombe kitupu.

SourceText: Learn more:
text: Jifunze zaidi:

SourceText: If your own cup is empty, you won’t have anything to pour into your child’s cup. Take care of yourself, so you can take care of your child.
text: Kama kikombe chako mwenyewe ni kitupu, hutakuwa na kitu cha kumiminia kwenye kikombe cha mtoto. Jijali wewe mwenyewe, ili uweze kumjali mtoto wako.

SourceText: Every week, ParentApp will support you to take a pause, relax, and look after yourself.
text: Kila wiki, Programu ya wazazi ya malezi itakusaidia kupumzika, kutulia na kujiangalia wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: **ParentApp supports you to build a strong relationship with your child.**
text: **Programu ya wazazi ya malezi inakusaidia kujenga uhusiano imara na mtoto wako.**

SourceText: A strong and loving relationship with your child is one of the biggest investments you can make in their future.
text: Uhusiano wenye upendo na imara na mtoto wako ni moja ya uwekezaji mkubwa unaoweza kufanya kwa maisha yao ya baadae.

SourceText:
I have three children, and I love them very much. I try my best to give them what they need, even when life is hard. I make sure that they are fed, washed, safe, and that they go to school. It’s also really important to me that my children respect others, that they behave properly, and keep our family name in good standing. 
The way I was raised – we would get into real trouble if we didn’t behave the way our parents wanted us to. My parents would hit me and my siblings to get us to behave. It’s what I know, so I thought that this should be the way I raise my kids as well. 
I really want my children to respect me, but I also want them to feel that they can trust me with their concerns and feelings. Even though my parents hit me and I turned out fine, I think I would have benefited from a relationship with my parents that was more accepting, loving and understanding – where I felt less fear about being hit or beaten, or to tell them about my problems.
text: Nina watoto watatu, na ninawapenda sana. Ninajaribu kwa kiwango cha juu ninavyoweza kuwapa wanachohitaji, hata pale ambapo maisha ni magumu. Nina hakikisha wanakula, wanakuwa wasafi, salama, na pia wanaenda shule. Pia ni muhimu sana kwangu watoto wangu wawaheshimu wengine, kwamba wawe na tabia njema, na kutunza jina la familia yetu liendelee kubaki na heshima. Jinsi nilivyokuzwa, tungejikuta kwenye matatizo sana kama tusingekuwa na tabia ambayo wazazi wetu walitaka tuwe nayo. Wazazi wangu wangetupiga mimi na ndugu zangu ili tuwe na tabia njema. Hiki ndicho ninachokijua, hivyo nilidhani kwamba jinsi hii inatakiwa iwe ndivyo ninavyowalea watoto wangu pia. Ninahitaji sana watoto wangu waniheshimu, lakini pia nataka waniamini wanapokuwa na mahitaji yao na hisia. Ingawa wazazi wangu walinipiga na nikawa vizuri, nafikiri ningefaidika na uhusiano na wazazi wangu ule ambao unanipokea zaidi, wenye upendo na unaonielewa -- pale nilipokuwa sihofii kuumizwa, au kupigwa, au kuwaambia kuhusu matatizo yangu.

SourceText: What creates a strong and loving relationship between a caregiver and child?
text: Nini kinafanya mahusiano kuwa imara na ya upendo kati ya mlezi na mtoto?

SourceText: Great question. In ParentApp for Kids, we use the image of a garden to think about what children need from their parents to grow and thrive.
text: Swali zuri, Katika Programu ya wazazi ya malezi ya watoto, tunatumia taswira ya bustani kufikiria ni nini watoto wanahitaji kutoka kwa wazazi wao kukua na kustawi.

SourceText: **The ParentApp Garden**
text: **Bustani ya Programu ya wazazi ya malezi**

SourceText: Each element in the ParentApp Garden represents a powerful parenting tool.
text: Kila kipengele katika Bustani ya Programu ya wazazi ya malezi inawakilisha zana yenye nguvu ya malezi.

SourceText: Every week we will focus on one of these parenting tools, and demonstrate how you can use it to support your child in positive ways.
text: Kila wiki tutajikita kwenye zana moja ya malezi na kuonyesha jinsi unavyoweza kuitumia kumsaidia mtoto wako kwa njia nzuri.

SourceText: ParentApp also includes ideas for activities that you and your child can do together at home.
text: Programu ya wazazi ya malezi pia inajumuisha mawazo kwaajili ya shughuli ambazo wewe na mtoto wako mnaweza kufanya pamoja nyumbani.

SourceText: These activities were specifically designed to help children learn in positive ways while spending time with you.
text: Shughuli hizi zimeundwa maalum kusaidia watoto kujifunza katika njia chanya wakati huo wakitumia muda na wewe.

SourceText: **ParentApp supports you to use stories and books to help your child learn.**
text: **Programu ya wazazi ya malezi inakusaidia kutumia hadithi na vitabu kumsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza.**

SourceText: Sharing stories and looking at books together benefits children in many ways.
text: Kushirikishana hadithi na kuangalia vitabu pamoja kunawanufaisha watoto kwa namna nyingi.

SourceText:
As caregivers, we want what’s best for our children. We want them to grow into successful, happy, healthy adults who contribute to society. One of the best ways to set your child up for success is to look at books together and talk about them with your child. This is a great way to help build your child’s brain, develop their reading skills, and help them become successful learners.

From babies to adolescents, reading or talking about the pictures and story helps children in many ways:

Children learn new sounds and words, and how to use them.

They learn how to listen and concentrate, which helps them at school.

Books and stories help children use their imagination, think and learn about the world. This helps them in every aspect of life.
text:
Kama walezi, tunataka kile kilicho bora kwaajili ya watoto wetu. Tunataka wawe na mafanikio, furaha, watu wazima wenye afya wanaochangia kwenye jamii. Moja ya njia bora ya kumuandaa mtoto wako kwa mafanikio ni kuangalia vitabu pamoja na kuvizungumzia na mtoto wako. Hii ni njia nzuri ya kusaidia kujenga ubongo wa mtoto wako, kukuza juzi zao za kusoma na kuwasaidia kuwa wasomaji wenye mafanikio.

Kutoka uchanga kwenda balehe, kusoma au kuzungumza kuhusu picha na hadithi husaidia watoto kwa njia nyingi.

Watoto hujifunza sauti mpya na maneno, na jinsi ya kuyatumia.

Vitabu na hadithi husaidia watoto kutumia mawazo yao, kufikiri na kujifunza kuhusu dunia. Hii huwasaidia katika kila eneo la maisha.

SourceText: Do you spend time looking at books or reading with your child?
text: Unatumia muda kutazama vitabu au kusoma na mtoto wako?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ndiyo

SourceText: Great! We are excited to share some ideas with you that you and your child might enjoy.
text: Vizuri! Tumefurahi kushirikishana baadhi ya mawazo na ninyi ambayo ninyi na watoto wenu mnaweza kuyafurahia.

SourceText: Not really
text: Sio sana

SourceText: That’s okay! We are excited to get you started on your book-sharing journey.
text: Hiyo ni sawa! Tumefurahi kuwa mmeanza safari yenu ya kushirikishana kitabu.

SourceText: At what age can I start sharing books with my child?
text: Ni katika umri gani naweza kuanza kushirikishana vitabu na mtoto wangu?

SourceText: It is never too early to start! Children of all ages – even young babies – benefit from book activities.
text: Hakuna muda maalum kwamba ni mapema sana! Watoto wa umri wote _ hata watoto wachanga - hunufaika na shughuli za kitabu.

SourceText:
Before I joined ParentApp, I thought that children only needed books when they start primary school. I was very surprised to learn that the earlier you start with book activities, the easier it will be for children to learn to read when they get older. 

I was even more surprised to hear that you can start book activities when they are still babies – even before they can talk. So I am now doing different types of book activities with my 9-month old, my 4 year old and my 7 year old. 

With my baby, I sit with her on my lap, and I talk about the pictures in the same voice that I talk to her when I feed or bathe her. She gets really excited – she  makes all sorts of sounds and flaps her arms. 

With my 4 year old, I describe the pictures and ask him questions about the story. I do this with my 7 year old too, and she is already starting to recognise some letters and words in the book. My children really enjoy these activities. I wish I knew about this when I had my first child.
text:
Kabla sijajiunga na programu ya wazazi ya malezi, nilifikiri kwamba watoto walihitaji vitabu  pale tu wanapoanza shule ya msingi. Nilishangazwa sana kujifunza kwamba ukianza shughuli za kitabu mapema, ndivyo itakavyokuwa rahisi  kwa watoto kujifunza kusoma pale wanapokuwa wamekua.

Hata nilishangazwa zaidi kusikia kwamba unaweza kuanza shughuli za kitabu pale wanapokuwa watoto wachanga-hata kabla ya kuanza kuongea. Hivyo, sasa ninafanya shughuli tofauti za vitabu  na mtoto wangu mwenye umri wa miaka 4 na mtoto wangu mwenye umri wa miaka 7.

Nakaa na mtoto wangu, kwenye miguu yangu na ninazungumza kuhusu picha katika sauti ile ile ambayo ninaongea naye ninapomlisha au ninapomuogesha. Anafurahia sana-anatengeneza sauti mbalimbali na akipiga mikono yake.

Na mtoto wangu  wa miaka 4, naelezea picha na ninamuuliza maswali kuhusu hadithi. Ninafanya hii na mtoto wangu mwenye umri wa  miaka 7pia, na tayari ameanza kutambua baadhi ya herufi na maneno ya kitabuni. Watoto wangu wanafurahia sana hizi shughuli. Natamani ningejua kuhusu hii nilipokuwa na mtoto wangu wa kwanza.

SourceText: How can I do book activities with my child if I struggle with reading myself?
text: Nitafanyaje shughuli za kitabu na mtoto wangu ikiwa mimi mwenyewe siwezi kusoma?

SourceText: This is a concern for many parents and caregivers. The good news is that you don’t need to read the book’s text when doing book activities.
text: Hii inawagusa wazazi wengi na walezi.. habari nzuri ni kwamba, hauhitaji kusoma maandishi ya kitabu wakati unafanya shughuli za kitabu.

SourceText:
As a caregiver, your involvement in reading activities is important at every age – whether children are very young, or whether children already know how to read.

Every caregiver can help their child with reading – even those who are busy or who cannot read themselves.

You can use the pictures to introduce new words and ideas to your child.

You and your child can create your own story around the pictures.

You can ask your child questions about the story, characters, and events. 

This creates important opportunities for conversation, thinking, and learning.

When families read together, children learn to enjoy reading.

Strong reading foundations help set children up for success in school, and later in life.

So, find a few minutes a day, every day, to read with your child. It’s one of the greatest gifts you can give them.
text:
Kama mlezi, ushiriki wako katika ashughuli za kusoma ni muhimu katika kila umri -iwe watoto ni wachanga sana au ikiwa tayari wanajua kusoma.
Kila mlezi anaweza kumsaidia mtoto wake kwa kusoma _hata wale walio na shughuli nyingi au wasiojua kusoma 
Unaweza kutumia picha kutambulisha maneno na mawazo mapya kwa mtoto wako.
Wewe na mtoto wako mnaweza kutengeneza hadithi yenu wenyewe kupitia picha.
Unaweza kumuuliza mtoto wako maswali kuhusu hadithi, wahusika, na matukio.
Hii inatengeneza fursa muhimu za mazungumzo, kufikiria na kujifunza.
Familia zinaposoma pamoja, watoto hujifunza kufurahia kusoma.
Msingi thabiti wa kusoma husaidia watoto kuwa na mafanikio shuleni na kwenye maisha yao hapo baadae.
Kwahiyo tenga dakika chache kwa siku, kila siku kusoma na mtoto wako. Ni moja ya zawadi kubwa unayoweza kuwapa.

SourceText: ParentApp provides many practical and fun activities that you can do without needing to read the book’s text.
text: Programu ya wazazi ya malezi inatoa shughuli nyingi na za vitendo ambazo unaweza kufanya bila kuhitaji kusoma maandishi ya kitabu.

SourceText: Watch to learn more:
text: Tazama kujifunza zaidi:

SourceText:
Book activities are a great way to have fun together with your child. Let’s take a look at how you can share this book with your child in a playful and engaging way. 

This book is all about the joy of playing. Join Lesedi as his imagination takes him all the way to the beach for an adventure! 

Describe the pictures to your child and ask them questions about the story. Point to the sandbox and ask your chid: “What is this for?” Point to boy in the picture and ask: “How do you think he is feeling? What do you think he is going to do next?”

Mimic actions from the pictures or story. Together with your child, pretend to put your feet in the sand and wiggle your toes. Talk about what the sand would feel like? 

Mimic the sound of the wind swooping in and blowing the umbrella away. Demonstrate surprise and ask your child how they would feel if that happened to them. 

Remember, book activities do not have to be serious. The goal is to make it a playful experience. We hope you enjoy the book and have fun together!
text:
Shughuli za kitabu ni njia nzuri ya kufurahia pamoja na mtoto wako. Hebu tuangalie ni namna gani unaweza kushirikishana hiki kitabu na mtoto wako katika njia ya kucheza na kushiriki.

Kitabu hiki kinahusu furaha ya kucheza. Ungana na Lesedi kama mawazo yake yanavyompeleka mbali ufukweni kuona mazingira.!

Muelezee mtoto wako picha na muulize maswali kuhusu hadithi. Onesha boksi la mchanga na muuliza mtoto wako: "Hii ni kwaajili ya nini?" Onesha mvulana katika picha na uliza:"Unafikiri anajiskiaje?" Unafikiri anaenda kufanya nini baada ya hapa?"

Igiza vitendo kutoka katika picha au hadithi. Pamoja na mtoto wako, igizeni kuweka miguu yenu kwenye mchanga na tikiseni vidole vyenu. Zungumza kuhusu mchanga ungejiskiaje?

Igiza sauti ya upepo ukiingia ndani na kuupiga mwamvuli mbali. Onyesha mshangao na muulize mtoto wako angejiskiaje kama hii ingetokea kwake.

Kumbuka, shughuli za kitabu hazihitaji kuwa makini. Lengo ni kufanya iwe ya uzoefu kimchezo. Tunatumaini umefurahia kitabu na mmefurahia pamoja!

SourceText: Sharing books with young children isn’t something that we normally do in our homes or community. How does this fit in with our traditional practices?
text: Kushirikishana vitabu na watoto wadogo sio jambo ambalo kwa kawaida huwa tunafanya katika nyumba zetu au katika jamii. Je hii inalinganaje na desturi zetu za jadi?

SourceText: Great question. We know that in many cultures, including Africa, parents pass down values and life lessons to children through storytelling.
text: Swali zuri. Tunatambua kwamba tamaduni nyingi ikiwemo ya Africa. wazazi huwarithisha maadili na mafunzo mbalimbali ya maisha watoto wao kwa kutumia hadithi.

SourceText: Let’s look at some of the ways that book activities build on this tradition:
text: Hembu tuangalie baadhi ya njia ambazo shughuli za vitabu zimeundwa kutokana na tamaduni hizi:

SourceText:
Take a moment to think about some of the traditional stories that you were told as a child, and that you tell your child:

When do you tell stories? How do you tell the story? During the story, what do you do to keep children engaged? After the story, what do you discuss? 

Oral storytelling and book activities have many things in common: 
You use your voice to make the story interesting, with different voices for different characters.
You describe the characters and events in detail so that children understand what is happening and why. 
You connect and interact with your listeners. 
After the story, you ask or answer questions and discuss what can be learned from this story. 

The skills you use during oral storytelling works just as well for book activities. Oral storytelling is a great way to connect with children and help them learn, and book activities do the same!
text:
Chukua muda kufikiria kuhusu baadhi ya hadithi za kitamaduni ambazo ulisimuliwa ukiwa mtoto, unazoweza kumsimulia mtoto wako.
Unasimulia hadithi lini? unaisimuliaje hadithi? wakati wa hadithi, unafanya nini ili kuwafanya watoto wako washiriki? baada ya hadithi, unajadili nini?
Usimuliaji wa hadithi na shughuli za kitabu zina mambo mengi yanayofanana. unatumia sauti yako kuifanya hadithi ivutie, yenye sauti tofauti kwa wahusika tofauti. Unaelezea wahusika na matukio kwa undani ili watoto waelewe kinachotokea na kwanini.
Unaungana na kuchangamana na wasikilizaji wako.
Baada ya hadithi, unauliza au kujibu maswali na kujadili nini cha kujifunza kutoka kwenye hadithi hii.
Ujuzi unaotumia wakati wa kusimulia hadithi hutumika vilevile kwa shughuli za kitabu. Kusimulia hadithi kwa njia ya mdomo ni njia nzuri ya kuungana na watoto na kuwasaidia kujifunza na shughuli za vitabu hufanya hivyo hivyo!

SourceText: How can I do book activities if we don’t have any picture books at home?
text: Nitawezaje kufanya shughuli za kitabu kama hatuna kitabu chochote cha picha nyumbani?

SourceText: We know that many families across the world struggle to access picture books for their children, or have only one or two books at home.
text: Tunajua kwamba familia nyingi duniani zinapambana kupata vitabu vya picha kwaajili ya watoto wao, au wana kimoja au viwili nyumbani.

SourceText: The good news is that ParentApp has a library full of digital books that you can share with your child using your phone. We also provide guidance for how to use these books in different ways to support your child’s learning.
text: Habari njema ni kwamba, Programu ya wazazi ya malezi ina maktaba iliyojaa vitabu vya kidijitali ambavyo unaweza kushirikishana na mtoto wako kwa kutumia simu yako. Pia tunatoa mwongozo kwaajili ya jinsi ya kutumia vitabu hivi kwa njia mbalimbali kusaidia kujifunza kwa mtoto wako.

SourceText: To get you started on your ParentApp journey, we’ve prepared some home activities for you:
text: Ili kukuwezesha kuanza safari ya Programu ya wazazi ya malezi, tumekuandalia baadhi ya shughuli za nyumbani:

SourceText:
🤝 **Play activities for you and your child.** 
These activities provide opportunities to bond while also supporting your child’s learning.

📖 **Digital books to share with your child.** 
Find a comfortable place to sit and share one of the many books available in the app. 

😌 **Short but powerful relaxing activities.** 
Being a parent can be so stressful. Take a moment for yourself to relax, breathe or reflect.
text:
🤝 **Shughuli za mchezo kwaajili yako na mtoto wako.**
Shughuli hizi zinatoa fursa kuungana wakati huo pia inasaidia kujifunza kwa mtoto wako.

📖 **Vitabu vya kidijitali vya kushirikishana na mtoto wako.**
Tafuta mahali pazuri kukaa na kushirikishana kitabu kimoja kati ya vingi vinavyopatikana kwenye programu.

😌 **Shughuli fupi lakini zenye nguvu za kupumzika.** 
Kuwa mzazi kunaweza kuwa na mkazo sana. Chukua muda kwa ajili yako mwenyewe kupumzika, kupumua au kutafakari.

SourceText: Welcome!
text: Karibu!

SourceText: Caring for yourself
text: Kujijali wewe mwenyewe

SourceText: Caring for your child
text: Kutunza mtoto wako

SourceText: Learning through books
text: Kujifunza kupitia vitabu

SourceText: Ready to get started?
text: Upo tayari kuanza?

SourceText: Counting Sounds
text: Sauti za kuhesabu

SourceText:
Sit down and close your eyes.
How many sounds can you hear?  
Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers. 
After ten seconds, how many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear? 

Try again for another ten seconds.  
Did you hear any new sounds? Did you hear any sounds inside your own body? 
Notice how you feel now.
text:
Kaa chini na ufumbe macho yako.
Je, unaweza kusikia sauti ngapi?
Sikiliza sauti za ndani na nje ya chumba. Zihesabu kwa vidole vyako.
Baada ya sekunde kumi, umefikisha vidole vingapi? Ulisikia sauti zipi?

Jaribu tena kwa sekunde kumi.
Je, umesikia sauti zozote mpya? Je, umesikia sauti zozote ndani ya mwili wako mwenyewe?
Chunguza jinsi unavyohisi sasa.

SourceText: Looking after yourself matters. And how you feel matters too!
text: Kujitunza ni muhimu. Na jinsi unavyohisi ni muhimu pia!

SourceText: Great! So good to hear that you are in a good space today. What a wonderful feeling!
text: Safi sana! Tunafurahi sana kusikia kwamba hali yako ni nzuri leo. Furaha iliyoje!

SourceText: Sometimes things go great. Sometimes they do not. And sometimes we do not quite know what to think... and that is totally okay! Remember that you are not alone.
text: Wakati mwingine mambo huenda vizuri sana. Wakati mwingine hayaendi vizuri sana. Na wakati mwingine hatujui kabisa cha kufanya... na hii ni sawa kabisa! Kumbuka kwamba hauko peke yako.

SourceText: Sorry that things are hard right now. You deserve good things and @global.app_name is here to support you every step of the way.
text: Samahani kwamba mambo ni magumu kwa sasa. Unastahili mambo mazuri, na @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia kila hatua unayopiga.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Children are born with a natural interest in the people and objects around them. 
This week, we will look at how parents can encourage children to **EXPLORE** and learn from the world around them.
text:
Watoto huzaliwa na matamanio ya asili kwa watu na vitu vinavyowazunguka. 
Wiki hii, tutaangalia jinsi wazazi wanavyoweza kuwahimiza watoto **KUCHUNGUZA** na kujifunza kutoka kwenye ulimwengu unaowazunguka.

SourceText:
“What is that? How does it work? Where is she going? Why is he doing that?” Children ask many questions every day as they try to make sense of the world around them.
As parents we sometimes get tired of answering our children’s questions. But encouraging curiosity supports children’s learning and development in important ways. When children are curious, they are more likely to try new things. They are more likely to explore and learn from their surroundings. This helps them to develop important skills like problem-solving.
text:
"Ni nini hicho? Kinafanyaje kazi? Anaenda wapi? Kwanini anafanya hivyo?" Watoto huuliza maswali mengi kila siku wanapojaribu kuelewa ulimwengu unaowazunguka.
Kama wazazi wakati mwingine tunachoka kujibu maswali ya watoto wetu. Lakini kuwatia moyo kwa udadisi wao husaidia maendeleo ya watoto na kujifunza kwa njia muhimu. Watoto wanapokuwa na udadisi, kuna uwezekano mkubwa kwa wao kujaribu mambo mapya. Kuna uwezekano mkubwa wao kuchunguza na kujifunza kutoka kwenye mazingira yao. Hii huwasaidia kukuza ujuzi muhimu kama vile kutatua matatizo.

SourceText: Let’s see how **exploring together** forms part of the garden image.
text: Hebu tuone namna ya **kuchunguza pamoja** kunavyounda sehemu ya taswira ya bustani.

SourceText: Plants are part of a wider garden, or ecosystem. In the same way, your child is part of a larger environment with family, peers and a community that present important opportunities for learning and growing.
text: Mimea ni sehemu pana ya bustani, au mfumo wa ikolojia. Vivyo hivyo, mtoto wako ni sehemu kubwa ya mazingira katika familia, rika na jamii inayotoa fursa muhimu za kujifunza na kukua.

SourceText: Here’s how to help children explore and learn from the world around them:
text: Hivi ndivyo unavyoweza kuwasaidia watoto kuchunguza na kujifunza kutoka kwenye ulimwengu unaowazunguka:

SourceText:
**Be curious together**
 Turn learning into a shared adventure. Try new things together and experiment with different ideas.
text:
**Muwe na hamu ya kujua kwa pamoja**
Geuza kujifunza kuwa tukio la pamoja. Jaribu vitu vipya pamoja na kufanya majaribio kwa mawazo tofauti.

SourceText:
Demonstrate your own curiosity by asking questions like “I wonder what happens if…” or “What do you think would happen if…?” or “Why do you think it works that way?”
When your child asks a question, explore the answer together instead of simply providing it.
If something doesn’t go according to plan, you could say: “I wonder why that didn’t work. What could we try next time?” Show your child that making mistakes is part of learning and that challenges are opportunities to grow.
text:
Onyesha udadisi wako kwa kuuliza maswali kama vile “Nashangaa nini kitatokea ikiwa…” au “Unafikiri nini kingetokea ikiwa…?” au “Kwa nini unafikiri inafanya kazi hivyo?”
Mtoto wako anapouliza swali, chunguzeni jibu pamoja badala ya kujibu kirahisi tu.
Ikiwa kitu hakiendi kulingana na mpango, ungeweza kusema: "Nashangaa kwa nini hiyo haikufanya kazi. Tunaweza kujaribu nini wakati mwingine?" Muonyeshe mtoto wako kwamba kufanya makosa ni sehemu ya kujifunza na kwamba changamoto ni fursa za kukua.

SourceText:
**Solve problems together**
Instead of solving your child’s problems for them, support them to come up with solutions that they can try themselves.
text:
**Tatueni matatizo pamoja**
Badala ya kutatua matatizo ya mtoto wako kwa ajili yake, muunge mkono ili kutafuta suluhisho ambalo anaweza kujaribu mwenyewe.

SourceText:
By involving our children in solving problems, they learn to find solutions more and more independently. 
First, talk to your child about what the problem is. “I can see you are trying to build a bridge for your cars but it keeps collapsing.”
Together, think of possible solutions. You could ask: “How do you think we can make it more sturdy?” or “What could you try instead?”
 You can also give your child options and let them choose a solution to try. 
After they have tried it, reflect together on whether it worked or not. 
Remember to talk with kindness and praise your child’s efforts.
text:
Kwa kuwashirikisha watoto wetu katika kutatua matatizo, wanajifunza kutafuta suluhisho zaidi na zaidi kwa kujitegemea. 
Kwanza, zungumza na watoto wako kuhusu tatizo ni nini. "Naona mnajaribu kujenga daraja la magari yanu lakini linaendelea kubomoka." 
Pamoja, fikirieni suluhisho linalowezekana. Unaweza kuuliza: “Mnafikiri tunawezaje kuifanya liwe imara zaidi?” au “Mnaweza kujaribu nini badala yake?”
Unaweza pia kuwapa watoto wako chaguo na uwaruhusu wachague suluhisho la kujaribu. 
Baada ya kuwa wamejaribu, tafakarini pamoja kama ilifanya kazi au la. 
Kumbuka kuzungumza kwa wema na sifia juhudi za watoto wako.

SourceText: Let’s look at some common problems that we could solve together with our children:
text: Hebu tuangalie baadhi ya matatizo ya kawaida ambayo tunaweza kutatua pamoja na watoto wetu:

SourceText: Too much screen time
text: Muda mwingi sana wa kutumia Luninga

SourceText: When it comes to screens, it can be really challenging for children to follow rules and instructions. Involving your child in finding solutions can help make a difference.
text: Linapokuja suala la kuangalia luninga, inaweza kuwa changamoto kwa watoto kufuata taratibu na maelekezo. Kuwahusisha watoto wako katika kutafuta suluhisho inaweza kusaidia kuleta tofauti.

SourceText: Fighting with other children
text: Kupigana na watoto wengine

SourceText: Children are still learning how to manage their emotions and interact with others. Finding solutions that can help your child get along with friends is important.
text: Watoto bado wanajifunza jinsi ya kudhibiti hisia zao na kuchangamana na wengine. Kutafuta suluhisho ambalo linaweza kuwasaidia watoto wako kupatana na marafiki ni muhimu.

SourceText: Not following household rules
text: Kutofuata taratibu za nyumbani

SourceText: To follow rules, children need self-control and motivation, which takes lots of practice. Work with your child to find solutions that can help them get there.
text: Ili kufuata taratibu, watoto wanahitaji kujidhibiti na motisha, ambavyo vinatoa mazoezi mengi kwa vitendo. Fanya kazi na watoto wako kutafuta suluhisho linaloweza kuwasaidia kufanikisha.

SourceText: Here are four steps for solving problems like these with your child:
text: Hapa kuna hatua nne za kutatua matatizo kama haya na mtoto wako:

SourceText: How to solve problems: Step 1
text: Jinsi ya kutatua matatizo: Hatua ya 1

SourceText:
**Talk about the problem**
Talk to your child about the problem in need of a solution.
text:
**Zungumzia tatizo**
Zungumza na mtoto wako kuhusu tatizo linalohitaji suluhisho..

SourceText: How to solve problems: Step 2
text: Jinsi ya kutatua matataizo: Hatua ya 2

SourceText:
**Find solutions**
Together, think about possible solutions for this problem. What can your child do to overcome the problem?
text:
**Tafuta suluhisho**
Pamoja, fikirieni juu ya suluhisho linalowezekana kwa tatizo hili. Mtoto wako anaweza kufanya nini ili kuondokana na tatizo hilo?

SourceText: You could say: “One option is for us to look at the book together.” Could that work?” If one child responds that this won’t work because the other child wants to go through the book too fast, ask for other suggestions. They could suggest to flip a coin to decide who gets to read the book first. Or they could choose to do something else instead. Ask your children to agree on the solution that they want to try.
text: Unaweza kusema: “Chaguo moja ni sisi kukitazama kitabu hicho pamoja.” Je, hilo linaweza kufanya kazi?” Iwapo mtoto mmoja atajibu kwamba hii haitafanya kazi kwa sababu mtoto mwingine anataka kusoma kitabu kwa haraka sana, omba mapendekezo mengine. Wanaweza kupendekeza kugeuza sarafu ili kuamua ni nani atakayesoma kitabu kwanza. Au wanaweza kuchagua kufanya kitu kingine badala yake. Waombe watoto wako wakubaliane kuhusu suluhisho wanalotaka kujaribu.

SourceText: How to solve problems: Step 3
text: Jinsi ya kutatua matatizo: Hatua 3

SourceText:
**Choose a solution to try**
Let your child choose which option they want to try.
text:
**Chagua suluhisho la kujaribu**
Acha mtoto wako achague ambacho anataka kujaribu.

SourceText: I’m glad we decided to spend time in the garden instead. Look how nicely our plants are growing.
text: Nimefurahi tuliamua kutumia muda wetu bustanini. Tazama ambavyo mimea yetu inakua vizuri.

SourceText: Yes! It’s nice to be outside on a beautiful day like this.
text: Ndio! Ni vizuri kuwa nje kwa siku nzuri kama hii.

SourceText: How to solve problems: Step 4
text: Jinsi ta kutatua matatizo: Hatua 4

SourceText:
**Reflect and learn**
Discuss with your child whether or not the solution worked, or what they might want to do differently next time.
text:
**Tafakari na ujifunze**
Jadili na mtoto wako ikiwa suluhisho lilifanya kazi au hapana, au anataka kufanya nini cha tofauti wakati ujao.

SourceText: “Well that was great – I was so impressed by how well you worked together in the garden. How was that for you?
text: “Safi hiyo ilikuwa nzuri - Nilivutiwa sana jinsi mlivyofanya kazi pamoja bustanini. Wewe uliionaje?

SourceText: I’m glad we found something else that we were happy to do together.
text: Nafurahi tulipata kitu kingine ambacho tulifurahia kufanya pamoja.

SourceText: Books and stories encourage children to explore different ideas and learn about the world.
text: Vitabu na hadithi huwahimiza watoto kuchunguza mawazo tofauti na kujifunza kuhusu ulimwengu.

SourceText: Here’s how to use books to explore:
text: Hapa ni jinsi ya kutumia vitabu kuchunguza: :

SourceText:
**Ask questions about the story**
This helps children think about what is happening, why this might be happening, and what might happen next.
text:
**Uliza maswali kuhusu hadithi**
Hii husaidia watoto kufikiri kuhusu nini kinatokea, kwanini hii inaweza kutokea, na nini kinaweza kutokea baadae.

SourceText: Listen to an example:
text: Sikiliza mfano:

SourceText:
Using this picture from the book called Big Blue Bus, ask your child: “Why do you think they are standing next to the side of the road? Why is she looking at her watch? How do you think the boy is feeling? What do you think will happen next?”
Invite children to imagine different endings to the story, or create your own follow up story. You could ask “what would happen if they went home for tea and the bus came while they were away?” or you could say: “let’s make up our own story of what happens when they get to the city. Where did they go first? What did they buy? Who did they meet?”
Asking questions is a great way to engage your child in the story and explore different possibilities together.
text:
Kwa kutumia picha kutoka kwenye kitabu cha Basi kubwa la Bluu, muulize mtoto wako: “ Unafikiri ni kwanini wamesimama pembeni ya barabara? Kwa nini anaangalia saa yake? Unafikiri mvulana anajiskiaje? Unafikiri nini kitatokea baadae?”

Waalike watoto kufikiria miisho tofauti ya hadithi, au tengeneza hadithi yako ya ufatiliaji. “Unaweza kuuliza “Ni nini kingetokea kama wangeenda nyumbani kunywa chai na basi lingekuja wakiwa mbali?” au ungeweza kusema: “hebu tutengeneze hadithi yetu wenyewe juu ya nini kinatokea pale wanapofika jijini. Walienda wapi kwanza? Walinunua nini? Walikutana na nani?”Kuuliza maswali ni njia nzuri ya kuwashirikisha watoto wako katika hadithi na kuchunguza uwezekano mbalimbali pamoja..

SourceText: Make connections between what you see in the book and your child’s life.
text: Husianisha  kati ya kile unachokiona  kwenye kitabu na maisha ya mtoto wako

SourceText: Show your child how what happens in the story is similar to or different from their own life. For example, if there is a chicken in the story, you could remind your child that you also have chickens outside your house that you feed every morning. You could ask: “Do our chickens look like the one in this story? Who feeds our chickens at home?” Or you could say: “look, he is playing with a ball. When you play outside our house, what do you like to play with?”
text: Muonyeshe mtoto wako jinsi kile kinachotokea katika hadithi ni sawa au tofauti katika maisha yake. Kwa mfano, ikiwa kuna kuku kwenye hadithi, unaweza kumkumbusha mtoto wako kuwa una kuku nje ya nyumba yako na huwa unawalisha kila asubuhi, unaweza kuuliza: “Je kuku wetu wanafanana na yule wa kwenye hadithi hii? Ni nani anayewalisha kuku wetu nyumbani? Au unaweza kusema: “Tazama anacheza mpira nje ya nyumba yetu, unapenda kucheza na nani?”

SourceText:
**Count and compare**  
 Use the pictures to count or make comparisons between different objects or characters.
text:
**Hesabu na Linganisha**
Tumia picha kuhesabu au kufananisha kati ya vitu tofauti au wahusika.

SourceText:
Books can help children practice counting, and to assess and compare different things.
Using this picture, you could point to the people in the bus and say: “Let’s see how many people are on the bus: 1, 2, 3, 4, …. Or you can ask your child to count. 
You could also ask your child to compare the number of people by asking “Are there more people on the bus or more people on the road?”
And you could ask: “Who is closest to the bus? And who is the furthest away? Who is sitting at the back of the bus? Who is sitting at the front? Are the two houses the same size? Is the bus driving towards the houses or away from the houses?”
text:
Vitabu vinaweza kumsaidia mtoto kufanya mazoezi ya kuhesabu na kutathimini na kulinganisha vitu mbalimbali. Kwa kutumia picha, unaweza kuonyesha kwa kuelekezea watu ambao wako ndani ya basi na kusema: “Hembu tuone ni watu wangapi wako kwenye basi: 1,2,3,4,........ 
Au unaweza kumwambia mtoto wako ahesabu.
Unaweza pia kumwambia mtoto wako alinganishe idadi ya watu kwa kuuliza “Je kuna watu zaidi kwenye basi au watu zaidi barabarani?”
Na unaweza kuuliza: “Ni nani aliye karibu na basi? Na ni nani aliye mbali zaidi? Ni nani amekaa nyuma ya basi? Ni nani amekaa mbele? Je nyumba mbili zina ukubwa sawa? Je basi linaendeshwa kuelekea kwenye nyumba au mbali na nyumba?”

SourceText:
Three easy ways to use book activities to explore:
1. Ask questions about the story and what might happen.
2. Make connections between the book and your child’s life.
3. Use the pictures to practice counting and make comparisons.
text:
Njia tatu rahisi za kutumia shughuli za vitabu kuchunguza:
1. Uliza maswali kuhusu hadithi na nini kinaweza kutokea.
2. Husianisha kitabu na maisha ya mtoto wako.
3. Tumia picha kufanya mazoezi ya kuhesabu na kulinganisha.

SourceText:
Small actions, big results! Parents who practice at home get better results.

For your home practice:
🤝 When a problem arises, involve your child in finding a solution and trying it out. 
📖 Make connections between the book and your child’s life.
😌 Think about something you are curious about or want to learn more about. Make some time to explore your interests!
text:
Vitendo kidogo, matokeo makubwa! Wazazi wanaofanya mazoezi kwa vitendo nyumbani wanapata matokeo mazuri. Hii ni kwa mazoezi yako ya nyumbani:
🤝Tatizo linapotokea, mshirikishe mtoto wako kutafuta ufumbuzi na kulijaribu.
📖Husianisha kitabu na maisha ya mtoto wako.
😌 Fikiria juu ya kitu unahamu nacho au unachotaka kujifunza zaidi. Pata muda wa kuchunguza mambo yanayokuvutia!

SourceText: Taking Care of Yourself
text: Kujijali wewe mwenyewe

SourceText: Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.
text: Kujithamini huanza kwa kutambua namna unavyojisikia.

SourceText: Fantastic! And well done for investing in yourself and your family – you have accomplished a lot.
text: Hongera! umefanya vizuri kuwekeza kwako na familia yako – umefanikisha mengi.

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. @global.app_name is here to help.
text: Pole kwa kutokuwa na siku nzuri zaidi. Umefanya vizuri kwa kujaribu kubaini kila kitu. @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Being a parent can be challenging. Take a deep breath and recognise all you have done for your family – you deserve praise!
text: Kuwa mzazi kunaweza kuwa changamoto. Vuta pumzi na tambua yote uliyoifanyia familia yako – unastahili kusifiwa!

SourceText: This module is about YOU. Looking after yourself is essential for a happy family.
text: Mada hii ni kwa ajili YAKO. Kujiangalia mwenyewe ni muhimu kwaajili ya familia yenye furaha.

SourceText: In ParentApp for Kids, we use the image of a garden to think about what children need in their lives to grow and thrive.
text: Katika Programu ya Malezi ya watoto, tunatumia taswira ya bustani kufikiria kile ambacho watoto wanahitaji katika maisha yao ili wakue na kustawi.

SourceText: Let’s see how **caring for yourself** forms part of the garden image.
text: Hembu tuone ambavyo **Kujijali** kunakuwa sehemu ya taswira ya bustani.

SourceText: The health of the gardener is important to the health of the garden. In the same way, parents need to take care of themselves, so that they can take care of their children.
text: Afya ya mtunza bustani ni muhimu kwa afya ya bustani. Vivyo hivyo, Wazazi wanapaswa kujitunza, ili waweze kuwatunza watoto wao.

SourceText:
We often forget to take care of ourselves, but it’s really important, especially if you are a parent!
When you reduce stress and treat yourselves kindly, it helps both you and your children.
There are times when we experience challenges, face problems, and do not know what to do. It is important to take care of ourselves every day, so we are ready to handle those times well and stay calm. 
When we are calm, we are in a good state to think positively and come up with positive solutions to any challenges we may be facing.
text:
Mara nyingi tunasahau kujitunza, lakini ni muhimu sana, hasa ikiwa wewe ni mzazi!
Unapopunguza msongo wa mawazo na kujitendea vizuri, husaidia wewe na watoto wako.
Kuna wakati tunapata changamoto, tunakumbana na matatizo, na hatujui tufanye nini. Ni muhimu Kujijali kila siku, Kwa hiyo tuko tayari kushughulikia nyakati hizo vizuri na kukaa kwa utulivu.
Tunapokuwa na utulivu, tunakuwa katika hali nzuri ya kufikiria vyema na kupata suluhu nzuri kwa changamoto zozote tunazoweza kukumbana nazo..

SourceText: Taking care of yourself is an important parenting skill. Let’s look at three powerful ideas.
text: Kujijali ni ujuzi muhimu kwenye malezi. Hembu tuangalie mawazo matatu yenye nguvu..

SourceText:
**Take a pause**

Taking a pause helps us to feel calmer in stressful moments.
text:
**Chukua pumziko**
Kupumzika husaidia kujiskia utulivu wakati unapokuwa na msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText:
All parents get frustrated, overwhelmed or upset. Taking a moment for yourself can help you to respond in a calmer way. 
When you are having a hard time, it’s okay to make sure your children are in a safe place and to give yourself a couple of minutes to step away and calm yourself. Even taking a few deep breaths makes a big difference. 
By staying calm instead of reacting strongly, you can also prevent a lot of problems!
text:
Wazazi wote wanachanganyikiwa, wanaelemewa au kukasirika. Kupata muda kwaajili yako inaweza kukusaidia kujibu kwa njia tulivu.
Unapokuwa na wakati mgumu, ni vizuri kuhakikisha watoto wako wapo sehemu salama na kujipa dakika kadhaa kuwa peke yako na kujituliza. Hata kuvuta pumzi inaleta tofauti kubwa.
Kukaa kwa kutulia badala ya kujibu kwa nguvu, unaweza kuzuia matatizo mengi!!

SourceText:
**Be kind to yourself**

Being a parent can be hard. Show yourself kindness and remind yourself of what you can be proud of.
text:
**Uwe mwema kwako mwenyewe**
Kuwa mzazi inaweza kuwa ngumu. Jitendee wema wewe mwenyewe na ujikumbushe kile unachoweza kujivunia.

SourceText:
When we are feeling stressed or overwhelmed, we often can’t help but focus on everything that’s going wrong. But just because things are hard, doesn’t mean you have to be hard on yourself. 
Identify negative thoughts when they start and decide if they are true or helpful. If not, find positive thoughts to replace them with. 
After a challenging experience, set-back or “bad day”, think about what you would like to do differently next time and then move on. Rather focus on what you have done well, and what you can be proud of.
For example, instead of “I am a bad parent” say “I am feeling overwhelmed right now, but I am doing the best I can and I will talk to a friend for support”.
text:
Tunapokuwa na msongo wa mawazo au kuelemewa, mara nyingi hatuwezi kusaidia lakini tunafatilia zaidi kila kitu kilichoenda vibaya. Ingawa mambo ni magumu, haimaanishi uruhusu maumivu ndani yako.
Fikiria juu ya mawazo yasiyofaa yanapoanza kukujia na angalia ikiwa ni ya kujenga au ya msaada. Kama sivyo, tafuta mawazo mazuri yafanye mbadala wake.
Baada ya kupitia changamoto, kumbukumbu au “siku mbaya”, tafuta kitu cha tofauti ambacho ungependa kufanya wakati ujao na uendelee na maisha. Badala yake zingatia kile ulichofanya vizuri, na kile unachoweza kujivunia.
Kwa mfano, badala ya “Mimi ni mzazi mbaya” sema “Najiskia kuelemewa sasa hivi, lakini najitahidi niwezavyo na nitazungumza na rafiki kwaajili ya msaada”.

SourceText:
**Connect with others**

Connect with your family and friends - you are not alone.
text:
**Ungana na wengine**
Ungana na familia na rafiki zako - hauko peke yako.

SourceText:
Being a parent is not always easy. Don’t hesitate to reach out for support when you need it. Sharing challenges with trusted people can lighten your emotional load and help you find solutions.
 Make an effort to share your feelings and experiences with trusted friends or family members. Honest conversations build trust and help you feel understood. This helps others to feel connected too. 
 Even a quick phone call or a thoughtful text can reinforce your connections and let others know you care.
text:
Kuwa mzazi sio rahisi kila wakati. Usiogope kutafuta msaada unapohitaji. Kuwashirikisha changamoto watu wanaoaminika inaweza kuleta wepesi wa mzigo wa hisia na kukusaidia kupata suluhisho.
Fanya jitihada kuwashirikisha hisia zako na unayoyapitia marafiki na wanafamilia wanaoaminika. Mazungumzo yenye uaminifu hujenga uaminifu na kukusaidia kujiskia kueleweka. Hii husaidia wengine kuona wako pamoja.
Hata kupiga simu kwa haraka au ujumbe wenye mawazo mazuri yanaweza kuimarisha umoja na kufanya wengine waone unajali..

SourceText: Yes, when we isolate ourselves, problems will start to feel even bigger. Reaching out to a friend can help.
text: Ndiyo, tunapojitenga, matatizo yataanza kuwa makubwa zaidi. Kutembelea rafiki kunaweza kusaidia.

SourceText: You can use book activities to take a pause when you feel stressed.
text: Unaweza kutumia shughuli za kitabu kuchukua pumziko unapojiskia kuwa na msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText: By sitting down with a book and focusing your attention on the pictures and story, you can forget about your worries for a moment.
text: Kwa kukaa chini na kitabu na kuzingatia mawazo yako juu ya picha na hadithi, unaweza kusahau kuhusu wasiwasi wako kwa muda.

SourceText: Connecting with others helps us feel less alone. You can use book activities to connect with your child and your family.
text: Kuungana na wengine hutusaidia kujiskia kutokuwa peke yetu. Unaweza kutumia shughuli za vitabu kuungana na mtoto wako na familia yako.

SourceText: Having some fun is helpful for parents too. You can use stories to relax, laugh and have fun together.
text: Kuwa na furaha kuna manufaa kwa wazazi pia. Unaweza kutumia hadithi kupumzika, kucheka na kufurahia pamoja.

SourceText:
Taking care of yourself is an important parenting skill! 
For your home practice:
🤝 When you notice you are feeling stressed, give yourself a moment to pause, breathe and regain your calm.
📖 Share a book with your child or family to relax and have fun together.
😌 Reward yourself by doing something you enjoy.
text:
Kujitunza mwenyewe ni ujuzi muhimu kwenye malezi! 
Kwa mazoezi yako ya nyumbani:
🤝 Unapoona una msongo wa mawazo, jipe ​​muda wa kutulia, kupumua na kurejesha utulivu wako.
📖 Shiriki kitabu na mtoto wako au familia ili kupumzika na kufurahia pamoja 
😌 Jipatie zawadi kwa kufanya kitu unachofurahia.

SourceText: How are you feeling today?

text: Huzuni

SourceText: This week, we are focusing on the topic of **CONNECTION**.
text: Wiki hii tutajikita zaidi kwenye mada ya **MUUNGANIKO**.

SourceText: Connecting with your child and spending quality time together makes a big difference to their development.
text: Kuungana na mtoto wako na kutumia muda vizuri pamoja inaleta mabadiliko katika ukuaji wao.

SourceText:
Connection is the feeling you have with those special people in your life where you feel safe to be yourself and that they support you no matter what. It’s when you feel seen, understood and valued.

Children who have a strong connection with their caregivers are healthier, have better relationships, and find it easier to overcome challenges. The simple act of spending some one-on-one time with your child on a regular basis can make a big difference to their lives.
text:
Muunganiko ni hisia ambayo unayo kwa watu maalumu ulionao katika maisha yako, pale ambapo unajiskia salama wewe mwenyewe na kwamba wanakuunga mkono bila kujali chochote. Ni pale unapohisi wanatambua uwepo wako, wanakuelewa na wanakuthamini

Watoto wenye uhusiano mzuri na walezi wao wana afya, na wana uhusiano mzuri, na wanapata urahisi kuzikabili changamoto. Kitendo rahisi cha kutoa muda na kuutumia kwa mtoto wako ana kwa ana, katika ratiba ya kawaida inaweza kuleta tofauti kubwa kwenye maisha yao.

SourceText:
In @global.app_name, we use the image of a garden to think about what children need in their lives to grow and thrive. 

Let’s see how **connecting with your child** forms a part of the garden image.
text:
Kwenye @global.app_name, tunatumia taswira ya bustani kufikiri kile ambacho watoto wanahitaji katika maisha yao ili wakue na kustawi. 

Ngoja tuone jinsi mchezo unavyokuwa katika sehemu ya picha ya bustani.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: The ParentApp Garden
text: Bustani ya Programu ya wazazi ya malezi

SourceText: A plant that is firmly connected to the soil can grow strong roots and withstand storms. Children need strong connections with their caregivers to grow and thrive.
text: Mmea ambao umeunganishwa na udongo unaweza kukua na kuwa na mizizi yenye nguvu na kustahimili dhoruba. Watoto wanahitaji uhusiano imara na walezi wao ili kukua na kustawi.

SourceText:
When a plant is firmly connected to the soil, it grows strong and healthy roots. In the same way, a child who feels supported and close to their parents will have a safe foundation from which to grow and learn.

When roots are strong, plants can survive storms and bad weather. When children have strong connections with their caregivers, they can overcome challenges and cope with difficulties.
text:
Mmea unapokuwa umeunganika vizuri kwenye udongo, unakua kwa uimara na mizizi yenye afya. Na ni kwa jinsi hiyo, mtoto anayejisikia kusaidiwa, kulindwa, na kuwa karibu na mzazi wake atakuwa na msingi wa kukua na kujifunza.

Mizizi inapokuwa imara, mimea inaweza kustahimili dhoruba na hali mbaya ya hewa. Watoto wanapokuwa na muunganiko imara na walezi wao, wanaweza kupambana na changamoto na kukabiliana na magumu.

SourceText: Connecting with your child is when you focus on them and show interest in what they are doing or saying.
text: Kuungana na mtoto wako ni pale unapomzingatia na kuonyesha kupendezwa na kile anachofanya au kusema.

SourceText: Here’s how to get started:
text: Hivi ndio jinsi ya kuanza:

SourceText:
**Make time to connect on a regular basis.**

Even 10-15 minutes can make a big difference. See it as an opportunity to take a break and relax together.
text:
**Tenga muda wa kuungana na mtoto wako mara kwa mara**

hata dakika 10 mpaka 15 zinaweza kuleta tofauti kubwa. Ione hii kama fursa ya kupata mapumziko mafupi na kutulia kwa furaha pamoja.

SourceText:
During one-on-one time, **give your child your full attention.** 

To help you focus on your child during one-on-one time, try to minimise distractions.
text:
Kwenye muda wa ana kwa ana, **mpe mtoto wako umakini kamili.**

Ili kukusaidia kumzingatia mtoto wako kwenye muda wa ana kwa ana, jaribu kupunguza usumbufu.

SourceText: What might distract you during one-on-one time?
text: Nini kinaweza kukusumbua kwenye muda wa ana kwa ana?

SourceText: My to-do list
text: Orodha yangu ya vitu vya kufanya

SourceText:
This is something that happens to all parents! It is normal to get distracted. 

If you find yourself thinking about other things, that’s okay. Notice when this happens and bring your focus to your child.
text:
Hiki ni kitu kinachotokea kwa wazazi wote! Ni kawaida kusumbuliwa.

Ikiwa unajikuta unafikiria juu ya mambo mengine, hiyo ni sawa, angalia hili linaweza kutokea na elekeza umakini wako kwa mtoto wako.

SourceText: Other children needing my attention
text: Watoto wengine wanahitaji umakini wangu

SourceText:
It can be really hard to focus on one child when you are also caring for other children.

Try to set up tasks or activities for your other children before-hand. There might still be interruptions, and that’s also okay.
text:
Inaweza kuwa ngumu sana kuzingatia mtoto mmoja wakati pia unawatunza watoto wengine.
Jaribu kuanzisha kazi au shughuli za watoto wako wengine kabla ya hapo. bado kunaweza kuwa na usumbufu, na hiyo pia ni sawa.

SourceText: Incoming calls or messages
text: Simu na jumbe zinazoingia

SourceText: We are all easily distracted by our phones. Putting your phone away or putting it on silent could help.
text: Ni rahisi sana kuvurugwa na simu zetu, Kuweka simu yako mbali au kuiweka katika ukimya inaweza kusaidia.

SourceText:
During one-on-one time, **be responsive and enthusiastic.**

Respond to what your child is doing and saying with enthusiasm and encouragement.
text:
Kwenye muda wa Ana kwa Ana, **kuwa msikivu na mwenye shauku.**

Mwitikie mtoto wako kwa anachokifanya na ongea kwa shauku na kutia moyo.

SourceText:
As you spend time together, pay attention to what your child is doing or saying. 
Respond to what your child is doing with enthusiasm and praise. Try not to be critical or negative during one-on-one time.
Giving your child your full attention and responding with enthusiasm helps them to feel close and connected to you.
text:
Kadiri mnavyokuwa pamoja, kuwa makini na anachofanya mtoto wako au anachokisema.
Itikia anachofanya mtoto wako kwa shauku na umsifie. Jaribu kutokuwa mkosoaji au kuwa tofauti na yeye kwenye muda wa ana kwa ana. Kuwa makini na mtoto wako na kumwitikia kwa shauku inamsaidia kujisikia kuwa karibu na wewe na kujiskia ameungana na wewe.

SourceText: Let’s hear from a caregiver:
text: Ngoja tusikie kutoka kwa mlezi:

SourceText:
When I first heard I had to spend one-on-one time with my child, it was hard for me. I’m always doing things for my child, why do I need to get involved if they are playing happily by themselves? I did not want to spoil my child so that he thinks we have to do everything together. 

But after thinking about how good I feel when someone makes an effort to spend time with me and to listen to me, I thought that this might be really good for my child as well. So I decided to try it. 

I sat down next to my child and suggested that we draw a picture together. I asked her what she would like to draw. She suggested we draw our house and garden. I asked her what she would like me to draw, and she said I can draw the tree outside our house, while she draws the house. It was actually really relaxing to sit and do something together. We had a nice discussion about some of our favourite things about our home and what we enjoy doing together as a family.
text:
Niliposikia kwa mara ya kwanza natakiwa kutumia muda ana kwa ana na mtoto wangu, ilikuwa ngumu kwangu. Daima nafanya vitu kwa ajili ya mtoto wangu, kwanini nijihusishe naye ikiwa anacheza mwenyewe kwa furaha? Sikutaka kumharibu mtoto wangu akifikiri tunatakiwa kufanya kila kitu pamoja.
Lakini baada ya kufikiri jinsi ninavyojiskia vizuri pale mtu anapofanya juhudu kutumia muda kuwa na mimi na kunisikiliza, Niliwaza kwamba hii itakuwa kweli nzuri kwa ajili ya mtoto wangu pia. Hivyo niliamua kujaribu.

Nilikaa chini karibu na mtoto wangu na kupendekeza kwamba tuchore picha pamoja. Nilimuuliza angependa kuchora nini. Alipendekeza tuchore nyumba yetu na bustani. Nilimuuliza angependa nichore nini na akasema unaweza kuchora mti nje ya nyumba yetu, wakati yeye anachora nyumba. Ilikuwa kiburudisho kweli kukaa na kufanya kitu pamoja. Tulikuwa na mjadala mzuri kuhusu baadhi ya vitu tunavyovipenda kuhusu nyumba yetu na nini tunafurahia kufanya pamoja kama familia.

SourceText: Did you know: connecting with your child can help reduce negative behaviours.
text: Je unajua kwamba kuungana na mtoto wako kunaweza kusaidia kupunguza tabia mbaya.

SourceText:
When our children are being difficult, it can be even harder to find the time and energy to connect with them. But this is often when children benefit from connection the most. 

Children are more likely to act out when they feel unseen or unsupported. If you notice your child is being difficult or acting out, try to make some time to connect with them and spend one-on-one time together.
text:
Watoto wetu wanapokuwa sio waelewa, inakuwa ni vigumu kutafuta muda na kupata moyo kuungana nao. Lakini hii ni mara nyingi wakati watoto wanafaidika zaidi na muunganiko.
Kuna uwezekano mkubwa watoto wakaigiza pale wanapohisi kutoonekana au kutosaidiwa. Ukimuona mtoto wako sio muelewa au anaigiza, jaribu kutenga muda kuungana nao na kutumia muda wa ana kwa ana pamoja.

SourceText: Won’t connecting with my child when they are being difficult seem like I am rewarding them for bad behaviour?
text: Siwezi kuungana na mtoto wangu kama anakuwa sio muelewa itaonekana ninafurahia tabia yake mbaya?

SourceText: Good question! Connecting with your child does not mean that you give your child everything they want to keep them happy.
text: Swali zuri! Kuungana na mtoto wako haimaanishi kwamba unampa mtoto wako kila kitu wanachotaka kuwafanya wawe na furaha.

SourceText:
Remember that what you experience, you can express. What you pour into your child’s cup is what will pour out. When your child experiences kindness and understanding, they learn how to do the same for other people. 

This does not mean that you allow your child to do whatever they want without consequences. You can support your child to improve their behaviour while still showing them that your love for them does not change.
text:
Kumbuka kwamba, ulichokutana nacho, unaweza kukielezea. unachokimiminia kwenye kikombe cha mtoto wako ndicho kitakachomiminika nje. Mtoto wako anapopata upendo na kueleweka, anajifunza kufanya hivyo hivyo kwa watu wengine.

Hii haimaanishi kwamba, unaruhusu mtoto wako afanye lolote analotaka bila matokeo. Unaweza kumsaidia mtoto wako kuboresha tabia yake wakati ukimuonesha kuwa upendo wako kwake haujabadilika.

SourceText: Sharing a book with your child is a great way to connect and spend quality time together.
text: Kushirikishana kitabu na mtoto wako ni njia nzuri ya kuungana na mtoto wako na kutumia muda vizuri pamoja.

SourceText: Here are some ideas for how you can use book activities to connect.
text: Haya ni baadhi ya mawazo ya jinsi ambavyo unaweza kutumia shughuli za kitabu kuungana na mtoto wako.

SourceText: Make book and story activities part of your daily routine.
text: Fanya kitabu na shughuli za hadithi kuwa utaratibu wako wa kila siku.

SourceText: Watch this video to learn more:
text: Tazama video kujifunza zaidi:

SourceText:
By reading together every day, your child will learn to love books and enjoy reading. The more time children spend looking at books, the more they learn. So, make reading part of your daily routine.

Even in a busy day, find some time to look at books and read with your child. Even 10 minutes a day can make the world of difference.

Find a time that works best for your family. This might be first thing in the morning or towards the end of the day when you want your child to come inside. Reading before bedtime can also help children fall asleep easier.
text:
Kwa kusoma pamoja kila siku, mtoto wako atajifunza kupenda vitabu na kufurahia kusoma. Kadri watoto wanavyotumia muda mwingi kutazama vitabu, ndivyo wanavyojifunza zaidi Hivyo fanya kusoma iwe sehemu ya utaratibu wako wa kila siku.

Hata kwenye siku yenye shughuli nyingi, pata muda wa kutizama vitabu na kusoma na mtoto wako, hata kwa dakika 10 kwa siku vinaweza kuleta mabadiliko katika ulimwengu.

Tafuta muda zaidi unaofaa kwa familia yako. Hii inaweza kuwa ni kitu cha kwanza asubuhi au inapoelekea mwisho wa siku unapotaka watoto wako waingie ndani, kusoma kabla ya kulala kunawezamsaidia mtoto wako kulala kwa urahisi.

SourceText: What time do you think will work for your family?
text: Unafikiri ni muda gani utafaa kwa familia yako?

SourceText: Morning
text: Asubuhi

SourceText: A book activity in the morning can be a great way to connect with your child and help start their day on the right note.
text: Shughuli ya kitabu asubuhi inaweza kuwa njia nzuri ya kuungana na mtoto wako na inasaidia kuanza siku yake na dokezo sahihi.

SourceText: Afternoon
text: Mchana

SourceText: Sharing a book together in the afternoon can be a great way to connect and take a break during a busy day.
text: Kushirikishana kitabu pamoja wakati wa mchana inaweza ikawa njia nzuri ya kuungana na kupumzika siku yenye shughuli nyingi.

SourceText: Evening
text: Usiku

SourceText: Book activities before bedtime is a great way to help children settle down and fall asleep easier.
text: Shughuli za vitabu kabla ya kulala ni njia nzuri ya kumsaidia mtoto atulie na kulala kirahisi.

SourceText: Weekends
text: Mwishoni mwa wiki

SourceText: It can be really hard to find time during the busy week for book activities. Weekends are a great time to catch up with children and connect.
text: Inaweza kuwa ngumu sana katika wiki yenye shughuli nyingi, kwa shughuli za vitabu. Mwishoni mwa wiki ni muda mzuri wa kuungana na watoto.

SourceText: As you go through the book, give your child your full attention. Notice and respond to what your child is interested in.
text: Unapopitia kitabu, mpe mtoto wako umakini mkubwa. Tambua na ujibu kile kinachomvutia mtoto wako.

SourceText: Listen for an example:
text: Sikiliza mfano:

SourceText:
As you go through the book, notice what your child is looking at, pointing at, or talking about and respond to it. 
For example, if your child is looking at the picture of the sandwich, you could say: “Look, he is eating some bread. What do you think is on the bread? What do you like to eat on your bread?”
Give your child time to respond, and let them set the pace. They might want to spend a long time talking about one page or move on quickly to the next page. Follow their lead as much as possible.
text:
Unapopitia kitabu, Tambua ni nini mtoto wako anachotazama. anachoonyesha au anachozungumzia na ujibu. Kwa mfano kama mtoto wako anatazama kwenye picha ya mkate. Unaweza kusema: “Angalia, anakula mkate. unafikiri ndani ya mkate kuna nini? Unapenda kula nini kwenye mkate wako?” 
Mpe mtoto wako nafasi ya kujibu, Na muache atengeneze kasi yake. Wanaweza kutaka kutumia muda mrefu kuongelea ukurasa mmoja au kuendelea haraka kwenye ukurasa unaofata. Fuata muongozo wao kadiri inavyowezekana.

SourceText: Don’t force your child if they are not interested. Rather try again another time.
text: Usimlazimishe mtoto wako kama hawavutiwi. Badala yake jaribu tena wakati mwingine.

SourceText: Listen to learn more:
text: Sikiliza ujifunze zaidi:

SourceText:
While it might feel tempting to force your child to do a book activity with you, this can do more harm in the long term. 
If your child enjoys the activity and has a positive experience, they will want to do it again. And the more time children spend looking at books and talking about the pictures, the more they learn and the better they do at school. 
Invite your child to join you in a book activity. If they don’t want to, rather try again another time. Keep asking them without putting pressure on them. You can also tell them about a particular book or story that you would like to share with them, to spark their interest.
text:
Wakati unaweza kujisikia kumlazimisha mtoto wako kufanya shughuli ya kitabu na wewe, hii inaweza kuumiza zaidi huko mbele
Kama mtoto wako anafurahia shughuli na ana uzoefu chanya, atataka kufanya tena. Na kadiri mtoto anavyotumia muda zaidi kuangalia vitabu na kuzungumza kuhusu picha, ndivyo anavyojifunza zaidi na ndivyo atakavyofanya vizuri shuleni. Mualike mtoto wako kujiunga na wewe katika shughuli ya kitabu. Kama hawataki, badala yake ujaribu tena wakati mwingine. Endelea kumuomba bila kumlazimisha. Unaweza pia kumwambia kuhusu kitabu fulani maalum au hadithi ambayo ungependa kushirikishana naye, kuchochea kinachomvutia.

SourceText:
Three easy ways to use book activities to connect:
1. Give your child your full attention as you go through the book together.

2. Notice what your child is interested in and talk about that.

3. Don’t force your child if they are not interested. Rather try again another time.
text:
Njia tatu za kutumia shughuli za kitabu kuungana.
1. Mpe mtoto wako umakini wako wote kadili mnavyokuwa mnapitia kitabu pamoja

2. Tambua ni nini mtoto wako anavutiwa nacho na uzungumzie kuhusu hicho

3. Usimlazimishe mtoto wako kama havutiwi. Ila jaribu tena wakati mwingine.

SourceText: Small actions, big results! Parents who practice at home get better results.
text: Matendo madogo, matokeo makubwa! Wazazi wanaofanya kwa vitendo nyumbani wanapata matokeo makubwa.

SourceText:
For your home practice:

🤝 Make some time to spend with your child one-on-one.

📖 Make book activities part of your routine, and use it as a time to connect. 

😌 Spending quality time with our children is important, but make sure you take some time for yourself too.
text:
Kwaajili ya kufanya nyumbani:
🤝Tengeneza muda wa kuwa na mtoto wako ana kwa ana

📖 Fanya shughuli za kitabu kuwa sehemu ya ratiba yako ya kila siku na ukitumie kama muda wa kuungana.

😌 Kutumia muda vizuri na watoto wetu ni muhimu, lakini hakiikisha unapata muda kwaajili yako mwenyewe pia.

SourceText: Welcome to @global.app_name

note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
You deserve to feel good, and have happy family relationships.

@global.app_name is here to support you.

Here is how to use the app:
text:
Unastahili kujiskia vizuri na kuwa na mahusiano ya familia yenye furaha.

@global.app_name ipo kwa ajili ya kukusaidia

Hii ni jinsi ya kutumia programu:
note:
The string

@global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Use the toggle bar on the top right corner to switch between the Map View and List View on the homepage. You can choose the view you prefer and switch back at any time.
text: Tumia kitufe cha kugeuza kilichopo upande wa kulia kwenye kona, kubadili kati ya muonekano wa ramani na muonekano wa orodha kwenye ukurasa wa juu. Unaweza kuchagua muonekano unaoupenda na kubadilisha muda wowote.

SourceText:
The Start/Continue button takes you to the module we encourage you to explore/finish. The module name changes depending on the module you are looking at that week.

This button disappears after all the modules have been unlocked. The modules are unlocked weekly.
text:
Kitufe cha Anza/Endelea kinakupeleka kwenye mada tunayokuhimiza kuchunguza/kumaliza. Jina la mada hubadilika kulingana na mada unayoiangalia wiki hiyo.

Kitufe hiki hutoweka baada ya mada zote kufunguliwa. Mada zinafunguliwa kwa wiki.

SourceText: Depending on the selected homepage, you can also access the module by clicking on the circular buttons if you are using the map mode.
text: Kutegemeana na ukurasa wa juu uliochaguliwa, Pia unaweza kuzifikia mada kwa kubonyeza vitufe vya mviringo, kama unatumia ramani.

SourceText: Or the rectangular buttons for the list view.
text: Au vitufe vya mstatiri kwa ajili ya kuona orodha.

SourceText:
This is the module landing page.

Here you get an overview on what to expect.
text:
Huu ni ukurusa wa mwanzo.

Hapa unapata muhtasari wa unachokitarajia.

SourceText: You can access various module home activities such as the Relax, Books and Play activities. You are advised to do these activities after going through the module as you await for the next module to unlock.
text: Unaweza kuzifikia shughuli mbalimbali za mada za kufanya nyumbani kama vile Kupumzika, vitabu na shughuli za kucheza. Unashauriwa kufanya shughuli hizi baada ya kupitia mada unaposubiri mada inayofuata kufunguka.

SourceText:
At the bottom we have several sections that you can explore whenever you want by clicking on the icons.

The library has additional books.

The Resource centre has additional activities such as songs, relax activities, support information, play activities e.t.c.

The settings page contains your personal information and other app settings.
text:
Chini tuna sehemu kadhaa ambazo unaweza kuchunguza wakati wowote unapotaka kwa kubofya kwenye kitufe.

Maktaba ina vitabu vya ziada.

Kituo cha rasilimali kina shughuli za ziada kama vile nyimbo, shughuli za kupumzika, taarifa za kupata msaada, shughuli za kucheza n.k

Mipangilio ya ukurasa imejumuisha maelezo yako binafsi na mipangilio mingine ya program.

SourceText: To build your knowledge and skills in parenting, complete all of the content in one module before moving to the next one.
text: Kujenga maarifa na juzi zako za malezi, Pitia vipengele vyote kwa ukamilifu kwenye mada moja, kabla ya kwenda kwenye mada inayofuata.
